Reviews.Title: “No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: Rune R
Reviews.Content: We selected the Comfort Suites as they're a Disney Good Neighbour Hotel & the reviews were encouraging. Arriving late on our first evening, we were initially a bit concerned about noise / people wandering around as the hotel is situated very close to Old Town, but parking the car and walking into the lobby we were very pleasantly surprised at how 'up market' & well maintained it felt. We had been expecting something a lot more basic and motel-like (penny for penny you would not get anything of this quality at this price in the UK.) Check in was quick, friendly and efficient, and we were given plenty of information regarding what time breakfast was served, pool opening hours and so on. The lobby area was clean & bright, and the elevators were clean and fast. We had gotten a good deal on a queen suite and were extremely pleased with our room which was several floors up and facing the pool. With the pool being available 24/7 we did worry if there would be a lot of noise, but during the 5 days of our stay we heard very little even though it was often busy when we got back from the parks. The room itself comprised 2 comfortable queen beds with blankets (just a minor quibble from me as I prefer comforters / duvets) and plenty of pillows, plus a pull out sofa. The 'kitchen' area comprised a table and chairs and small sink area with cupboards, plus a small fridge and microwave. All were very clean and the room smelled fresh. Bathroom was also very clean and the shower excellent. Very much enjoyed our stay here and intend to return in December. We had a hire car so did not use the shuttle service, if you have a car it's only 25 or so mins drive from Orlando International and a vert straightforward route. You are only a minute's drive from the 192 with its many restaurants and stores and there are Publix, Wal-Mart & Winn-Dixie all within easy reach, plus a Wal-Greens pharmacy more or less just across from Logans over the 192. You are also close to Celebration which is worth a look around. Walt Disney World is very close and is very easy to get to from the hotel, on a good traffic day you can be parking up at magic Kingdom / Epcot / DHS in 10 - 15 mins, maybe less. Old Town is only a few mins walk away and good for a n hour or so's diversion in the evening. We only tried the breakfast a couple of times but have no complaints, there was plenty of it - egg patties, canadian bacon (think 'ham'), waffles, baked beans etc etc plus pastries, fresh fruit, cereal, juice and tea or coffee. Possibly it would get a bit repetitive if you had it every day but hey, its included in the price of your room so its up to you if you want to eat. It made a good slow start to non park days for us and the staff were busy but friendly. All in all we thoroughly enjoyed our stay, we were there mid Feb so possibly not the busiest time (UK half term) and have no complaints, it exceeded our expectations and we look forward to staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased, will return”
Reviews.Author: wallisan
Reviews.Content: 7 day stay in mid-April 2012. We picked this hotel for our Orlando vacation based on the high ranking on this site and we were not disappointed. Found it surprisingly quiet, but busy in the mornings. Very nice pool, hot tub and even a pool bar, but the wading pool is now converted to patio seating due to accessibility laws which was a disappointment. Not a fancy 5-star but close to it and for the price a great deal. Front desk staff very pleasant and accomodating, Vernon even gave my daughter a stuffed toy upon our late arrival the first night. Cleaning staff very nice and thorough, well worth the $10 tip as were treated very well. Yes the elevators are a bit crowded first thing in the morning but that's par for the course and only a few minutes wait. Breakfast was great and a bit of new variety each day, no complaints for the week. Anybody who whines about this hotel has too high expectations and should stay at the Ramada or Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: j2arch
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel between April 6 and 14 and cannot say enough nice things about it. I looked at all the reviews and went back and forth between this hotel and a Holiday Inn by the Disney Stores. Decided to try it and see. The hotel is adjacent to old town which worked out for my teenagers the first night to visit while the wife and i got settled in. The check-in was smooth and fast. Rooms are first rate, nice size, decent beds and pullout couch. The maids did a decent job staying on top of our trash lol. The breakfast was your standard stuff but served us well. I will stay here again next time when visiting Disney. try it as I think you will also enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Holiday”
Reviews.Author: starwave
Reviews.Content: We spent 14 nights at this hotel, it was clean, friendly in a great location and breakfast included in the room price was a super bonus. We would recommend this hotel and location.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: FunYoda
Reviews.Content: This is a hidden gem and should be rated more stars. This was our second stay for 11 nights from 3/26/12. This is the most comfortable, clean and friendliest hotel ever. We stayed at a 4 star in Orlando previously and this hotel is cheaper with the better standards and amenities and triple the room size. We had a suite where the kids had their own room with TV on the sleeper couch. The free breakfast, wifi and parking really helps to keep the vacation budget in check (unlike the 4 star where al these were very expensive) . The staff is brilliant - our room was spotless and we had no problems getting a late checkout time. The 24 hour excellent coffee with half and half is also a bonus. The location is wonderfully quiet although we faced old town. Disney is a 9 minute drive away. The ticketing lady was wonderfully efficient getting us the right tickets in under 10 minutes (4 star hotel took 50 minutes and issued wrong tickets!) We enjoyed every minute in this hotel and was very sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sue K
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Comfort Suites having read reviews on this website. we were not disappointed! The hotel was comfortable , clean and in a good location. Breakfast was included in the room price and it was very nice - my little girl particularly enjoyed the Mickey Mouse waffles! The staff at the hotel were polite and helpful - right from the desk staff to the cleaners. Our room was cleaned daily and the cleaners even arranged my daughter's soft toys on her bed everyday (she loved this). The pool area was excellent and open 24 hours. There was a guest laundry which proved handy to wash and dry clothes if needed and was reasonably priced (good for families travelling with children as you don't need to pack as many clothes if you can wash items) We felt welcome and comfortable at the hotel and would definitely stay here again if we return to Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel except for one thing”
Reviews.Author: cwb631
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying I would give this hotel a 3.5 if it was an option. The hotel is located right off of US 192 behind Old Town. It is not too easy to find and as your driving in you'll start to fear you made a big mistake by the surrounding area but rest assured the hotel is ahead. It is less than a 10 minute drive from Disney and the hotel provides a free shuttle service. The hotel itself is very clean inside, it has a nice game room, a heated pool, and a poolside bar. Another nice touch was the ability to purchase Disney tickets right in the lobby. The breakfast was also very nice each morning with a wide variety of food along with Mickey shaped waffles. Unfortunately for us, our room, although non-smoking, must have been a recent conversion because the smell of the room was horrible. We attempted to air it out but by the time we realized the smell was not going to go away, we felt it would be too much hassle to move since we were only staying two days. So to be fair, the hotel was not given a chance to rectify the situation. However I do not appreciate this even having to be addressed, it is a huge pet peeve of mine when hotels do not properly clean rooms upon converting them from smoking to non-smoking. The other major issue was the hotel only has two elevators for a very large establishment. They were constantly packed. Also as far as I could find, there was only one staircase that lead to the lobby forcing even more people onto the elevators. While overall the hotel was ok, with the wide selection available in the Orlando/Kissimmee area, I am not sure I would return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Meoco17
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice! The pool is open 24 hours...the breakfast buffet is very tasty with hot and cold options...and this hotel is right in the middle of Old Town with go karts, mini golf, and all kinds of things to do! It is also very close to the Disney Parks. I will stay here again for sure! The staff was very friendly and helpful...rooms very clean and spacious!

Reviews.Title: “Overall Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: Skycam_12
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel, as it offered all the amenities that I was looking for, including: large suites, breakfast included, close to Disney, etc.. I spent a lot of time reading all the reviews, (the good and the bad) and I hope to address them all. Upon arriving at the hotel, the lobby was well kept and clean, check in went smoothly, room was clean, everything exactly the way I had hoped. The breakfast was a buffet style, and it varied slightly everyday, offering your basic, eggs, sausage, breads, cereal, and my daughter's favourite Mickey Mouse waffles! The coffee was good, and an added bonus, was that it was offered all day long. On previous reviews I noticed people complained about the elevators being slow, yes they were not your fastest moving elevators, but nothing that would deter me from choosing this hotel. The pool area, was well kept, and my kids loved how it was heated. Not sure if they mention on the website or not, but the kiddie pool is closed, and they are doing some sort of work on it. The hot tub looked OK, although I did not use it. My one complaint was the large groups of students that this hotel caters to. At night time they would come back from their various outings, and they would bombard the pool area from about 9pm until 11pm...and if you happen to be in the lobby when they arrived then it was almost impossible to get on the elevator...but I must say, at no time, did any of the students or kids misbehave...there just seemed to be a lot and after a long day at the park, I would have loved to sit by the pool/ bar let the kids have a swim, and wind down, but every-night that we were there...it just became to crowded..so we would just go upstairs to our room. With that being said, I had no trouble whatsoever, we were close to shopping, dining, you are able to get tickets for various attractions right at the hotel, and they even offer shuttle buses, although we opted to drive ourselves, so I can't comment on the shuttle service. Check out was easy, and I found everyone at the front desk to be friendly and willing to help you out. I would definitely stay here again, when travelling in the area, especially if you are travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Hookedonjetfuel
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 adults stayed at Maingate East March 24-31/2012. We booked it as part of a package that included airfare and car rental. I was a bit apprehensive about 4 of us staying in one room but the room was so large, it wasn't an issue. We had 2 very comfortable queen beds and a pull out couch. With everything that was included it was an awesome value. We really appreciated the breakfast which always included eggs, cereal selection, juices, coffee & tea, breads, fresh waffles, fruit and sometimes sausage or ham - there was plenty of choice. I also enjoyed having tea & coffee available 24 hours. The staff here is so friendly and helpful that I can't understand any guest having an issue. The pool was quite a bit larger than I imagined from the pictures and it was always quite warm. The hot tub is tucked in a quieter area and was great after a long day in the parks. I just cannot say enough about this hotel. The next time we visit this area we will absolutely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: heidi t
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed here a week. We never had an issue with anything! Our room was big and clean. Our housekeeper was incredible. The breakfast was good. Something different everyday. We enjoyed the pool which is open 24hrs. My kids liked that they could swim anytime at night after we got back from the Parks. I will say if your in a hurry take the stairs, the elevators are really slow..But we still really enjoyed this hotel and our stay here and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “This is THE PLACE for us... Forever :)”
Reviews.Author: srr91899
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a couple different places over the past 8 years of being a florida resident enjoying Orlando. And finally I find a place that has everything our family needs. And the price!!! It was so awesome! And Old town is in walking distance! I cant wait to go back and stay here! Didnt get to try out the pool since it was cold. But next time we will

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Value”
Reviews.Author: MsWahine
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while I was in town for the 2012 Disney Princess Half Marathon. Originally I wanted to stay on the resort, but the price here was too good to pass up. The hotel was okay. I stayed in one of the older rooms, which seemed to need a little updating. But everything was in working condition and the bed was comfortable, so I didn't complain. The housekeeping team did a very good job of cleaning, and making sure they got in early instead of waiting late like some hotel chains do. The breakfast buffet was ok. They did have quite a bit of options, but it wasn't the best buffet I've ever had. The mickey waffles were a nice touch. Too bad they were cold :( The worst thing about the hotel was the elevator. It was so SLOW!! It was by far the slowest elevator I'd ever seen in my life. When I was alone I just took the stairs (which are way on the other side of the lobby) because I would still get to my room faster than using the elevator. Surely there's something they can do about that. Overall, the hotel met my needs for the weekend so I was happy. Not sure I'd stay there again though, unless I'm traveling with a large group.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled - mgmt or mission must have changed - DISRESPECTFUL”
Reviews.Author: Kelly S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two years ago and thought it was a decent place, so re-booked for this week. The staff has not been friendly or helpful at all. When we checked in yesterday, I asked whether they offered wheelchair assistance to their guests, just to get around from room to pool to snack bar, etc... I was told that they had one, but that someone was using it. I had just broken my foot, so it was a recent, and immediate concern. They said that I could use it in the morning, and was also told that I could get the phone number for a local service that rents them. So this morning, while my family is at the parks, I thought I'd sit by the pool. I get ready, and call downstairs to ask for the wheelchair. THe person says that they don't have one. I explained the conversation yesterday, and they say they'll call me back. When they do, they say that they can't find it. I hobble downstairs on crutches, and ask at the desk, explaining what I was told last night. The man there, Trey, denies ever telling me that there was one available to use. Right in front of me, told two coworkers that what I was saying wasn't true. I asked about the pool food bar, as I was hungry. They said that it opened at 3, but that they'd probably only do hotdogs today, as there was a big group coming in. What? I asked for a manager, and he/she conveniently wasn't available until tomorrow, after I check out. I asked about the name of someone on their "Manager on Duty" board, and they said that was only the engineer. What? THen they all just stood there, halfway looking, and halfway pretending that I was no longer an issue. No offers of assistance, no customer service. Our family and friends will not be coming back here again. Cannot believe I was treated this way.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with alot of amenities”
Reviews.Author: Nancy1986
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here last week and could not ask for a better hotel. The hotel was spotless and the rooms were clean and the staff was wonderful. Free internet hookup in the rooms and they also had a computer in the lobby area. The breakfast was fantastic, with hot and cold foods and a lot to choose from. My daughter loved the homemade biscuits and gravy. Old Town was was so close you could see it from our 7th floor window. The view was amazing I think we had the best view in the whole hotel. The room had everything you could possibly want refrigerator, microwave, coffeemaker and also had a full size couch that turned into a bed. I would definitely stay here again. One last thing the shuttle was also fantastic and always on time. No need to take your car to the parks and pay the 15.00 parking fees.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste money on upgraded room !”
Reviews.Author: 4frank
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights in March and paid extra for the "deluxe" room. The beds were horrible, the pillows were horrible and it wasn't the cleanest by any means. I went to the front desk to complain and was told that the upgrades were for a new dresser and carpeting. Mattresses were not replaced and they are the same through the whole hotel. Why would anyone pay extra for that? Honestly, I didn't like the answer and she was a little rude about it. Breakfast was the typical complimentary thing. Nothing special, but no surprises from lack of quality. It's free and pretty much the same at any hotel that I have been to. As far as "comfort suites" they should change their name, it's misleading.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: melissamarques77
Reviews.Content: My family and I were very pleased with our stay at this hotel.. The price is great, the staff is very friendly and helpful, and the free breakfast buffet was great! We enjoyed having Old Town so close to the hotel, its in walking distance so you don't have to worry about finding a parking space, especially on Friday and Saturday nights, Old Town can get very busy. We will definitely be staying here again, already made reservations for July..

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price!”
Reviews.Author: FunHaHa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we weren't checking into a Disney hotel until Friday, and arrived up in Kissimmee on Thursday night, about 11:00PM. The reviews of the hotel weren't too bad, so we chose to stay here for one night. You do not go here if you're used to posh, updated hotels. This isn't the hotel. However, with that being said, it's a great hotel for the price. We stayed in the Queen suite, which had 2 Queen beds and a sofa bed and as there were 2 adults and 2 older children, that was great. We were seen right away at the desk and shown right to our room. It had a great view of the pool- and I did request not to be close to any groups, elevator, and stairs, as my son has a hard time sleeping, and it appeared that we were giving a room to match our requests. Yes, the furniture was old. Yes, the carpet wasn't the best. Yes, the comforter was old. YES, the tub was old. But then again, I wasn't paying 5-tar prices, so I wasn't expecting a 5-star room. You do get what you paid for. I was in a good location- across the street from Old Town, within walking distance to many attractions, and 10 minutes from where I was staying-the Boardwalk, in Disney. It also included FREE wiifii, and FREE breakfast, which not many places do in the area. As for the breakfast- I thought it was great. Many choices, and I don't know why someone said that they ran out. It was manned by many staff members, always replenishing. I loved their breakfast. The one negative I really did have was for the pool. It was to be a heated pool, open 24 hours, and my son was so happy to be able to go swimming at anytime, because we weren't sure that once we hit Disney, that we'd have time to go swimming. That pool was freezing! My husband and son could barely go in it! He was so disappointed! If it was heated, they kept it at a very low temperature. Would we stay here again- yes. We might try one of the "updated" rooms, but it was definitely worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for familes.”
Reviews.Author: 1980rebel
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel with great amenities. Makes you feel like you are at home. Clean and comfortable rooms, with a small kitchenette. The pool was amazing even in cold weather. We just had to take advantage of that heated pool! The breakfast was filled with everything! Waffles, pancakes, eggs, bacon/sausage, fresh fruit, cereal.......The location is right in front of a fair and is kind of loud if you are staying in the front rooms. Overall we loved it and definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: 16371Traveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from another wonderful stay at the Comfort Suites Maingate East. Upon arrival, the front desk staff Orisanda and Trey were very courteous, friendly and helpful and professional. The building, it's rooms and grounds are very beautiful and well maintained. The hot tub and pool area is very relaxing. The breakfast buffet is always delicious and hot items vary a bit each day. We always look forward to seeing friends who also vacation there each year, which says much about the quality of accommodations. The hotel's location near the Disney Parks, many restaurants, the Old Town shops and Saturday Nite Cruise can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: AKFamilyZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Great morning breakfast, nice pool/hot tub, outside bar. Rooms are clean, quiet and spacious, staff friendly and helpful. Restaurants and entertainment near by. Shuttles are helpful getting to parks...the evening pick up is a bit misleading...we waited an hr after closing of Sea World to be picked up and it took an hr to get back to the hotel. The shuttle services a few other hotels so you want to keep this in mind if you have evening plans.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lilfoot2
Reviews.Content: This is our go-to hotel as we arrive in the Orlando area after a 15 hour drive. We have stayed here many years in a row and love it! The rooms are comfortable and spacious. The pool is great and the hot tub is private. Love the pool bar and the BOGO coupons. Breakfast is great - lots to choose from and plenty of seating, as long as the cheerleaders aren't in town! :) Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amandaxx_12
Reviews.Content: Me and my 18year old daughter traveled to this hotel. The hotel is very nice and clean when we arrived in our room it was hugh we stayed in the two queen sized bedroom, it was facing old town, the bathroom is very clean and the kitchen comes with everyone what it says on their website but it does not come with plates or forks and knifes so i shouldnt buy some paper ones back home. We noticed that the hotel would be amazing if you was disabled the floor ground is for disabled people and the tables at breakfast has enough room for a wheelchair also the transport buses to the theme parks have all of the equipment to carry a wheelchair. The breakfast is okay for the first few days then it starts to repeat constantly all we ever ate was scrambled eggs, waffles, toast and fruit loops. The hotel is facing old town which is great if youve got kids, however you have to buy a wristband you cannot just pay for one ride if you only like the look of one. The transport can be a bit of a nightmare as it picks up a few hotels before comfort suites so if there are alot of people already on it it may be hard to try to find a seat, the driver then goes on to pick up other hotels even when there is no room at all!!, and the times of the buses can be a bit of a pain as you either get there too early or you get there half way through the day, also the coming back is a nightmare too as everyone is waiting for this bus, however dont let this put you off the hotel because all of the hotels use this bus so it doesnt matter where you stay. But if you want to go to the parks on your own time outside of the pondarrosa theres a busstop the bus is either 56/57 i cant remember but it says magic kingdom on it its only $2 but if you want to get another bus its still $2 just tell the drive you want a hopper before you pay. outside of the ferris wheel theres a busstop where you can get picked up for busch gardens it is free aslong as you have your ticket for busch gardens otherwise you have to pay, it is worse getting this bus as it costs $300 each way in a taxi. The location of the hotel is amazing its about 30mins aways from magic kingdom including all of the hotels stops and about 40mins for universal, it also offers a shopping bus that takes you to lake buena vista shopping mall for free, but if you are interested in shopping i suggest going to orlando premium outlets there so amazing and very cheap too, the reception try there best to help you with all of your problems, however the woman on the ticket desk is very rude and does not help at all, the hotel is in the middle of everyone resturant possible such as ponderrosa, sizzling grill(highly reccommend), kfc, mcdonalds, burger king, red lobster, pizza hunt etc etc etc, so you will never ever go hungry!, we really enjoyed this hotel and the location is very ideal. Oh yes and by the way all of the reviews saying dont stay here because you can hear old town NO YOU CANT, we was facing old town and you cant hear NOTHING old town closes around 11oclock aswell.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: hoteldali
Reviews.Content: Just perfect for families, nice, clean, free parking, nice pool, close to the parks and very reasonable prices compared with the other hotels. The only problem was Wi-fi that is not working very well and not a very smiling staff, but it was not a big deal.... There's also a supermarket open 24hrs very close so you can get what you need just going with a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: BrewCity
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and very spacious. We got a lot of use out of the kitchenette. The maids did an awesome job cleaning everyday. The pool area was very nice, we loved the heated pool and that is was open 24 hours. The breakfast was just ok for us. It was free so I am not complaining but I could only eat it for 2 days and then I was so tired of it. The kids seemed to be ok with it though. There were many days where they ran out of food and we had to wait for them to refill and also we had to wipe our own tables down on 3 different occasions because there were no clean ones and no one to be found to clean ours. We liked the location and that we could walk to old town and some of the nearby stores. We didn't use the shuttle to any of the theme parks because we wanted to be on our own schedules. Overall it was a great value. Would I stay here again? Not sure...

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: lindab62
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weeks stay at the Comfort Suites, Maingate East, Kissimmee. Have to say firstly that the rooms are very nice, we stayed in two suites with adjoining doors. They were very clean and comfortable. On the down side, the breakfast even though it was complimentary was terrible, first day there was hardly anything left went, we went to eat at around 8.30am, the place was very busy mainly due to the busloads of kids that were staying in the hotel. It's the norm to use plastic knives and forks along with disposable cups and plates. After the second day of not being able to find a seat we decided to eat elsewhere for the rest of the week. Now don't get me wrong I have nothing against teenagers in fact I had two with me, but when there's loads of them around it doesn't make for a good family holiday. The staff shall we say were not the friendliest or helpful of people and to be honest were a little rude. Lets just say that I would definately not be returning to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Winter Getaway”
Reviews.Author: John J
Reviews.Content: Very clean, the staff was friendly and competent, the breakfast was good. The pool was heated to the mid eighties and very clean. The only complaint was that the shuttle to Disney ran either very early or you had to wait until mid-day, so we just drove instead. My wife found the breakfast to be limited, but it was prepared well and the serving area was immaculate. The Old Town amusement area looked a little run down, but I saw the same type of people coming and going that were at Disney, and they seemed to be having a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: noah53
Reviews.Content: Good Comfort Suites, had 2 queen beds, sofa bed, desk, table plus 3 chairs, frig, microwave and bar sink with countertop, updated room with new Panasonic flat screen tv on 7th floor facing pool and undeveloped area of trees. Nice quiet location. Lots of parking, lovely heated large pool and 2 rows of tall palms in front. Breakfast was good with constant refilling during weekend. Red Lobster just a short drive away plus many other eating places. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, well maintained, great breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: Trainman52
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice in the past 5 years and have already booked another stay for the Fall. The hotel is located off 192 just East of Old Towne. There is plenty of parking (even on those evenings when Old Towne is overflowing) and the lot is well lit. The lobby is basic, but what more do you need? The complimentary breakfast is kept well stocked and fresh. There are two women there who constantly monitor the area. In addition to the usual cold fare, there are a variety of hot items which are quite fresh. The rooms are well maintained. You have a refrigerator, bar sink, microwave and coffee maker. On more than one occasion we brought in food for dinner and had it in the room. The pool area is likewise well maintained with plenty of room for the amount of people that use it. There is a KFC right next door and a Cracker Barrel down the road a "bit". There is a Logan's Roadhouse just west of the hotel. If you sign up for some of these restaurant's mailing lists, they will send you a discount coupon via email. Don't request it too far in advance as they are generally short-dated. The ride to the Magic Kingdom from here is about 20 minutes or so. Straight down 192 and follow the signs. Keep in mind that NO off property hotel is "right near" Disney. They have a huge buffer around their property. If you want to be close, you must stay "on property". You should consider joining the Choice Rewards Program and getting their charge card. This will earn you points which can be used towards your stay (a 30 day booking window applies). You cannot go wrong choosing this hotel. Have a great time!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place near Disney”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelplaces
Reviews.Content: We just left Comfort Suites and arrived home today. It was a very nice place to stay if you are thinking of hotels outside of the Disney parks. The breakfast is great, with enough variety of hot and cold items that everyone should find something that suits them. The breakfast staff is hardworking and constantly refilling items, so no problem there. They are very attentive, for sure. The pool area is very nice, the water is heated and there is a small separate kiddie pool. The area is very clean and well kept, and there is a nice supply of towels waiting for your there. In the late evening there is a small bar that opens in that area. We did not venture to it, but some folks did and they seemed to be having a good time(not rowdy though...) The lobby is large, nothing too fancy but again, clean - as is the whole hotel. Parking is right out front and convenient. There is every possible chain restaurant (both sit down and fast food) on the main strip within 4 or 5 minutes from the hotel. Another neat feature is its location to a small amustment park known as "Old Town" Kissimmee. There are some rides for the kids, if you are not looking for a full days entertainment. And there are some cute shops and a few restauarants. This is all within a 3 minute walk out the front door of the hotel. We felt very safe in the area in general. I would say the area between this hotel and over to Disney is nice. If you go the opposite direction about 5miles, well,,,,,,,, not as nice(but we drove 10miles that direction every day, did not feel I was in any danger - just not a well kept area). For our purposes the placed worked about really, really well. We only went to Walt Disney Magic Kingdom (1day) as we were in town for another purpose. Stayed at this hotel 6nights with no problem. The room we had was quite large. 2 queen beds plus a pull out sofa. Also large fridge and microwave, plus a sink outside of the bathroom (bathroom has its own). I thought the room was a larger one than most that you see.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: RCfam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 days, the breakfast was wonderful the pool and hotub were clean and warm, the rooms were well kept. We will be staying here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent VFM”
Reviews.Author: philby123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for 2 weeks. The staff were very helpful and the rooms were cleaned daily. The complimentary breakfast was very good. There is a taxi service but a little expensive, for the second week we took the Lynx 56 bus to Magic Kingdom where free Disney shuttles to all Disney resorts. We frequently went to Pleasure Island using the Disney shuttle, travel this way was dirt cheap, for 2 adults $8 ! Old town is a nice feature where a couple of decent bars can be found. Comfort Suites at Maingate East is recommended for those on a budget looking for a clean, friendly place to stay. My wife and I plan to return there Jan 2013.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Groups”
Reviews.Author: CasaDeCarina
Reviews.Content: I took a group of 50 people to Orlando last week and we had an excellent experience at Comfort Suites Maingate East. Merryjane was our contact for planning and she could not have been easier to work with. Our rooms were spacious and clean, the location of the hotel right next door to Old Town was perfect and the experience was overall wonderful. Breakfast was delicious... I have only good things to say. Merryjane also went out of her way to help me make other arrangements when the bus bringing my group from Chicago to Orlando broke down. She went WAY above and beyond what she had to do, making my job much easier and my stay much more pleasant. Highly Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Carrie B
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Comfort Suites for 5 nights and it was perfect! After reading the reviews, I had mixed emotions on my choice but Im glad we chose this hotel. The hotel is tucked back of the main road so dont think that you have made a wrong turn some where. Our room was plenty big enough for all six of us with the young ones sleeping on the pull~out couch. The room was clean and had a huge bathroom but we were in a handicapped room. The breakfast was great, eggs, sausage, biscuits and gravey, cereals, fruit, fresh made waffels...something to please everyone! I dont know what people are expecting but if that isnt enough there are plenty of resturants to get breakfast in walking distance. Pool was open 24 hrs which was great since we got back to the hotel late eveyday. Over all it was a great hotel. For those looking for a 5 star luxurious hotel, this is not it! For those who want a nice, clean , easy access hotel for a reasonable price than this is it!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Rocks”
Reviews.Author: David G Posted by a Virgin Holidays traveler
Reviews.Content: Second time we have stayed at this hotel for Christmas and New year. The staff are exceptional and really go the extra mile to make your stay a comfortable one. The maids do a fantastic job and little things like turning the towels in floral displays is a real pleasure. The rooms are comfortable, clean and well appointed. The complimentary breakfast is far more than continental which virgin list it as and really sets you up for the day either in the parks or just lazing around the pool and in the hot tub. Even the price of drinks at the pool bar is very reasonable unlike other Florida hotels (a small beer being just $1.35). Overall a great place to stay (so much so we have just booked for Christmas 2012)

Reviews.Title: “Comfy at Comfort Suites”
Reviews.Author: Tracie C
Reviews.Content: Following a recommendation from our friends, we booked into this hotel for 12 nights during out trip to Florida and throughly enjoyed our stay. The room was quite spacious and clean, the staff were friendly and helpful. Excellent and very well priced washer/dryer facilities on every floor. The pool and jacuzzi area was excellent and lovely and warm, and it was quiet for most of our stay, with fresh towels always available. The bar snacks were adequate and very reasonably priced. There were plenty of places to eat locally (no restaurant on site) and things to do, such as Mini golf or the old town amusement park. It was an easy drive to all the major parks. We didn't use the shuttle bus facility so cannot comment. The breakfast was fine, the children loved it and there was a big enough variety to keep most people happy. We moved into a 5 star hotel at Lake Buena Vesta for the final week of our trip and it wasn't nearly as nice as the Comfort Suites. Slight negative points were the a/c unit was quite loud and we didn't have a particularly good view, but these are minor points.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, pretty good location, but . . .”
Reviews.Author: nikkirose
Reviews.Content: Well, the hotel itself was okay. Rooms were clean and spacious, pool area was nice, although the kiddie pool area wasn't working. Breakfast was typical, nothing spectacular but a decent variety of things and a few healthy choices (fruit). I have to agree with some of the other reviewers who said the front desk wasn't very friendly/helpful. I was traveling with a small child and had a lot of bags and there was no help offered -- never even told me about the luggage carts that would've helped me. But I am not sure that it can be blamed on this hotel or just the area in general. Tourists are a dime a dozen so they are not so quick to bend over backwards for you. Beware that their theme park shuttles only run a few times a day and if you want to go at any other time, they will happily call you a (overpriced) cab. They don't tell you that if you walk the few blocks up to Highway 192, you can catch the Lynx city bus #56 for $2 that will take you to the exact same place as the shuttle -- and it runs every 20 minutes. You do have to cross the street and walk down a bit, but it still beats the cab, and it will drop you off on the way back right in front of Old Town. And if you need a cab for any other reason, I would suggest calling your own and not going with who the hotel recommends. I think they really take advantage of tourists who don't know any better. And they don't have a shuttle from the airport or the train station. Again, use your own cab service. The hotel's location was pretty good...Old Town is a neat little spot -- had a really good quick bite at the Tex-Mex place. And there's a whole amusement park right there in front of the hotel with very reasonable prices and a nice mini-golf place, too. I would recommend the hotel with the above caveats, as it's a decent place in a pretty good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Easy Drive/Close to Disney Parks”
Reviews.Author: lingard123
Reviews.Content: The hotel has great service and is and easy drive and close to Walt Disney World parks. The Breakfast is so so, same foods each day.The breakfast staff was very helpful and did a wonderful job. The room was clean, the front desk was helpful, the night clerk made it feel safe and did a great job keeping up on the computer time. The hotel needs wireless internet through out and or adapters, my laptop did not have the large port, the safe should be free, it would be nice if there was a stove in the room. Our king bed slipped around a lot and was not very comfortable and the bedding, (not bed cover) was old. My son enjoyed the pool.

Reviews.Title: “DISNEY DREAMS TURNED INTO DISNEY NIGHTMARE”
Reviews.Author: PattiLeit
Reviews.Content: After researching, I was very excited to be going to CS....upon getting to hotel. I found the front desk staff and guest service staff in need of a hospitality course or two! Our rooms weren't ready so our luggage was taken, our credit cards were swiped for specific rooms that were assigned to us and we proceeded to Epcot for the day! A very specific question that I should've asked was how often are there shuttles to parks? Well, I'll tell you...3 shuttles to get to the Disney parks,an 8:05 and 11:55 a.m. to Epcot and a 1 p.m. to Magic Kingdom. If you miss these, you can walk to the highway (10-12 minute walk) and then become part of the mercy of Public Transportation busing(lynx 56)These were Always late!!! After arriving home around midnight to get into our rooms (remember we left before they were ready for us)I was given room keys to two rooms, one of which was no longer adjoining with my children! No apologies, just told that we do not guarantee adjoining rooms. I had paid for the adjoining rooms that AM! Too much stress and witholding of information and poor attitude....we luckily found 6 rooms the very next morning at the Best Western Lake Buena Vista and got out of this hotel as fast as possible! The shuttles at the Best Western are every 30 minutes and are never late!

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Hotel for Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: Brendon P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights and could hardley pick any faults with it. The rooms were clean and tidy. You either get a pool view or view of Old Town from you room. The hotel is close to lots of eating places and Old Town amusement park if you wish to go there. They have a massive 24hr pool and hot tub which is right next to the pool side bar. The breakfast is very adequete and can fill you up having lots of choice from hot buffet and cereals. The only fault is that they use plastic plates along with plastic knives and forks which i was not a fan of. They have a free shuttle that goes to and from Disney World. The shuttle can be late in the morning and night so just be careful if you have a reservation somewhere. The bus drivers are Mexican and are not appoligetic if they are late. If they are late they also tend to speed so hold on when going round corners. Very hard to fault this hotel. It is definately a top hotel to stay at if you are in Kissimmee.

Reviews.Title: “Made a long vacation worth the trip”
Reviews.Author: Jim M
Reviews.Content: Perfect stay in a perfect location. This Comfort Suites provided everything needed on our vacation. The pool was clean, hot tub great, room was perfectly spotless upon arrival, bed were comfortable and the service was fine. Some of the staff could use a refresher course in hospitality, but it was not enough to put a damper on what was a great hotel. The support staff is what made the hotel perfect as the housekeepers and maintenance man were terrific. They were more than happy to help out with any issue that arose throughout our stay. You cannot find a better hotel in this area and the security of this place is great.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Jojo1511
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Excellent location close to everything.The room was large enough for our family of four. The hotel was clean, the staff friendly, the pool and hot tub enjoyable. Breaksfast was filling to get our day started for the parks. My kids especially loved the Mickey Mouse waffles. I couldn't find anything wrong with this hotel. A very comfortable place to stay while on vacation. Ms. Barbara at the ticket desk was helpful and friendly. We will stay here again on our return trip in April.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation?”
Reviews.Author: Tuyet P
Reviews.Content: There is no point to book a reservation with this hotel. We have 5 people and booked our reservation ahead of time. When we arrived, they said they made a mistake and our room was given to others and put us into this tiny room where I had no space to sleep but to sleep on the sofa. I just got up and write this comment while staying here at this hotel because my back hurts and I couldn't sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: tanya999
Reviews.Content: Large well equipped rooms, all rooms can sleep up to 6 people. Very clean. Swimming pool is very warm and the hot tub is almost too hot to go into. Conveniently situated for the entertainment at 'Old Town'. Breakfasts are adequate although not always to one's taste. Hot coffee all day long. Some of the staff on reception are not very friendly. Lots of restaurants nearby. Walmart easy to reach - helpful as microwave/fridge in room. This is 2nd time we've stayed here and we would return. Free internet in rooms. Although a busy hotel, no noise heard in room.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly run night shift”
Reviews.Author: PapaBaar
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel with nice rooms. Problems were at night. First night internet in room didn't work. After trying two cables on two different laptops maint. man was still skeptical that it was their problem. Next morning we packed and moved to a different room-problem solved. Nights two and three there were teenagers from a large group running and yelling in halls well after midnight. After multiple calls desk clerk on night three said I should have switched rooms. First, I did that once already, second they should not have put me in the middle of a tour group (hotel was not full, and third they should have dealt with the people causing the problem). First three nights pretty much ruined my view of what might have been a five star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay for Disney Parks”
Reviews.Author: Robin009
Reviews.Content: A great location for visitors to the Disney Parks or Celebration. The rooms are large and comfy and the front dest staff was great. The breakfast was above average for any hotel chain.The only problem was one morning (in the breakfast area Sunday Dec. 11th) there was a group of high school cheerleaders/drill team there that though they were Gods gift to the world. They were rude to hotel guests and employees and their chaparones were not any better.

Reviews.Title: “Very Surprised An Relieved”
Reviews.Author: blondie54-1
Reviews.Content: I booked a one night stay before leaving for the Caribbean for 3 rooms an 6 adults 1 child. I picked this hotel because it looked and sounded okay in the advisor.,but still thinking it could be a dump..What a pleasant surprise, it was really nice. Check in was fast and everyone was so sweet, they even had the rooms ready and at our request close to each other (when is your room ever ready when you get there, and do they really ever listen to your request?) THEY SURE DID!!! The room was super clean, I'm always looking for anything to complain about,beds were great to sleep on,not worn out, we had a great view of the pool. Our son's room had a good view of the front and Old Town, It was noise free. I did read that someone didn't like the breakfast (it was free) If they couldn't fine something to eat that they liked then they should of stayed in their room, they had anything and everything to eat an it was good.=) We would and will be back to stay here again. Thanks for having a super place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: William S
Reviews.Content: Located back off the main road in a quiet area. There is an amusement park nearby and Old Town Disney which is not much to see but old shops and food places. I would not recommend wasting your time. However, this is a great hotel and an excellent "hot" breakfast buffet with a few different items on the buffet each day. Great value for the price. Very clean quiet area and close to shopping, Disney theme parks, and restaurants. Large rooms and very comfortable bedding and great shower with a coffee pot and refrigerator in the room. The bed pillows were a little small and could be larger but are acceptable. Overall everything was great. Lobby very colorful and nicely decorated for the Christmas season. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced and close to attractions, with good free breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: BetelNut808
Reviews.Content: What I really liked about this place was that we did not need to rent a car to get around. There is a free shuttle to the major resorts and there is a couple of fun parks within walking distance. There are restaurants within walking distance as well. The rooms are comfortable. On the down side.. It did seem noisy at night with people coming and going.

Reviews.Title: “Best we have stayed in, in Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: BilkoSheffield
Reviews.Content: Great value for the price, and we have stayed in many in Kissimmee. The Breakfast Buffet was a bonus, as it was nice not to have to go out and find breakfast each day. Some days it was nice just to have Scrambled egg on toast, and not have to face a full All American in a reseraunt. The Hotel in general was very clean, a few small moans but on the whole it was good. Just can't get my head round the fact you get a small kitchen, Microwave, Sink, Fridge and a nice dinning area. But no plates, cups or knives or forks are supplied. A trip to Wall-mart sorted this though. The Hotal can be a little roudy at times, as we found out on the middle of the first week. When 3 coach loads of 13 - 15 year olds arrived. They were on the whole well behaved, if a little noisy at times (11.45pm once) But all in all a great hotel in a great position with all you could ask for at the price. I am sure we will return on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem Close to the Attractions”
Reviews.Author: Trailerman68
Reviews.Content: A return visit for us to the C.S. Maingate East. We were accompanied this time with my wife's parents. We did not ask for an adjoining, but were pleasantly surprised to find our rooms were adjoining. This hotel is just a short 10 min drive from Disney. It is right next door to the Old Town Entertaiment Complex, great entertainment value. There are numerous restaurants along 192 and are within easy walking distance. The morning breakfast is excellent value and does save time from having to find breakfast in the nearby restaurant. Need groceries, Publix Supermarket is a 5 min walk to pick up supplies. This hotel is very excellent and away from the hustle and bustle of the hotels closer to the attractions. All of the staff are to be commended for the friendliness and courtesy. We were very happy with our 7 night stay and most definitely will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay at in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: BewareEconolodge
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel last year, very close to Disney World and walking distance from that cool place called OldTown. Next time we go back in Orlando this is our hotel for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: TB_Paul
Reviews.Content: We went to Orlando for a seminar and chose this hotel based on the reviews and the property location. The hotel exterior is reminiscent of island colors and agree with others about the nice pool and hot tub. The room was plenty big enough for the two of us. The biggest issue we had was the bed. We did not sleep very well as we thought the mattress was too soft and a bit lumpy. Also, the gap under the room door was a little large allowing light and noise from the hallway to creep into the room. So, if the purpose of a hotel is a place to get a good night's sleep, the Comfort Suites missed the mark. Other than that, we enjoyed our time at the hotel. Breakfast, as expected when all the rooms are sold, was busy, but not a show stopper. We will look around for other locations when we go back to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: eurockAustralia
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 4 nights to visit the theme parks. Top location - we requested (using previous Trip Advisor reviews) a room at the back of the hotel & there was no noise whatsoever. The front office staff were fantastic & went beyond the call of duty printing us off maps, etc for our next few days travelling after checking out. Trey especially was so very helpful & friendly - he should transfer to the Radisson in Carteret,NJ - he could certainly teach them a few things regarding customer service. The rooms were spotless, the breakfast fantastic including the breakfast staff - nothing was too much trouble ...only downer like a few reviews was that it got a bit busy in the breakfast room but saying that - we always managed to get a table for only 2 of us. Not sure what the fuss over the lifts is......might have to wait 2 minutes - some people are so demanding! We also used the shuttle every day - it was always late but did 10-15 mins matter in the whole day of a theme park...chill out people - you're on holiday!! We missed it one night but that was our fault - we misread the place to catch it & we paid $30 for a taxi back so $30 total over 3 days was still good value for 3 theme parks transfer. I used the laundry room whilst there & it was the cheapest we used over our 4 week visit to the States. We also had to wait approx 10 minutes for a luggage carrier on checkout but these minor things was certainly not enough for any negative reviews. We also used the bar & had a snack on the first night we arrived - not bad, very convenient but heaps better eating around if you can be bothered to venture out. All in all.... a great value hotel, clean, friendly staff, good location & amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: fkscott
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 days in a 2 queen bed suite, rooms were spotless, the breakfast buffet was wonderful and included eggs and saugage, the pool was nice, warm, the hot tub was also very nice, both were open 24 hours, we also used their laundry room, which was clean and reasonably priced, friendly and helpful staff, great location, good prices, you cant go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Before & After Disney World Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mauser
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay at this hotel for one or two nights before we check in or out of our Disney World hotel. We want to get an early start at DW, so we arrive in Orlando a day before our Disney vacation and stay at Comfort Suites Maingate East. We always leave DW late in the afternoon (to get our moneys worth on our tickets), and we stay at Comfort Suites that night and head home the next day. We have stayed at this hotel 4 times over the years. The last time was in April 2011. Rooms are very nice and very clean. The breakfast is very good also. We found only 2 downsides. If they have a lot of tour busses, the breakfast area can become very crowded and the luggage carriers become very scarce(I think they only have 3 for the whole hotel). We hope to visit DW in late 2012 and will stay at this hotel again. Mauser

Reviews.Title: “As per other reviews - a very good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: skr80
Reviews.Content: Large comfortable quiet rooms, with comfy beds!! small dining area with fridge and sink. Buffet breakfast extremely good with a great variety (though it was disappointing to see people pile up plates with food and leave half of it). Close to Disney, and in Old town, so superb for walking to bars / restaurants and attractions at night. Having stayed previously in a nice I drive hotel , I have to say I much prefer the location and attractions in this area. I would stay here again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel decent price good location”
Reviews.Author: SpringlakeNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay- decent hotel at a good price - includes a varied breakfast- Service at the hotel was very nice and friendly. Quiet rooms - we found it best not to eat at the restaurant's they recomemended. They had a good fitness center and a nice pool- Nice size pool. Clean rooms and staff was keeping the breakfast area clean and refreshed food when it was getting low

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: manka04
Reviews.Content: This was a very good hotel, good location close to all disney parks. The staff were very friendly and helpful.I went with my two kids 10 and 7, they liked going to the swimming pool after the visit to the parks, heated pools and nice breakfast. Just one dollar for washing and one for drying. Overall we had a comfortable stay in this hotel and we will definitely stay here on our next visit to orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Still my favourite in the area”
Reviews.Author: truereviewChorley
Reviews.Content: Every time we visit kissimmee this is still our favourite hotel. Have tried others in area but return to this one. Rooms are good size. Laundry on each floor. Good size pool and excellent continental breakfast included in price. Many hotels in kissimmee do not include breakfast. Location ideal for Disney and Old Town. Within walking distance of good restaurants and Old Town but still nice and quiet. Can't wait until our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Quiet and Close to everywhere”
Reviews.Author: Emma J
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 2 week honeymoon in Florida, we stayed at Comfort Suites in Kissimmee. The ticket prices for the parks were so expensive that we needed a budget hotel. Comfort Suites is great if this is what you are looking for. Obviously for the price, you don't get preferencial treatment, even if it is honeymoon! Staff were efficient if a little cold. Breakfast was free, but basic, we ate in the hotel most days, but for a treat went down the road to Cracker Barrel for a more delicious brekkie! The bar does not stay open very late, don't know if thats just the time of year, but Old Town is a stones throw away if you want to stay out longer. Overall the hotel was good, cheap and close to all the parks, perfect if you just want to use it as a base. Just a tip, when we went we arrived it was dark and the 'Florida Plaza' sign was missing some lights and was not very noticeable from the road. The road you need to turn down off the 192 is directly before the big 'Old Town' Ferris Wheel, next to a Red Lobster.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget option, but I would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: zerotax
Reviews.Content: Pros:Clean, large rooms, nicely setup, good location, friendly staff, excellent breakfast, near Old Town (a small amusement park). Cons: Small hotel bar. Its outside. Fine for summer, not so fine when it gets cooler. NOISY. On Friday and Saturday nights, we found it hard to sleep (our room faced the nearby Old Town amusement park), breakfast was so popular it was too crowded and noisy - on weekends we had to eat outside - there were no tables inside, only 1 computer in the "business center" we frequently had to wait to use the printer, slow elevators - we stayed on the 4th floor and found it quicker to use the stairs, Disney shuttles run so infrequently (1x or 2x a day) that we could not use them, pool was unattractive and could be cleaner, "resort fee" of $2.26 per day to cover the cost of the broken safe in our room and local phone calls (that we never made), pull-out couch/bed was very uncomfortable for my 9-year old. Overall, this really is an OK, low-cost option. But in the future, my family and I will look for something a bit more upscale.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy and Clean”
Reviews.Author: lucky37
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because it was close to Disney and Universal and because it was rated 5th on Trip Advisor. We found it very roomy and clean. Housekeeping was excellent (I believe her name was Marilyn). They serve a hot free breakfast every morning from 7 am to 10 am, which of course, saves you money. The beds were comfortable and even though it is close to Old Town, there was no noise at all. You can't beat the price for everything you get. My family and I will definitely stay here on our next trip to the Theme Parks.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again. Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nsobgyn
Reviews.Content: The rooms are extremely clean. The beds are comfortable. The breakfast is great; not fancy but there is a decent assortment of cold and hot foods. The pool area and jacuzzi are also very clean and nice. Overall, I will be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Basic, no-frills accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Proslacker
Reviews.Content: It's a really simple place, no frills accommodation. Rooms are clean and basic, nothing really special about the hotel. Location wise, pretty near WDW, although it is situated in a remote area. For its value (can't remember exact cost) for a 4-sharing room, prices are good for tourists visiting the theme parks. Also, free breakfast is provided, cereal, waffles, fruit and the like. Somehow we walked away with the feeling that we could have gotten a better deal in the nearby hotels. But not too bad on the whole.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: BobandJoyce
Reviews.Content: We stayed here using our points and were very satisfied. We had a large suite with lots of chairs and a sofa, fridge, microwave etc. Only drawback was we were only here one night and at Disney all day so didn't really utilize the room. The breakfast buffet was a real surprise---none of this skimpy selection here! Two kinds of eggs, Canadian bacon, waffles, muffins, cerals, fruit etc, etc. We plan on going back again in Dec as the location is really handy and there are tons of nearby resturants. Staff is pleasant, helpful and friendly--all in all a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: FunYoda
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly as advertised on the website - clean, roomy with nice staff. The value can not be beat as breakfast and parking is free. We opted for a king suite with 2 rooms on the second week which worked out really well. It was wonderful after a long day at the parks to escape to a quiet almost homelike atmosphere. The 24 hour coffee is just great! Breakfast was really good - the kids enjoyed the Mickey waffles and so did we! We are coming back March 2012 en looking forward to our stay :)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Doneyroney
Reviews.Content: So, I stayed here on business, not on vacation. Conference was at the nearby and highly overrated Gaylord Palms. I found the Comfort Suites very suitable for my purposes. Room was comfortable, clean, well-appointed. Pool was great and nearly empty while I was there. I'd recommend this hotel for business travelers, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 9/25-9/27. It was very clean. Very afordable and very close to everything. 15-20 minutes from all major attractions and there were a lot of great places to eat all up and down the road. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. While we didn't have time to use the pool, it was crystal clean and beautiful. The breakfast buffet every morning was fantastic. The chocolate chip waffles are to die for! I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Share the pool with Racoons”
Reviews.Author: ocean68
Reviews.Content: The first room was not one of the "updated" "deluxe" rooms. It was thread bare, dirty sheets and a pull out with a mattress that even my nine year old would not go near. We were moved to a renovated room. It was better, with newer furniture, but still dirty sheets and blankets. It is nasty to find others hair on your bedding!!! My husband went to the pool for a late swim to find racoons all over the pool deck and in trash. Bizarre considering its a very city area. Would not stay here again. No way.

Reviews.Title: “well be back”
Reviews.Author: theesserys
Reviews.Content: this was our 4th time back and bye far the best hotel weve stayed in for the price,location,we stayed over the road in the holiday inn and also further up the 192 road in the bestwestern lakeside twice but this hotel beat them all,free breakfast,very clean well decorated rooms,staff was helpfull if needed and pool was great heated all year round and kept very clean.hotel also supplies a free theme park shuttle bus at various times off the day free off charge.And also anouther plus oldtown 5mins walk across the road.our family loves oldtown great places to eat also old car cruises on fri and sat night plus plenty of shops and arcades.ontop off that a great fun fair called fun spot with plenty off rides for only $35 dollars all night.so really nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to stay”
Reviews.Author: dorian2120
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location close to disney and great places to eat tikki bar opens at 4 and has half price drinks til 7.breakfast which is complimentary has good choice and free tea and coffee all day is a bonus would stay here again in a blink

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Rip off Disney ticket sales.”
Reviews.Author: ellieblackcat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in August and had a lovely time for the most part. The room was great, the pool was clean and inviting, the location next to Old Town was excellent and a nice breakfast was available each day. The down side to this hotel is the lady in the Disney ticket booth within the hotel who told us her price for the one day passes for the 3 of us for EPCOT was cheaper than the gate price. We were very shocked and disappointed to find the EPCOT gate price to be actually a lot cheaper than what she charged us. We were also very angry but did not let it spoil our day out. Shame on the staff in that hotel who sell Disney tickets. How can they charge more than the gate price?

Reviews.Title: “For short family stopovers - great value, great breakfast & plenty on your doorstep”
Reviews.Author: chipmcdouglas
Reviews.Content: Room wise this is a fairly average, pleasant enough stay on a moderate to low budget - no suprises there. But get this room on a bargain rate -many are available online, and you find yourself with a great value package for short stays. A decent buffet breakfast was thrown in, the pool area is large & clean & Old Town/ Fun spot is a 2minute walk across a quiet street - thats one HUGE games room. Okay so it's not beautifully landscaped like some resorts, but this is practically a third of the nightly rate and with no 'resort' fees! Plenty of food options nearby on the 192 (but via car only) Celebration is 5 mins away, and a Wal-Mart is close by too. If you're doing a 1 or 2 night stay over, like us, then this is perfect. For longer -okay you may want to pay more & be nearer Disney ( as in Disney shuttle bus distance - by car its only a 25 min drive away) but for short stops - where fun is the agenda - then i'd pick this place again in a heartbeat - and plough all those savings into cold beer & spicy pizza across at Old Town after a long theme park day. I've stayed at much nicer in Orlando - but i've also had to pay WAY more. For a cheap & cheerful option - especially if you're not planning to be around much in the day anyway ( you'll be at Disney) then this is great option on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Every Year”
Reviews.Author: daisymaeToronto
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel every year for the last six years.The staff is very helpful and friendly,the prices are great and it is so close to all the major theme parks.They have a complimentary deluxe breakfast,hot tub,bar and free shuttles to the theme parks.It is always spotless and we have never had to worry about anything.We will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, would visit again.”
Reviews.Author: jannster
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights during our stay in Florida. The rooms were clean and nice. Two queen beds and a sofa bed. Fridge, sink, coffee maker. We had 4 adults, 2 kids and we fit in there nicely. When we arrived, we were pleasantly surprised to find that "Old Town" was right next door. The kids enjoyed going over and walking through it. The breakfast was amazing! They go above and beyond the call of duty for breakfast! WOW! My kids ate and ate. They were full enough that we did not have to even eat lunch while at the amusement parks. Very nice... thanks! The pool stays open 24 hours a day, which is nice when you stay out at the parks so late. One night we saw a raccoon stealing garbage from a garbage can out by the pool. Vile little creatures, but they are difficult to control. Not the fault of the hotel at all. Bar by the pool was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaMomOfTeens
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night while visiting some friends who were vacationing at Disney. We often stay at Comfort Suites because we can get two beds plus the pull-out sofa, so we already knew what to expect from this hotel chain. This particular hotel is in very good repair, especially considering that it is in a high-traffic area and caters to vacationing families and youth groups. It is freshly painted and the furnishings look relatively new. As others have mentioned, the elevators are slow - so if you are impatient and averse to using the stairs, I suggest you ask for a lower-floor room. We had a room on the 4th floor that faced out the front - it had a nice view of Old Town in the evening. I was initially worried that late-night noise from the nearby rides and outdoor entertainment might be an issue, but it was not. The complimentary breakfast buffet had a variety of hot and cold items and was quite good. The staff at this hotel was excellent - very courteous and helpful. Everyone from the front desk receptionist, breakfast servers, housekeeping and the man touching up paint in the hallway greeted us with a good morning and a smile. Kudos to the management of this hotel for quality maintenance of the property and staff training! It's the attention to detail and the staff that makes this a 5-star hotel in its category. This hotel is easy to get to from the highway and has convenient access to Disney. Next to the hotel is an area called Old Town. There are carnival rides, go karts, midway games, mini golf, cheesy tourist shops and restaurants. We happened to be there on a Saturday night so there was also a classic car show and outdoor entertainment. This is not an upscale operation and I wouldn't necessarily make a special trip for it, but since it was right next to the hotel, we did wander over there for an hour or so.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmyP1989
Reviews.Content: Loved every moment only downside pool bar don't open till 3 n kiddie pool not big enough Otherwise FAB

Reviews.Title: “My best Florida trip yet!”
Reviews.Author: Debw555
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd trip to Florida as a single mum and my favourite hotel yet. I'd definitely stay here again. I didn't hire a car so made good use of the hotel shuttles to Disney, Universal, Seaworld and Lake Buenavista mall. In addition the Lynx bus stops at the top of the road so you can get to Magic Kingdom or Downtown Disney for $2 each so you are not tied to shuttle times. The free breakfast filled us up each morning and we were happy with the variety and selection. 24hr coffee was a bonus too and much nicer than the coffee provided in the rooms. The room was cleaned daily, the pool area and pool were clean and normally very quiet. All staff were pleasant and very helpful. We really enjoyed our stay. Yes, the lifts are slow, however there are stairs too if you are in a hurry ;o)

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: E-man1979
Reviews.Content: Was there for 4 days, great place.Real good customer service. We had 2 problems with the room and they resolved it quick. The breakfast buffet is awesome, you got to try the chocolate chip mickey mouse waffles!!! Pool was nice but the kiddie pool was better!! Rooms are a bit smaller than pictured, but the location is great. Would recommend this to anybody!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: jjo0722
Reviews.Content: We are from south fl and had a baseball tourney at espn wide world of sports, and hotel was like 5 mins away, great place, rooms are huge

Reviews.Title: “Return visit and it wasn't as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: loru100
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel a few years ago and went back due to the great AAA rate and complimentary breakfast. The service was good and we were satisfied with everything until the last few days of our stay. They had rented out basically the entire floor to a school group and the noise didn't stop all night. The security guard posted on our floor did nothing, just kept reading his book and when we complained to the front desk they said there was no other room to move us to. If we would have been starting our vacation rather than finishing it, we would have switched hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel403
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to Disney, only $25 cab ride if shuttles don't work for you. Public transit will take you to disney also, bus stops in front of Old Town.Kids loved Old town across the street and there are lots of places to eat close by.The free breakfast is good. The hotel itself is nice and very clean. The service is great, our air conditioner wasn't working properly when we first arrived and they had a new one installed within an hour! The kids loved the pool and it was never overcroweded. Staff very friendly and helpful. We will definitely be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicole R
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family of 5 and 2 other couples with kids for Memorial Day weekend. Great hotel for the price and includes free breakfast buffett, excellent clean pool and kid pool, friendly, shuttle to parks, and walking distance to restaurant. Cant wait to go back. Staff was great, no problems getting fast service and extra towels (and we asked alot trust me). We had a AAA discount so we got it even cheaper then we thought. Only problem was water in shower came out a little slow (water restrictors on) but otherwise great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for an Orlando Vacation”
Reviews.Author: smartcookie1916
Reviews.Content: We spent the two nights here as our base to visit the Magic Kingdom and Sea World. The hotel was bright, clean and the staff professional. Our room was spacious, newly furnished and best of all... it was immaculate! Old Town is advertised as a place to visit--the economy has had an impact on the place. It is not worth visiting even if it is directly across the street. The complimentary breakfast is a buffet, it is adequate but if you like your breakfast to be hot you may want to go somewhere along the highway. As I stated earlier, the hotel is well maintained it is a good base for a trip to Orlando. It is AAA rated. I would definitely stay here again and encourage others to do so, too.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Saekiz
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the hotel.. Never really got a chance to test the facilities, because we were spending both days in the local hospital.. :-( Rooms, though, are nice and spacious with all you may need for a plessant stay. Breakfast is really nice with a wide array of products.. Staff is nice and welcomming.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: havlyn
Reviews.Content: I totally enjoyed my experience at this hotel. Checkin was smooth, room was clean, house keeper Doribel did a great job everyday. Breakfast was beyond what I thought it was going to be. The location was perfect everything was right across the road even better than international drive. The pool looked great even though I did not go into it but family did everyday even until 3am. The next time I will get room with flat screen. There is also security in parking lot because i left a door open in jeep and got a call from frint desk. Will definitely come back again

Reviews.Title: “very clean and comfortable but needs thicker walls!”
Reviews.Author: rtyson
Reviews.Content: The rooms were lovely and clean when we arrived and the ladies from housekeeping made sure it stayed that way throughout our 2 week stay. The bathroom was large, well lit and well stocked with toiletries and the shower stayed hot even at 'peak shower time'. It was nice to have a kitchenette in the room, so we didn't need to find somewhere to eat out for every meal, but there was no crockery or cutlery supplied in the rooms so that had to be bought elsewhere or borrowed from the breakfast area. The free breakfast was definitely an added bonus to our stay and there was enough to enable us to vary what we ate so we didn't get too bored eating the same thing every morning. Free tea, coffee and hot water in the breakfast area throughout the day was a nice touch too. The 2 elevators where a little slow at busy times, we stayed at an off peak time so it was only really during the breakfast period that we were affected, so we used the stairs to help work off that sausage and egg. None of us used the fitness room, though it did look quite well equipped we felt walking round the parks and swimming was enough exercise for us, which brings us to the pool, plenty of seating/loungers and towels were available, the pool was a good temperature and the hot tub was boiling! 2 minutes was enough for me! Loved the location too, right behind the old town and close to restaurants so we were able to nip out a fair few evenings without the car. Our only gripe about the hotel was the wall thickness, any raised voices in the adjoining rooms was almost like being in there with them, we had one couple argue all night which wasn't pleasant, when we enquired about moving rooms at the reception we found out that luckily the couple were moving on that day.....only to replaced at the weekend by a couple of coach loads of teenage girls on our floor. So if you stay at peak times when a room change is not possible you might want to pack some earplugs to get you through noisy nights. Oh and they could have done with more than one computer with internet access in the lobby. But on the whole we had a fun and comfortable stay at the Comfort suites and would recommend to any heavy sleepers/earplug owners :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel ...Clean rooms ...Great Staff....Near Everything”
Reviews.Author: tombaby1
