Reviews.Content: Great Hotel ...Clean rooms ...Great Staff....Near Everything

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel-Old Town”
Reviews.Author: Beachgirl2301
Reviews.Content: Actually we stayed there in January 2007. We had the top floor with a view of Old Town. Enjoyed going to Old Town, especially on Saturday afternoon. The vintage cars was something to see. The shop were also nice and very clean area. Very friendly people at the stores, and the entertainment on the stage was out of this world. Front desk staff was so good to help us get back to the Orlando Airport. We never had any issues with the hotel. Everyone said hello in the hallways. We felt right at home. We stayed for a week and the breakfast was very good. Hotel is extremely clean, and the rooms were done up well. Beds were very comfortable, and linens well pressed and beds made up perfectly. The drapes were great, and nicely decorated, which kept the room dark in the morning. The bathroom was well equipment with shampoos, soaps, conditioners. Did not spare anything. The furniture is good quality. We really felt like we were on vacation staying at Comfort Suites. The internet worked good, and lots of room on the desk to work from. Had many coupon books in the lobby for local restaurants, which was very helpful. Don't rent townhouses nearby, as they are dirty and stinky, and not as safe an area like this hotel. We enjoyed walking to Old Town, and some of the best restaurants in town. The suite has plenty of room for a family. The kitchenette had a kettle and coffee maker, along with a little fridge/freezer and microwave. Kitchen cabinets and a sink. What more would someone want? Rooms were made up on a timely manner, and the carpets were cleaned daily. Our suite was kept up in a timely manner. We enjoyed walking through the door, to have the suite totally taken care of. Now I call this a real vacation. We bought a few things at the grocery store, and had snacks at night. Ground maintenance was great. Always cleaning and it sure showed it, when you drive up to the front doors. There was a shuttle bus also that takes you to the hotel. Car rentals just around the corner. The shopping nearby was also good. Be careful going out at night away from the hotel. Some areas are questionable. If you stay on the main road 192, then everything should be okay. We will be taking a cruise from Port Canaveral, and will stay a few nights, just to visit Old Town and take in the entertainment. Check out the website for Old Town and see what bands are playing at Old Town. You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!!!!”
Reviews.Author: welovemickey13
Reviews.Content: We changed to this hotel after awful reviews on our first choice and we could not have been happier,we loved this place! It was so clean,the staff could not have been more helpful or polite.The free breakfast was much better than we thought,more than adequate to set you up for the day with lots of freshly cooked eggs,French toast etc and also yoghurt,fruits,etc.It was so quiet in spite of it's proximity to Fun Spot and old town.The pool area was clean and well maintained.We read the previous comments on the slow lifts but honestly we did not find it a problem at all.We would go back without hesitation,we were so comfortable,well looked after and we felt safe,all in all loved it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Watched EPCOTS fireworks from my room!”
Reviews.Author: disneydave666
Reviews.Content: Bad things first. As mentioned countless times before, the elevators are slow and you can be waiting for a wile by the recption area until it arrives. Yes it is inconvienent but please do not let that spoil your vacation. The rooms are spacious and functional - no signs of any bugs that had been reported in a previous review. The pillows are small but you get plenty of them. The bathroom is big and they provide shower gel and shampoo. My room was cleaned everyday with a daily towel change - no complaints with my room. Towels are provided around the pool and the pool bar opens from 3pm to 10pm. The pool bar provides food ( burgers pizzas and snacks ) and during the happy hour can get a beer for $1.35 ( about 80p to us Brits! ). Very friendly staff who make you feel welcome. Breakfast is great and unusual to have included in a hotels room rate. Get ther early to avoid the crowds although I usually ate ouside around the pool which was lovely to do. Obviously try the Mickey Mouse waffles!! WiFi is available on the ground floor and broadband is available in your rooms. There is a small gift shop , ATM, games room and gym. I could see Disney World's fireworks from my room which was on the 6th floor and could actually see Spaceship Earth. The hotel is lterally next to FunSpot and Old Town so you will never be bored. I was worried that you be able to hear the Go karts but you cannot so dont worry. The bus to the parks are very good but be there early as they tend to leave before the published times. Remember that the if you want to go to EPCOT and do not want to wait for the afternoon bus go on the 8.15 to the Magic Kingom which takes you to the Transportation and Ticket Centre and and go on the EPCOT monorail. You can also get to Hollywood Studios, Animal Kingdom and the waterparks on the Disney buses which you get opposite your drop off point (lane 25). Overall, this is excellent value for money and a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to Stay, I would definetly come back”
Reviews.Author: gac13fc
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel after researching lots of hotels online. I'm happy to say everything I read about was true. Although just me and my husband stayed here, there were lots of families. The room was very clean with comfortable beds and new bedding. The fridge and microwave although we didn't use it much was great to have. The pool and hot tub were open 24 hours. The free breakfast was hot and cold, a great variety, and plentiful. Staff was polite and helpful, maid service excellant. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. There was a $2.26 daily charge for local calls and in room safe which I didn't use. Actually there was not even a lock on the safe and I never bothered to ask for one. When I checked out I asked about the charge and was told it was a surcharge for other things and they ran out of keys for the safes. So I paid it, returned home looked back on the site to see I read correctly that the charge was for local calls and safe. I called the hotel and they immediately refunded me the charge, no hassle. I am very picky about where I stay and this place was definetly a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: CECI_11038
Reviews.Content: The best it has is the excellent location. The room was very comfortable and spacious. The hotel facilities and breakfast were very good. The only thing that wasn't so good were the elevators. It seems that there were lots of people staying in the hotel and it took ages to get an elevator. I was travelling with my baby so it was quite complicated to use the stairs with the stroller.

Reviews.Title: “Convinient, clean comfortable and fun!!”
Reviews.Author: DataGirl75
Reviews.Content: This particular location was directly across from Old Town. We were able to easily visit Old Town, then unwind for the evening by the pool and hot tub with a drink from the tiki bar. Rooms were so clean and comfy! The next morning, we went down for breakfast and were amazed at the spread of food. Crowded, yes. But it was delicious and free! The only downside was that the elevators were a little slow.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for comfort, amenities, and Orlando attractions”
Reviews.Author: hutsonfam
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced for the beautiful, spacious rooms and the complimentary expanded breakfast. Easy access to Disney World locations.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: CeliaBraz
Reviews.Content: Quiet, well located and trusted reviews. The hotel has a good maintenance and looks like new. I definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the money”
Reviews.Author: robbry999
Reviews.Content: Quick attentive service,large rooms ,excellent for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday! Definately recommend!”
Reviews.Author: gneville90
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two week trip to Orlando and chose Comfort Suites and loved it. The rooms are very spacious and are cleaned daily. There is a TV, microwave. hairdryer, fridge/freezer and a safe in the room. The pool area is fine, we were just using it as a base so only spent a few evenings around the pool, and also found the bar very pleasant and the snacks good. The location of the hotel is great. Directly outside the hotel is not the best view but we saw many other hotels that had a worse locations. Burger King, Red Lobster, Mcdonalds, Pizza Hut, KFC, and also the Publix food store all within under 10 minute walk so you'll never go hungry. Our plan was to hire a car but never felt the need. We read lots of reviews before we went with people saying you must hire but we got away with the shuttle and taxis. The shuttle timetable looks very poor but actually worked for us. and if we wanted to go at other times we just got a taxi which was very reasonable. Shuttle times; Magic Kingdom - 8.15 returning at 18.00 or 22.00. Epcot - 11.40 or 12.20 returning at 21.45 Universal and Seaworld - 9.50 returning at 19.45 Must remember that there are internal Disney shuttles that run to all Disney water parks and theme parks. Breakfast is ok but nothing special. All food is served on disposable plates and cutlery which we hated. All in all we found the hotel absolutely perfect for what we wanted. We wern't going to be spending time at the hotel because we went for Disney and Universal, hoiwever the time spent in the hotel and by the pool was very pleasant. Obviously if Disneys the main reason for your visit go in one of there hotels, but if you want to be out of the parks and doing your own thing, and eat where you want to eat definately go here! Would definately recommend the hotel. For the price you pay and the service you get its great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Would 100% Come Back!”
Reviews.Author: sarahbeey
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, our first room was a little small for a family of 4 but when we asked at reception to upgrade to a bigger room this was not a problem, they let us view the room first which was fantastic, a lot bigger than before, and with a separate bedroom for the adults leading into a mini bathroom aswell. Maid service was excellent, she deserved a tip everyday! Breakfast did the job before the long days ahead of us and the complimentary hot drinks 24hrs a day was brilliant. Would defintely stay here again. Everyone was very welcoming and friendly..

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel outside of Disney!”
Reviews.Author: ad1dasfl
Reviews.Content: This is my go-to hotel when I head to Disney during "peak" Disney season, and most of the time in the off-season. Comfort Suites has nailed down everything you need for a relaxing vacation, or even just a weekend get-a-way. You're hotel stay includes a hot breakfast buffet, for FREE! It's not one of those comtinental breakfasts either. There is scrambled eggs, french toast, bagels, toast, sausage gravy & biscuits, cereal, a variety of juices, as well as a Mickey waffle station. And there is coffee in the lobby 24 hours a day. For a family of four this will save you about $40-$50 per day by eating at the hotel as opposed to going to one of the outside breakfast buffets. The pool and jacuzzi are open 24 hours, and they provide towels at the pool so you aren't wasting your room towels, and then chasing housekeeping for more towels. The tiki bar at the pool is very reasonably priced. A mixed drink costs about $5, which is nothing compared to the $10 the Disney hotels charge for the same size drink! Some of the rooms are a little dated, but otherwise very clean and comfortable. None of those flat, lifeless pillows, in fact you get 4 to a bed! The comforter is very comfy, and the sheets are soft. The bathroom is oversized, which is great when you're staying for a week, there is plenty of room to spread out all of your toiletries! The room also comes equipped with a decent sized refrigerator (bigger than those tiny dorm-sized ones), cupboards to store your paper plates, a microwave, a coffee pot with coffee supplies, and a small kitchen sink. All of these items at a Disney value resort are extra. In fact, the fridge at Disney in a value resort runs a little over $10 a day, and it's the tiny dorm fridge. In order to get a fridge for free at Disney you need to book a moderate resort or higher, which can be costly. The hotel is located within walking distance of Old Town and FunSpot. They are certainly no Disney World, but a nice change and pace if you have an extra day to spare. I can't remember if internet is complimentary in the rooms, but I was able to access their server by the pool. I never tried to access it in the room itself. The only negative I can find at this hotel is the elevators are EXTREMELY slow. Ask for a 1st or 2nd floor room. All in all I give Comfort Suites 5 stars. They have everything you need at reasonable prices. I've stayed at many hotels in and out of Disney. I do suggest staying at a Disney resort at least once, but after that save yourself a lot of money and pick this place!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!! VERY RELAXING!!”
Reviews.Author: leeleelob
Reviews.Content: This was my seventh trip to Orlando and the first time we had stayed outside a Disney resort since 1995. Hotel in a great location and a bit tricky to find at first but we got there in the end. Lovely and clean, very big and quiet and relaxing. Room was big and had a little kitchenette - only complaint I have was there was no crockery/cutlery supplied which which was a pain considering there was a microwave, sink and fridge but nevertheless, these were dead handy and we didnt eat in anyway! Lovely big beds and bathroom and all very clean. Swimming pool was lovely and the unlimited free tea and coffee downstairs was great. We didnt make use of the breakfast which came with our room as we tried the first morning and it was manic!!! Great location, only 5-10 minutes from Disney!!! Would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Foslo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights while visiting family in Kissimmee. The hotel is clean and covers all the bases for me... comfortable accommodations (although the pillows are small squares and rather lumpy, but they give you enough so you can have a selection) with good closet and drawer space, included full breakfast, fitness center, PC for guest use. The staff were friendly and helpful. The quiet location is great for the Disney parks, and Rte 192 is loaded with restaurants and shops. It's close enough to the I-4, as well. I enjoyed viewing the many classic cars parked around Old Town during the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: L0vet0travel2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from April 1-8 2011. We rented a car which I think is a better option than depending on the bus. I liked that we could come and go as we pleased. I also loved that is right next to Old Town.. my boys ages 12 and 15 loved that. They didn't even care if we went to the parks they had so much fun in Old Town. Walk out of the hotel parking lot and you're in Old Town..there's restaurants, stores, rides and bars...what a great location. The hotel is back where there is nothing behind you so it is very private. I found the staff to be helpful and friendly despite what others have said. Our room was spotless clean and the maids work hard. The beds are so comfortable too..lots of room even a sofabed. Across the street there are flea markets and restaurants..everything you could possibly want is in the area from a Publix supermarket to a 24hr Walgreens..what a great location. I would recommend this hotel..you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: Susan47Anglesey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 2 week honeymoon in May 2011 and was totally dissapointed with the hotel and staff. On arrival, after an 8½ hour flight, 90 minutes waiting to get through immigration and a 20 minute transfer, we were not made to feel welcome at all. We were handed our keys and told which floor we were on. The check-in lady did not seem very helpful at all and on asking about the shuttle service were just handed a piece of paper. The lady came across as very impolite. The room was basic but adequate however it was not quite as the brochure. The cupboard draws were broken. Both the sink and toilet was blocked on arrival but the maintenance man did call promptly only to have to be called out again the following monring. A word of warning the aircon is very noisy and if you leave it on it was make a raquet throughout the night! Breakfast was included and was OK albeit it was the same most days. Eggs, Muffins, Ham, Beans, Cereal, Toast, Jams and Waffles. Biggest problem was the shuttle service to the theme parks. Too Disney World it was at 8.15 with a pick up at 7.30pm. If you wanted to go to Sea World and Universal Studios it was not until 9.50am with a pick up at 7.30. Epcot was not until 10.50am. The staff at the hotel were not very helpful when we inquired about public transport. They simply had no idea. Luckily we found out that the 56 bus (which goes from outside Pandorosa) takes you straight to Magic Kingdom, a 20 minute journey for 2 dollars. Busses run from 6.00am until 10.40pm Ideal! when you arrive at Magic Kingdom there is a Nr 50 bus which then takes you to Downtown Disney and Sea World. If you ask for a transfer before you get on the Nr 56 bus you do not have to pay for the Nr 50! if you use the transfer within 1 hour. Again the bussess run every half hour and gives you the flexibility to enjoy the theme parks better. The public transport was amazing and very reliable. If you do stay at this hotel I suggest eating at Denny's. The food was fantastic and the service excellent. I The corridor outside the room did smell of P

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and well located”
Reviews.Author: BJC84
Reviews.Content: Travelled here the 2 weeks before Easter with my family, 7 of us in all. We chose this hotel as we had been quite a few years ago and wanted something in Kissimmee, rather than a villa. The Comfort Suites was chosen as we wanted a hotel like you find in the UK rather than a motel, some motels the rooms open straight out onto the grounds rather than into the building. It also needed to have family rooms, sitting and kitchen area, pool and restaurant, it also include a buffet breakfast (bonus). This fitted the bill and checking Trip Advisor had good reports and a good rating, its fair to say I can see where some of the comments come from except the ones about the staff. This is on the basis they could not have been more helpful at check-in or through our time there. Is it recommended yes definitely, will we stay again planning on going in 2013 (hopefully). Its location is ideal, literally next turning right after the big wheel in old town going East on 192. Comfort Suites is the large building next to the Pirates Cove pitch and Putt on the left hand side. There are a number of restaurants locally along with a small supermarket all of which can be walked to, if crossing the road use the traffic lights as there is a crossing there. We didn’t and crossing the 192 (3 lanes ether way) was fun !!, then found out about the crossings. Another tip for driving and wanting to go west on 192 use the service road rather then a “U” turn, its quicker and easier. When you get in the room there are a number of take away leaflets and they get pushed under the door, ideal if you can’t be bothered. Call them up and they deliver, didn’t use it ourselves but all the Americans did. As there is a fridge in the room you may want dinks etc, there are a couple of local supermarkets but we went to Walmart. These are easy to find, 1 is on 192 just keep going it’s a fair way, the other is go East on 192 when you come out of the hotel and turn left at the 3rd set of lights and its straight down that road. You can ask at the desk and they give spot on directions, better than the sat nav. Its wider location is also spot on around 45 mins to an hour from Sanford (using the tollroad, you need $5 - $7 in change as not all booths are manned), and 30 - 45 mins from Orlando airport. Interstate 4 is 5-10 minutes away, the furthest large attraction is Universal about 30 mins away. Also if you don’t fancy driving or don’t have a car walk round old town at night is good fun, Thursday, Friday and Saturday nights the are car and bike shows. Hotel facilities are really good, some basic but adequate. The car park is large and you park where you want, make sure you have the pass on especially on Thursday’s, Friday,s and Saturday’s as there are cars parked everywhere due to the shows. In the reception area there is a small shop with some English papers, drinks, chocolate, emergency item, sun cream (get it at Walmart far cheaper than taking with you) and gifts. A small games room which works from tokens, exchange them in the machine in there. Internet access is also available from a machine in the business centre along with a printer, an ATM is also in here though we didn’t use it. Finally a desk to buy park / attraction tickets, no cheaper than gate price but it gets you straight in. The only down side is there try to sell you other items. Also off here is the fitness suite, not massive but if you’re like us you’re on holiday so what the gyms off the agenda. The dining area is also off the reception area with tea / coffee available 24/7. Breakfast is good, cereals, muffins, juices, toast, hot foods (egg, sausage, beans), try the waffles freshly made and some days Mickey shaped. Outside is the pool, kiddie pool and hot tub along with the bar open 15:00 to 23:00 and you will need your ID (in fact you will need it everywhere). Our rooms were excellent on the 4th floor and all had 2 queen size beds and a pull out, so the room could sleep 6. They have air conditioning, this varied room to room on how good it was. Two of the rooms were automatic (set the temp and its trips in and out maintaining that temp), the other room was manual and ran full time (just turn it off when too cold). Also in the room is a safe, you are given the lock when you check in (its covered by the resort charge about $20 for 2 weeks). In the kitchen area there is a fridge, microwave and small sink but no utensils. We had jacket spuds one night and the hotel gave us plates and cutlery, just the job. Also coffee maker, TV with good channels including ESPN, Iron plus board, hair dryer and enough storage for clothes etc (would be tight for 6). Maid service every day, toiletries in the bathroom along with plenty of towels (towels are also at the pool). Impressed with the rooms for size and facilities. Check-in was easy, initially thought we had a misunderstanding with the rooms. Wanted 2 doubles and a family room, I thought she said 3 doubles. Explained what we had booked, she went away to discuss it with some one and came back with a solution. We then had a discussion over what was in the room, then I realised I had made a mistake. The rooms were exactly as we had requested, in fact better than as we were all adjacent to each other. We decided whilst in the US to go to Planet Hollywood, eTickets were cheaper from the UK so ordered them online. Got them as a PDF and the computer in the business centre blocked them. Spoke to the lady on reception who spoke with some one in admin, I then went into their offices to log in and print them off. Also asked them for directions and advice on various things, it was never a problem. They could not have been more helpful. We were all impressed with the hotel, including the wildlife (Racoon, couple of snakes and a spider all taken care of no danger to you).

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL WE LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: sarahlouise1988
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful! Located a few steps away from Old Town and right on the 192. Lots of places to eat and things to do nearby, Mini Golf is a two minute walk from the hotel! Roughly 5 minutes away from Disney Parks and around 15-20 minutes from Universal Resort. Our room was on the 7th floor Suite 730 which overlooked Old Town it was very quiet, spacious, modern, clean and comfortable. Clean towels provided daily the housekeeping was excellent, all staff were lovely and very helpful. Lovely pool area and hot tub, lots of sun loungers to go round and towels are provided by the pool so theres no need to worry about bringing your own. The hotel has a bar which is called Baracuda Barts, its located by the pool and opens from 3pm - 11pm serving drinks and food. Free internet access, use of printer which is great for when it comes to checking in or catching up with those at home! Breakfast served from 7am-10pm which is great! Good variety of food such as Cereals, Eggs, Bacon, Beans etc - Fruit, Toast etc. *** Good Places To Eat *** - Black Angus Steak House - Bahama Breeze - Chillis - Planet Hollywood *** Avoid! *** - Sizzler (I got sick after eating here! :( ) - Ponderosa *** Other things to do *** Sunshine Hellicoptor Tours (On the 192 - 5 mins from hotel) - From $20 per person - A must do its fantastic! Wonderworks - Indoor amusement park Ripley's Believe it Or Not The Titanic Experience A BIG thank you to the wonderful staff at this hotel who ensured our stay was PERFECT. We can't wait to return in the future!! Sarah & Neil

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Disney”
Reviews.Author: AlsoCuteAndFluffy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Suites over Easter so we expected it to be busy, however this only happened at the weekend when the Schools checked in. The hotel is clean with good service, we were checked in with a minimum of fuss, which was appreciated after 90 mins at immigration! The breakfast was a pleasant surprise with sausages, eggs and other hot items, plus lots of freshly made waffles! A word of advice, get there early as the breakfast area can be busy. Free wi-fi in the public areas with free wired internet in the room. We stayed in a queen suite which had two doubles and a sofa bed, plenty of room for the three of us. A small kitchen area with a sink and coffee pot - no kettle and a fridge. Just over the road is fun spot and Old Town, we popped over but had already bought our Attraction tickets so didn't try all the go-kart tracks. Looked like fun though! The Hotel is about 4 miles from Disney and only a mile or so from I-4. A great hotel that we would recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort with an even better location!”
Reviews.Author: amska1
Reviews.Content: I booked this resort for a 3 day vacation based on the reviews I had read on Expedia. I was not disappointed! Despite it being spring break, we were placed on the top floor (the hotel honoured my online request) in a quiet room away from the tour groups. The room was very clean, however it was a tinge musty. The housing staff did a fantastic job cleaning every day. The pool area was fantastic - it backs on to a nature area, so there is nothing behind the resort but greenery. The pool was warm with tons of lounge chairs. Breakfast was one of the best aspects - tons of options! However it was very busy early on with people going to the parks, so we often waited until 9:30 when it was a little quieter. I love the Mickey waffles. You could not ask for a better location - right on the border of Disney's lands, behind Fun Spot, and on the 192 strip. Fun Spot is a GREAT time with rides and games and stores that stay open until 1am or so. Despite our room facing it, we never heard anything and were not bothered by the lights. We would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “They Checked Someone Else Into My Room and Gave Them a Key!!!”
Reviews.Author: Apple4WI
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying we stayed at this property about 2 years ago. We were impressed with it, and thought we'd try it again. It's still a nice hotel and a good value, but is, how do I say this, feeling tired. As with our prior visit, the 2 elevators are very slow. I recommend you find the stairs. The breakfast is still very good, with a good variety, but the breakfast area gets very busy and finding a table can be difficult at peak times. Breakfast doesn't open until 7:00am, so if you're planning an early visit to Disney which often opens at 8:00, you'll miss the Disney opening activities (as we did waiting for breakfast to open). It would be nice if they opened breakfast earlier. In other hotels we've stayed at they usually will open early, but here, 7:00 on the dot. Our room was ok, not as spiffy as we remembered it last time. It was clean, but there were marks on the walls, the freezer door in the mini fridge was hanging on by only 1 screw, the coffee pot button fell off when we pushed it, and the channel buttons on the TV no longer worked (we misplaced the remote for a while). It's apparent by the fresh paint in the public areas that they do have an upkeep plan, but it's time to refresh the rooms a tad too. The icing on the cake was this. We were staying for 3 nights. On the third night about 10:00, we hear someone trying to open our door. I check the peephole and sure enough, 2 travelers. I open the door to their surprise, and they do in fact have the same room as me, and their key worked, but they couldn't get in because I had the deadbolt on and the "swing arm lock" over. They went back to the front desk, and a few minutes later I get a call from the front desk. Who am I and why am I in this room? I give them my name, and they apparently checked me out after the first night of my 3 night stay. I don't think so! No apology, nothing, all they said was that they'd check us back in, gee thanks. Totally unacceptable. Needless to say, we won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Metsin2007
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything one would need in a hotel stay. You can easily walk to Old Town or FunTown and easily drive to any Walt Disney complex too. Thanks Trey!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay, off peak”
Reviews.Author: munchie11
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms, excellent breakfast and fabulous heated pool. Well located for all the action, but set far enough back to be quiet. It does seem a magnet for Spring break teenagers and kids, that can be rowdy, so avoid school holidays and special events if you want to really enjoy this super place. Not one of the cheapest places to stay in KIssimme, but out of season, worth the extra.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant, Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: HenMillvacation
Reviews.Content: Very good location if you want to go to Disney World you buy your tickets right at the hotel for all the parks. Old Town right out front door so you have something to do at night if your not at one of the parks. Budget Car Rental can walk to it, even though they picked us up. $35.00 dollar cab ride to Universal Studios and $22.00 to go to Sea World hotel does not have shuttle to those parks. Breakfast in morning great except for the sausage gravy what are they thinking! Pool open 24 hours and is very warm we were swimming at 11:00 pm and it was February. Complimentary computer to use so you can check the weather or your flight home also has a printer. Staff wonderful. Didn't charge us for parking the car. Only thing if you want to only go to Universal and don't have a rent a car I would stay closer to Universal if you don't want to have to pay for a cab back and fourth.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel --- Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: yeah009
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Hotel between 17th - 22nd Feb2011 (while we went to the Daytona 500) and were really impressed. I have stayed in Hotels in Florida costing far more and this Hotel Tops the lot. Very very Clean. Excellent House Keeping, All Public areas clean, tidy . Only critism is the free breakfast is a little restricted in choice, but nothing that could not be overcome. Location is handy if you fancy a little stroll on a night into local shopping area/ funfare all very nice.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: musicmom1
Reviews.Content: Excellent accomodations - rooms, breakfast, pool, staff - all are excellent. Great location - Old Town and lots of restaurants; good shuttle service to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: fromDE
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Feb 5-10, 2011. It is a nice hotel overall and have no complaints about the cleanliness or quality of the room. The location would be better for families or younger folks since it is near attractions such as Old Town Kissimmee and a mini golf course. (I would rather not hear screaming from the kids on the rides at 1AM.) Also, the shuttle to Epcot was awful, a rattling tin can with a limited schedule. The room included a kitchenette with its own sink which was great for snacks and such. Wifi is only available on the first floor area. Ethernet cable in the room. Game room was a nice touch and not over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place - Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Langley
Reviews.Content: Here on business for a conference and was able to get a suite with a discounted AAA rate. During the reservation process I requested "early check-in" and the desk clerk got us checked in 2 hours ahead of normal check-in. The hotel is brightly colored in tropical hues. It has received numerous corporate awards over the years but none in the past few years. The room was spacious and clean. Microwave, mini-fridge, small sink were standard. Bathroom was equally spacious. However the shower was a bit wimpy and you needed to run the hot water in order for it to get hot. The bed was comfy but the pillows were a bit too soft for our tastes. Flat screen HDTV and both wired and wireless internet were available. No problems. There is a single workstation business office in the lobby area. Breakfast was excellent. Daily changing hot menu items to include Belgian waffles. usual line up of cereals, fruits, and yogurts. Because the hotel caters to Disney-bound families and school groups, the dining area fills up quickly. There is a outdoor pool but the weather was too cold for us, but a few hearty Brits enjoyed swimming. There is also a poolside bar-dining facility with Happy Hour specials and discount coupons on check-in. Other casual dining is available at the adjacent Old Town complex and almost anywhere along the Highway 192 strip. Overall, it was a pleasant stay. No problems encountered. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth It”
Reviews.Author: thane1010
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after looking through trip advisor. Unfortunately I didn't have a very good first impression as I had specifically requested a king bed and sofabed but got 2 queens as no king's were available. They did state that I could have a king the next day, but we never bothered as by then my son had ensconced himself in the bed and refused to move to a sofa bed! However after this everything else was excellent. we really enjoyed the morning buffet and thought the choice was excellent. The rooms were large and clean and the staff very friendly, the lady on the ticket desk booked our Busch gardens bus for us. Although, as stated by other travelers, the lifts are incredibly slow and we were on the 7th floor. The only thing I would suggest as an improvement would be wireless internet rather than the ethernet that they have. (My husband was especially impressed by the Cheerleading teams that were staying in our hotel for a competition!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Our room had two different size bugs, which we believe were roaches.”
Reviews.Author: looshomestead
Reviews.Content: This facility was part of a package that our travel agent booked for us. Upon arrival it looked very nice, and was in a great location. This hotel caters to large groups. When we entered there were bus loads of teenagers. We were concerned that it would be very noisey, but that was not a problem. The problem was there were bugs in our room. When we first entered our room, we killed three bugs in the bathroom. We than put on another light at a small kitchenette and killed several smaller bugs. The room was very nice and quite clean, but the bugs were not what we bargained for. When we reported it to the desk clerk, he suggested that they were ladybugs, and assured us that the room would be sprayed and we wouldn't have any problems. The next day, we killed another bug that ran under our door and we caught a small one and took it to the night manager. She was extremely indifferent and said our two options were to change rooms or have the room sprayed again. We changed rooms on another floor. Things appeared to be ok in that room, until we turned on the TV to watch the Super Bowl, and couldn't get the channel because of a weak signal. We contacted maintenance who was unable to fix it and had us move to another room. He however, was the only staff member that apologized to us for our trouble. This third room was fine, with the exception of not having any hot water to take a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sarahbear1116
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend there last month to take the kids to Disney. This hotel is superbly located, only a 10 minute drive from the parks. They also offer free shuttle service to the parks, but they're on a strict schedule. The A/C in our room went out as soon as we arrived. The staff was very prompt in trying to resolve the issue, but unfortunately the unit was beyond repair. They gladly upgraded our room for free. The hotel is within walking distance to Old Town and Fun Spot. (If you don't know what they are, you should look it up!) They are a great budget alternative to the big theme parks of Orlando. The pool area was clean, and the hot tub was perfect! Breakfast was ok, but just your typical buffet. I think it's a great value for the price and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay... Great location...”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_GreenFrog
Reviews.Content: My mother and I traveled on business in the middle of January. It was our first time stay in this hotel. I would recommend it for anybody traveling in groups and with kids. Room was spacious, clean and it had a fridge, microwave & coffee maker, ironing supplies. My only complaint would be the front door... The space between the door and the floor was so huge, not only we could hear everyone passing by, the light from the hallway was beaming through so bright, we had to use the sofa cushions to cover it. Breakfast was pretty dissent, with lots of offerings. What was really impressive, is one morning we came down with our suitcase to the breakfast area, and left it by the table to go get coffee. We were got just a few minutes, but when we got back to the table, a hotel associate, Gloria, was standing there guarding our belongings... That was outstanding. If I ever have to travel to this area again, this is the place I would pick.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems”
Reviews.Author: The Traveling Couple
Reviews.Content: Good location for this hotel just off the main highway with no traffic noise. Good size room with coffe maker, fridge and microwave but no cutlery provided!!!! Basic complimentary breakfast is provided but all in all very good and saves you money. The swimming pool area is good to relax around with a wading pool for children. There is free scheduled transportation to the parks if you need it. We would use the hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel i've stopped at in Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: Timmyfinders
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anybody visiting Orlando. The hotel is ideally located by the Old Town area of Kissimmee with easy access to all the Disney attractions and is just off the I4 allowing a speedy trip to Sea World or Universal. We were more than happy with the Kings suite which we thought was a larger than average room in Kissimmee. The manager was supervising the up grade of rooms one day and was happy to show us round other rooms in the hotel, The Twin bedded rooms are even bigger than the King but the multi roomed suites give an amazing amount of space. I will check out the price of them next time I stay! The FREE breakfast whilst not being 5* is a fantastic bonus when staying here and the options vary each day. Although the choice is limited the quality is as good as any of the “Breakfast Buffets” available along 192. The free tea/coffee which is available all day was nice when returning to the hotel. The hotel rooms are very clean and the public areas, including the laundry facilities which are on each floor, are kept in an excellent condition. We didn’t notice any noise from Old Town even on the cruise nights. Being honest the only thing that may effect some people who aren’t early risers (aren’t you going to a theme park! and we only noticed as our room was right at the end of the corridor), is the field to the right of the hotel is sometimes used for hot air balloon flights but the view you get of them launching is great and apart from the first time I never really heard them., Other people I spoke to didn’t know that the balloons were there. You could always ask for a room on the left end of the hotel! Brilliant hotel, great breakfast, friendly happy staff. Stop here if visiting Kissimmee,. I know I will!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Deal in Kissimmee!"”
Reviews.Author: TheDisneyFansFamily
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 5 nights. Easy check-in and good front desk service. We came in very late, but staff was on site and ready to assist. Lobby was clean and inviting. As we were in town over Christmas, our goal was to get to Disney early and stay late. The hotel allowed for all of the above. They had a "hot" breakfast starting pretty early in the morning...so you can eat quickly and hit the parks. The food was not super awesome or anything, but the scrambled eggs and sausage served its purposed. They also had biscuits and gravy for us old dudes :) The rooms were clean. Everything worked well, except the drain in the tube. It was clogged. Housecleaning staff was very kind and did a GREAT job in cleaning up the room. Can't overstate how good they were. Internet on the top floor worked only with an Ethernet cable, but we managed (cable provided by hotel.) Pool area was very nice. They had a hot tub, a big pool, and a kiddie pool. Towels were always on hand in a bin near the pool. The pool was heated and did not reek of chlorine. Kids and I swam for a whole day and did not have burning red eyes. The only semi-sucky thing is that there are only 2 elevators. With the Christmas/Disney rush, there were often long lines of people waiting in line...especially around breakfast and dinner. Usually didn't have to wait long...but it is what it is. All in all, I don't think you can find a better value in Kissimmee. Trust me...we looked at a few others and even stayed at one (the Baymount...UHG!) This is a good value. Close to highway, parks, shopping, etc.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best values in Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: SoCalC8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my mom and son for a Christmas getaway and I am very happy with my choice for deciding to shack up here. For $57 a night, I can't really complain about anything. Beds are comfortable, shower is great, rooms are clean, staff is very courteous and the free breakfast buffet is pretty damn good - and it saved us $$$ for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great location”
Reviews.Author: MrRedStar
Reviews.Content: This was 4th time to Florida and 2nd time in Kissimmee and considering we only paid £2650 all in was an absolute steal. Hotel is located about 500 metres from the main highway but you are not bothered by traffic noise at all (if you can ask for a room overlooking the pool as it is quieter that side). Rooms were typical american standard being a good side and clean - 2 double beds - fridge, microwave, coffe maker, etc but most bizarely no crockery or cutlery? We borrowed paper plates and plastic cutlery from the Restaurant as and when we needed it which worked fine. There is a safe but you have to pay $3 dollars a night so bear that in mind as a cost. The complimentary self service breakfast was of a good standard with a selection of cereals, fruits, juices available plus fresh waffles along with scrambled egg, bacon, sausage and beans - it doesn't change though so you may want to alternate with going out for breakfast every other day as we did. Restaurant not open for dinner so only food available in the hotel was from the pool bar which was pretty basic. Pretty of choice from all the major Restaurant chains on your doorstep although you will need to drive as it is along a 2/3 mile strip. Complimentary coffee available in the lobby 24 hours a day was nice. Plenty of parking out front so never a problem. 20 minute drive up to Universal and 15 minutes to Disney so ideally located. Overall definately worth a look if you want to keep the cost of visiting Florida to a sensible level.

Reviews.Title: “Very COMFORTable!”
Reviews.Author: litanowells
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and pretty well located to visit theme parks if you are driving (has a big parking lot too). If not, they have free shuttle to the parks. The surrounding area has a few fun parks (good if you have kids who need to have more entertainment after visiting Disney or Universal). I think the best was the breakfast with a wide variety (pastries, hot breakfast, hotcakes, fruits, toast, etc.) and they also changed the menu every day (I stayed for 9 nights and never got bored of it). There were not "bad" things to point out, only that the room didn't seem spotlessly clean the day we arrived, but nothing to be seriously upset about and that the lift sometimes seemed to be taking ages to come but I suppose it was only because they were doing some kind of repair works on one of them and all guest were forced to use the other one… I guess they work well normally. The front desk and maintenance staff were very helpful and friendly. Breakfast staff was very nice. The suite was very comfortable and spacious. Internet facilities worked perfectly. I can’t speak about the pool because I couldn’t use it because of the cold weather although it seemed very clean. As most of Orlando things, they are very family-friendly, so would recommend it for families. They also have a bar by the pool and seemed to be quite good for single travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Thank Nina for a Job well Done!”
Reviews.Author: SierraBorn
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay over the weekend. It's an older property, but well maintained. Staff was friendly. We had just come in from a long drive. When we arrived & checked in, the room was very clean & smelled fresh. The two queen beds were comfortable with a spacious suite & mini kitchen. The bathroom was sparkling w/ complimentary soap, shampoo & conditioner and lots of clean fluffy white towels (cute folded towels- how do they do that?). Clean coffee maker with packs of coffee, creamer & suger in a tidy basket on top of a clean microwave (means alot to me). There was a safe in the closet, but there was no padlock, etc., (maybe an oversight?). Also did I say it was quiet? I saw plenty of kids, but, It was very quiet. The hotel is located neatly away from the main street hustle & bustle; near shops and fast food restaurants. I’d like to thank your housekeeper Nina for such a professional cleaning detail; very fresh/ clean room, job well done. The location is approx. 4 miles from Disney & 8 miles from Universal studios. Oh, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Bhavin69
Reviews.Content: Well located for the Orlando Parks, very comfortable/clean and nice breakfast range. The property is I believe in the final stages of cosmetic updating, which has further enhanced it. Internet is 'hard-wired' thus, a good service provided. The price should be slightly lower during ''off-peak'' periods..and I think the lifts may be an issue during busier periods.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: HOTEL0111
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay at with a good breakfast buffett. However, this hotel tends to book large sports teams as it is near Wide world of sports. This tends to create alot of noise when these teams are staying here. The rooms need to be better sound proofed as I could here somebody coughing in the next room and if anybody is in the hallway, the noise travels all the way down the hallway. Good place to stay for one night. If you are staying more then one night, I could choose somewhere quieter. Also, the elevators are very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with your family.”
Reviews.Author: ace215
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and comfortable. Staff was very friendly and always willing to help. They even helped me find our way around town, when we were lost, twice. Michelle at the pool Cabana was awesome! She made our family want to hang out at the pool instead of go to Disney World. The only complaint was the sofa sleeper was broke. The staff offered to move us, but we made due. Very pleasant stay. Security staff was great as well. Would definitely recommend to others. Thanks for a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is good and clean enough - very close to Disney Parks! Good breakfast selections.”
Reviews.Author: Malily
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I was VERY apprehensive about staying at Comfort Suites. I'm a bit of a snob, and was scared. The GOOD: LOCATION: The hotel is very close to Disney Resorts. We never used the Shuttle buses, because they don't come and go every 10 mins. It's scheduled. But Disney is close enough, if you wanted to leave one of the parks for a couple hours and go back. Not a problem. FOOD: Free morning breakfast - and they had a great selection. Don't expect gormet. But they had good options - cereal & milk; biscuits, english muffins, and other breads; eggs (scrambled and hard boiled), some breakfast meat, and the best thing - waffles - its hard to mess that one up! They even make chocolate chip waffles- and you can get them in the shape of Mickey Mouse - if you have little ones. Also, they have a restaurant - which had good prices (fair prices), and was suprisingly good - compared to the Walt Disney World Swan Hotel - which we stayed at our first three nights. The Pool: Small, but good enough. From the looks - it looked clean. We didn't go in it. CONS: The ROOM: Clean enough for me to stay. There is grime they don't clean up on the bathroom floor. But the tub looked clean. Our Room initially smelled like dirty socks and bleach. So we exchanged with my parents - who were next door! ha! For $67/night, its a good buy.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel nice and quiet but near attractions”
Reviews.Author: davos
Reviews.Content: hotel room was very nice and despite having funfair and Old Town across the road was very quiet.buffet breakfast made ideal start to day and you could have everyting from cereal to waffles and porridge and fruit and toast as well. At the weekend the bufftet did get bit busy but there was still seating available. car parking was free and was various eating and drinking places within walking distances of the hotel. lots of gift shops to and shops selling tickets to disney etc. old town itself comes alive at night with special nights for old cars to show what they can do and other nights it bike nights. some of the cars and bikes are pretty standard but most have special paint jobs, lights, re built engines etc. so after dayu in park you can just walk across to old town to chill out.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: 4ty
Reviews.Content: Our room was very nice. Lots of space and very clean. Unlike other posts we did have an updated room. All the hotel staff was very nice and helpful. Breakfest was plenty for my two teenage boys and the heated pool was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sac2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week and really liked the hotel. Do note that it is not a 4 or 5 star resort. It is similar to a Holiday Inn Express. The hotel is conveniently located near many chain restaurants, Old Town, and Fun Spot. The Disney parks are just a ten minute drive away. (I would highly recommend a rental car). The room was spacious and appeared to be recently renovated. It was fun to look out the window and watch the brave people ride the Skycoaster at Fun Spot, a small amusement park next door. The hotel is very clean and well-kept. The staff members seemed friendly although some were more helpful than others. The free breakfast buffet was decent with a nice selection of hot and cold items.The Mickey waffles were especially good but who eats baked beans for breakfast? The hotel has a computer/printer for guest use, a small gift shop, and a heated outdoor pool out back with children's pool and hot tub. We found this hotel to be an excellent value compared to the Disney hotels, some of which cost more for one night than what we paid for five nights at the Comfort Suites. We would highly recommend this hotel to others looking for a nice, affordable place to stay near the Disney parks.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: coasterfan98
Reviews.Content: The room was very spacious. The bathroom was large enough. At breakfast they had plenty of stuff to choose from, which changed every day. I liked the breakfast hours of 7:00-10:00am every day. Close to Walt Disney World and was within walking distance to Old town and Fun Spot. The hotel staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed overall...”
Reviews.Author: Moniclarke
Reviews.Content: I have been a "frequent stayer" at the Comfort/Choice Hotel brands for a while now. They do give out frequent and good reward points. So with that in mind I booked this place online for an affordable 1 night stay for a wedding we were attending nearby. I called the place first to see when it was last updated and was told most rooms had been recently refurbished. I was told to make a request online for a refurbished room. So I did. I also requested an early check in. The day prior to arrival I called to confirm all of this. I was told the early arrival would not be granted until the next day (our arrival date). I called that morning and was spoken to very rudely by the woman. She said she would not know if I could check in early until 1:00pm! That was the time we needed to be in the room to change our clothes before attending the wedding at 2:30! We arrived at 1:15pm and there was no one to be found at the front desk. The lobby smelled like fried foods (gross). I was not impressed. Finally a man came and starting spewing excuses as to why we could not check in early. He said the hotel had been full the night before. I calmly asked again, was there not a single room ready? He finally relented and gave us a room, but it was very dated, not updated, and the flooring and bedding was old and gross. The bed was awful and I could not sleep. I really do not know if they truly have any updated rooms as all the rooms on our floor looked to be the same. It was a bad experience overall, and I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with the Softball Team”
Reviews.Author: SoftballMom2012
Reviews.Content: Our daughter played softball at the ESPN Wide World of Sports Complex. This hotel was about 6 miles from the Disney attractions.It was a perfect location in that it wasn't busy with Disney traffic. And there are lots of restaurants, stores, and attractions nearby. Check out Old Town for an interesting experience! The girls actually did the swing ride for $35 best ride EVER! Band and Car show on the weekend- cheap prices and fun time! Too cold for swimming but the girls did get in! The Nike Clearance store has shoes for around $30. We ate at the Steak n Shake it is open 24 hours! Girls went to Universal for Harry Potter- wasn't quite what they expected-enjoyed butterbeer, $11.50 with mug to bring home. Adventureland was good fun for teenagers. We went to Cocoa Beach, it took about 45 min. to get there, easy and fast. Went to Ron Jons, walked the beach and had clam chowder on the pier at the little restaurant spot.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Disney Parks”
Reviews.Author: boarder010
Reviews.Content: just finished a 6-night stay here 10/27/10 to 11/01/10 and I would say this place is a solid 4-stars. The hotel is tucked away from the busy 192 highway, so you don't get much noise or traffic which is nice. huge parking lot that was barely full when we were there (off season though). Check in at 3p, check out at 11a The hotel had a friendly front counter staff and some nice included amenities: -breakfast buffet (7am-10am) which included hot and cold items, restocked quick so stuff doesn't run out, and large dining area -mini-fridge, microwave, and coffee maker in room -laundry, ice, and vending machines on each floor -free WIRED internet in room, wifi in public spots...if you want wifi in your room, better pack a wifi hotspot -free shuttles to parks (with fine print - see below) -game room for kids, fitness room, and 24-hr pool -free parking The room we were in was a King Studio (king bed + sleeper sofa)...it was nice, nothing too fancy about it. I appreciated that the room was quiet but that could of been due to the off-season emptiness. The room had a connecting door to the room next to us, I heard the people's TV next door every morning...so just be aware of that. We were at the end of the hallway, so I didn't hear too much hallway noise. The hotel also charged us a $2-something daily resort fee, which is no big deal to me for all the stuff they provide. This is a separate fee charged during checkout if you book through a travel site. So the shuttle service is pretty lame in my opinion and I was thankful we had a rental car. The lady at the counter there was a bit rude too. If you want to use the shuttle you must sign-up before hand at the counter. There are limited seats so be sure to sign up asap. It does not go to Animal Kingdom, so if you want to go there, you go to take a shuttle to Magic Kingdom or Epcot and transfer from there using Disney's system. I mean if you want to save money from not having a rental car, use the shuttles. I was thankful that I could come and go as I please from the parks. The times were as follows (pickup / drop off): Magic Kingdom: 7:05a / 5:45p, 8:45p, 10:15p Epcot: 10:35a, 11:20a / 10:05p Hollywood Studios: 10:35a / 8:55p Universal: 7:50a / 7:15p SeaWorld: 7:50a / 7:30p There was fast food places and a grocery store nearby and also a walgreens. Across the street is a little family amusement park type place with carnival games, rides, and a go-cart track. We walked through there one night and it was "meh-sketchy", I think it'd be better to just use the game room in the hotel hah. I highly recommend to stay clear of the Old Town area...that place was sketchy at night! I mean, we walked by it our first night and there was a sign that said "don't display your colors"...that should of been a tip. Walked through there and it was biker bars and sketch crowd. We walked in and practically ran back to the hotel hah! That would be my only negative about the area. A good tip as well...if you're driving to the hotel from the 192, just turn on Florida Plaza Blvd. GPS might say to take Holiday Trail but that way is a bit longer and you have to drive through Old Town that has a stop sign for pedestrian traffic which can be a bit slow at times. Overall a good place to stay, I would stay there again and recommend it to friends...unless I found a similar place that was even more close to the parks or offered something better, or nicer area. It was a nice hotel with no issues, and when traveling, that's all I really ask for. If they want to make it to 5-stars, I think they should do a bit more to enhance the guest experience or provide a "wow" stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, again”
Reviews.Author: Koll
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April & liked the hotel so much, was our first choice this time too. Nice warm pool which the kids loved, large spacious room, great breakfast selection. We stayed in a suite & esp enjoyed the large tv. Special comment worthy for housekeeping... so nice to return to such a clean & tidy room & care taken to ensure that we had ample towels for a family of four. Loads of restaurants nearby. Free wifi in the lobby & free fast cabled net in rooms. Perfect family hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay for Disneyworld & Universal!!”
Reviews.Author: brendabob24
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely amazing! The suites we clean and updated, the pool was great and breakfast couldn't have been better. Not too many items you could have wanted that weren't there. The beds were confortable and well appointed. Bought all of my attraction tickets at the hotel. Great prices and freebies! We didn't use the shuttle because it only ran at certain times, so we paid the $10 parking fee and drove to the parks, which also allowed us to come and go as we pleased. The staff gave me any and all discounts that could be applied and we stayed for 8 nights for around $900 with breakfast included. Next time we visit Disney and Universal, this is where we will be.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: zasiura
Reviews.Content: Totally agree with the person from Southampton said on report dated 20th Sept, following stay in August, may have been same time. Rooms queen suite - great size for 2 adults 2 children, beds v.comfortable. Good view on 6th floor of Old Town & fireworks at 9 o'clock. Some previous comments about light under door, no problem when you are asleep!! Even though the hotel was undergoing refurb this block had not been done so yet, but was not showing any real sign of age it still looked fresh.Having microwave & fridge was an added bonus. Breakfast a great bonus to charge the batteries for the day and it was included in the price - real bonus and no complaints here either. The added free thermos drinks all day was also good idea. Probably the only small negative was having disposable plates but so what! Facilities The pool was great - warm and never too busy the jacuzzi though was too warm. The pool bar could have opened at lunch time rather than 3pm. Whenever we used reception they were very helpful. The games room, ticket office and shop good to have though not used very often. The use of on line PC & printer great except for the wait while teenagers look up face book etc. Close by Lots of good palces to eat within 5/10 minutes drive the Golden Corral gets our #1 vote due the volume of choice and quality of food. #2 was CiCi's pizza buffet grreat choice(at least 20) reasonable quality excellent value - especially with discount vouchers. close Will come again and definitly recommend this to as many people as possible

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tasharose-x
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in august 2010 for 18 nights with another family. Check in was easy, went straight up and got our key cards and safe key (only small payment for safe. about $30 i think?). Our room was on the sixth floor and our friends family on the fifth. Room was big enough for what we needed. There was 5 in our room, so we had to use the sofa bed but this wasn't an issue. Beds were comfy, some complain they are too soft but after a long day at the theme parks i know i could of slept on a park bench! Microwave is handy for reheating pizza etc. Bathroom is big, however water from shower and tap can be a little smelly. Pool was big and was rarely full, only a few sun loungers however so if it did get full there would be a problem. The pool bar is open from 3, and happy hour is from 5-7 p.m.. We didn't need to use the kids pool but it seemed okay, hot tub is lush! very hot however so i wouldn't recommend it for children. Staff at pool bar don't seem very interested in what they are doing, but there we go. Food from pool bar is good and cheap. We ate at the hotel a couple nights when we couldn't be bothered to go anywhere else. The raccoon mentioned in other reviews does appear sometimes! however it does seem friendly and doesn't come near anyone. Lifts can be slow at times, depending what time of day you use them. Wifi is good, only use it up to the 2nd floor but if your sat at the bar its good. Breakfast can be repetitive but as its free it doesn't really matter! Breakfast wasn't too busy on weekdays, however at weekends they have jehovah witness conventions so breakfast gets very busy! Shop isn't expensive in reception. In a good location, lots of restaurants and shops within walking distance. Shuttles get very busy and often put on more than they can handle. Drivers were a bit crazy too but they're free so you cant complain. We had a lovely time and would definitely recommend it to anyone going, its very convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: RobynMay28
Reviews.Content: I would recomend this hotel to anyone on a budget. The free breakfast was pretty good though I would have liked some healthier options. The only healthy options were some soggy fruits and limited yogurts. We got the Delux King Suite and it was kept spotless every single day. The bed was soft and cozy as welll as the pillows. I was afraid we would hear noise from the pool but it was super quiet at night. One of the elevators had to be repaired but it was still quick. We got free lollipops from one of the workers for being on our honeymoon. The only problem I had was that their cab transportation and bus services were often late and unreliable. The short walk to Old Town was great and we were able to do some romantic stuff there like get massages side by side.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value.”
Reviews.Author: CanandaiguaKid
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my 2 kids, wife and grandma. Hotel is efficient and well run. A great value. Morning breakfast is a nice feature before hitting the parks. With kids, breakfast alone can run $25 a day, not to mention agreeing on a place to eat and travel time to the restaurant. The hotel has a smallish pool which was never crowded. Parking was easy, I can imagine the wait time for the 2 elevators may become long in peak season. Although the hotel implies suite, the king size bed does not have a room to itself, so beware. The website is totally clear on this, but takes a careful review of the room layouts to get this info. I wish there was a way to open the windows in my room. With 4 to a room, venting the room would be nice. Overall the hotel offers a great value to families. Its my second stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely super place to stay - lovely pool!”
Reviews.Author: RhianElen
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel - spacious and clean. The rooms are well kept, nicely set out, and plenty of room for my mother, my sister and myself. The extra sofa space was particularly handy as suitcase storage space. The best thing about this hotel however is the pool - it's huge and largely unused. There's also a wonderful hot tub that's just glorious after a long day at a theme park. Both are open 24 hours, which is ideal if you can't sleep at night. The hotel's situated steps away from Old Town Kissimmee, but it feels very remote - it's not overlooked by any other hotels and it's far enough from the busy main road that you aren't at all aware of any cars. It's a little far from the theme parks ($35 dollars in a cab to Universal Studios each way) but there's a free shuttle at 7.50 in the am and 7.15pm to all of the main parks. And the distance to the busy part of Orlando shouldn't be a negative at all - it was a good thing for us. Would definitely stay in this hotel again, it's great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for an excellent price”
Reviews.Author: S&W-82
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided everything we could want. We stayed 8 nights in August 2010 and were thoroughly impressed. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was very clean, soundproof and large. There was a laundry room on each floor ($1/wash and $1/dry), as well as a pop machine and ice. The conceirge was helpful, the pool and pool area clean and the breakfast was a great value. There is coffee available 24 hours/day. There is a fitness centre and a business centre. The pool area has a bar that also serves small lunch meals and snacks in the afternoon until about 11:00pm. A few glitches: there are 2 elevators and during busy times - usually in the morning - you have to wait quite awhile. The shuttle times to Disney World are quite limited so you have to plan your trips accordingly. If you don't want to wait for the shuttle, cab fare is approx. $20 each way. AREA INFO: Old Town is across the street and is wonderful place to wander around, Check out their website at www.old-town.com. There's something going on there until 11:00pm. Pirates Cove mini-golf is next door to the hotel and is a fun place. There are 2 courses on the property. Adults cost $9.95/round. There are several restaurants withing walking distance. Here's my opinion on the ones we ate at: Red Lobster - great, Logan's Steakhouse - okay, Pacino's Italian - great, Ponderosa - good, Full House Chinese Buffet - not good, Bennigan's - good, Olive Garden (took a cab) - great., Flippers Pizza in Old Town - great, Kool Katz in Old Town - not good. OTHER INFO: We arranged airport transportation through Happy Limosine. It cost about $50 more than an airport shuttle (return) but we didn't have to wait for others or stop at other hotels and they include a 15 mintue grocery stop on the way to our hotel. Our driver stopped at Publix's and we were able to pick up some bottled water and snacks. It was great to have this out of the way and not have to find somewhere near the hotel. All in all we were very happy with our hotel and area decision. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but Shuttle could be much better stay away from Pool Side as its noisy”
Reviews.Author: Jamdad
Reviews.Content: Good Points - Good Location, 15 mins from Disney, Free Breakfast, Free Shuttle, Very Clean, 2 Comfortable Double Beds, Free Wifi in Lobby, Some helpful staff. near Old Town. Bad Points - Stayed on 5th Floor on pool side which was much too noisy, Slow Lifts, Some rude staff, Shuttles are much too infrequent and therefore you may have to stand. Virgin advertise 5 mins to WDW, 10 mins to Sea World & 20 mins to Universal - in reality the multiple pick ups made by the Shuttle mean the true timse are 30 mins to WDW, 45 mins to Sea World and 80 mins to Universal. Overall - Fine Hotel if you have a car, but would not recommend if you do not have one.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Reeta6174
Reviews.Content: The comfort suites was very clean, comfortable, and a nice treat for the children. The pool area was kid friendly and the breakfast was the best I've had at a choice property. The rooms were spacious and in good condition. Overall, a very nice stay with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: me555
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was very good value, it came with a buffet breakfast everyday, must say it was the somethings every other day but was plentiful. This Hotel was well located for all Disney Parks and Universal and was within walking distance of lots of restaurants. Must say that the lifts are very slow and the front desk staff seem a little unhelpful!! The pool is large and clean, is open 24 hours and comes with free clean towels by the pool. This hotel comes with a fitness center which is free to guests The pool bar is a bonus and does serve food which is ok if you don't wanna go out at night after a long day at the parks. All in all a good base for your Florida holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Usually great...NOT this time!”
Reviews.Author: Northportdiver
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at this hotel while in Orlando and I'm usually VERY happy. This time they placed me right across the elevators. I was unable to sleep all night long due to the constant people screaming and yelling while exiting the elevators and the ice machine going 24/7. The front desk could have, and should have warned me about this location!! I guess I should have asked.......now I know better!!

Reviews.Title: “The Service was Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: xmars
Reviews.Content: My family stayed for an entire week and was mistreated at least twice during our stay. The ticket booth lady completely ignored us when we tried asking questions about purchasing tickets for the theme parks, yet paid attention to a white man that walked up to her (we're Hispanic). We were forced to walk away. My son became sick and needed salt to make a solution for rinsing and asked the night front desk clerk for some and he rudely responded, "It's an office, not a kitchen!" Again, we walked away. The remark was not necessary; a simple "no" would have done. We were also insulted at Disney but that's another story. The sheets in the room were NOT ONCE changed, the trash was NOT taken out, and any trash or paper left on the floor was never picked up. Will never return nor recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but would recommend car hire”
Reviews.Author: jakata_10
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 week stay here and would recommend this accommodation. The room was spacious and clean and towels were changed daily. We should probably have researched the surrounding area more as we felt it was a lot further away from the likes of Seaworld and Universal and some of the main shopping areas than we would have liked. The hotel provides a shuttle service to the main parks but the return times from seaworld and universal are 7.30 - 7.45 so if you want to stay later than that a cab back would cost up to $40. The Linx bus service worked out much cheaper for us on the occasions that we missed the shuttle bus back as it stops on the 192 right next to old town. The hotel won't give info on the linx buses but timetables are available on the buses. We didn't use the hotel snack bar but found a couple of good places to eat on the other side of the 192, although crossing that is not for the faint hearted!! We'd recommend Bennigans and Logans Roadhouse though get here early as it fills up pretty quickly! We travelled here with Virgin and their nearest welcome meeting is at Best Western Lakeside or at the House of Blues in Downtown Disney both of which are $20 -$25 cab ride. So although we liked both the hotel and the area we would recommend car hire if you want to stay longer in the non Disney parks or visit the further away shopping malls.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Beautylex
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our 7 and 10 year old for 7 days and had an amazing stay! The bed was great nice and soft like I prefer (my husband thought it was too soft though). The housekeeping staff was really nice and we always had plenty of clean towels. The standard suite was a little smaller than I had imagined, was really just a normal King hotel room with a pull out couch. But it worked great for us. The location of the property was great. A little too great, though, our kids were talking about going to FUN SPOT (located across the street) while we were in Magic Kingdom!! The 24-hour pool was just great, always clean and always had clean towels. The kids enjoyed swimming after visiting the parks. The pool bar was excellent - the "Mango Tango" is a must try. :) The free breakfast was definitely a HUGE bonus. The food was good, cereal, muffins, juice, donuts and a few hot options (sausage, Mickey Waffles, beans, etc.) and coffee / tea all day. We were a little tired of it by day 3 though, and walked down to McDonalds (about a 1/2 mile) to get breakfast a few days. Speaking of walking, there are quite a few restaurants within walking distance from the hotel. We walked 1-2 miles every night to dinner, and enjoyed every minute of it. I burned calories and the kids got to see lizards, bugs, and even a snake on our journey (they were THRILLED!). This is a great hotel at a VERY affordable price. If we come to Disney again, we will be staying here for sure! I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “SWEET SUITES!”
Reviews.Author: SCTrekkerMom
Reviews.Content: My family stopped at this Comfort Suites for one night on the way to Disney. We liked the location - minutes from parks. We were really impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel. We booked through the Choice Hotels.com. We were surprised to find a really nice breakfast - meats, eggs, oatmeal,etc. The kids loved the Mickey waffles! The only negative thing I could complain about would be the "resort" service charge and tax (total added to bill; $6.46). Although this is a VERY nice hotel, I would not classify it as a resort. We enjoyed our stay; however, and with the nice breakfast included, I won't complain!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Attentive staff - perfect vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Mhz
Reviews.Content: We had a great visit, this hotel is a great 3 star value. The staff were friendly and very helpful and the accomodations were clean and comfortable. We had a snafu with the amusment park tickets we purchased through the on site guest services and the hotel management worked with the 3rd party guest service to correct it promptly and stress free. It could have been a nightmare but they made sure we were taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “would go back again”
Reviews.Author: Bob499181
Reviews.Content: Stayed from Jun 30th -July 7th, 2010. Everything thing was perfect, very friendly staff. Great breakfast. Very, very clean rooms. The maid even made designs with the towels. We used the desk service to purchase tickets to Disney and Sea World and tocall taxi's. This saved a lot of time. Great location within walking distance to many restaurants and to Old town and the Fun Spot. Prices at the gift shop for laundry det etc was very reasonable. Yes, elevators were slow but stairs were accessable. We would definately recommend this hotel and we will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HnG1177
Reviews.Content: Great weekend with the kids.We had fun in the 24 hour pool.Breakfast was good except for the long lines. The elevators took a long time.The rooms were clean and spacious. The sofa sleeper was awful.Fridge and small freezer for your ice packs was great. The water in the hotel was very smelly i recommend not to drink it, use bottled water. All in all the hotel is very resaonable for the price,

Reviews.Title: “Great stay great price great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: juan4rmmiami
Reviews.Content: Overall great hotel. The breakfast was great there was eggs,susage,biscits and gravy,walfels,yogurt,cereal,milk and orange jucie.The rooms where clean and comfortable house keeping was fast and friendly.There is shuttle to the parks daily and on time. Overall great bang for your buck will recommed to everyone will be back soon cant wait!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Morning Front Desk Person was the Worst!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl143
Reviews.Content: Our stay from June 7-13 was fine but was destroyed by the morning concierge/front desk person on duty on June 13-Sunday.
