Our flight was cancelled due to the Spirit Airline strike and the night before I was told to go to the front desk at 7am so I can print our alternative booking. I have children s o I was so worried due to the strike. At 7am I was promptly at the front desk and the person said he was still busy and to come back and check the business center. I went to the business center-a small cramped place with 1 computer with a printer. My card was not accpeted saying "insertion error" I went back to the front desk and did that person help me? No--he said try another card. So I went up back to my room got another card and went back down. I tried the other card and did not work again an error. I went back to him this was 7:15 he said he could not help me since he was busy and to wait. I waited 10 min in front of him!He was so rude! Still he was busy and did not even go to the machine to see and help me out.What kind of service was that. It was 7:30 and for 30 minutes he did not do anything to help me. Another incident was they served cupcakes with peanuts! My daughter had an allergic reaction and we had to call 911! Places with lots o children should be a peanut free environment! I will definitely not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic. friendly. very clean. great location. good value”
Reviews.Author: chipsters
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a good hotel that you can enjoy then this will not disappoint you. when our family went in oct/nov 2008 we had no hotel problems at all. The breakfast was great with more than enough choice to keep the normal person happy. The lobby staff were a real blast and very helpful and chatty too. Having 2 kids with us room size and cleanliness was a priority and the maid service was 100%. 2 queen size beds and a double fold out sofa/bed worked a treat to keep them separated and happy. Good and free bus service too the parks. Swimming pool was great too and cleaned every morning as we could see them from our window. Going back again this year and cant wait. With the bonus of old town nearby with its rides/shops and hot rod shows its a real bonus when your not at the parks. The only negative comment is about other guests slamming doors and generally having no respect for other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlackpoolRox
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first week of our honeymoon because it was cheap and close to all the action in Orlando. We didn't expect much from the hotel but what expectations we had were well exceeded. The free breakfast is extremely good. It can be a bit samey but you don't have to eat the same thing every morning, there is a lot of choice. I know other people have complained about the lifts being slow and they can be but we used the stairs whenever the lifts were taking too long so wasn't an issue for us. The pool area was lovely and although we only had time for a quick dip on the last day, we sat and had a drink at the poolside bar on a couple of occasions. As others have mentioned, the pool is open 24hrs a day which could have been a problem for us as our room overlooked the pool. Although some of the noise travelled, we were so tired out from our days at the theme parks that it didn't keep us awake. The only thing we didn't love about this place was that the shuttle bus was a bit traumatic! It went all round the houses, sometimes crammed more people on than there were seats for and the buses were generally a bit old and uncomfortable. However, it is a free service and so saves you paying huge taxi fares ($30 from Sea World, $20 from Epcot) or paying $14 a day for parking at the parks. I would definitely recommend this hotel, especially for families. Old Town is just across the road and is full of interesting shops and people and there are a few places to eat within walking distance and plenty within a short drive. All in all, not the most luxurious of stays but certainly very comfortable and a great base to explore Orlando from.

Reviews.Title: “the free breakfast alone was worth it”
Reviews.Author: linder1
Reviews.Content: The free bus service to disney was always exactly on time. The staff at the hotel desk was very pleasant. The clerk young Ted was so observant that he remembered my friend from last year. He remebered that she wore a hat last year that sa id VerTrip Advisor. Very pleasant man,The rooms were clean always and the bed was very comfortable. The breakfast was wonderful which offered a different hot meal every morning..

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: georita77
Reviews.Content: There is nothing bad we can say about this hotel. We have never stayed at a Comfort Inn or Suites before, but we will stay here again. We picked this hotel due to its location and price. You never know what you are going to get. The pictures on the website does not do the hotel justice. It was very, very clean. You could tell it was well taken care of. It is within walking distance of "Old Towne". All restaurants, fast food and sit down, are within 15 minutes drive. If you have to drive farther, it is literally a straight shot, down the main highway. Our room was very clean. That is a big plus for us as we do spend alot of time in the room. It was also quite. Any minor noise that you may have heard comes with all hotels which have corridors. We were overlooking the pool and no noise came through the air conditioning system, which also worked beautifully. The bed was very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We are not just talking about the front desk staff. All the staff! We could go on and on. Yes, we were very happy with our stay there. Yes, we would and will recommend this hotel to our friends and family. Yes, it is worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: FerTravel
Reviews.Content: Awesome breakfast, comfortable rooms, great pool. Perfect location to do things other than Disney. It is literally 15-20 minutes away from everything Disney. We stayed a week and it was nothing for us to get to all our activities. We went to Disney World, Hollywood Studios and Typhoon Lagoon. In addition we went to Orlando for the Pirate Adventure Dinner, an airboat tour and spent a day at Cocoa Beach. We started every day with a great breakfast and ended it with a nice swim in the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good service/value/location; worth staying here!”
Reviews.Author: CoolHIguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for families: free breakfast (wide variety including hot items), pool, kiddie pool, jacuzzi, exercise room, game room, shuttle service to Walt Disney World/Universal Studios, and concierge service for area attractions. Staff was very friendly and helpful, except for the concierge lady who always looked like she did not enjoy her job, so sad. The shuttle service is a contracted bus service, not the hotel's own bus, but it gets you there just the same; one day though it was crowded and we had to stand the whole ride to Disney but it was only about a 10 minute ride. Breakfast was great, lots of different items to choose from. Location is good, close to area attractions and to lots of restaurants. Decor is bright and cheery, grounds were clean, and our room was spacious and comfortable. Location is set back off the busy street so it is very quiet. Negatives are the TV is an old 25-inch CRT; would've been nice to have a flat screen instead, and the free internet in the room was wired, not wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: trips4fun1
Reviews.Content: I had to write a review because reading the other reviews on this site really helped me to decide on this hotel for our family vacation. It is really nice. Looks great. It is clean, very nice atmosphere and the room was great. The staff was very helpful. We arrived early before check-in time and they let us check-in early and even upgraded our room to a 1BR king suite with a sofabed in the living area that was available. The pool was nice and heated which was great. The hot tub was nice too. They also have an outside area by the pool where you can order food and drinks and they can send it to your room as well. The room was very spacious. We stayed for 5 nights and had plenty of room for 2 adults and a 6 and 13 year old. The location is great too. It's near everything and right next to Old Town and an affordable mini fair/amusement park called Fun Spot that you can walk to from the hotel which the kids loved. We've stayed in Kissimmee before and love the area and this will definitely be our go-to spot when we go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall facility”
Reviews.Author: oooooooooooo
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly, pool, tiki hut. Food served at tiki hut, short drive to EPCOT........

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a family with teens”
Reviews.Author: MilWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: We were there for four days with our family. Housekeeping: With a family with three teenagers, we were pleased to come back at the end of the day to a very clean room. Food: Breakfast in the morning was good and offered several hot items instead of just cold continental items, although I really didn't understand the baked beans available every morning. The country gravy was good and filling for a day walking around in the parks. If a family with teenagers does the math on this part of the deal, they will realize quickly this is an awesome value considering how much it costs to feed a family with teenagers. Bar: The bar was a nice place to hang out after a long day of walking around. Prices were fair and the selection was ample. Location: It is just minutes away from Disney, Universal, and Sea World. There was also a little fair close to the hotel with carnival rides. Pool and Hot Tub: It was a little cool when we arrived there, so it was great that the pool was heated. They kept this area very clean and well maintained as well. An added bonus is that these areas were open 24 hours a day. Fitness center: The equipment had a good enough assortment of cardio and weights to keep up with any fitness routine. The weights even had enough weight to give my sons (190lbs each) enough resistance to have some challenge. Downside 1: The elevator was slow and overcrowded. The hotel was full when we stayed, so this cause a little bit of a delay. However, we were on vacation so it was not an issue. Downside 2: There was light coming through the door from the corridor. It wasn't enough to keep you awake if you were walking around all day. But, if you didn't come for the parks and light bothers you, this would get on your nerves. It didn't bother us at all.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond In The Rough”
Reviews.Author: IceCold87
Reviews.Content: On my first big road trip with my girlfriend I decided to take her to one of my favorite destinations in the United States. We planned a trip for Florida and decided to stay in Kissimmee. I had stayed there when I was younger and it was always a great vacation. Looking for hotels in Kissimmee we noticed that many of the old hotels we stayed at before were now closed down, but came across Comfort Suites on-line. We looked at the pictures and read some reviews and we were sold. We booked in early September for 12 nights. Upon arriving we realized it was the off season and that the hotel was almost empty. During our 12 nights there we only noticed an increased crowd during the weekend. The hotel main lobby is bright, colorful, and immaculately clean. Everything is well marked and the hotels various awards are in plain sight. The main lobby includes a games room to keep kids occupied, a small gym with about 10 machines just down the hall, a small store for necessities (fairly priced), and a large dining area for the Free Breakfast which is by far the best part of this hotel. The staff were friendly and efficient and we were checked in in no time at all. Staying on the 5th floor we had a view of Old Town and the Fun Zone across the street. The rooms are huge! Extremely clean and well furnished for the price. The bathrooms are well designed and the shower is rather large. Within a few hours of unpacking we headed to the large heated swimming pool, with hot tub and kiddie pool. The deck was clean, clutter free, with a nice pool-side bar which was also fairly priced. When checking in the hotel gives you coupons for 1/2 price drinks at the bar, as well a bundle of coupons for restaurants in the area. I will definitely book at this hotel and have stayed once since my trip in September, we just stayed there in early March. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Orlando area.”
Reviews.Author: rohrt
Reviews.Content: I came to the tripadvisor and saw the other reviews. There were so many positive reviews I booked right away. I travel alot and had some standards I was looking for. These are the things I liked about the stay. This hotel was almost $50 less a day then others I looked at. Free Internet WiFi but week signal on the top floor. Nice little fitness center but didn't have a chance to use it. Free breakfast was very nice and had a larg variety that changed daily Very nice heated pool, hot tube and baby pool. Pool side bar was very nice and we got some buy one get one 1/2 off drink tickets with the room. Take your drinks to the hot tub and enjoy. Right next to old town and I mean right across the street. Nice clean rooms and the kids liked how room service placed the stuffed animals or decorated the towles like a cruise lines do. With three kids we had some pretty a pretty messy room so we tiped the maid service well. Ticket booth in the lobby for all the attactions. Shuttle service to and from the parks. If I had one complaint it would be not having a balcony or a window that opens this however could be seen as a good thing too for saftey with small children. Over all we had a very nice stay and no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: sleepy510
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week during March break and had a lovely time. It was one of the busiest times of the year and the hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating in every way. The pool was warm and clean. It was great because the weather was on the cooler side but we could enjoy swimming in the pool without being cold. The hotel is located close to all the parks, outlet mall, and tons of restaurants. We had a great time and would definately go back to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Keeps Coming Back”
Reviews.Author: HeatherbelleT
Reviews.Content: Large clean room pool 24/7 hot tub hot breakfast shuttles to theme parks, outlet malls. Have been using this hotel since they opened no regrets ever. Walking distance to Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “great place,to stay”
Reviews.Author: nick73EnglandUk
Reviews.Content: first time trip to america,hotel very clean n tidy,staff all friendly and helpful,we stayed for 2 weeks in feb 2010 the room we had was very big with 2 double beds and cleaned to a high standard. even tho they had a few school parties stayin this didn't cause any problems,the breakfast (7-10) was great plenty to choose from,free coffee n tea 24hrs a day. the only problem we encountered was the shuttle buses to the parks.You had to request a pass at guest relations but I don't see why as when the buses arrived you wasn't asked for this pass and you have to be waiting early to get a seat on the bus as they become quickly full and the bus still had to go to other hotels.You only had a limited amount of times to travel which caused us to take a taxi back to the hotel on a few occasions as it was easier than waiting for the shuttle.I would recommend renting a car rather than relying on the free transport. Old town was great and we found the ponderosa and dennys on highway 192 value for money,plenty to do with the kids,the pool and hot tub was a favourite and the classic car show every fri/sat nights very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RGNJH
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 11 nights in February. Room was clean, beds were comfortable. 17 year old slept on hide a bed, but our 13 year old only spent one night on the hide a bed, said it was terribly uncomfortable. Continental breakfast was a great perk. Saved us a lot of money and had hot and cold items to choose from. This hotel has shuttles to all the parks, which was one of the reasons we stayed here. Only complaint would be the shuttle buses used for the Universal/Seaworld route; less than desirable as far as the interior goes, old and grungy. Pool and hot tub were great. Pool had nice warm water, as it was quite cold in Orlando during our whole stay. Elevators are slow but you get used to waiting for everything while visiting the parks. Be prepared to buy a lot of bottled water, the water smells like sulphur in this area for some reason. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a few glitches”
Reviews.Author: nykellyfamily
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great except for we left for Downtown Disney at 10 am and came back to our room around 5 and the maid had not cleaned the room yet. There was also black mold around the windows and the kiddie pool was not heated. Other than that is was a great hotel and we had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: JourneyingMan
Reviews.Content: Second time for us at this property--and another great stay. You can't beat this location for access to "Old Town", freeways and attractions. Very friendly service staff and good value also. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Warmest Pool In Orlando”
Reviews.Author: yahooholidays
Reviews.Content: Spent two Christmas's in Orlando and stayed here for couple of nights both times. Good value for money, clean, tasty breakfast, toasty warm pool (needed in winter season). If we ever go to Orlando again, we will certainly check-out the Comfort Suites Maingate. We love ya!

Reviews.Title: “worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: daisymaeToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the comfort suites maingate east in Sept.This is our third year there.It is the only hotel that I stay at.I know that I don't have to worry about cockroaches.jAs for the days inn beside it.,stay away.Although some people don't think that the buffet breakfast is the best at comfort suites,I always found something on the buffet to eat.Its a great hotel.We are staying there again this sept.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it the 1st time so stayed a 2nd time”
Reviews.Author: saz_haras
Reviews.Content: 2nd time I have stayed at Comfort Suites Maingate East - First stayed here in 2007 - Hotel is just as excellent as before - travelled with my mother - when we checked in was warmly greeted by the Hotel Manager - had a room on the 6th floor overlooking Old Town & Fun Spot USA which we could hardly hear when live music was on - we could also see the Disney Epcot firework display every evening(when we was in) from our room - also had a Welcome basket in our room on arrival courtesy of the hotel as repeat guest which was a nice surprise. Free high speed internet access in room is good as well. Breakfast is excellent - yes it can get a bit repetative but when it is included in the cost who can complain. Free Coffee and tea 24 hours a day is also a bonus. The free shuttle bus to Disney is excellent - you book it in advance, they have 3 going out and 3 coming back - you book this with the customer service desk and tell them what time bus you want to go and come back on. Hotel also does free shuttle bus to Universal and Sea World and there is also a free shuttle bus to the Lake Buena Vista Factory Outlets. Pool and Bar area always clean and tidy as is the whole hotel. Never had a problem at all and this hotel will be my 1st choice of hotel when I travel to Kissimmee again.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL WE'VE EVER STAYED IN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: badboy09
Reviews.Content: Best hotel we've ever stayed in. Staff was excellent, even upgraded us and let us look at the rooms before we decided, very informative of the area,(old town was great, Tex-Mex restaurant was delicious) pool area was nice/clean, bar and sandwiches, very good. Got stuck in the elevator, but they fixed it promptly. Hotel was remodeling but you couldnt tell it, always clean and presentable. Housekeeping did a wonderful job as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dogboy55
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June 2009. It was our first trip to Disney and I was a little more than nervous about going to this hotel not knowing for sure what to expect. It was really nice. The room was big enough for my husband and myself and our 14 and 20 yr old. The pool was nice and warm and never crowded. The poolside restaurant depended on which bartender was working...it was just okay. In a pinch it worked. After a long day at the park it was to have something available where we didn't have to leave. We loved the location and are planning a trip back to the area. This was absolutely perfect for going to the parks. We did not run into bad traffic once. Given that we live in a town of 900 people I was surprised as I had anticipated much worse. Room was good and clean. We requested extra shampoo and soap, etc and left a tip...we had more than enough supplies for the entire week. Try out Old Town on Wednesday night if you have time. They have a Elvis impersonator that was really fun. I am pretty sure it is every Wednesday night, but check out Old Town's website if you are interested. Park was incredibly hot in the middle of the day. Minnesota does not have humidity even close to this. I truly recommend going back to your hotel and getting out of the heat for a while. Even with teenagers you tend to get crabby and tired after too much sun. Having a car was really nice. I would rent one if you can budget it. We loved Steak and Shake-cheap burgers and shakes which the kids loved. Also would recommend the Texas Roadhouse- really good ribs. Didn't care for the chinese place located across the street from the hotel. It was a buffet and just okay. The breakfast everyday was crowded in the morning. Sometimes the groups could be watched and disciplined better. After 7 days it got a little boring, but it was something and it gave my husband and I someplace to go while the kids slept in and we could plan our day. Our gps came in really handy. You can download POI on mousesavers.com. Worked out perfectly. Ultimately we really liked this hotel. It was perfect for our price range. We paid about $75/night not including tax. We would definately stay here again but our looking foward to trying something new next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: derinr
Reviews.Content: What a great Hotel, would stay again anytime, breakfast good, staff where all great, look out for the Happy Hour at the pool bar 4pm-7pm, beer half price

Reviews.Title: “A Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Trailerman68
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easy to find and close to all the attractions of Kissimme/Orlando. The hotel is going through some renovations right now, but you would never know it as your only inkling was the painters walking around. The breakfast was excellent for the 6 days we were there. Our 3 year old just loved the Mickey Mouse Waffles with Chocolate Chips. The heated pool was excellent after a long day and we used it every day. When we arrived, we discovered that the Microwave did not work, we notified the front desk and within an hour, we had a new microwave. We can not say enough about the friendliness of the staff and very accomodating. This hotel is only a 10 minute drive to Disney and Seaworld and at a great price. We enjoyed the small kitchenette.....very handy. We would recommend this hotel highly will be back again for our next trip to Florida.

Reviews.Title: “FAB”
Reviews.Author: helensut1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week then travelled to the beach and later stayed at Hawthorn Suites LBV. Yes breakfast did get boring but was much better than LBV. Although rooms in LBV were better (separate lounge) there was something really homely about this hotel, it's fairly small and easy to get around, handy laundry on every floor, bigger pool and heated too, pool and snack bar, mickey mouse waffles etc. etc. and the location is perfect. We felt a little homesick for Comfort Suites and Kissimmee, although LBV is handy for downtown disney and perhaps a little more upmarket, you can't walk anywhere and there's so much more going on in Kissimmee - yes some shops are tacky but that's all the fun of Orlando. We wouldn't hesitate in booking here again, only downside is room size, two double beds but no separate lounge area so when the kids are asleep you are stuck in the same room as them but most hotels are the same so hey hum.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Great price”
Reviews.Author: tke_303
Reviews.Content: Pretty much of what you've read in previous reviews is correct. This hotel is clean, great location, nice staff, good pool, & awesome bar/bartenders. Breakfast is a little weak, but it definitely saves you some money from eating out. Free shuttle service is a nice perk, but pick up/drop off times are usually not the most accommodating. Only issue that we sort of had is that the room furnishings are a little dated compared to some of the newer hotels/resorts around the parks (i.e. no flat screen TV, 80's style beach furnishing, etc). So, if you like "fancy" or "upscale" looking hotel rooms, you might find fault on that point. Overall, good room at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: wilf1030
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October 2009 for 14 nights, the room was very clean and the kitchen area was a great bonus. The beds were the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in, think I will e-mail the hotel to find out what make they are! The pool was great and had a very relaxing atmosphere, nice to relax here between those hectic Theme Park visits. The free breakfast each morning was very good, great just to get up have breakfast and then head out for the day. The location was just perfect with loads of restaurants and shops of the 192. Very easy to drive to Disney and Universal and all the roads were well signposted from the 192. This accomodation added to what ws an amazing holiday, I will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Our vacation was Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Seh1474
Reviews.Content: We stayed 9 days at this hotel and loved every moment of it! We traveled with two small boys ages 6 and 7. With Fun Spot and Old Town right outside the door and a short convenient drive to any of the Disney parks, this hotel's location was fabulous! The boys enjoyed the Mickey waffles every morning, and enough other options were available for the adults that it didn't get overly repetitive. Our room was clean, spacious, and quiet. The wait for the elevator wasn't too long most times, but we did choose to take the stairs during check-out times. The kids loved the pool, although a March evening in Florida is still a bit cool for swimming, even in a heated pool. We will definitely consider booking this hotel again if we return to the Orlando area!

Reviews.Title: “Nice base for Disney operations”
Reviews.Author: hill8570
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at this hotel one night, as we wanted something sort of close to the Orlando airport (as we were flying out the next morning, and driving up from Clearwater the morning of the flight didn't appeal to me) and this hotel had far better reviews than the hotels closer to the airport. Definitely lived up to the reviews -- nice, quiet location, good included breakfast, lots of room in the suite, and a real nice pool. Only downsides (and they were small ones) were the somewhat funky smell in the 2nd floor hallway. (not quite musty, but it was strange), and the somewhat slow internet. Wouldn't keep me from staying here again -- it'll certainly be on the "considered" list next time we're at Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews”
Reviews.Author: RonEastYorkshire_UK
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Orlando took a great deal of researching, including trying to find a hotel that was decent without breaking the bank. Based on reviews on Trip Advisor I booked into the Comfort Suites and was not disappointed. This hotel is rated at 3 stars and I can honestly say I have paid far more money for hotels with more stars, which aren’t as good as this one. The hotel is very clean, the staff are very friendly our maid on the 5th floor was outstanding. The breakfast was nice even if it can become a little repetitive (you can always eat out). I think the most telling thing about this hotel is the minor things people find to complain about; Polystyrene plates and cups – A least every one is clean. Pool too warm – In Florida when the sun warms it up all day!!!! Timeshare people – A firm no thank you is enough. Pizza Fliers – Bend over, pick up and place in bin. Crossing the 192 – Use the pedestrian crossing. Slow Elevators – Never had a problem during my stay. If that’s all people can find to complain about, it must be doing something right. Will I go back – TOO RIGHT

Reviews.Title: “our vacation was great.”
Reviews.Author: barbiedoll66
Reviews.Content: my sister & I stayed 6 nights & 5 days & we enjoyed our stay very much,our room very clean every day, their breakfast filled you up for the day at the parks,the pool was great for relaxing after a long day, the bar was great for an evening of relaxing, we loved our room nice & plenty of room, loved the bathroom it was huge, room to turn around, everything was great for my sisters first time visit to Florida, folks believe what you see on the internet about this hotel it's all true it is exactly what you see, thank you folks for a great vacation. there people very friendly, helpful staff great job. we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Bianca38
Reviews.Content: We arrrived, my husband and I with our 9yr old son and 13yr old daughter, at Comfort Suites Aug.13 a day early and we were able to check in with no problems. The service was fast. We stayed for 9 days. The breakfast was great. The rooms were clean and the swimming pool was excellent. The kids had a great time swimming and they loved the hot tub. The location is great. Very close to Disney and right across from Fun Spot and old town. We took the kids to Fun Spot and they had a great time. This a definite stay again hotel. The best part for us is kind of hard to pick, we loved everything about it. Had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, well sited.”
Reviews.Author: m0psey
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after some good reviews on first arrival we were very pleased with our room. One of the reasons we booked it was the location. It's very near to WDW and has the Old Town Kissimmee on it's door step. The hotel was very clean and the maid was very accomodating after we had a couple of illnesses and couldn't leave the room when she arrived to clean it. The pool area is fine however i was suprised to find a heated pool. It was 95 degrees during our stay and it offered no help when trying to cool off. It was like jumping into a bath. While the complimentary breakfast's welcome i do object to eating off polystyrene plates with plastic cutlery. Also it would've been nice if the hotel had a lounge to relax in after a day at the parks. A few whicker chairs in the lobby isn't good enough in my opinion. A lastly they should sort the lifts out. 2 for 185 rooms isn't enough and the stairs are at the end of the corridor and not really well signposted which means those that would normally walk down from floors 2/3 waited for the lift. This meant that those up on the 6th/7th floors had to stop on every floor on the way down. Just a few minor grumps which didn't detract from a generally well run and welcoming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jules092
Reviews.Content: this is a great place to stay, with or without kids, the rooms are roomy, we had a king suite with 2 bathrooms, the bedsettee in the longe was a comfortable bed for our son,the large bedroom was spacious, there is a microwave and fridge in the room, the hotel is very clean, and a great pool and bar. the location is next to old town which is a great place to visit, on fri and sat eves there is cruise nite, where they bring in allsorts of cars from vintage to sports, hot rods. breakfast is included in the price, we would certainly recomend this place

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable - breakfast a bonus”
Reviews.Author: Frostycat
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 nights here - the main reasons for choosing this hotel were for the large rooms and the free buffet breakfast. They did not disappoint - the room had two double beds, plus a large seating area, which was great as there were 3 adults in the room and it gave us a bit of breathing space, and somewhere to put 3 suitcases without falling over them all the time! The breakfast was great, with hot and cold selections, and something to suit even the pickiest teenager! As advised by other reviewers on this site, we requested a room overlooking the pool, as apparently rooms on the front could be noisy. They complied with this request, and we had a room on the second floor, which was perfect. The pool was nice and great to come home to after a hot sticky day, as it remains open 24 hours. There is a pool bar/snack bar which serves excellent pizzas and other hot food which can be delivered to the room. My only criticism of this is that it does not open until 3 o'clock which is a shame if like us you would like some lunch before hitting the parks for the afternoon and evening. The location was very close to Disney and within walking distance of Old Town with its shops and fairground, which comes alive on weekends when there is a parade of vintage cars. Sea World and Universal Studios were quickly reached by a 20-minute drive along highway I4. My only criticism of the location would be that although it is very close to highway 192, the only restaurants within walking distance are Red Lobster and Pizza Hut. Logan's Roadhouse is an excellent steakhouse a short drive away and Ponderosa is a cheaper option where the steaks were very good. You can see this from the hotel but you try crossing highway 192 on foot! We made a few abortive attempts and then gave up and went back for the car! All in all, a great stay, but we probably prefer International Drive as a location because of the huge numbers of restaurants and shops that can be reached on foot. If this hotel could be transplanted to that location, it would be just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to stay-- We loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: triptaker1971
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay was great. Check-in & Check-out was easy. The entire staff was very friendly and helpful. The pool area was very nice, very well maintained and clean. The same goes for our room. The best part of our stay... was the piece and quiet we got at night. There were no obnoxious neighbors and we actually got a restful nights sleep. This, above other things is the most important to me! I would absolutely stay here again, we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: christopherjordan
Reviews.Content: All in all, this was a great deal. Clean, spacious rooms and very good service from the staff. Free Internet was good. Breakfast is included and this could use some improvement. They only had scrambled eggs one day that we were there. The rest of the time it was hard boiled eggs. They had baked beans every day???

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate Comfort at Comfort Suites”
Reviews.Author: ladyraceruk
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Comfort Suites Maingate East, and we found it every bit as good, if not better, than our first stay, which was in 2006. These suites provide everything a family of four could need. We stayed here for three weeks and found it excellent throughout. Firstly, this is a 3*, so it's not a 'luxury' hotel, but it is extremely nice and I would rate it at 3.5 stars. It is clean and spacious, and has great facilities. There's a pool, kids' pool and jacuzzi, pool bar and grill, gym, shop with photo service and free coffee all day. And there's a free breakfast, which is excellent. There's also free ice, air con, and laundry service. Our room had 2 queen beds plus a sofa bed. Also had a hairdryer, fridge and coffee/tea making facilities, plus free internet access which was great as we took our laptop. Plenty of room for 4 of us for three weeks. Rooms were cleaned to a very high standard every day. The only moan about the hotel would be the pushy salespeople who reside in the lobby. They try to get you to view a timeshare in exchange for some tickets, and if you speak to them, you can be there for over an hour!! Just say NO, and they'll leave you alone for the rest of your stay. The location is also excellent for eating and drinking and entertainment in the evening. 2 minutes walk from about 30 restaurants at Old Town and just across the road on the 192. There's also a funfair and go-karts at Old Town, and the world's tallest skytower. Huge!! There's also crazy golf and a shop within two minutes walk. Obviously most people have a car, but there are free shuttles to the major parks. We drove, and it's 2 mins from Disney parks and about 20 minutes from Universal/Seaworld. Overall, I cannot fault Comfort Suites as it's very good value for money, with everything a family could want in terms of the standard of accommodation, facilities and location. We love it so much we're returning for our third visit in 2010!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaTN
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in early July. Hotel is excellent for the price. Rooms are great, pool is great and everything is clean and neat. Would definitely stay here again. Plenty of restaurants nearby and the kids loved the amusement park area across the street.

Reviews.Title: “So Far So Good”
Reviews.Author: ScouseOwens
Reviews.Content: Currently staying at hotel, was happy to read so many reviews on Trip Advisor about it. Staff very helpful at check in. Breakfast great a good choice of food for everyone in our party. Pool area clean and tidy, hot tub a blessing after a busy day. Pool bar Barracuda Bart's good value for money, quick service. One thing I have noticed is quite a few people who have reviewd this hotel have passed a comment on lifts being slow or not working. The other morning we were on our way for breakfast and one lift got stuck on our floor (6th floor), on the way back from breakfast, staff were saying we could use the service lift although there was still one working. Engineer was on site repairing. Later that day both lifts in full working order. Room very clean and housekeeper very friendly and if you ask for anything its sorted. Only real problem we have had is with the shuttle bus from the hotel to the theme parks, that also calls in to a few other hotels on the way ( I know this is not the hotels fault. This is our 1st time to America and we did not fancy hiring a car.) They go out at 8am and 12.10pm to Magic Kingdom and one at 10.20am to Epcot. Coming home 6.00pm and 10.00pm from Magic Kingdom. What you dont realise straight away is they have one leaving Epcot at 9.45pm this then goes to the Magic Kingdom to become the 10.00pm bus so if it is half full at Epcot and a lot of people get on at the Magic Kingdom you end up standing up on the journey back to the hotel. One night in particular we were all packed in like a tin of sardines. Also you cannot watch the fireworks in the Magic Kingdom if you want to get 10.00pm shuttle as they start at the same time so if you want to watch them you need to jump a taxi back. Other than this little problem everyone is enjoying themselves. Great location for Old Town Kissimmee especially if you like American Classic Cars, on show every Friday and Saturday evening.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Worry it lives up to the good reviews”
Reviews.Author: 1bluskylover
Reviews.Content: I was planning my 3rd trip to Florida this time along with my teenage daughters I also brought my mother along so of course as usual I did my due diligence but researching hotels in the area. And research I did until I almost couldnt take it anymore. I decided on this location because I thought it would be good to be around activity without the I-Drive bustle. What a good decision! What a sense of relief I felt when we drove up. Everything looked exactly like the pictures. The lobby was nice but not stuffie the first contact personnel were laid back but yet professional. They do send you to get your parking pass from a time share solicitor but I just I'm divorced and that took care of the spiel. My room was exactly what I saw online. Location- excellent! There are so many eataries I couldn't begin to name them all and they are all within either walking or a small radius of the hotel. You are only a few steps from Old Town where you will find loads of games, rides and neat things to be true tourist Pool- great! what a plus knowing you dont have be on a pool hours schedule. It was always very clean and it was great be able to order a burger by the pool and if you sit by the windows you can pick up the WI-Fi signal Housekeeping- the wonderful lady that cleaned my room the first 2 days was excellent she went above and beyond even to fold something I had on a suitcase stand but after her service was average Elevators- yes they are slow and be prepared to stop on every floor Overral- I feel I recieved and excellent value for the price I paid (approx $67 per night) each time I've visit edFlorida I stay somewhere different one year Ramada Gateway, next Holiday Inn next year Mystic Dunes now Comfort Suites and all thing considered this was by far the best value. I usually dont stay the same place twice but I think Comfort Suites may change that!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great stay”
Reviews.Author: 42istheanswer
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late, or very early depending on your point of view. We had pre-booked our room many weeks in advance based on the reviews from this site. We were given a room right off of the lobby next to the weight room on the main floor. The staff checking us in stated that it was late and that was all he had. I questioned this as they knew we were coming and we had guaranteed a room for nine nights on our credit card. With the 3 hour time zone difference for us, everyone was up early to go to their activities. They were loud and we were woken up after a short sleep to hear all the chatter and noise from the lobby. The staff at the front desk was helpful and moved us to a room higher up and away from the elevators, pop and ice machines. What a difference. It was a regular room. No compensation for the inconvenience of noise and having to move. The rest of the stay was quiet except for July 3rd and it sounded like someone was being asked to leave but we only heard the protests as they walked by our room, not what ever the precipitating event was. July 4th was party night. It was a celebration and the WDW fireworks were the best we have ever experienced. The rooms were clean on the surface, but after the 3rd cleaning, we had a sock and some other stuff on our coffee table that did not belong to us. Something fell behind the dresser, and it was not very clean back there. Otherwise the bathroom, and room were clean. No offencive odours, and that is a challenge is such a humid climate. The safe in our room did not work. Breakfast was great. Met our needs, and there was a great variety. We are not into doughnuts, but loved the waffles yogurt and fresh fruit. The coffee was fresh and there was lots of it! That goes for the food too. We were usually part of the early crowd, so we never had to wait long for our fresh waffles. The pool was beautifully landscaped. I liked that it was open all night. Everyone during our stay was enjoying their time in the pool playing and laughing, yet were never obnoxiously loud disturbing those sleeping in rooms off of the pool. It was such a relief after a hot day at Disney to be able to cool down in the pool. The raccoons are cute and smart, starting at one garbage can and working around to the others. The staff do not encourage their visits, and guests seemed to be afraid of them for the most part. They can be rabid, so it is wise to stay clear of them, but they are not known to attack if left alone. They have a routine and I did not see them approach any of the guests. The elevators are slow. We were on the 6th floor and would take the stairs. With it being so hot, the stairwells are not air conditioned and by the time you hit the 6th floor you would be soaked and hot. Did not need the fitness centre... Someone had spilled a cup of coffee in the stairwell by the door, and the staff had that cleaned up very quickly. The fridge was very handy. We froze bottles of water and were able to have cold water well into the day. The location is very convenient. Our Google directions were not as easy to follow as they should have been. It is not hard to get to the hotel from the airport. Be aware that some of the toll booths are not manned late at night and change is required. Keep a load of quarters with you just in case. Tolls varied from 50 cents to $1.25. WDW is easy to get to. Traffic on July 4th was challenging, but that was the only time. Traffic moves well. Signage to WDW is great. Returning to the hotel, we followed the signs to 192, but almost missed the right hand peel off to Kissimmee as that info was not visible until after the peel off. Thankfully with few cars around we could pull over the 3 lanes and still make it onto 192 in the correct direction. It would be nice with the Epcot theme being such an important one, if this hotel could have recycling bins for paper, plastic, glass and cans. We would take our beverage containers to WDW to dispose of them there. It broke my heart to have to throw paper and glass away. What amazing beds and pillows. ZZZZZZ I was concerned that the hotel would not be what was claimed in the ratings, but we were so very pleased to have had a great time there. We have stayed on the WDW properties in the past, and have not felt as good as we did here. Thank you for giving us a much needed vacation to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You All for your reviews!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Thompson_Ct_Ekim15
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to just what we were expecting.Just as the other reviews stated. We got in at 9:30 pm on Sunday june 21st. Meet a very nice lady at the front desk. I told her that Tuesday was our 25th wedding annv. And asked if maybe we could get an upgrade! She was so nice to us first she teased us a little and then gave us our room. It was on the top floor end of hallway facing Old Town.Room 732. We opened the door and could not believe the room. It was the executive king suite.Nice Very Nice!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Only paid $65 dollars a night stayed 4 nights then moved to the Hilton at Downtown Disney (not so happy there) for 4 nights at alot more money. Back to the Comfort Suites. All the reviews were right SLOW ELEVATORS and lots of kids.3 high scholl wrestling teams were there.Breakfast was ok at best.Ate out a couple of mornings.Pool and hot tub good.Bartender not so didn't know how to make a simple drink lol. When we return to Fl. we would not think twice about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, perfect location, good value, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jajamarqz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights and everything was great. Our room was exactly what I expected with a little kitchenette. The lobby was nice with a little game room that our boys played in after a long day at Disney. The pool was nice, there was also a kiddie pool and a hot tub, plenty of towels and lounge chairs. The breakfast was great, they had hot breakfast and they had about 3 different menus the 5 days we were there. The Mickey Mouse waffle was the best and you can even ask the cook to add chocolate chips in the waffles. The elevator was a little slow and the bathtub drain was a little dirty, other than that everything else was good. As far as location, it is very close to Disney, we came home in the afternoon for a break then went back to Disney that afternoon. Old town Kissimmee is right outside, and we just walked down there to eat dinner and go shopping one night. It's a good bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulour for the money”
Reviews.Author: trevortke
Reviews.Content: I paid $69 for this and it was money well spent. Rooms spotless, breakfast amazing, everything everyone else says is right. Stay here, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay - Another great stay with Comfort Suites”
Reviews.Author: Sunday_Morning
Reviews.Content: This is our second time at the Comfort Suites Maingate East. We chose this hotel through Tripadvisor the first visit (December 2006) when we travelled to Orlando as a couple, and therefore it was a natural choice for our first stay in Orlando with our daughter (18 months). This time around, we knew we needed a suite in order to put our daughter in the "living room" in her playpen while we slept in the king-sized bed in the adjoining bedroom. We chose this suite because there was a door that shut between the two rooms instead of just a half wall as a divider like a lot of other suites we had seen. We paid a bit more than a regular room but it was so worth it for our comfort and sleep! The hotel is simply a nice, plain, ordinary, comfortable hotel. Perfectly clean in the rooms, communal areas are also comfortable and functional. The front desk service was perfectly fine, and although the Disney salespeople at the desk couldn't offer any better deal on a 1-day ticket than at the gate, they never hassled us or tried any hard sale tactic. The pool is medium sized and perfectly clean and servicable. The hot tub is large and often empty. There is a small "baby" pool with a sprinkler type of "mushroom" that rains down. It is freezing cold and not recommended for babies! Quick note to all that say that breakfast is "free". It is not "free", it is included in your price. That being said, breakfast is ok, nothing to write home about. Mickey shaped waffles are probably the highlight. Hard boiled eggs, cereals, yogurts, powdered eggs (ugh), juices, and bacon round out the comprehensive breakfast. The tables can be hard to come by if you come at peak times, and slightly sticky from all that syrup! The suite was a real jem however. A large kitchen area led through to a living room area with couch, chair and tv. The master bedroom with king sized bed and large dressing area which led to the large bathroom. Plenty of room to spare for our small family. The cons: the kitchen has nothing in it, not even a spork. If you want to use the microwave or keep food in the fridge, you'll have to buy plates, napkins, bowls, cutlery, the works. Not even a bottle opener to be found. Other cons: The internet access is through a cable, and the cable hookup is in the kitchen area. Because our daughter napped in the living room area, I couldn't work in the kitchen area as they are open to each other. I tried to run the cable under the double door to the master bedroom but it was so short I ended up sitting on the floor to work. It would be nice to get another internet jack in the bedroom. As others have said, the pizza flyers under the door are inconvenient, but really, if picking up a couple of flyers from the floor is biggest hassle in your day, you've had a pretty good day! All in all, we will definitely stay here again...I can't wait to go back to Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL TO COMPLEMENT YOUR ORLANDO THEME PARK VACATION”
Reviews.Author: harveyl
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Comfort Suites Maingate East Hotel, after reading all the positive comments about the property...they were all true! 1. Breakfast(FREE) was a real plus with fresh fruit, eggs(hard-boiled & scrambled), cereals(hot & cold), waffles, french toast, toast, sausages of all kinds, muffins, and superb coffee(plus great O.J./apple juice), and lots more....for free! Although lots of people came for the free breakfast, tables were constantly being cleared, and food constantly being replaced, so nothing ever "ran-out"! It was a real plus to start the day. Breakfast ran every day from 7:00 A.M.-10:00 A.M. 2. Free transportation to Theme Parks-my wife & I used the free bus service every day for a week to get to Disney World parks. The buses were ALWAYS on time for pick-up(3 times in the morning) and return to the hotel(three times in the late afternoon/evening). Pick up hours varied from 8:00 A.M. to Noon and return time from 6:00 P.M. to 10:00 P.M. This alone saved us $12.00 parking fee per day, and the aggravation of parking & walking to the front gate(or taking a tram ). The buses went into only one Disney park per trip(varied during morning & afternoon), but Disney buses took us to the park we wanted, quickly & efficiently & free. Same for Universal Park for drop-off & pick-up. 3. Rooms were very clean, cheery with microwave & fridge. Washroom was extra large with excellent shower in the tub. Room was cleaned well every day with lots of EXTRA towels supplied each & every day, plus soap, conditioner, shampoo & lotion. Everyone in hotel was friendly. Location of hotel, just two miles east of Disney property was a real plus with lots of restaurants nearby. We rented a car, but the "main drag", Highway 192 could easily be walked to in five minutes. Being next to "Old Town" was also lots of fun. Hotel pool/whirlpool seemed to be constantly in use, all the time! Common areas were also a pleasure to sit in to wait for the morning bus. Lots of chairs & couches in the front area. I give this property five out of five! We had a great week at this hotel We strongly recommend it to anyone thinking of spending some time in the Orlando area!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...would stay there again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: teed43
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Suites for our family vacation the end of February. We loved it. What a great location. Close to everything we wanted to do. The rooms were clean and spacious (but would have liked the bedroom to be a comopletely separate room). The pool area was beautiful. The staff was friendly. What a great place to stay for the money. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay even for those not going to the Parks”
Reviews.Author: nevets_83
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent choice for those wanting to visit Orlando with no intention of going to the parks. Front desk was quick and efficient and the parking was free and ample. The room was large, clean, and could sleep 6 comfortably. Wifi was a little slow but we managed. The grounds were really nice, the pool was well treed with palm trees and the pool was never over run with kids. The location was also excellent it was close to Old Town so you could go for a leisure walk, with tons of food and attraction options. We also drove to Downtown Disney one night and only took 15 minutes so the parks are also nearby. Did not take the shuttles as we did not go to the park but noticed the hotel does have them. Breakfast was actually really good we had no problem finding a table and the hotel was pretty full. Overall, I enjoyed this hotel mainly for the location, the pool and the value and would not hesitate to stay at this again and maybe even visit the parks next time.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a 'Stay Again' kind of hotel”
Reviews.Author: maraljo
Reviews.Content: We (my husband, our granddaughter aged 8 and myself) arrived early evening on Thursday 19 March to be greeted with a beaming smile from the receptionist and a 'Welcome to the Comfort Suites'. We were asked if we needed help with our luggage, told exactly where our room was located and told to be sure to ask if there was anything we required! The room was large (2 beds, a small kitchenette area and a proper bathroom) with views over the pool. It was immaculate and every time we returned to it after an exhausting day at the parks etc. it looked great. Our housekeeper was called Svetlana - we met her on our 2nd day - and she was charming. Needless to say, we left her a good tip at the end of our stay! The system here is an envelope with the housekeeper's name on it and room for comments, a good idea so that the tip goes to the right person. The hotel is right opposite Old Town which is starting to look rather run-down, it now has lots of fairly tacky fairground rides which is a shame as it used to be quaint and had an Olde Towne atmospherere. However there are LOTS of good restaurants around within walking distance, a special mention for Red Lobster at the top of Florida Plaza Blvd as their serving staff are excellent!! Food is good too!! On the subject of food - unless you are desperate and/or tired - I wouldn't bother with the Barracuda Bart's poolside bar. The menu is limited, overpriced and almost inedible. We decided to eat there on our first evening and it was a big let-down. We waited ages for it to arrive and left most of it. Which is why I gave only 4 for value. You would be better off, if you just want a fast food snack, going to McDonald's on the 192 .opposite the turning to the hotel. All-in-all this is a great hotel and we shall definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: ChaseSlough
Reviews.Content: Loved the location - everything you need nearby. Could do with more regular shuttles to the parks, but even getting a cab wasn't expensive. Will definately be going back

Reviews.Title: “This is a Great Place to Stay !!”
Reviews.Author: Orlandofunatic
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at this hotel at least 10 times over the past five years. We are from West Palm Beach and this is our first choice when we visit Orlando since it has ALWAYS been a sure bet. No its not five star but your not paying five star. In my opinion, its a great value for the money considering the size of the rooms and the newer age of this hotel. We are everyday people who like nice things. Forget about the guy who complained about pizza flyers under the door. Consider the source....Our rooms were always clean, well appointed and the staff was great. It convenient to the Mouse House, Universal and Seaworld.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: sheamac
Reviews.Content: my family of five (including children ages 9,6,4) stayed at comfort suites maingate east on 2/26/09- 2/28/08. Arrived at 9pm check in easy,no wait. Rooms are a nice size with comfortable beds, lots of extra pillows. Sofa bed uncomfortable, but my 6 year old did not mind it. Kids loved the pool area. Pool bar food not very good. Houskeeping did an amazing job. The kids did not want to leave to check into the Disney Hotel we had booked. We would stay again in the future. Morning breakfast buffet was good, very crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Nice friendly clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: lisavsummeren
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel with friendly staff,they were always helpfull when we asked something,clean and neat,nice swimmingpool and bar,great breakfast with lots of fruit,de mickey pancakes where good,shuttle takes long but it's free so that is okay,nice busdrivers,comfortable beds,walking distance old town with many restaurants and shops,it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: luvabreak
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 (2 adults & 2 kids aged 11 & 6) stayed for 6 nights at this hotel in January 2009. I read all the reviews and was most impressed. I have to say that I wasn't disappointed at all when we arrived there. The hotel is close to the Disney Parks (about 10-15 minutes by free shuttle), which was the main reason I booked there. They also offer a free hot breakfast daily which was great! Most reviews say that the breakfast room filled up quickly but we didn't see that as we were always there just after 7am each day. Free shuttles to Disney departed at 8am, 10am and 12:30pm daily. The hotel also offered free shuttles to return in the evening but these buses filled to the absolute maximum and could take up to 1 hour to get back to the hotel. This was not so great but we did it for 5 days as we didn't have our own car. Hotel is very clean, beds are comfortable and staff very nice to deal with. Our 1 bedroom suite was on the 6th floor and contained 2 queen sized beds in the one room and a kitchenette. A day into our stay, we realised that we really wanted a separate room for the adults so we enquired at the front desk as to the possibility of changing rooms. They couldn't have been more hospitable and found us an amazing 2 room suite with KSB and pull out sofa in separate room. We had 2 huge bathrooms and a great view of the pool (which unfortunately we never got to use as we spent all our time at the Disney Parks!). The rooms are huge, plenty of space to move around even with 6 suitcases! The only complaint I have is that you would expect a room with a kitchenette to have the basic essential items, (plates, utensils, glasses etc.. ) available for its guests to use. But there was NOT A THING in the cupboards and drawers, so we had to purchase disposable items from the nearest supermarket. There also isn't a lockable safe in the room which meant that I had to lock our personal documents and cash in our suitcase. The safe is in the cupboard as they advertise but there isn't a lock on it (I found this to be the case in both the rooms we stayed in, so perhaps they want their guests to use a safe in their lobby). The hotel is located just behind "Old Town" which is an amusement park that comes to life in the evenings. There is a Red Lobster restaurant about 1 minute walk away - really great staff and delicious food (highly recommended). On the highway nearby are many chain restaurants like Ponderosa (inexpensive & edible), Pacino's (Italian, so-so food) and many others. On the night of our arrival we took a cab to the Premium outlet mall (20 minutes by cab) and stayed there until 10:30pm (most nghts it's open until 11pm). There are a lot of really good stores there and you an pick up a good bargain if you have the energy to sift through it all. We purchased our 5 day Disney tickets at the tours counter at the hotel. It saved us the long lines at Disney itself and allowed us to walk right in. Just remember that in Orlando everything is far away (in distance) so unless you have your own car , definitely take a cab! I needed to see a doctor during our stay and was told that the nearest medical centre was down the road. Down the road is actually 20-30 minutes by cab, so don't be fooled. I would definitely stay at this hotel again if we returned in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A winner, once again”
Reviews.Author: Teddy10572
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th year in a row, that we have stayed here. Rooms very clean and staff very friendly. Breakfast buffet not bad at all for a hotel. We usually go the parks for for several days, however some of our favorite attractions include: SAK's comedy club in Orlando, Lake Cypress Airboat Tours, and never miss Crabby Bill's in St. Cloud.

Reviews.Title: “We've been bamboozled!”
Reviews.Author: tippANDbb
Reviews.Content: We're frequent visitors of Orlando Florida. We NOW stay in resorts because of these crap hotels. It's funny because we were actually suckered into this hotel with Wyndham reward points. We were told that if we signed into the timeshare we would get a week free at this hotel. Of course we were pretty skeptical because what hotels are actually free? We thought that since Wyndham was a reputable place of business, we would have a nice stay at a nice hotel. Little did we know, eh? We had a sign in our room, stating that we would probably see bugs. It said the bugs were harmless but still, they're BUGS! The air conditioning was very noisy. The bathroom toilet was also loud. The room smelled of old feet, and old nursing homes. The pool was inappropriate for children. Not the pool itself but the people in the pool. They were doing things that small children should not witness. The pool was occupied with basically the whole hotel. The hotel itself was THE worst place we have ever stayed in. WE WILL NEVER RETURN, IF WE WERE PAID TO COME BACK! We are now owners of a timeshare and will never revert back to hotels, especially comfort suites. UNACCEPTABLE, unless of course, you're used to staying in cheap, inhumanely comfortable & or gross, hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelinFlorida40
Reviews.Content: Liked everything except the pizza flyers being stuffed under the doors every night, annoying !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: LBH88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Comfort Suites Maingate East the first week of February 09, could not have picked a better hotel. Excellent service by the friendly employees, comfortable beds, lots of pillows, wonderful continental breakfast. The only thing I would do different is rent a vehicle instead of depending on the shuttle service. The shuttle drivers were kind and helpful and always on time but very limited in times leaving and returning. Sometimes it took us nearly an hour to return to the hotel just 2 miles away from WDW due to all the stops along the way. Wasted valuable time. Otherwise, I LOVED the stay.

Reviews.Title: “exellent hotel location”
Reviews.Author: flafoggs
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, had one problem the first time we stayed,but problem was taking care of,water was on floor by a.c. unit maintaice took care of it, perfect location to all theme parks and old town,good breakfast and pool area, kids really loved the mickey mouse pancakes.after staying at another hotel because of this being full was a mistake, this hotel beats them all,also if you like putt putt golf you are within walking distance to pirates cove golf, old town and resturants

Reviews.Title: “a must try”
Reviews.Author: charlieCoDurham
Reviews.Content: myself and husband and 4 children stayed for 3 weeks in dec 08, we where pleasantly surprised when we drove upto the hotel, it was really nice from the outside, very clean, upon entering we where welcomed by a very friendly male, where we where given all our details of breakfast etc,our room was nice and clean and spaciuos, although no room for all over our cases,the only problem we had was flees in the room which we complained about and the room was debugged straight away, the children where in the pool till gone midnight and they loved it, we had a problem which with 1 of the washing machines but the manager soon rectified the problem,the breakfast good, and everywhere was cleaned all the time, even round the pool was always clean,we will be going back,

Reviews.Title: “Not like it use to be”
Reviews.Author: samsapopingmom
Reviews.Content: This use to be our favorite hotel and have stayed here a number of times for our family reunions. I always book the hotel for the whole family and ask for a couple of things. This time I had 8 suites. First my younger son has muscular dystrophy, is in a powerwheelchair and life support breathing machine so I ask for a lower floor. I also asked for a connecting rooms so I could have my teenage nephews in the connecting room near us. Last was for the rooms to be near each other. I got none of my requests. The woman at the front desk just kept repeating to me of how I just made a request but had to take what is available when I checked in. Never looking up at me, she just kept playing with the computer. We were placed on the top of the hotel on the 7th floor at the end of the hall near the maintenance room. One of the elevators were broken for part of the stay. Huge problem with a power wheelchair. No connecting room but joining-got a lecture on that by the women at the desk looking at the computer too. The boys ended up across the hall. And only a couple of the rooms were near each other. Mother in law was 4 floors below. I got a lecture from her too. I got the complaints from the group. The rooms had black mold in the bathrooms. Toilets didn't work. A room near my sisters had a water problem and the equipment cleaning it was very loud. Then when the staff walked out of the room they yelled at girls for being loud in the hallway because people could be sleeping. No one could have been sleeping with the noise the staff was making. They heard the front desk call people names after the guest got in the elevator. Kitchen staff was eating waffles over the waffle tray during the breakfast serving time. I won't be staying there again mostly because I don't want to hear the complaints and do not want to be on the top floor with a child who has too much medical equipment to be carried down the stairs when the elevators don't work. I felt that the staff just didn't care. My husband tried the second day of our stay to get a lower floor and got the same response that I did.

Reviews.Title: “We love Comfort Suites Maingate East”
Reviews.Author: Lori_Cooper
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from our third stay at Comfort Suites Maingate East (two adults, two children). We researched various hotels on the internet before booking this one for this particular trip, just to see if maybe we would find something else for a change. My husband and I looked at probably 50 hotel reviews in the Kissimmee / Lake Buena Vista area but ultimately decided to stay at the Comfort Suites Maingate East again. It's clean, the rooms are spacious and the housekeeping is good. The pool is warm and the pool area overall is really nice and well-kept, and is open 24 hours and nicely lit in the evening (and there are always lots of towels), and you can buy drinks inside the eating area in the evening to take to the pool if the pool bar is closed,. The staff is friendly and helpful. There are laundry facilities and vending and ice machines on every floor (and small boxes of Tide and fabric softener are available in the little shop in the lobby for a buck). Also, the location is great. Sure, the breakfast is full of carbs, but it's a breakfast that's included in your stay, so if it's not what you want to eat one morning, then you can go out! We also never had any issue with the elevators being slow as other travellers have mentioned (we are on vacation, after all!). Would we stay here on our next trip to Orlando? Absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - loved it”
Reviews.Author: Jackbronson
Reviews.Content: Arrived early hours of 27th December 2008 , & was greeted at reception by 'Vernon', who completed our check in, a few minutes, very hassle free. We chose this hotel for it's proximity to Disney & also Old Town, which is a very good 'base' for returning from the parks at night, & also a varied choice of restraunts nearby. Had a lovely 'King' suite - huge bed, very comfortable, wish I could have taken it home. Big bathroom to go with it. This is undoubtedly the best hotel we have ever stayed at in Kissimmee/Orlando. It was quite expensive, but this because of time of year, it got very much cheaper after 1st January, for the remainder of our stay. I requested a high floor & front facing, looking out towards Old Town. You could see the fireworks from the Disney parks out the window, any nights we happened to be in the hotel before they started. You can park the car in the car-park & walk along to Old Town should you wish to have a beer in some livelier atmosphere. The breakfast, which many raved about in previous reviews, was not up to much. Eggs/beans/ Sausage gravy (kind of cheesy sauce with broken bits of sausage throught it , Waffles,biscuits. Cereal/yogurt etc. Really, it's a minor grumble, the rest of the hotel made up for it. Ok if you have hungry kids to feed without the expense of going out, but being only a couple with grown up kids, we chose to eat out most mornings. 24hr pool was exactly as it said - always plenty towels, really warm water, all the time. The jaccuzzi pool was excellent as well, water was roasting. Always plenty car-parking space. Always hot coffee in the dining room 24hrs. Found Racoons raking in the bins behind the car-park after returning one night. We used to bring back scraps to feed them after that. They are amusing to watch, but they take off quickly if you get to close. As hotel has a lot of vegitation behind it, guess that's where they stay. We loved this hotel - was a pleasure to come back to after our days out. We will definitely stay here on our future visits to the area, it has everything we wanted. Cannot rate it highly enough. Having stayed at the the Best Western Lakeside during a charter holiday summer visit, they are incomparable. A universe apart. If you've booked to stay here, at Comfort Suites Maingate East, you have made such a wise choice for you accomodation. Only thing that would make it better was if 'Cracker Barrel' moved in next door (breakfast) Enjoy your visit

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel! Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: djdjdjfj
Reviews.Content: What a truly excellent hotel. The room size was great, the facilities excellent, and it is located within easy drive of all the main parks. Magic Kingdom, Epcot, Blizzard Beach, Hollywood Studios and Animal Kingdom to name only a few are within 10 mins drive from the hotel. The hotel was extremely clean, the pool and jacuzzi were excellent and the staff really friendly too. The house keeper kept the room in tip top condition and everyone was pleased too help. This is the perfect location for all the parks, good restaurants within walking distance and Old Town is right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Fun”
Reviews.Author: heatherkMaine
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel for the money in Orlando. We have stayed in this hotel a couple of times. The hotel is easy to find. It has an amazing free breakfast daily, The breakfast even has make your own waffles and several other hot dishes. The pool is great and the hot tub is awesome after a long day at the parks. The rooms are very clean and the staff has been very friendly for the stays we have booked there. The hotel has free shuttles daily to Disney parks, saves a lot on gas and parking. It is quiet considering it is next to Old Town. Weve walked around Old Town and it can be kinda fun but is definately a tourist trap. The hotel is close to everything. Walmart and many other major stores within a mile or two. CiCis pizza was great all you can eat for cheap. If you are a shopper The Mall at Millenia is great but pricey. There are premium outlets all over the place. We love this hotel and have had no problems with parking lot break ins, we never even heard about any. I would definately reccomend this hotel to anyone!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time and what a lovely room!!!”
Reviews.Author: bonnieronnie1
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 1 dec to the 15th and we had a great time there. I think it is petty for the last reviewer to only score the hotel a 2 for an incident which is not the responsibility of the hotel. Cars can get broken into anywhere in the world and i suppose Kissimmee is no different. We never had any problems at all with parking and the whole experience was very pleasant. The one slight problem we had was when we bought our Sea world tickets from the guest relations man and when we got to the park we were held up for a while until our tickets could be validated. We mentioned it on our return and we were just fobbed off by a different guy who was on duty. Apart from that, the hotel is set in a great place, just off the 192 and across from Old Town's Fun Spot which we visited most nights for a walk and a meal and a drink or two. We also drove to the Gulf of Mexico to Treasure Island and Madiera Beach and stayed there for a couple of days which was brilliant. We stayed at a motel called the Tahitian for about 30 quid a night which was great value for money. We stayed in room 318 which was HUGE and we never had any problems at all whatsoever, We enjoyed the hot tub and boy was it hot in there. We loved the racoons at night, they are lovely Food from the barts bar is quite good Not too keen on the breakfasts that were on offer, they were slightly different each day but bacon bits and sausage gravy is not to our liking, we recomend you try the ponderosa for breakfasts which is just on the other side of the 192 We had a horrible meal in the chinese buffet which is next door to the ponderosa, the food was luke warm and not cooked properly. Denny's is great for any meal of the day and not bad value either especially if you use the coupon book in the hotel foyer Go there and enjoy it.... Oh, by the way, once my wife discovered WallMart, we ended up spending more there than in the theme parks.... Brilliant shop and very different to it's sister shop here in the UK, ASDA.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Parking Lot Break-Ins”
Reviews.Author: beans1234
Reviews.Content: We have no complaints about the actual hotel itself, however travelers need to be aware that they have frequent break-ins in the parking lot. Our vehicle (and one other) was involved in a smash in grab at approx 9pm. There is quite a bit of traffic/people in and out of the parking lot, plenty of lighting, but this did not stop the thieves. There is also a lot of solicitation on the property from local pizza joints. The hotel does have security, however when this occured his hours were 10 pm - 6am. Most of these break-ins were occuring before he is on duty. Of course the police were notified, reports written, fingerprints lifted...but we do not expect to find our items that were stolen. We realize that the hotel is not responsible for items stolen, however it would have been nice if they had offered (we did ask) to credit at least one nights stay (we stayed 3). After all, we are out a lot of money after paying for a new window, and replacement of inside items. Not to mention my husband had to spend part of our vacation driving to Orlando for the new window. We were in Orlando for our daughter's birthday weekend, which obviously turned out to be not so "magical". Instead, we got to explain why people would do this and steal our things from our property. So, if staying at this location...clean out your entire car before checking in!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel at a fair price near Disney World”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Redram
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel based on other Tripadvisor reviews. I must say that the hotel was a great choice for our stay near Disney World. The price was right, the rooms were large and clean and the service was excellent. This is a very good choice for lodging in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: CarrieB72
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night during our two week fly drive holiday, and it didn't disappoint. We chose the hotel because we were visiting Medieval Times that night, which was a Saturday, but we arrived in the afternoon and were pleased to find a lovely old town area within 3 minutes walking distance. As we were there on Saturday, there was a vintage car display and fairground, so if you plan on visiting, maybe weekends are best. The old town is definately worth a visit as there are lots of great shops and bars. The room was large, very clean, with a well appointed kitchen. The beds were comfortable and the staff were friendly. This was not an expensive hotel, but you get exceptional value for money and there is a large, free car park at the front.
