We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Do your homework!”
Reviews.Author: RAMartini
Reviews.Content: I have been a fan of trip advisor for many years. I not only use the website but preach it to others for it's non-biased approach. After the second time staying at a "top rated" resort and coming back with it's ok attitude, I realized that you must read between the lines. A huge red flag is when you are staying in a town and the top rated restaurant is a mediocre chain establishment. The town itself, "Kissimmee" is a tourist trap of bad chain restaurants and hokie gift shops and phony knock-off outlets. The hotel is located quite nicely off the main drag behind old town (cheesy, but fun carnival type place). Let me start off by saying the entire place is very clean. The staff is very friendly and handles any issues quite well. The pool area is very nice and a child's dream. The outdoor bar is below par but serves it's purpose. The rooms are of a good size but not huge. There are 2 elevators which are very slow and if you are on a higher floor can be very nerve racking. There are 7 floors in all. Here's some stuff that doesn't sound major but when you stay there it is. The towels by the pool could be used to sand wood. If you are flying Southwest and need a computer to pre-check in, plan on spending .25 cents a minute on the hotels computer and a dollar per page to print. Couldn't this service be free? The free breakfast is not scrumptious, delicious, fabulous and any other adjective I have heard it described. It is packed egg mix, frozen sausage, frozen biscuits, yogurt, bread, cereal etc. By day three you won't even go to it. Not to mention the eating area is packed. The hotel is close to all parks and attractions, but you will need a car. The beds are above average and the pillows are nice down alternative instead of those neck ache cheap foam rubber jobs. The bottom line is that this is the number one hotel in the area. There is no competition. Kissimmee is littered with cheap 39.00 a night places. This hotel is nice. At a hundred bucks a night I guess it has good value. If this is just another trip for you to Florida it will probably due. If this is a trip you have been dreaming of and saving for, I would recommend spending a little more. Hint 1#- If you do stay here call ahead and insist on a lower floor Hint 2#- book with their website for best rate choicehotels.com Hint 3#- check out the close by town of Celebration for a beautiful alternative. It is like night and day.

Reviews.Title: “Speechless”
Reviews.Author: Suitesfor3
Reviews.Content: I worked with Marriott for 20 years and after leaving 4 years ago we started to stay at Embassy Suites. Our family (13 yr old son) typically stays at Hilton and Marriott family hotels and we have stayed in Comfort Suites on two occasions. We take 3 vacations a year and with the price of Disney we decided to look for a better hotel price close to the park. It has been 6 years since visiting Orlando and we knew that much has probably changed. We split the vacation in half by staying at Hawthorne Suites in Buena Vista first. Both hotels had a high rating and our stay at Hawthorne was pleasant and looking forward to being closer to Disney. We stayed at Kissimmee Residence Inn 11 years ago and thought the area would be good. We drove into Kissimmee and I started to wonder if the right choice was made. We drove up to the hotel and my jaw dropped because of the neighborhood and was wondering what the family thought. We went inside and the lobby was very basic like a motel and not very clean. The staff was extremely nice and accommodating. We booked a suite by phone but they had us in a regular room. They were able to upgrade us to a master suite (very expensive) which we went to look at. It was big and clean but there was something about it that made me worry. As we were going back down the elevator, my wife noticed a lot of bugs on us. That is when I decided to try and get out of our reservation. The staff allowed me 1 hour to find another hotel and cancel or we would have to pay for the first night. We left and my family was so pleased that I decided to not stay at this property so we called the previous hotel and went back in to cancel. Again, they were very pleasant with canceling the reservations without any problems. I give the staff an A+ and the location an F and was very unhappy about the rating given to this hotel by travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay again at the Comfort Suites”
Reviews.Author: FloridaPhil_8
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel and we really like everything it has to offer.The rooms are spacious and very clean, the free buffet breakfast is very good and the swimming pool area is usually quiet if you feel like having a relaxing day. The location is ideal for the Disney Parks and is very handy for eating out at the numerous restaurants along the 192. If you like steak, try the Stadium Bar and Chop House located on the front of Kissimmee Old Town, the steaks are excellent, the best we have eaten in Kissimmee.

Reviews.Title: “Just a heads up for Choice Rewards members staying at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AMJ2
Reviews.Content: Please note- this review is only important if you are booking using Choice Reward Points (Choice is Comfort Suites' parent company), other readers may find it irrelevant (except from a customer service standpoint.) If you are booking using points for a free reward stay, please be sure to clarify with this hotel before arriving. Hopefully this doesn't happen to anyone else, but I wanted to post this so others wouldn't have the same troubles. From the other reviews posted, it sounds like a good hotel otherwise. We have stayed at Choice brand name hotels quite a bit, but this was our first time using reward points for a free night's stay at a Choice Hotel. I called the hotel directly around 3 months in advance to book a room using reward points. The customer service representative stated that would be fine. I asked if she needed any of my reward numbers, and she stated that they could get them from us once we arrived. I thought that was a bit odd, so I clarified once again to see if we could use our reward points to book the stay (essentially being free.) She again said everything was booked for our reward stay. A week before our trip, I called to confirm that they still had us down for the reward stay. The representative stated that we were down for a stay, but not for a reward stay. I explained that I had booked the hotel using reward points. She stated that she had to go ask to see if that was okay. She came back on the line and stated that they could not redeem a reward stay directly and that I would have to call the corporate line to redeem the stay. I then called the corporate line, and the representative told me that this particular hotel was "out" of reward stays for that time period so we could not book a stay for that time. From what it sounds, each hotel is only allotted a certain amount of reward stays per night or time period. I told the representative what happened, and she told me that she could not personally do anything but instead to call the hotel manager directly and give that a try. I called the hotel back and asked to speak to the manager. I believe it was a manager, but it was not the hotel's general manager. I told him about our sticky situation and that I would appreciate any help he could give me. He was argumentative and defensive about the entire situation. I didn't mean for him to get so worked up about the whole thing. He stated the original representative never would have told me that we could book a reward stay through the hotel directly. He stated that booking reward stays was supposed to be done through the corporate line. He insinuated that I was lying by stating that he had already spoken with the original representative and per their conversation, the representative didn't even know it was possible. He stated that she did not remember our original conversation, but I said that I did as I keep detailed records. I told him that I remembered the conversation and that it matched my records. I asked if there was anything he would do, and he told me that there was nothing that he was going to do. I calmly told him that I expected better customer service, and he very boldly stated that he was providing good customer service. Not to make him look bad as I'm sure he has to deal with many issues, but that comment almost made me laugh and get mad all at the same time. I told him that we would no longer be staying at Choice hotels, and he stated that was o.k. I can definitely admit that it was partially my fault that I didn't realize we were supposed to call the corporate line to book the stay instead of the hotel line. I can also admit that all of this just sounds like a simple miscommunication. On the other hand- I also think that the hotel could have handled this in a much better way. If they would have told me to call the corporate line in the first place, we could have avoided this whole mess. It made me feel a little upset as we had stayed so many nights in Choice hotels previously that I felt like I had earned that reward stay. (Actually we spent so many nights that we were Platinum members.) I also felt belittled and treated rudely by the manager. We were planning on having a free stay through the reward points. The plane tickets were already booked, so we ended up having to spend a decent amount of non-budgeted money on another hotel that wasn't as nice. Again- if you're not booking using a reward stay- I'm sure this is a good hotel and I hope that you have a good experience. I know we were really excited about staying there and we wish we could have stayed :(

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: LouKYLady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Comfort Suites Maingate East for the week of August 17-23. We were totally happy with all aspects of the hotel and it's staff. The breakfast buffet was extensive and had a lot of variety. I don't see how anyone can't find something to 'fill the bill' for breakfast. Choices included donuts and other sweet goods, cold and hot cereal, 3 types of fresh fruit, 2 types of canned fruit, yogurt choices (both in flavor and full/lowfat varieties), hot items including scrambled eggs or hard boiled eggs, sausage or bacon, sometimes ham or sausage stir-ins for the scrambled eggs, waffles, breads for toasting, and the usual beverages including coffee, tea, juice, hot chocolate, and milk. Check-in was quick and easy and housekeeping was superb. We were never asked about a timeshare presentation by the concierge, but they were happy to answer a couple of questions we had. The pool area and bar were very nice, unfortunately, tropical storm Faye moved in early in our stay and taking advantage of these two items went down the drain. Although the elevators having to make many stops could be slow, it was not a major inconvenience. We will stay here again whenever we visit the Orlando area in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall value, but...”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel061203
Reviews.Content: Based on the numerous reviews we found on TripAdvisor, we booked the Comfort Suites Maingate East. Here are the great things about this hotel: 1) it is spotless-they pride themselves on their cleanliness and they do a GREAT job; 2) the staff is very helpful, friendly and patient; 3) the pool is nice; 4) the location is good; 5) loved the refrig and microwave in the room. Some not so great things: 1) the free breakfast buffet has too many high carb, high fat products - donuts, sausage, gravy, biscuits, no non-fat yogurt and during busy times the waffle operation was extremely slow; 2) some of the fitness center equipment was not in good working order and notice to the management did not produce any results; 3) the rooms are getting shabby and showing their age; 4) people are allowed to smoke in the pool area and they did so with a vengeance; 5) the elevators are slow.

Reviews.Title: “Nice motel, but a lot of problems”
Reviews.Author: pampamOklahoma
Reviews.Content: This is a nice motel and close to Old Town, worth walking around. Had a nice room but the A/C had problems. was moved to another room around 11pm, smaller room at that, went to Disney next day, thought when we got back around 10:30 pm A/C would be fixed in room but wasn't, had to move to another room once again, A/C worked but we were so tired that we decided to leave the next day instead of staying another day, tired of changing room. This motel was booked months before our trip to Disney, taking our grandkids to Disney for the first time so wanted everything to be perfect! I looked for motels for weeks so this was a disappoinment when we were finally there. Elevators are really SLOW!!! Get up early to get around!!!!! The breakfast was good but get up early to beat the crowds, it fills up fast!!! Next trip to Disney we will stay at another motel and hope this time we have the "perfect" trip with no problems with the motel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place for the price”
Reviews.Author: GBorbs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the first weekend in August and loved it so much that we canceled our plans to go to Cocoa Beach the next weekend and returned to the Comfort Suites. This place had nearly everything you could ask for: Attentive staff; clean, spacious suites; comfy beds; a fantastic hot and cold breakfast (Belgian waffles, scrambled eggs, biscuits and gravy, all included in room price); a small arcade off the lobby; a crystal-clear pool that was open around the clock plus a hot tub and a poolside bar. Was also only five minutes to Disney parks, 10-15 minutes to SeaWorld and Universal, and was across the street from Pirates Cove minigolf, the FunSpot amusement park and Old Town Orlando, a three-block strip of shops, restaurants and amusements. Only real gripe was that the business center downstairs didn't offer free computers for checking emails, etc. Instead it had computers where you paid by the minute with a credit card, and the machine i used didn't work very well. But when you add up all the positives about this place and include the fact that we didn't pay more than $79 a night to stay here (book online!), this was incredible. Our first choice in Orlando, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the whole family”
Reviews.Author: ellegirl119
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 days before heading to Walt Disney World. The room was very nice and great for a family of 5. The pool was nice and large and the breakfast in the morning was good and there was always a different featured item every morning. The hotel was in a great location even though there was a lot of traffic. Old Towne is is right across the street and next to the hotel there is a really nice minature golf course. The hotel was great and the staff was nice. Everything was clean and the concerige can answer almost any question about the surrounding attractions. The hotel says that they have free shuttes to some of the major attractions like Sea World, Universal Studios, and Disney World, and they do, but the problem with the shuttles is that there is only one time for most of the parks. Which means that you have to plan your days around the shuttles, which isn't worth it. Just pay for parking... you'll be happy you did!!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sharp2003
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this hotel very much. My brother and his family came to Florida to visit with the idea that all of us would go to Disney and the such. I chose this hotel because of its proximity to the theme parks and Old Town was next door to enjoy without having to drive and pay for parking. I also loved that the pool stayed open 24 hours and the jacuzzi was great especially after a long day at the parks. The hot savory breakfast the hotel served was your usual belgian waffles, eggs, biscuits & gravy, muffins etc....nothing fancy but enough variety to at least satisfy a hungry tummy. It's free what more can you ask for?? If you want fancy and room service then you need to have your wallet ready to pay elsewhere. Granted this hotel building seems to be older but it was clean, service was great and the employees were very friendly. There are also enough restaurants (fast food & otherwise) nearby. Overall, I would definitely come back when other family members come and visit again even though I only live an hour and a half away! Its just so conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Great! Great! Great!”
Reviews.Author: zanielane
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay here July 19-25, 2008. I can't say enough good things about the whole experience. Check in was a breeze, & our room was ready upon arrival. The cleanliness of this hotel was really a plus. Our rooms where just as the hotel photos showed, actually looked better in person. A/C worked perfectly and housekeeping did an excellent job. The beds and pillows where really comfortable. The pool area was nice and clean and never crowed.(its open 24 hrs). The free hot breakfast was perfect for vactioners on a budget. They offer a variety of hot/cold breakfast food to fill you up before a long day at the park. The location of this hotel is great! It is within walking distance to numerous restaurants, fast food places, supermarkets and shopping. One slight caution, be sure to be outside a little early for the daily shuttle service to the parks. They sometimes ran about 5 minutes earlier than the shuttle schedule stated. All in all we had an amazing time and this hotel definitley gets 2 thumbs up from me.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Fallguy0007
Reviews.Content: This is likely one of the better choice hotel chain properties in the area but it is starting to shown signs of age when you go beyond first impression and if you are a bit pickier than most. This is an older property with excellent design and excellent location however. Internet in lobby is a pay machine with 4 min for $1 plus $1 a page to print this could be a pain if you are flying southwest and trying to book in 24hrs in advance. What appears to some to be discount tickets in the lobby is really a sign up for time share presentations. Fairly clean for the most part but it can be a bit hit and miss as well. Go out and walk around “Old Town” if you are in the area it is worth it

Reviews.Title: “"Beware" "Beware"”
Reviews.Author: pauly-oo
Reviews.Content: Beware everybody customer service horrible. We booked a suite 3 weeks prior to arriving, they gave us a confirmation number once upon arrival I was told that the hotel was booked and I would have to make other arrangements. The sad part is that this is standard procedure. Manager was no help at all very, very poor customer service. People be aware of this place. I can't believe it's ranked so high nothing special about this place.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: fuzzyyy
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here from 29th June to 13th July, for a holiday to orlando to do mainly the parks (disney world , universal etc.) For that, the hotel was in a very good location, and just a short drive from most of the parks. another thing that was greatly appreciated was "old town" which is just across the road from the hotel. It provided us a place to eat at night and various shops and a huge fair. There is also a classic car show at weekends which was kinda cool. The free breakfast is great if a little repetitive. The suite we were given was on the top floor and had plenty of room for a family of four. It also had a fridge a microwave and a few cupboards which were greatly appreciated. Had no problems with "slow lifts" apart from our last few days when one of the lifts broke down and only one was operational. The pool area was very good, and we used it almost everyday (the bar at the side of the pool makes great pizzas btw) and the hot tub was extremely hot and relaxing which was great after a long day at the parks. One thing to note is that there is a raccoon by the poolside which we were scared of, because we have had no experience with a raccoon before and did not know if they were aggressive or what but we were assured that the raccoon would not harm anybody aslong as they stayed away. overall a great value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: love2travel2
Reviews.Content: God clean 3 star hotel We are staying at the hotel right now, and I agree with the previous reviewers, the hotel is nice and clean. You just have to be aware that it is only a 3 star hotel. From some of the reviews it could look like you are going to stay at a 4 or 5 star hotel. If you expect this it will not live up to your expectations. There is nothing fancy or luxurious about it, just really good value. The rooms are large and well kept and the beds are just perfect. We slept really well. There are plenty of items on the breakfast buffet, not fantastic quality, but hey it is free and the hotel is a fantastic bargain for the price. We are just not used to that many sweet things in a breakfast buffet I swear I found it really hard to find anything that wasn’t loaded with sugar- except the fruit which was great. The pool was kind of dirty when we arrived on July 4. But after a couple of days it was fine again. I guess is couldn’t quite keep up with the vast number of guests Our main problem is the shower. The water pressure is fine in the sink, but the shower is just not good enough. It is difficult to get the shampoo out of hair because of the design of the showerhead – very little water comes out.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for disney trips”
Reviews.Author: Auryn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March of 2008 with my boyfriend who was home on military leave. The hotel staff were friendly, gracious and accommodating. We had a room on the 5th or 6th floor I believe, facing the parking lot. It was actually a nice view because we could see all the lights of the nearby events. A nice lit cityscape. We are both very very particular about bed comfort- we both LOVED the bed, pillows and linens. Everything was spotless and super clean. The bathroom is huge- biggest hotel bathroom I've ever been in (ive been on 3 different continents, in all types of accommodations). The room had a nice kitchenette area with a microwave, and a love seat. The buffet breakfast was very good. I asked him if he wanted to add anything to this review and all he said was "AWESOME WAFFLES!" We both loved the dark chocolate chip mickey mouse waffles. The only problem we had with our stay was that it was easter week and there was a HUGE group of church kids staying at the hotel. Absolutely the most rude, obnoxious, and ill mannered children I have ever seen. If I hadnt gotten up early both mornings to have breakfast, we wouldn't have had any. They camped themselves in the breakfast room and ate the hotel out of house and home, while blasting the tv and screaming loudly. This has nothing to do with the hotel itself, they tried to control them and minimize their behavior but there was only so much they could do being as the chaperones had no intention of doing their jobs and mostly let the children run around like heathens. I am in my late 20s and love kids- so no this isnt the opinion of some crotchety woman who doesnt like kids. We will definitely be staying here from now on when we go to orlando. The hotel is very close to the disney entrance as well as many restaurants, shopping centers etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great place!”
Reviews.Author: cms1976
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Comfort Suites Maingate East from June 14th-June 19th. The reviews were very accurate. The hotel was clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. I am very picky about cleanliness and was very happy with our room. The beds were extremely comfortable-we all slept very well during our stay. The breakfast was great. A great variety each day and with it included in the price, wow! The pool was very clean and great to swim in, just the right temperature. We ate from the bar one night due to pure exhaustion, but the food was good as well. We also needed to print our boarding passes from Southwest as a previous reviewer did and simply asked the front desk, who directed us to the concierge desk and he happily printed them within a minute. Great service, clean room, good food - we couldn't ask for more for under $100 a night! I went through the hotel website with my AAA discount and got a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, affordable, great location, cant wait to stay again”
Reviews.Author: zgoodfella75
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been researching websites and finally decided on Comfort Suites, Maingate East. and we are glad we did. The location to the Disney parks is less than 10 minutes to all of them. Restaurants are aplenty right around there. Old Town was fun and safe, my 2 year old had fun riding the kiddy rides there. The breakfast buffet was OUTSTANDING, the food was hot, good choices, and filled us up for a long day out at the parks. The pool area was clean and had a nice kiddie areas that had a 6 fooot gate around so kids could not get loose. When we checked in we got coupons for 2 for 1 drinks at the poolside bar, which my wife took advantage of. Rooms were ALWAYS clean when we got back, cute little towel animals were left, and AC was ICE COLD. The elevators I heard were slow, we only noticed 1 day when we went downstairs (at a peak time) 8'ish, waited no longer than 3 minutes. All in all will definitely stay again on our next trip to Disney and Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay”
Reviews.Author: zaimei
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about Comfort Suites Maingate East. Good Points: Located about 10 mins. from all Disney theme parks with car, about 20 mins. from airport, has a free shuttle to disney and buena vista outlet mall, lots of resto around like red lobster, chili's, ponderosa, ihop, macaroni grill, harley davidson resto, etc.etc.etc. Close to a walgreen's. Very nice breakfast selection- scrambled eggs,ham, mickey-shaped waffle with whipped cream and fruit,, biscuit and gravy, food depends on day. Clean big room, free toiletries always replaced, fluffy soft pillows, controllable aircon, has travel agent at lobby, athough you can only purchase disney tix that is minimum of three days. Very cheap for the price, around $80/day. Much quiter than int'l' drive. Fun pots in front is not really bothering. Has internet for a fee, free morning newspaper, nice pool, free large parking. Bad points: Just that it's quite a drive to int'l drive and universal.Renting a car may be necessary. Highy recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DorsetDumpling
Reviews.Content: Overview We checked in at the Comfort Suites late afternoon on Friday and when we went to our room, we discovered that the room we had been allocated had a King size bed and a sofa bed. We had specifically booked two Queen size beds almost one year before. We went back to the Reception desk to say that we had been given the wrong room but the lady on the desk said they had no twin Queen size rooms available until Sunday and there was nothing she could do. We decided that further protest would only aggravate the situation, so we remained calm and advised that we would speak to the Virgin (our tour operator) representative the next day. This mild threat seemed to do the trick as the lady then said that if we returned early the next morning she would see what she could do. We returned to the desk at 7.30 a.m. the next morning and miraculously our requested room was available! The previous occupants must have vacated very early indeed! We have a funny feeling that the hotel keep their options open at the weekend and wanted a room that would sleep six, available for last minute bookings and placed us in a four person room. When we spoke to other guests we found out that they had also had the same thing happen to them on their first night so it may be the hotels practice to upset guests on their first day! Whilst we were very unhappy on our first night, the rest of our stay was delightful. Lifts We had no problems with the much talked about lifts and we were on the seventh floor. Perhaps we Brits are a little more patient. It puzzled us that able bodied people on the first and second floors used the lifts when the stairs would have been so much quicker and easier. The thing we did not like about the lift was that it was hot and the smell of breakfast seemed to linger in it a little too long! Raccoon I would warn you that the poolside raccoon is a problem. Cute as he may look, he has a penchant for Tortilla Chips, Cookies and indeed any food item you may have on you or in your bags. No food item should be left unattended. He is not afraid to steal from you even if you are in close proximity! Facilities The washing and drying machines on each floor were in good order and cost $1.00 for a wash cycle and $1.00 for a drying cycle. The hotel do not sell stamps but will frank your postcards and send out with the hotel mail at 90c for a postcard to the UK. Transport to Parks We did not use the hotel shuttle to the Parks but we were aware that there were three buses a day to the Disney Transportation and Ticket Centre, the first one leaves at 7.35a.m. There was also one bus at 9.25 a.m. to Universal/ I.o.A. On a day when my husband wanted to have a couple of glasses of wine with his meal at Epcot, we took a Taxi from the Hotel to the Transportation Centre and picked the Monorail to Epcot (you have to pay the $11.00 parking fee for the Taxi if you actually enter a Disney car park) and the fare was $25.00. The return Taxi from Epcot was $20.00. This hotel is ideally situated for all the Parks (10 minutes to Disney and Seaworld and 15 minutes to Universal and IOA) and on the couple of occasions we found the time to go to Old Town it was nice to wander around in the warm air,and sit down for a drink outside rather than in an air conditioned environment. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great once again”
Reviews.Author: atcmom
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying here. We were once again quite pleased with the hotel. It is very basic, but comfortable and well maintained. For less than $100 we got two queen beds and a pull out sofa, which works perfect for the five of us. The staff was nice, as was the person who cleaned up our room. The breakfast is great and saves us a lot of money, as there are five of us. The beds are very comfortable and I slept like a log, which is very unusual for me to do on a bed other than my own. The pool is plain, but the kids enjoyed it. The nights we were there a large group of kids from a soccer tournament were also there, which made for a noisy hotel. All was quiet by 11 pm though, so not that big of a deal. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for something comfortable and big enough for 5 to 6 people.

Reviews.Title: “Review on Comfort suites maingate east”
Reviews.Author: TravellerOlic
Reviews.Content: We found the accomodation at the Comfort Suites Maingate East ok - a great location for doing the Disney Parks (set back from the main 192 & away from busy Hwy with great view of Old Town bungie + you can also spot the Swan/Dolphin Disney hotel from b'room window if you hav view tht side, the otherside is view of pool) & rooms were clean. The only disadvantage to this accomodation in our opinion is tht it isn't suitable for couples staying for longer than a week (which we did) as it is catered for families which we didnt hav a problem with - the only problem we had was being disturbed during the early hours of the morning by kids shouting/screaming & running down the corridor (we were informed tht accomodation take in the "teams" which are groups of kids tht stay at resort during this particular time of year to do sports etc ) + people were checking into their rooms still during the early hours which was also heard. The trick is to keep the "air-con" on during the night (or wear ear-plugs if you are a light-sleeper) as this does drown the noises from the corridor out & people waiting for the lift (as the lift is extremely slow - they only hav the two lifts in the middle of the corridor which made a sort of "choo choo" noise when they arrive at your level. Having said all this we would definately stay at the Comfort Suites Maingate East again but at a different time of year - we found the "free breakfast" which you don't often get really handy with fresh-fruit put out every day & it doesnt matter what age you are, everyone loves those "Mickey" waffles. Roll on '10 we miss Florida already!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: rdwacw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel May 14th-19th with our son,his wife and our grandsons. We arrived an hour before check-in and we were given our rooms immediately. The hotel was an excellent value for the price. The location is easy access to Disney. There are also many restaurants nearby. The breakfast buffet in the morning is pretty extensive. The menu rotates between boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, biscuits, toast, gravy, donuts, fruit, yogurt and other items. The management maintains both the property and the rooms well. The facility is very clean. An added bonus is that Old Town which has many shops, restaurants and an amusement park is within walking distance of the hotel. If I had to list any negatives, it would be that the hotel needs more elevators. There are only two and they are very busy in the mornings. Also, in the business center, it costs a dollar a sheet to print from the computer. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and I would recommend it to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at a great price”
Reviews.Author: IluvTrippin
Reviews.Content: Theres a good reason why this hotel is one of the top family hotels based on TripAdvisor. Great stay at good price. My wife and I stayed at the Comfort Suites Main Gate east the first week of May and we're pleasantly surprised at quality of stay for the price. The hotel is just off Kissimmee's main strip, HWY 192 back behind the carnival-seque "Fun Spot USA" and beside the "Old Town" classic town walk (not that good, btw.... Its not horrible, just tourist trappy) We asked for, and received at no extra cost, a standard suite on a higher level after previous reviews encouraged avoiding the lower floors due to noise and crowds during peak season. The hotel's decor was nice and, while the elevator was a tad slow, the place is very nice.Tip #1: Book with the 'Magicard', the FREE official 'Orlando Info' tourist card which can be found by going to the 'Orlando Info' website (google it).. you can print it off, or find them in Florida Information Centers. Because we booked with the 'Magicard rate', We ended up paying only 99$ for the first night and 69$ for three more evenings. If you even mention the Magicard, you will probably save money. The suite was fantastic and did not disappoint.: It was clean, featured a Queen bed with adjacent loveseat facing a 26' TV with full cable. The bathroom was nice, clean and well stocked. The suite also had a business table beside the TV, as well as another 2 person table in the suite part, a minifridge, microwave and a mini coffee maker that was restocked every day when housekeeping came by. Free Hi speed Wireless internet was available down in the lobby. They also have free hi speed wired internet in the room with a short cord connected to the business table beside the TV. Tip# 2: Request a front facing room... while you can hear the FunSpotUSA carnival they do shut down later in the evening, its not facing the pool which could potentially get noisy, and the higher up you are the views are great at night. The breakfast., which runs 7am to 10am, is a Hot breakfast changed day to day. with the "hot" component being either Hard Boiled Eggs, Egg Patties with Sausage, French Toast, Biscuits and Gravy (a southern staple). There are also tons of dry/wet items like cereals, porridges, bagels, and even mini-donuts. The coffee is good and theres a nice selection of teas. Tip#3 Get to the breakfast area early, get your stuff, and eat outside by the pool. The breakfast room is small, but the perfect solution is to eat out on the pool patio. We did it every morning and it really made the experience better because it can get quite crowded for breakfast. But with the modest pricing, getting a full hot breakfast along with nice accommodations really set this place apart. There we're only two real negatives, and they we're that bad at all: 1) the volume of the in-room air conditioner/bathroom fan - a little loud at first, but soon becomes background noise that isn't noticeable at all - and 2)The timeshare info booth- near the 1st floor elevator, there is a booth with people offering timeshare info. While they are quite professional, if you engage them - like asking for attraction ticket info - they will try to get you to sign on for a free breakfast and then a presentation on timeshares. While they didnt bug us most of them time, there was one day in particular when one of the associates went out of his way to get our attention while we were heading to our room. While its understandable, since it's their job, it wasn't the nicest experience... other than that, they didn't bother you; So it wasn't really that bad. If anything, don't let that keep you from booking at this hotel. Overall, it was a great stay and well worth the money we saved and spent elsewhere instead of on a hotel room. If we ever come back to the Orlando area, this will most probably be our hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experiance”
Reviews.Author: MRLewis1970
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel from April 30, 2008 to May 8, 2008. I had read all the reviews and was anxious to see if the hotel would meet the other visitors recomendations - and it did. Well and above. We checked in before the 3:00pm check in time - and was told the room was not ready at that time but that we could come back in about an hour. They gave us a ticket to give back to the clerk when we got back to get our keys. We went ahead and headed off to Magic Kingdom till about 7:00pm. When we got back, our keys were ready. The room was very clean. And was exceptionally nice for a 3 star hotel. Our rooms were kept clean on a daily basis - and my 3 year olds stuffed animals were always sitting up and watching for him to come back that night. I personally did not care for the mattress' just because of the firmness, but my husband thought they were fine. The pillows were outstanding - and pleanty of them. In fact upon checking with the front desk, we found out that they sell them - and that many people enjoy them. My husband is still saying he'd like to have several if we could get them. The breakfast is more than average for a hotel "free" breakfast. I was fine with the choices available - but my husband was not real thrilled. Just nothing he cared for. If they would add bagels of some kind that might help. We're used to bagels almost every morning. But they do have a good selection. Waffels are great - and they have different toppings for them - such as strawberrys and whipped topping. Everything about the hotel that we encountered was very clean. And maybe because of the time that we went - we never encountered any problems with the elevator. May have to wait a few minutes at times, but nothing major. Needless to say - we really liked this hotel and plan on going back our next vacation. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JennieOntario
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 8 nights from may 7-15th with my family of 5. This hotel has so much to offer for such a great price! Breakfast was great, even my skeptical husband who used to do continental breakfasts for a choice hotel thought that this breakfast was exceptional. They even have flavored coffee creams and both fruit toppings and whipped cream for the waffles. The pool area is really nice, they offer $1 draft beer from 4-7 at the poolside bar. The room was always clean, and my kids rushed into the bathroom to see what towel creature was left for us, and looked around for where their toys had been placed. It made our stay that much more special. There are lots of shops in oldtown, we did not find the sales people there very friendly, but it you walk up to 192, there is a flea market and several resteraunts. There is a Publix within walking distance for even my 4yo, we grabbed a cab back from there though because we had too much to carry with us. The shuttle was a good deal if you don't want to rent a car. Getting to downtown Disney is quite a trip, and the times are not always convienent, but overall we were happy to relax in the air conditioned bus and let someone else worry about getting us back to the hotel. The shuttle always plays a movie to keep the kids occupied which was really nice. Even though we went during a slow time, the shuttle got pretty full and some people had to stand, something to consider if you are going during peak season. One day we grabbed the Linx bus from disney transportation center, it went to oldtown quickly and was only 1.75 per adult, kids were free. I think it is more difficult going other places though. The only complaint that we had about the hotel was that there were no luggage racks availavle when we arrived, and the staff did not offter to help us with the luggage or try to locate one for us. Other than that, everything was great. I will recommend this hotel to others and will deffinitly go back if I decide to venture to Florida again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb throughout...can't fault it.”
Reviews.Author: lugg2004
Reviews.Content: Myslef and my wife stayed in Comfort Suites from 26/4 to 10/05. I cannot fault this hotel at all. The rooms are very clean, the maids do an excellent job every single morning, always leaving you a nice, clean place to come into. They change the beds every 3 days, which is more than ample for most people. We were in a King size suite, and the bed was massive....i'm 6"2, and I couldnt touch my wife when I woke in the middle of the night!!! (Bonus or not? You decide!). The location is excellent. You are 2 minutes walk from Old Town and all it has to offer, and a further 2 minutes will take you to Ponderosa, IHOP, Denny's, KFC, Burger King, Sizzlin Grill and Pacino's, so if you aint too struck on driving to eat, you don't have to. The 192 is close, as is Old Town, and you do hear some "white noise" from Old Town on a Friday/Saturday night, but when the air con is on in the room, it is very, very faint, and it certainly didnt keep me up , and I am a light sleeper. The complimentary breakfast i good every morning, with a meat choice, biscuits, gravy, egg choice, waffles, donuts etc etc. It isn't as good as you would get if you paid for it, but hey, you don't have to. It's very tasty, and you can eat as much as you like. It does get busy in the breakfast hall though, you are better to get there before 8am to ensure you have a table. There are only two elevators for 7 floors, and yes sometimes you have to wait a minute or two, but the stairs are accessible from the far end of the lobby. We used the elevators only when we had armfuls of stuff anyway. The staff on the front desk and in the bar and dining area are friendly and helpful, always trying their best to answer any queries you may have. The concierge desk is actually timeshare, and they only approached me once, and were easily got rid of. They aren't pushy unless you approach them. I left a couple of buxcks every morning for the cleaning lady, as they really do an excellent job, and I got the cleanest hotel room I have ever stayed in. The pool area is also cleaned first thing in the morning, as it can get a lot of towels that certain lazy individuals don't put bac lying around, but by 0730am it is clean as a whistle. The prices here are very good. Granted, you will not get the same standard of facilities you would in a 5 star hotel, but then again, you aren't paying for that here. What you get for your money is excellent, large, clean rooms, a delicious breakfast every morning and excellent customer service. I would reccommend this hotel to anyone, and if I return to Florida again in the near future, there is no question as to where we will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DSchmidtNekoosa_Wi
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews from tripadvisor and travelocity. We were not disappointed. The hotel is not a Hilton or 5 star hotel but we didn't expect one either. As far as the rooms being clean, ours was spotless. I noticed that after checkout the staff removed all mattresses, moved the bed and dressers, and vacuumed every square inch of the carpets. They even removed the air conditioner covers and cleaned the vents. How someone could say their rooms weren't clean is beyond me. Granted if you're going to stay for more than a day they don't necessarily change your sheets every day but I'm sure most people don't change theirs every day at home either. The pool was clean and very nice and the breakfast was better than most hotels that I've stayed at. There are plenty of restaurants within a mile of the hotel. The hotel is also very close to all the major attractions. The only down side is that the hotel is about 3 blocks off the main highway and the area , old town, an amusement area and park doesn't look very appealing. It's a great clean, low price hotel for families with children. They didn't get all their awards just because it was their turn. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “One night stand”
Reviews.Author: tapaustin
Reviews.Content: Overall - Good value Had a couple of issues, but they are a bit nit picky. First Check in was scheduled for 3pm, but the room wasn't ready until 3:30pm. Took 30 minutes out of the Disney experience. Not a big deal, but hey deliver what you say!! Second the tub drained slow. Use some drano or something on occassion. Pros - - Value, $69 per night for a King Suite was pretty good. - Bedding decent. Not the softest, but was a pillow top and good quality. - Good location, pretty close to Disney. - Front Desk employees were friendly and helpful. Drew us a map to Walmart. - Fridge, microwave, couch in the room. - Shower head was an adjustable head and the water pressure was strong. You could set it to message or high stream, etc. Loved it!! except I was standing in 6 inches of water by the time I was finished. Cons - - Elevators slow - Breakfast is overrated. The Mickey waffles are cool. Summary: Would stay here again. Good value, friendly staff, clean facilities, close to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: rttAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I checked in with my family on Wednesday April 9 (after Spring Break, not during). Upon arrival we were greeted by a run down looking lobby. It had old outdated furniture, a tiny gameroom that needed help, a front desk clerk who did not smile or greet us at check in (or even make eye contact once). I simply did not find anything cheerful in it as others had stated. It looked simply depressing. * We also had the fun of experiencing the bus loads and bus loads of teenagers. Granted, they have a right to be there as anyone else, but I find it irresposible of a hotel to book that many at one time. *The elevators were slow but I'm sure it had more to do with the amount of people using it rather than any maintenence issue. *The rooms are very below standard. I have stayed in many all suite hotels and I found this one to have the least amount of space in them compared to a regular suite. It is not much larger than a regular hotel room. *The carpet had not been vacuumed. *The walls had chipped paint. *The bathroom had hair and soap scum in it. *The furniture was chipped and scratched and old. *The window had hand prints on it. It stayed this way for the entire stay even though I asked it be cleaned. *The pool was green....really dirty. There was about 3 clean towels at the pool area. The rest of the towels were all dirty in a big heaping pile and thrown randomly on the pool area grounds. *Breakfast was very large with a big variety. We decided to eat elsewhere though as there was a huge line and no tables to be had. * I can't really comment on the friendliness of the staff as I really didn't see many around. They were nonexsistent. *The sheets barely fit the beds. At least not in the room I stayed in. They were both flat sheets. When you pulled the top sheet up to get in, the bottom sheets pulled out from being tucked in. It was very uncomfortable. *The area around the hotel was questionable. It would be a great spot for bikers and partiers and smokers. I did not feel safe in the Old Towne area. I'm surprised at the reviews this hotel receives. Talking with fellow guests during my stay, it seemed we all felt the hotel was unacceptable. The rates are cheap and unfortunately the hotel reflects that. If you are used to economy hotels then this one would probably be ok for you. If you have stayed in nicer, higher priced hotels before, then this is a step down and you will be disappointed. I believe a hotel should enhance a vacation. This one simply did not. It was worth a shot though but never again.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bonnies4winns
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel twice and love it. When you walk in, the lobby is large and brightly colored and very Florida looking. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. Our air conditioning wasn't working and when we called down to the front desk, they sent a maintence person right up to our room to replace it and it was on a Sunday night at 9:30. The pool is clean & open 24 hrs. so when you get back from the theme parks, you can relax in the pool or hot tub. The grounds are landscaped beautifully in front and in the back of the hotel. The location is great. It is about a 15 minute drive to the Disney parks and there are many restraunts in the area to choose from. It is off the highway a little so it is very quiet and there is an open area in the back with trees. The free breakfast was very good. Everything you could possibly want, plus a special item added each day. "Old Town" is a short walk away, maybe a block. This is an area with unique shops and restraunts and the best car show I've ever been to. There is also live music at night and some rides for the kids. You can't hear any of the noise from Old Town when you're at the hotel. As far as the people who complained about the teenagers in the hotel, my advice is not to go to Florida during spring break time. You will find teenagers to be a problem wherever you stay during spring break. Bonnie S. Essexville, MI

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Not too crazy about 192”
Reviews.Author: haalni123
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 7 night stay at the Comfort Suites Maingate East! Here was our experience! Pros 1. Nice size rooms! We had a queen suite! And for a familly of 5 it was perfect! VERY clean! 2. Nice warm pool! It got a bit chilly during our stay! (record lows) and the kids were still able to swim! 3. BREAKFAST! The free breakfast was wonderful! A true money saver!! The kids loved the Mickey waffles! And the staff was always so pleasant. The variety changed daily, boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, with stir ins, sausage, bisquits and gravy, assorted teas, coffee, hot chocolate, juice, english muffins, muffins, mini donuts etc.........! Very yummy!! 4. The poolside bar made very good drinks!! We had frozen Pina Coladas! 5. The maids were very good! Our room was always cleaned, and the kids Disney stuffed animals were always set on the bed when we got home from the parks, and they got a kick out of it! Cons 1. There were several teens staying at the hotel during our stay. One night they were playing FOOTBALL in the hall. Since we were SO tired, it didnt matter so much, we just put the bathroom fan on and it helped. It only happened one night, and if it had happened another night, we would have complained. 2. Elevators SLOOOOOW, so slow! And the stairs lead outside, so that wasnt an option. 3. 192, too commercial and a bit seedy. But the hotel was set so far off the road it really didnt bother us! Overall, a great stay, we would definately stay here again!! Hopefully next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever!!”
Reviews.Author: sparklyred
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nightmare from beginning to end. We were due to arrive on April 8. I booked through hotels.com. I called to confirm the night before and was told that my reservation had been cancelled since the April 2nd!!!!!! There was nothing they could do. I would have to deal with it through hotels.com. I told them I needed a room and she said sorry were booked. At this point I am freaking out. I called hotels.com and they said they had not cancelled the reservation and they put me on hold and called the hotel. The girl who answered told hotels.com they had received a fax cancelling the reservation. Hotels.com said they had sent no such fax. The girl then looked for the fax but could not find it because it did not exsist. Hotels.com informed them they had to reinstate my reservation. So when I called back the girl stated I had 2 reservations and when I cancelled the first one, it cancelled out both of them. But I worked at a hotel for 10 years and know that a computer does not cancel reservations, the hotel had to do it themselves, for whatever reason. So, we get there and I am checked in as the person at the front desk is watching the people in the gift shop to make sure they are not stealing. Um, shouldn't they have someone for that? So, we get to the room and it is serious need of update. Really ugly. So, we go to get something to eat and there are bikers and shady looking people in the old town area. And lots of bars. It didn't seem family friendly. Then the next day after a long day at the parks we come back to take a swim and there are literally 100 hundred kids in the lobby going up the elevator. It took forever. Then we go to the pool and it is all green, but of course my kids want to swim. So of course the hundred kids come down to swim also. Not good. We couldn't use the hot tub because it was packed with rowdy teenagers. Needless to say the next day at breakfast was insane and packed and loud and not that great. We found out these busses were leaving that day so we decided to try one more night. So we went to the parks and come back and there are 4 more busses pulling in!!!!!!! So, the whole night and breakfast was a repeat of the first, but with even more teenagers. I had completely had it and called hotels.com and said I hated the hotel and I wanted to check out. So they called the hotel and the hotel said as long as we check out by 11am they wouldn't penalize us. And hotels.com would refund us for the rest of the stay. So we checked out by 10am. But of course I looked at the bill later and Comfort had charged me for the room which was already paid for through hotels.com I was not shocked....horrible experience from beginning to end. I haven't even called yet to let them know they screwed up my bill, I STILL have to calm down and it's been 5 days. I would never stay again. Oh, and it was the smallest suite I've ever seen. My advice....if you're going to Disney, spring for a Disney resort. Oh yeah, and they charge a resort fee!!!! This was by far no resort. Oh and the housekeeping wasn't anything special. I heard that the houekeepers do cute things with stuffed animals so we left some out. Nothing!!! They were still sitting in the same spot when we returned. I can't even express how much I hated it!!I can not even tell you how miserable this stay was. I really put a huge damper on the first two days of my vacation. Ugly, outdated, unkempt, understaffed, UGH!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Good - shame about the 200 or so teenagers arriving daily”
Reviews.Author: Jennyspacagna
Reviews.Content: Arrived on 29th March 2008 for a 2 week stay. As a previous reviewer mentioned the lifts are extremely slow and one broke down for 2 days so it was a nightmare! Their are no internal stairs and the ones near us take you out into the car park so it is not really an option to just take the stairs. Our room was absolutely fine. We had the 2 queen beds requested and the put up sofa for our teenager. We were on the 7th (top) floor and away from the lifts so it was fairly quite. The cleaners are wonderful and did a great job every day. The main problem with this hotel are the groups of teenagers allowed to stay there at any given time. One day there were six coaches in the carpark which was ridiculous. In the evenings they overtook the pool so if you wanted to go with your family for a swim it would not have been easy. Even in our room we could hear them nearly every evening. One day we complained that the pool was dirty and immediately the hotel sent someone to take samples. After a while it was discovered that the teenagers had stuffed loads of straws in the vents so the pump was not working. They did sort it out quickly but maybe if the teenagers were supervised this would not have occured. Breakfast fine apart from being overrun with teenagers. Overall I would not stay here again without assurances that there would not be groups of kids staying here and as that is unlikely I would simply not risk it.

Reviews.Title: “I WILL NEVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: dannyjohnson
Reviews.Content: We Arrived On Sunday March 30TH For What We Thought Was Going To Be A Great Vacation And It Was Our Kids First Ever Vacation Went Inside Checked In Got The Keys To The Room Went Back To The Car Got All Our Luggage Then Went To The Room We Booked A Studio Suite With 2 Queen Beds Got To The Room There Was One King Bed So I Told My Wife I Was Going Back Down To Let Them Know This Is Not What We Booked Well The Girl At The FrontT Desk Said Oh Well You Booked With Expedia So It Was Just A Request Doesnt Mean You Get It So We Grabbed All The Luggage And Went Back To The Car Because Me And My Wife And 2 Kids Wasnt Sleeping In One Bed So I Called Expedia Was On The Phone With Them For The 3 Hours We Were Just Sitting In The Car Then We Said Screw IT Went Riding Around Untill We Found Something Out So I Called Back To The Hotel And Told The Girl At The Front Desk I Wasnt Taking That Room And She Said Well I Can Give You A Bigger Room Which Had A Living Room And A Seperate Bedroom But Still Only One Bed Also The A/C In The Bedroom Had To Be Changed Out 3 Times And Then Still Didnt Work HalfF Of The Time Had ToTake The Stairs Every morning Because They Only Had 2 Elevators which were very slow And Plus One Broke Down Also Ladybugs In The Room Woke Up One Night With One Crawling On My Arm Toliet Kept Running The Whole Time so thats how our vacation went.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient to the Disney Parks”
Reviews.Author: tamaralea
Reviews.Content: The hotel may not be in the best part of town (next to some type of Carnival and most of the nearby restaurants were quite dated), but it was very easy to get in and out of the Disney parks. The hotel was nice and new and the rooms were certainly large. We appreciated being able to check in early, at around 1 pm. Elevators were terrible in the morning, when everyone is going to breakfast or checking out. We ended up taking the stairs down from the 5th floor. The only problem was that it lets you out outside and you have to walk around the building to get back in. Noise was never a problem. Breakfast was excellent. Rates were very reasonable, especially with our AAA discount.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: QueensMarine
Reviews.Content: Stayed hear for 6 nights during easter week. This is the second time I have stayed hear. For the money this is a great hotel. The staff is very friendly, knowledgable and always accomadating. The pool area is very nice and has a bar that opens after 3pm. Their is also a kiddie pool and a hottub. The pool is open till 11pm. The room is larger than average and very clean. A small area includes a sink, microwave, mini fridge and multiple cabinets. The breakfast area is very large and nice/clean. The hotel was full but we always managed to get a seat. The breakfast includes 3 kinds of cereal(fruit loops, frosted flakes, Raisin Bran) different kinds of instant oatmeal, doghnuts, muffins, cinnamon rolls, toast(white & whole Wheat), english muffins(plain and Cinnamon raisin), bananas, oranges apples, juices, a varitey of yogurt, biscuits,regular and chocalate chip waffles that are prepared for you. On a daily basis the following items were served but changed regularly, French toast, scrambled eggs, egg mcmuffins, sausage patties, bacon, prepared oatmeal and boiled eggs. The area is right next to old town and a great minigolf place. Theiir are many restaurants in the area to include simple fast food to a little more upscale places. The hotel is situated that it is knid of secluded and from the traffilc and noise of route 192 and old town even though it is right next to it. Some people have complained about time share people but in the two time I have stayed hear I have never been approached, These people seem to have booths in the hotels lobby where they advertise ticket sales for the major theme parks. If you approach them for tcikets they will attempt to get you to look at a video while having a breafast offsite. I know this because my brother in law did it. These people are not aggresive and they will not bother you during your stay uinless you initiate the interest/contact. This hotel also includes a fitness room with a very versatile weight unit, 2 treadmills, one eliptical and a stationary bike. All worked and were in good condition. I used them and was able to see my kids in the pool from this area. My only complaint is that the bar was out of many items to make mixed drinks for much of my stay. Otherwise the hotel gives you two tickets which are buy one drink get one free at the bar. The drinks are also reasonable. A bottle of beer is $3.50, draft is 2.00, mixed drinks are 3.50 (Virgin) 5.50 Regular. Not bad when you are getting two for free.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews were accurate”
Reviews.Author: williamkopti
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was as good as the reviews mentioned previously. The rooms are big with a sofa and coffee table, small two seat table next to the refridgerator and microwave. The fridges small freezer compartment froze three to four drinks daily for our trips to disney and there was plenty of room for alot of drinks to keep cool. The front desk was extremely helpful and also kept a list of local eateries on a sheet with driving directions. Two Walmarts are within 3-5 miles east of the hotel and also offer tons of Disney stuff at a good price. We bought most of our stuff there and they were similarly priced to the Character Outlets at both locations (Buena Vista and Premium Outlets). The Breakfast hot items changed daily (sausage links or chopped bacon or chopped ham, scrambled eggs or hard boiled eggs). Biscuits and gravy looked to be a hot item that never changed. There are two types of waffles (normal or chocolate chipped) shaped as mickey mouse and they make the waffles for the guest so there is not slow down like the usual choice locations. Plenty of breads, cereals, etc like other reviews. Seating is tough after 7:45am to 9:45 am, so go early around opening and it's easy. The pool is heated, and the majority of the pool is in the 4 ft range so young kids have alot of play area that they can stand in. The jacuzzi is large and the pool bar is always opened it seemed. It doesn't get too crowded at the pools like some places so do not worry. Plenty of seats and chairs. They do have some timeshare folks in permanent booths at the front which I never visited even after recieving some welcome package there. I also timed my trips to Disney and Downtown Disney and none were more than 16 minutes with no traffic to speak of. Only thing to be aware of is the room doors are loud when they close on there own and you can hear your neighbors doors shut and outside hallway noise. Our first night it was a concerned since we stayed on the first floor. A friend of ours stayed on the second and had not noise to speak of but for us we kept our bathroom vent on and the bathroom door cracked for some white noise to drown any outside noise and it solved it. So if you have family that are light sleepers like I do that might be a trick or get a room on the second floor like our friends did. We liked our location and enjoyed the pool, breakfast, and clean room.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic room, pool,location”
Reviews.Author: DerbyshireBanjo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week here. Loved the heated pool, the maids always kept rooms clean and tidy. The breakfast was good, plenty of fresh fruit, toast, cereals, eggs,yoghurts. The staff didnt mind if you took extra fruit, muffins etc up to room for snacking later in the day and tea/coffee is available 24hrs a day. We liked the Old Town, we felt safe and found everyone really friendly. About 5 min walk from hotel is every type of restaurant you could want and all really good value and service. We didnt hear any shouting or see groups of teenagers in fact we were pleasantly surprised at how well behaved and polite everyone was. Would definatly stay here again and would recommend it. We hired a car and found the road signs a little confusing. Definatly look for Mile Marker 9 as that is where the hotel is and it is off the main road so you cant see it from the road. We went to Sea World and Busch Gardens and both parks were almost empty so we got to see all shows and go on all rides without even queing - we were told Mondays are best days to do parks as they are quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but be wary of noise.”
Reviews.Author: JAMJARUk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 week stay and had the same problem as our previous stay in 2006. For 5 days we were disturbed by groups of teenage coach parties staying at the hotel. There was shouting, screaming and door slamming until late and it started again from 6am. We asked to move rooms, however we were advised that coach parties were on all 7 floors! We thought we were just unlucky with the noise during our previous trip in 2006, but being disturbed twice is not a coincidence. Although the hotel was good and in a great location, we will not be returning. Anyone thinking of staying should be warned that teenagers running wild could seriously affect your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Families”
Reviews.Author: jbx2usa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during our Disney Christmas trip in 2007. This place is very nice for the price. The rooms are huge, complete with free internet and refrigerator. Six people can sleep comfortably here but that's only when 3 or 4 adults are here. The pool is open 24 hours and heated, so you can swim whenever you like. Every room is quiet, so no need to worry what side you're one. We overlooked the parking lot and didn't hear anything. The service was great, even though I read plenty of reviews stating otherwise. Nobody cared what we brought in and the staff was very courteous. The free breakfast is a nice touch, but you will get sick of eating almost the same thing everyday. Of course, the kids won't get sick of it at all so remember it's free and it's good food. I cannot say enough good things about this place, really. I priced over a dozen hotels and this one just came up tops. When I got there, we sacrificed nothing for the price. In fact, we got a lot of amenities that pricier places didn't offer for free. One thing to note: this hotel is on the opposite side of the Disney exit than the others. What this means is that you have NO TRAFFIC getting in or out of the park at any time. Trust me, you want to pay attention to this tidbit if you're driving in. Plus, the hotel is literally 5 minutes from the park. It's the best deal for the price, trust me! It's right next door to Old Town, which is kind of a dumpy-looking carnival place, but it's fun to go visit once... plus Fireworks are offered every Saturday, you can see it from the hotel. I learned the week we went that the Disney-owned resort I was considering staying at had the pool closed the entire time! Of course, the Comfort Inn Suites here had the pool open and heated the entire time. And, while there are a lot of families here, the place isn't overrun by kids either.... and we went at the busiest time of the year...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room, great breakfast and location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBBoomers
Reviews.Content: We just completed a 4 night stay here last week. Huge room with a separate sitting area, microwave and refrigerator (came in handy to bring some food to Disney) and king-size bed. One of the nicest free breakfasts we've seen in our travels with eggs, waffles, fruit, cereal, etc.. in a huge dining area. We never had trouble finding a table, even during peak hours (all weekday mornings). We didn't use the free Disney shuttle, preferring the flexibility of driving ourselves (10 minutes). Rates were far less than the Disney resorts and most of the other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Big room for the price”
Reviews.Author: Bran_Fan
Reviews.Content: Previously, we stayed at a Disney-owned hotel. We liked this better because it was twice the room at half the price, plus it was much, much quieter. Add in the free breakfast (Mickey waffles) and we were beyond happy. For adults, there is healthy breakfast food like yogurt, cereal and oatmeal. I enjoyed the variety and quality of the breakfast. I noticed rooms right next to the elevator and I was glad I didn't stay there. Request a room at the end of the hall. Our maid folded the towels into animal and flower shapes for us, which was a wonderful touch that pleased the kids. The room was always very clean, and we liked the long countertop in the bathroom. The beds are comfortable and they include plenty of pillows and plenty of towels. The pool is heated like bathwater--lovely in February. It was 80 degrees one day so the kids went swimming. They have a shuttle bus, but it only goes to Magic Kingdom TTC, and then you have to transfer to Disney bus for another park so it was not practical. We used taxis instead which was about $22 each way. If you have a car it's super easy! Just drive there, it only will take about ten minutes. I read so many postive reviews of this hotel and I wondered if it could really be that good. Guess what? It is!

Reviews.Title: “Great room for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Travel-Megg
Reviews.Content: Our family chose the Comort Suites Main Gate East for our trip to Disney in January 2008 and we couldn't have been more pleased. The hotel is well kept, everything is clean and bright. The employees are helpful and pleasant. The rooms are amazingly spacious, espically when compared to Disney property rooms. The free breakfast was great- who doesn't like Mickey waffles! Even though we visited during the slow season, and the breakfast area was large, it got very crowded late morning. Make it a priority to get there early. The hotel is located near many restaurants and attractions. Overall this is a beautiful Hotel at a great price. This is a wonderful place to crash after running yourself ragged at the theme parks! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Location brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Caroline250
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of days in 2006. Due to a late flight we arrived at the hotel around 8pm, and the staff were friendly and the rooms very large. We had a rear facing room overlooking the pool, and it was nice and quiet. The lady behind the bar at the pool was very friendly, and the food was fine. The location is great for mini golf, Kissimmee Old Town & the Disney Parks are a 5 minute drive away. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “XCLNT Hotel - xcpt Room 518 Noisy”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinGardenGal
Reviews.Content: Traveled with our 17 year old son for a short 4 day stay in Kissimmee. I guess we don't travel enough - and learned that staying in a room across from the elevator is a Bad idea. Very noisy as people wait to get on the elevator. The staff was very helpful. Concierge very helpful. The free breakfast was perfect for quick mornings. Very clean everywhere - rooms, restaurant, pool area. We would definitely stay again, only not across from the elevator :-)

Reviews.Title: “Prefer it to on site Disney Resorts”
Reviews.Author: goldmatinee
Reviews.Content: On our 25th trip to Walt Disney World, my son, daughter-in-law and I booked a concierge room at the Polynesian Resort, and, as an afterthought, I booked a room at Comfort Suites Maingate East as a means of affording some privacy for all for a part of the stay. I chose this hotel on the basis on the TripAdvisor reviews and to say that I was not disappointed is an understatement. While staying on site at WDW has its advantages, in terms on greater space, lighting, quietness, and housekeeping, I would prefer this hotel to most of the deluxe resorts on site, all of which I have used at some time or other. In fact I chose to use this room for the entire stay. As a registered guest at the Polynesian, I was able to compare their concierge level breakfast to the free one at Comfort Suites, and I preferred the one here. The drive to the parks is short and easy, even with all the construction in the vicinity of I-4. For some $300 per night difference, I would prefer to stay more days and give up the perks of staying on site. This may not have been true a dozen trips ago, but certainly is now. I have stayed at many resorts around any on Disney property, and this is my #1 pick.

Reviews.Title: “Will Return”
Reviews.Author: brutus3371
Reviews.Content: Great place for a family to stay! My wife and I brought our 2 year old son to Disney for his first visit and stayed at the Comfort Suites. This trip was only a short 1 night stay (only a two hour drive from Sarasota where we live). We liked the location, walking distance to Pirate's Cove mini golf, Fun Spot and Old Town. The room was very clean and spacious. The front desk staff did a nice job welcoming us and getting us checked in and out quickly. We enjoyed the free breakfast before our day at The Magic Kingdom and for the price ($73 including tax) you can't beat the deal. It's nice to know of a clean, inexpensive hotel that is close to entertainment, restaurants and the Disney parks. We will return for our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: lizNewHampshire
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very clean, suites very roomy,free cont. breakfast is above average. Family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time at the Comfort Suites Maingate east”
Reviews.Author: feejez
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for two weeks in Nov 2006 with a friend. It was the week before thanksgiving and as the hotel got busier the service remained very good. The staff were both helpful and friendly at all times. The 'free' breakfast was wonderful and I don't know what people complain about. If they are wanting a more extensive breakfast or someone to cook the toast for them were some 'complaints' that I heard then they need to stay somewhere that you pay for breakfast. The range of food at breakfast we thought was brilliant and there was always more than enough food. The pool was lovely and warm and the hot tub great at the end of a day at the parks or out shopping. The rooms were always cleaned well and me and my friend are hoping to be back when we can. For anyone thinking about this hotel for a family or friends it is quiet and out of the way. You can even ditch the car and walk to downtown kissimmee for a meal and a drink. If not then there is a great steakhouse on the other side of the main road called Logans steakhouse. When we were there they started doing a great meatloaf which was liked by all.

Reviews.Title: “1st visit, won't be our last!”
Reviews.Author: th_8527
Reviews.Content: I had sleepless nights trying to find the right hotel. But it seemed the moment I found one, I found complaints about the neighborhood, cleanliness of the room, or harassment by timeshare sellers. I originally booked another hotel and canceled it. That was the best decision I could have made. We did see the hotel we cancelled. Even though it was closer to Disney, we realized it was closer to "Downtown Disney", which is Disney, but not particularly the place we needed to be close too. Comfort Suites was a gamble, but I was convinced it was the right place. You had a choice of any restaurant you have ever heard of within a one mile stretch. The hotel offered many coupons where the kids eat free. The hotel was 15 minutes to Magic Kingdom. The breakfast was phenomenal. Biscuits with Gravy, ham, mickey made to order waffles, scrambled eggs, english muffins, sausage links. It saved us tons of money. We ate a huge breakfast. Took snacks with us to the park and ate dinner at a restaurant. $40 a day, not bad for eating out of town. I never experienced the so called fighting for food or rude kids, while getting breakfast. But we had a strict schedule - 7:00 am go down for breakfast. 7:25 am back in our rooms for packing our fanny packs. 8:15am leave for Disney. 8:30 arrive at Disney. When most were coming down, we were leaving. THe hotel was clean, the rooms were big, more than enough room for two adults and two kids. The staff was great. This is the place we will always stay when we go back to Orlando. I was concerned about the amusement park out front. You could not here the amusement park and out front means way out front. It had no effect on our quality of stay. The pool area was nice. It was just too cold to swim, plus we came to see Disney World not to swim :)

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: joeeoj
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not bad given the price - I paid $80;$69;$80 for a 3 night stay, not too sure why the change but it is a good value. I didn't find the breakfast as good as people write, but the pool was heated and bigger than it looked in the photos. BEWARE the hotel is set back a fair bit behind the "Old Town" amusement park and although that in itself isn't a problem it means it can't be seen from US192. Watch for mile marker 9. A bigger sign would help - there are hundreds of signs on 192.

Reviews.Title: “Used hotel for business meetings”
Reviews.Author: Berkshire_UK
Reviews.Content: Needed to meet with some colleagues and decided that the location was suitable for everyone, as a member of the party had stayed at the hotel before. I booked a small suite, rather than a standard room, but on check-in got upgraded to the largest suite, which was a full lounge area, kitchen, 2 bathrooms,and 2 TVs, with a separate bedroom. This was ideal, as we held our 2 day meeting in my room, which saved a fortune on hiring a meeting room. Location is great, for all the attractions (Disney etc) and plenty of places to eat (Red Lobster, Branigans etc within walking distance). Breakfast was ok, I expected a bit more variety when I read the reviews, but there was always plenty of food. Complementary tea and coffee at all times. The bar area is outside, so at 9pm on a January evening it gets a bit cold, and its not that inviting to sit on pool chairs.
