I tried to book again for March 2008, but the hotel was already full, but I would definately go to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Option for Budget-Minded Disney Travelers”
Reviews.Author: R_Ko_A2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights while visiting Disney. The room rate was exceptional! If you are traveling with anyone over 60, call the hotel's 1-800 number and ask for the "Over 60 Traveler Discount". This discount is not offered online. The rooms were spacious and clean. The cleaning staff was friendly and helpful. The pool was warm. The continental breakfast included hot items on a daily basis, such as fresh waffles, diced ham, eggs, biscuits/gravey, and sausage. It was an outstanding breakfast by comparison to other continental breakfasts I've had. There is a free shuttle offered by the hotel to the Disney parks and to local outlet malls, but the shuttle times are very limited! Also, there is not a formal business center at the hotel. If you want to use the internet there is a $1 / 4 minute charge on a rickety computer. Printing costs extra.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong at the Comfort Suites”
Reviews.Author: LongIslandGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Comfort Suites last year during our daughter's spring break Disney trip. Note: I generally review as a function of overall experience, which to me, includes price. This was the 2nd time we stayed at the hotel, the first time was actually in the spring of 2002 before we had kids. We pay the extra $ for the convenience of what I considered a pretty generous continental breakfast. This is not the Ritz Carlton, but it is a still a fantastic hotel that gets all the basics right. 1) Clean pool - though not big 2) Clean hotel, Clean rooms - very spacious 3) Convenient 4) Inexpensive (I payed less than 109/night). 5) Friendly staff 6) Generous continental breakfast Overall, I highly recommend this hotel if you're looking to save a few bucks in Orlando for the amusement parks but not stay at an old dingy place.

Reviews.Title: “Additional information people should be aware of.”
Reviews.Author: true_experience
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Christmas 2007 for 4 nights. We stayed at this hotel summer of 2005 as well. The pros: - Great Location - very close to Disney World - Clean room The cons: - Limited free breakfast hours - 7:00 am to 10:00 am. And seating is limited. If you happened to sleep in and go after 8:30am, it would be a mad house. Long line and people were fighting for seats. I saw it happened. - Slow elevators. There are only 2 slow elevators. Expect delay in transit between lobby and guest rooms during morning hours. - There was a puddle of water next to toilet in the bathroom in our suite. It was never fixed even though we complained about it. Hope this help to set expectation! True_experience

Reviews.Title: “Yet another great review about this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: chubbytraveler
Reviews.Content: It seems almost cliché to write another great review of this hotel. Some folks seem to have found fault with this place, but I think they're just looking too hard. Unless this hotel goes downhill in the future, my family will stay here every time we visit Kissimmee. We loved our week at this hotel. Large rooms with even larger bathrooms. VERY comfy beds. Great housekeeping. An excellent heated pool and hot tub. Nice amenities. I could go on, but with the exception of the slow elevators, there's simply very little to dislike here. Some may see it's location next to Old Town as a negative, but my teenagers loved this. It was a good way to fill-out our slower Disney days. The Fun Spot next door was also enjoyable; great go-karts! This hotel is clean, friendly, has a great location and leaves you wanting for nothing. Try it for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near everything!”
Reviews.Author: mima4nyc
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. The rooms are extra big with big beds that are very comfy. We innitially booked 4 nights here and 2 in Tampa but decided to cancel tampa and stay here for all 6 nights - we just drove to Tampa and back. The breakfast is as in other hotels with the continental breakfast. The pool area is great and never crowded. Since we are still in this hotel I am planning to go tonight for a swim. The housekeeping is great - every day they clean the rooms. The elevators are not crowded at all as one of the reviewers said - they are on a slower side though but its not like you are waiting more then minute or two. This hotel is also close to Disney and Orlando and anything you would like to see. The area itself is great with a lot of restaurants and its adjusent to Old Town. The outlets are also close to this hotel. Al in all excellent hotel for the budget travelers. Will definitelly stay here again whenever in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Fair review”
Reviews.Author: Cindyfttc3
Reviews.Content: I do not agree with the glowing reviews for this hotel, nor do I agree with the ones condemning it. No, I would not stay here again nor would I recommend it to a friend, HOWEVER, it depends on what you are looking for. I will explain below. Since October 2001, my family has visited Disney world 28 times (found this out from Disney records while trying to book a hotel), Universal Orlando 7 times, and Sea world 4 times. In all fairness, this was one of the worst hotel experiences we've had. Since we do a good bit of traveling to quite a few places and have stayed in $49.99 a night hotels as well as $300.00 a night hotels, that's a pretty strong statement. CONS 1) Customer service is pretty much non-existent and the night staff is openly rude (3 different night desk clerks and 1 night security guard) 2) First room air/heater broke within 30 minutes of arrival. Received second room, sofa bed was broken and would not pull out. Security guard was sent to assist but stated repeatedly he "did not want to break a nail"-no, I am not joking, that is a real quote and was said at least 5 or 6 times. We were told we would have to move to another room. When we asked if the sofa bed could just be swapped out or if we could use a roll away bed to keep from packing everything up again we were told "No, you will have to move if you want the sofa bed. Third room, hair dryer and internet cable did not work. 3) Wireless internet is available only if you sit in the lobby which would be ok if the internet cable worked in the room, which it did not (in any of the rooms we had). 4) If you have ever been to Magic Kingdom on a Saturday--that is exactly what the breakfast bar is like, a stampede with all the associated pushing, walking in front of people, parents not watching their children as they stick their hands in the food and hit people as they go by. 5) At any given time, only one of the elevators is working which makes for VERY long wait times. If you stay here, stay on one of the lower floors so you can use the stairs, it is much quicker. 6) Pool bar offers 2 for 1 drinks so it gets a little rowdy at night and the elevators smell of beer. PROS 1) Great location. 2) The appearance is lovely inside and out. 3) The rooms (2 queen bed with pull out sofa) were fairly big with a good layout. 4) The breakfast bar had a great variety including Mickey Mouse shaped pancakes (I have to admit this was selling point when we booked the room and the girls loved it), sausage links, ham, assorted muffins, doughnuts, fruit, cereals, breads, yogurts, and applesauce. 5) Nice little arcade for the kids. OVERALL You can get much more bang for your buck and much better treatment elsewhere. My 11 year old always nicknames the hotels we stay at like "The Color Hotel", "The Lobster Hotel", "Our Favorite Hotel", "The Train Hotel", etc. she has dubbed this hotel "The Mean Hotel". That pretty much says it all. If you are reading this, I hope you have a wonderful trip and find just the right hotel for you and your family.

Reviews.Title: “Good bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: Nickibrowneyes
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find. My boyfriend and I went to Trip Advisor and read the reviews for many hotels. Most were positive for this hotel. Because of that, and its close proximity to Disney (less than ten minutes), we went ahead and booked it. The hotel itself was great. We were on the 5th floor, facing the parking lot, and away from the pool noise. Our room was cared for every day, with new towels, soaps and TP. The hot breakfast evey morning was fantastic. If I could 'nit pick,' I would just say that I would have liked bacon with my eggs, and also cheese as a mix in for my eggs. But the biscuits and gravy were excellent. Throw in fresh hot coffee and waffles, and our bellies were good to go while we were at Disney. The hotel was just a bit off of the main drag, set behind, "Old Town," a small district of restaurants, shops, and carnival style rides. It kind of reminded me of Gatlinburg, TN.There were putt-putt courses (one inside-black lit, one outside), two different go-cart courses, a Bungee catapult, as well as many other carnival rides. My boyfriend and I felt like two teen-agers at a carnival. All of this was within walking distance from the hotel. It was a nice little spot to unwind the first night of our trip, before going to the parks the next day. There were several sports teams at the hotel at the same time, so there were plenty of kids around. We didn't hang out in the common areas too much, though. The halls were relatively quiet. I would say that the front desk was a little under-staffed for the size of the hotel. They will help you with anything, but be prepared for a wait. Also, I would caution anyone about the "consierge." They were friendly enough, but they are a separate entity, who will ask you to visit a time share property in exchange for their services. They did help us with directions on the last day, however. If you haven't booked your activities, you may want to look in on them, to see what they're offering. Otherwise, I'd ask the front desk, or make some phone calls. If you are looking to take a shuttle to Disney, it is a little inconvenient. They pick up at 7:30am and 10:30 am. One was a little early for us, and one was too late. We ended up taking the rental car to the parks. It cost us $11 each day, but one parking pass is good for the all of the parks. All in all, I would say that this is an excellent hotel. It was good value for our money. They certainly treated us right.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent clean comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: unitedstates
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a 10 day stay at this hotel and I couldn't have picked a better place to celebrate my 40th Birthday. Everything about this hotel is excellent. The rooms are immaculately clean with very good housekeeping. The beds are large and very comfortable and clean. The breakfasts were fantastic with a slightly different menu each day which included French toast, sausages, scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, biscuits & gravy, donoughts, toast, bagels, fresh fruit, yoghurts, cereals, etc. There is also fresh coffee available 24 hours. The staff are very friendly and helpful. I reported a faulty hairdryer and 10 minutes later the maintenance man had fitted us with a brand new hairdryer. The pool is lovely and heated and there is a fantastic jacuzzi and poolside bar. I loved my stay here and would definitely go back again! What a fantastic hotel!

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chrissybobo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the right side of old town and has its own street. It has a very warm heated pool which was awesome for the cooler nights. The breakfast is a good start to your morning before you go to the parks. The hotel is in the middle of everything close to parks and food. Rooms are very spacious and clean and I would recommend this hotel to everyone. We are definetly going to book this place again! The hot tub is great to and the hotel is very friendly. The beds are very comfortable. The elevators are not that bad we were on the top floor and never had a problem. A little patience goes a long way!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Farmer_Terry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four days and were very pleased. The room was large and very clean, as was the bathroom, the two queen beds were large and comfortable, the air-con worked well, and was reasonably quiet, and the staff were pleasant and helpful. On the down side, we had booked a studio suite and were expecting a kitchen. In fact what we got was a sink, a fridge, a coffee maker, and a microwave. No plates, cutlery (silverware), glasses etc, so we had to nip down the road to Wal-Mart to get the bare essentials. This could have been a misunderstanding with Expedia or another example of Brits and Yanks using the same words to mean different things. Not a big deal – but don’t expect a kitchen! The free breakfast was better than we expected, but didn’t change and could get repetitive. Great for a few days though. There are plenty of good restaurants within a short drive, the main I4 is just down the road with fast access to downtown Orlando, and the Disney parks aren’t far away either. I would certainly recommend this hotel as good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely pleased”
Reviews.Author: lakelover724
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from an 8 night stay at Comfort Suites Maingate East. We were extremely pleased with our stay. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. Our room was cleaned daily with fresh towels, our king size bed was very comfortalbe and the free breakfast included exceeded our expectations. Great location with many nearby restaurants. Just one warning: Beware of the time share tour for the free tickets. The free tickets were great, but there is some pressure when you go to view the time shares. It also takes about 2 hours, not the 90 minutes told to us by the concierge at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Very Best”
Reviews.Author: ljsflorida
Reviews.Content: I just returned and all I can say is this is the best Comfort Suites I have ever stayed in, This place is super clean, the rooms are big and comfortable, the breakfast is great, you get eggs, ham, biscuts & gravy, waffles, and all the other stuff that a regular continental breakfast gives you. it is right next to old Town. I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarieIKR
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. Stayed here Oct 11- Oct 19 and was very pleased. The bed is the best part. Really comfortable...we had a king size. Wonderful thick comforter and we had six pillows on the bed and two in the closet. We used all 8 the entire time. It was wonderful. Fitted sheets too, which was awesome. Room was cleaned beautifully and quickly everyday. One morning we left for breakfast and had to stop back in the room real quick and it was already cleaned. Our room faced Old Town which was randomly noisy on Sunday night. That was the only night so I have no idea what that was about. The elevators are slow but were only a real problem about two times. Then we used the stairs, which are all the way down the hall and not noticable. If I had a second or third floor room I wouldnt have even used the elevators once I found the stairs. I didnt use the breakfast, pool or shuttle service. I am on vacation!! Rented a car (2008 PT Cruiser) for $150 and ate at the Cracker Barrel down the street almost every morning. Well worth the money but I dont have kids! Super quick check in/ check out. We walked to Old town to check it out. It was ok....something to kill some time. Also has mini golf within walking distance. Very close to all the Disney/ Universal parks. And...lastly...the Air conditioning was amazing. I thought we were going to break it with how high we had it blasting...but there is nothing like coming back to the room after a long hot day at Disney to a nice frosty room. Excellent stay. Highly Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: glen76
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October and can safely say out of all the hotels ive stayed in, in Orlando this would be pretty near the top! (The Hard Rock Hotel being top) It was clean, staff friendly, food nice and a great location! I stayed with wife and 2 young kids and it was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bear050
Reviews.Content: Date: October 10, 2007 From: Miami, Florida My family and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The room was comfortable and close to Disney World. The hotel has a continental breakfast which is more than adequate. They provide plenty of food choices and it is enough to get you through the morning. The hotel staff was very nice and accomodating. We didn't have any problems with the elevators being too slow. We didn't visit the conceirge desk, so we had no problems with them trying to sell us time shares. I did not personally use the pool, but my husband had his morning swim there and he was pleased with it. All in all it was a great stay for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: TorontoAnimator
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Disney World trip in Oct.2007. I booked 1 bed room with 2 bathrooms. when check in they gave us a package with all good brand name products: toothbrush, chocolate....... the living room and bed room was huge. super clean and quiet. the bed was firm and very comfort. Breakfast was great. food was hot...we like Mickey shape's waffle. It's fun. I rent a car so I don't know the shuttle service. very close to the attraction. good place to stay! No complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: greensox
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is one of the best i ever stay . There is only a few little things that could get this Hotel even better. Everything is very clean, the rooms, the lobby , the pool . The breakfast every Morning is great , and save you a lot of money . The maid service is perfect. Everybody is very frendly and helpful. like some others said the elevators are a little slow, but we have a room on the first floor , an normaly use the stairs. The bad thing is the shuttle service to Disney . we use it a few times but this great Hotel is not worth such a terrible Shuttle. First pick up Time is 7.35 am. Thats to early , the next Bus comes at 10.25 am. thats to late . The return times start at 6.45 pm to 10.30 which is O.K. One time we use the later Bus at 1.55 pm because we want to stay for the fireworks . The Bus picks us up a take a tour to 7 other Hotels picking up people. It takes us more than an hour to the TTC. on the way back he takes the same tour so, we see the 7 other Hotels again . Thats bad. So we use our car to drive to another Hotel and use their shuttle service to save the 11$ rip off Disney Parking Fee .

Reviews.Title: “The best in Kissimee!!”
Reviews.Author: mabe88
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks at this hotel in September 2007 and think the Comfort Suites are excellent. We have been to Florida on 4 occasions, staying in hotels, motels and an executive villa and this accommodation was by far the best experience we have ever had. The rooms are very spacious, comfortable and exceptionally clean as are all areas of the hotel. The full size fridge, coffee maker, microwave and hairdryer were all in excellent working order (which is commonly not the case in other hotels). The pool and jacuzzi provide a relaxing environment between theme parks and the 2 for 1 frozen cocktails and meals served at the poolside bar are delicious. The hotel is in a great location for Old Town and a good selection of restaurants are within walking distance. The hot & cold buffet breakfast is a great start to the day and the availability of coffee 24 hours is very handy. This hotel is an excellent choice and is so much more than a base from which to do the theme parks. I would go back tomorrow - if only to steal the extremely comfortable mattress from the huge bed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: lilone
Reviews.Content: Seven of us stayed here for 10 days. Our room was very clean with lots of space. This hotel is very close to the theme parks, 10 minutes to Disney Parks, about 15 for Universal. The food was ok, with a nice variety and best of all it was FREE!!! I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: VEEHuddersfield
Reviews.Content: My family and I ( 4 adults and 2 children) stayed at this hotel in september 2007, we found it in a great location in kissimee, close enough to all the disney attractions, if that's what you want, or as a base for exploring the area. This was our fourth hotel of our stay and found it excellent value for money. We did'nt book it before hand, just called in upon passing, we had a coupon booklet ( widely available at gas stations, on the streets, or from the service stations) so we used it and paid $69 per room per night. I will never pre-book our hotels before we go on holiday again when you can get some really good deals from the coupon booklets. The hotel was very clean, rooms were very spacious, had a fridge, microwave and small dining area, and the staff really friendly and welcoming, especially Richard on reception, but most of all the FREE complimntary deluxe breakfast each morning was well worth the stay which consisted of cereals,toast, muffins, waffles, eggs, juice, coffee, tea, hot choc, oatmeal, fruit and yogurts, i'm sure i've missed something, but you will get the jist. Overall it's one of the best comfort suites that we have stayed in and will definately be going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located, very quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: fluffybundles
Reviews.Content: This place is great. The location is convenient and very quiet and the beds and pillows are very comfortable. We stayed 10 nights and didn't want to leave. The free breakfast was great and filled us up for a long day at the parks. The hotel offers free shuttles but there are only a couple that run in the morning and a couple that bring you back at night. It wasn't convenient for us and we had a car the entire time we were there. We arrived very early in the morning and were grateful they let us check in straight away. However, we didn't find the staff overly friendly but thankfully we didn't have to deal with them very often.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Welshtraveller07
Reviews.Content: If you are in Orlando for a theme park holiday, this is a great place to stay. We spent 2 weeks here and the hotel has everything you want and none of the expensive frills you don't need if you are out all day. Good location, short drive to Disney and very near the I-4 for everything else. Set back from the 192 so very quiet. If you don't want to use the car all the time, there are restaurants and shops withing walking distance. Hotel itself is very well run, cool, clean, quiet. Staff are great - very efficient, hard working and friendly. When we arrived we told reception that our room safe and hairdryer were broken - both were mended within 10 minutes! Rooms and bathrooms were big enough for a family of 4. The free breakfast is a great money and time saver. The pool was never crowded and was always clean with plenty of towels, you could easily spend a day here if you needed a rest from all the theme parks. Great value for money, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat customer!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: arubamama29
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th time that I have stayed here. The third time I stayed, I got a welcome back basket in my room full of goodies and a handwritten welcome note! This time, I paid for a regular king suite and they upgraded me to the 1 bedroom suite:) I love this hotel...the beds are comfy, the rooms clean, the staff are very helpful. My only downsides are that I did not know about the hotel chains reward card( I could've had a lot of points by now). The breakfast buffet is a little monotonous. Now that I have signed up for a reward card, I will continue to stay at this hotel ( as a member, you can get a 2pm checkout)

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay!”
Reviews.Author: smileeface
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Suites Maingate East 9/14 - 9/15. We live in Florida and have been to Disney somewhere near 100 times--no kidding!!! We've had annual passes several times and are big disney fans. We've stayed in Disney Resorts, deluxe, moderate & value and many times off property as well. Sometimes we splurge and sometimes we economize. This Comfort Suites was a great find. It looks like it has been newly painted, and it is clean and comfortable. Lobby is small but pretty painted in blues and yellows. The 2 bed suite we stayed in had very comfortable beds and soft pillows. Room is long and wide. Furniture could use some updating but very presentable room with new bedding. The bathroom looked newly done, air vents were white and clean. Small kitchen sink, small fridge and coffee maker are convenient. It is one short block (1/8 mile walk) to Old Town which is a fun place to go to if you have extra time. Although we didn't use the pools they looked inviting with plenty of trees and landscape around them. The breakfast buffet was adequate although the scrambled eggs tasted a bit synthetic, but it's enough to get you out the door. AAA price of $62.99 for this weekend. I would stay here again, and I do recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Kissimme I've ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Anny-Yury
Reviews.Content: We decided to book this hotel the same day we were driving to Orlando. As soon as we got there, our room was ready. The room was huge!!!! the beds very extremelly comfy and the pillows were amazing! I was surprised by the size of the the room. It also had a fridge and a microwave. Red lobster is right next to the hotel, and the Old town is 1 min away. All 4 Disney parks are less than 15 min away. The hotel has a great location, and is easy to get to. The pool was ok, but we found many bugs in the water. My fiancee got bit by a bee that was in the water. We were on the 1st floor, so we never used the elavators. Breakfast was good. They have something for everybody. So, overall, the hotel is extremely clean, the rooms are great, beds are comfortable and the price was afordable. We paid a little bit more than we usually pay when we go to Orlando, but an extra $15 made a difference this time. We've stayed at the Clarion, Masters Inn, Radisson, Best Western, but if I had to go back to Kissimmee, Comfort Suites will be my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Azakirst
Reviews.Content: Having read all the other good reviews on trip advisor we were looking forward to staying at this hotel and I'm pleased to say that we were not disappointed. The room we had was excellent, very modern, clean and well maintained, the maid service was also very good with the rooms being cleaned daily. Towels were made into various different shapes much to our childrens delight; on returning from the parks each day they would go straight into the bathrooms to see what the maids had made. The breakfast was an added bonus and saved us quite alot of money over the course of our two week stay, there was always something that we found to our liking. There were no problems with reception, we only had the need to speak to them on three occasions, once to check in, once to check out and once to ask if we could keep our room on for an extra two and a half hours prior to checking out; the girl on reception had a quick check at the availability and said that it would not be a problem and there would be no charge. Lots of people on here mention the lifts, I can honestly say that we did not have a problem with these and never had to wait more than a couple of minutes, we were on the 7th floor. We were also at this hotel over the labor day weekend when the hotel was fully booked and although very busy there were no problems for us. it may be that the hotel has listened to the feedback and it has done something about the problem. The pool area was clean and tidy and the pool a nice temperature, we never went in the hot tub as it was on the very warm side, "prefer getting in a hot tub when the outside temperature is nice and cold". The poolside bar is good and offers fast food such fries, hot dogs pizza etc. the staff are friendly and you can pay cash or charge to your room, this may only be available if your staying at the hotel for a few days or more? One would of warning, if you're going to sit at the poolside bar in the evening, make sure that you cover up or spray plenty of insect repellant over the uncovered parts.....if you don't the mozzi's will have a feast! Obviously the hotel cannot be blamed for this, its out of there control not like the rest of the hotel which they are in full control of. So if your looking for a good place to stay then you need look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Suprise”
Reviews.Author: nigelsmom1
Reviews.Content: Was able to use my Choice Rewards points to stay here for just one night. Great location. Went to Red Lobster for lunch. Lobby has great front desk staff and a desk with excursion information is also available. Clerk even gives out 2:1 drink coupons, good for use at the pool bar. Only note, pool bar only excepts cash, no credit. Good parking, nice pool and hot tub! I'd definately recommend this place for family and will probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Westgate Resorts pretending to be concierge”
Reviews.Author: gs1234
Reviews.Content: First the good parts - room was nice and big and cleaned daily. The hotel was located in a great location right beside junction of Interstate 4 and Irlo Bronson Highway - very convenient for Disneyland and Universal etc. Good quality tea and coffee was served all day! Games room is great for kids! reception is also very helpful. Now the bad parts - a very pushy timeshare sales company called 'Westgate Resorts' rents the concierge space at the hotel. The hotel do not sell attraction tickets directly and send you to these people who claim to give you 100 dollars off your disney tickets. However before you get this you are fo rced to waste 5 hours of your holiday (they say 1 hour but it is 5!) getting a very very hard sell on a very dodgy timeshare deal! Avoid like the plague! The other bad thing about the Comfort suites was the 'breakfast.' The lines were long and slow and the restaurant was totally overcrowded. The hot 'ba con' and 'scrambled eggs' was totally disgusting tasting muck! Stick with t he pastries and pancakes and suffer the queues. The swimming pool also had a bug problem - lots of bugs floating around on the surface! It was open 24 hours and in the 10 days that we stayed there we never once saw it been cleaned!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WrexhamLad
Reviews.Content: Our family have just come back from a 2 week stay at this hotel, and I can categorically say that it was excellent. I have read previous reviews (most of which were complimentary) of the hotel, and it seems to me that those people that criticised it had totally unreasonable expectations. The hotel was clean and the room was excellent - the maid service was excellent, and the room was always clean and tidy when we returned from our days out. The breakfast was excellent and although fairly basic, was certainly more than adequate to set you up for the rest of the day - as well as cereals, there was a selection of cooked food, as well as pastries, waffles, fresh fruit and yoghurt. There was a choice of fruit juice and tea and coffee on tap all day. The much maligned lifts were certainly not as bad as people have made out in their reviews, and we never had to wait more than a couple of minutes, and even this was only occasionally, and I would not consider this to be unreasonable. We were never approached by the people on the concierge desk and as far as I could tell they were not putting the hard sell on anyone - I was asked once whether I wished to complete an on line questionnaire when I got home, but when I declined it was accepted with good grace. The pool area was also clean and tidy, and the provision of clean towels at the poolside was a definite plus. I also made use of the fitness room, which was also excellent. The hotel is perfectly placed for visiting all the local attractions - Disney is only a 10 minute drive away, and the I4 is less than 5 minutes away which gave easy access to the likes of Sea World and to Kennedy Space Centre. Overall I would rate this as an excellent hotel, and would not think twice about staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “RECOMMENDED!”
Reviews.Author: nata2908
Reviews.Content: We stayed three days of last week at this hotel and were happy 1. to get a good deal as 20% off 2. to have a very big, nice and clean room 3. to have a good breakfast (fresh and canned fruit, three kinds of cereal, milk, yogurts, apple sauce, doughnuts, muffins, eggs, sausage, bacon, juices, toast, waffles, tea, and very good coffee with vanilla cream!) 4. to refresh in a hot tub and pool (available 24 hours!) after walking in Disney for the whole day 5. to find a place for a dinner with no problem (Boston Lobster feast is just within 2 min. of driving! and also a lot of other restaurants and pizza places) 6. to spend no more then 10 min. to drive to MGM Studios and Magic Kingdom. It's a very good hotel and good price. We'll definitely stay there again in our next visit to Orlando. No wonder, they have several golden and platinum awards. Tip: it's better to book a room there at least 5-6 days before you visit. That weekend we stayed there, hotel was packed (maybe because of summer time though).

Reviews.Title: “great hotel will be back”
Reviews.Author: virginiaborn
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel we have stayed in ,offered from choice hotels,and the rooms are large and clean maids were great and helpful, arcade room also , beds nice and extra pillows and blanket in the room,heavy comforters and real fluffy pillows,clean ,breakfast was plentiful and changed a little every day, never ran out of pool towels at any time of day,great location for disney world never went the wrong way probally 8 minutes to disney, lots of restaurants nearby and directly behind oldtown which was nice touch,we might just go back to florida just to stay in this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: chiro65
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews here online about this place and I wasn't disappointed. The place was very clean and the breakfast was fantastic with a wide variety of foods and the hot foods changed daily with 4 different options ( always consisting of one egg product, and bacon and/or sausage). The staff was polite and the location next to Old Town allowed us to walk to the carnival type activities without any extra driving.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than last time....”
Reviews.Author: saleblue
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Comfort Suites. It was even better than the last time. Check in was extremely quick. We have never been approached by the Concierge which suited us fine. Our room was really large and extremely clean. The pool was great. Never crowded even when the hotel was busy. You could always get a chair/lounger. We ate breakfast a couple of times while were there. But my daughter really likes Perkins so we had to go there as well. We went over to Old Town a few times which was great as they had some fairground rides perfect for my daughter who is 6. This hotel is less than 5 minutes walk from Old Town, the Crazy Golf and a Red Lobster. It took us less than 15 minutes to get to Disney even in the mornings when the roads were busier. There is free coffee in the hotel restaurant 24 hours a day. After staying here for the second time I don't think we would be able to cope with having a standard room again as the extra space of the living area is a Godsend. We have been travelling to Orlando for over 10 years and this hotel is the best one we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: RareTraveler79
Reviews.Content: Great Place to Stay. We drove up, got a great rate since it was August. $90. 2 Minute walk from Old Town and Rides/Go Carts. Rooms were good. Fridge/Micro. Pool and Bar were open late, which looked like fun. Breakfast was good too/big variety.

Reviews.Title: “Best Possible Location”
Reviews.Author: kur32
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the most comfortable beds & matresses I have ever come across - pillows were very soft. Rooms are very clean. The included free breakfast (from 7 - 10) was great & convenient - freshly made chocolate chip waffles, pastries, fruits, yogurts, cereals, eggs, sausage, biscuits, gravy, hot coffee, juices, etc. Hot coffee, tea & coca were available around the clock in the dining area for guests. USA newspapers are free. Pool was never closed & was always stocked with clean towels. Nice outdoor poolside bar (try the huge nachos at a cheap price), We didn't use the Disney shuttle as we had a rental car but the 1st pick-up was at 7:30 AM & the 1st return to the hotel was at 6:45 PM. This hotel has an EXCELLENT location. It's about 15 minutes or less from Disneyworld & EVERY major restaurant or fast food is very close (within walking distance or short driving distance). Large Publix supermarket was across the street (buy snacks & drinks to keep in your room). A supercenter WalMart is closeby & had a huge selection of excellent Disney merchandise that was better & cheaper than those shops where you think you're getting a deal. A few large flea markets (450 vendors) are across the street. Old Town is just steps away - lots of shops, rides, restaurants, Friday & Saturday nite car shows. This really was the BEST LOCATION!!! We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place... the reviews were true!”
Reviews.Author: ThaiChee
Reviews.Content: After doing research and reading tons of reviews on this site plus others on hotels near/around Disney we opted for the Comfort Suites Maingate East. We wanted a hotel close to Disney that would be good for a 4 yr old, a 2 yr old and a 3 month old plus my wife and I. I was apprehensive that the reviews wouldn't be accurate etc. but was pleased the minute we pulled up, The check in was very quick, our room was ready and I was impressed by the room - clean, 2 queen beds, fridge, microwave, view of the pool . The breakfasts were great, the location was awesome (old town is right next door and worth the visit) and the pool was fun. Although we only stayed 2 nights we will be back next year for a little longer stay. You can't beat the proximity to Disney and it's a short drive to the outlets and Orlando. I hope the staff and GM keep up the great work so it's just as great next year!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Front Desk Service”
Reviews.Author: FactsTO
Reviews.Content: Arrived to the worst front desk experience in 20 years of travel. Manager at the front desk could not find our reservation and demanded from the beginning that we provide a credit card. Spent 2 hours arguing in the lobby with "manager on duty" resisting to even speak to our travel agent. He continued to blame us, our travel agent and the tour operator for the missing reservation. Would not search for reservations in their own system. The front desk team were all 'chirping' in with arrogant comments. It turned out the reservation was in the system all along. Our paperwork was correct after all. Our travel agent was shocked at his unprofessional work and rudiness during the incident. We escalated to head office and they sent us a 2 nights voucher with all the desirable periods blacked out, even though our booking was during high season. Please avoid this arrogant establishment, go to Embassy Suites for better ambience and breakfast. Save your kids the drama and trauma.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Triathletewithkids
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel for a family with kids who are looking to save their money for visiting the attractions. Upon arrival, our check in was very quick and efficient. There was plenty of parking and it was free. Our room was neat and clean with 2 queen size beds and a full sofa bed. We were there for 4 nights and were able to take advantage of the deluxe continental breakfast which saved us (family of 5) at least $100. It had eggs, sausage or ham (depended on the day), waffles, muffins, donuts, cereal, oatmeal etc etc. I was pleasantly surprised with the variety. The second night we were there, the A/C didn't seem to be blowing cool air so I called the front desk and within 30 minutes the maintenance man came, replaced the whole unit and we were cooled down within 1 hour. It was pretty fast and I was impressed. The staff was friendly and the pool area was very nice and clean. The hotel was across from Old Town which was nice to walk around at night. The only bad thing I can say about this hotel is the ELEVATOR is the slowest thing in the world. We were on the 5th floor and most of the time we ended up walking down or up the stairs. Other than that, we spent most of our days at the parks, so I felt it was a good decision spending less on the hotel. We felt completely safe and would definately stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shellyleyva
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here. The staff was friendly and the housekeeper was fantastic. The buffet breakfast was very nice and did save us a lot of money. The elevators were slow as I had read in other reviews. We were on the fifth floor and actually beat the people waiting for the elevators many times by taking the stairs. The rooms were nice and it was great having an extra bed. There were gift shops around to do shopping that is cheaper than at Disney World and there were a lot of places to eat nearby. The free shuttle was the only downside. It only runs a couple of times in the morning and then a couple of times in the evening. It was really not convenient foe us because we like to come back during the day and then go back at night. Also, it did not run late enough to be able to catch the firework shows. We just took our car and paid the parking. The pool is great. Nice and warm, and the restaurant by the pool is not that bad to get a snack. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out. Don't believe the other reviews like I did!”
Reviews.Author: Zapatablu
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews as I always do before I book a vacation I thought this would be a nice hotel. I mean the majority of the reviews give this place a thumbs up. Well don't be fooled. Go somewhere else. First let me tell you that they are renovating (painting) and the lobby was in shambles. However, I didn't let it bother me. The rooms are indeed large thats the only good thing. The recliner was broken, the TV blinked off and on all day, and the pull out sofa had a mattress as thick as a papertowel. Still I pressed on. We made due. That is until breakfast the next morning. I don't know where the pictues that are posted of breakfast came from but trust me they were not from this place. It was awful. The eggs were tasteless and the sausage taste like some sort of potted meat. Needless to say we ate out each morning after that. We stayed 4 nights and that was 4 days too long. To top things off they charged me 12.84 for a missing pillow that the maid took. I argued but to no avail. Just stay clear!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jas9946
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel for the price. Bar- The bar is located near the pool and offers a wide variety of drinks and food. Breakfast- The breakfast offered a wide a variety and I was pleasantly surprised. Cereals, doughnuts, muffins, eggs, sausage/ham/bacon, orange and apple juice, waffles, toast, english muffins, biscuits and gravy, fresh fruit, applesause and yogurt was all offered. Check In/Out- Check In was pretty fast and we got a free gift packet which was nice. Check Out was very easy since we had no additional charges we just left. Concierge- I read reviews that said that the time share people bothere you but they never approached me or my family once. Elevators- the elevators were slow and many times i just opted for the stairs. Front Desk- The front desk was very helpful and friendly. Location- This hotel has a great location. It is within walking distance from countless restuarants(both local and chains) and many shops and amusement rides in old town. It is also located very colse to Disney World so we only had to drive about 10 minutes each day to get there. Pool- The pool area was nice and clean. The pool was open 24 hours which was a plus. The pool did get quite crowded during peak hours (5-8PM) but other than that it was pretty spacious. The hot tub was also nice and the had a small kiddie pool with a water mushroom. Room- The room was very spacious especially for only two people. It had a microwave, refridgerator and cupboards. The beds were very comforatable and had a lot of room to move around in. Shuttles- The shuttles to Disney came at very inconvienent times and they only ran a bout three times a day. So if you took a shuttle you were stuck in disney for the whole day. I recommend renting a car to go to disney and to go to restuarants( out of wallking distance) and to a grocery store to pick up some snacks and food for the room. The hotel was very nice and I like it a lot. I don't plan on traveling back to orlando for a while but if I do I will definitley check out this hotel first.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, Travelodge at best...................”
Reviews.Author: mgrolimund
Reviews.Content: Hotel was booked via my father for a honeymoon so it wasnt my choice. However dispite their disputed 'awards'! I would like to warn all that this hotel is not all its painted to be. For a start the bar is located in the pool area only and only open for short periods. Not what we anticipated. Reception Staff are far and few between. Most concerning is the 'Concierge' service, which is in name only. As they actually work for WESTGATE RESORTS who appear to own half of orlando. Therefore the only service they offer is tickets sales with the condition you attend a sales meeting. Any other 'concierge' services in the traditional sense dont exist!! We attended one of these sales meetings in order to obtain our 50% reduction in ticket prices to Disney Resorts, only to be treated like what I can describe as utter sh*t after making ourselves clear we were only there to get our tickets. This aside other things about the hotel were their 'delux' breakfast. Which if i know america after our stay is at best a $5 breakfast, The hotel has 7 floors, on these floors it has at least 20-30 rooms. The hotel has possibily the worst lifts in the whole of america i am not joking by saying you can wait at least 15mins for 1 of the two lifts. In fact I even walked up the stairs at one point. Americans may faint at this point of this post!! ;) only joking. maybe only visitors of orlando....... What i am not joking about is this hotel is budget. If i learnt anything about my trip to america is you get what you pay for. Which is far enough. But I feel this hotel has too much credit for what is on a best greatest ever day is a ordinary hotel at best.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmsnr
Reviews.Content: Here's the scoop: Check in was quick and efficient-and they allowed us to check in at 10:30 am. Hotel rooms were a great size for a family of 5(2 queens and one pull out couch). Maid service: great. Elevators: a bit slow during peak periods. We were on the 5th floor so it sometimes took a while. Free Breakfast: Not much variety. One type of egg daily-either scrambled, or hardboiled and one day we had english muffins with eggs. Sausages were average. Bacon was bacon bits-no long pieces. Cereal-frosted flakes, raisin bran and fruit loops. Variety of donuts. Waffles were the highlight of the morning-especially the chocolate chip mickey mouse waffles. Not much fresh cut up fruit either. Nonetheless, breakfast was a great start to a busy day at Disney and the price/convenience was right. Pool: Heated pool, not overly crowded and great after a Disney day. 3 feet to just over 5 feet. Hot tub timer not working well and often shut off after only a few minutes. Games room-was small but met our kids needs. Concierge-did not bother us at all. Location: Conveniently located on Marker 9. We did stroll over to Old Towne one evening but didn't buy anything. Rides don't look safe. We will probably not stay there again as we typically don't stay at the same hotel twice. Our preference is Lake Buena Vista-closer to Disney and better shopping. Tip: Kids liked the Frosty's at Wendy's.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a good stay”
Reviews.Author: matdenbos
Reviews.Content: My family of five stayed here and we found the hotel rooms large and clean with comfortable beds and pillows. The mini kitchen with microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker and small wet bar sink came in handy when making lunch/dinner. The hotel itself was large and clean and front desk clerks were very pleasant and professional. The continental breakfast was adequate but very busy with everyone stating there day there before heading to the parks. We did have one bad night because a large church youth group and their advisers made a mess of the pool area and helped themselves to our towels that were on our table with our personnal belongings. Same group kept all the luggage carts overnight but management was helpless in locating the carts because of the inconsiderate people. We had to carry everything including the luggage, coolers and storage bins. Other than that it was a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3 star, many other are better”
Reviews.Author: tommyl72
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights, got some problem but resolved with front desk. Defintely not a 3 star hotel. Stay here if you like boiled eggs for breakfast. Do not order any pizza from the flyer that is left on your front door. It looks like they make the pizza from their garage.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: KFtrip
Reviews.Content: Great location: a couple of miles away from Disney and very close to restaurants/shops. A block away from Old Town shops. Worth a visit. Clean Rooms: All beds, bathroom, sofa, etc...neatly clean. Great Complimentary breakfast: Fruits, cereal, waffles, eggs, sausage, biscuit, coffee, juices. Great added value. Free Parking area, another added value. Great Price: $92.00 per night, double-bed room and pull-out sofa. We had 4 kids and 2 adults in the room. We managed it pretty well, the rooms are big enough. Great Staff: This is what really makes the difference. Helpful front desk. My family and I had he bad luck of having a whole female basketball team as next door neighbours and they were extremely loud, noisy, and disruptive. On our first call, front desk sent security to very kindly ask the guests to calm down a bit. Since they continued with their party, we called again and the front desk promptly found another room for us. And finally, when I checked out, I arrived back at home and noticed I had left a CD case with more than 100 cds in the hotel room. I promptly called the hotel which forwarded my call to the Housekeeping Manager, Cindy. Thanks to her, I received my goods through FedEx this morning. I've been traveling for a long time and several times a year. I've stayed in superb luxury hotels, but none of them had the commitment with the customer as the Comfort Suites in Maingate East. I'll definitely be back there with my family. Thank you all at Comfort Suites!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, poor shuttle schedule”
Reviews.Author: laura08
Reviews.Content: We (a family of 5) stayed here for two weeks and could not fault this hotel. The rooms were very clean - the housekeeper Violetta was excellent and the free breakfast was a bonus. We enjoyed walking through Old Town, but didnt try any of the attractions. The only problem we had was that we didnt have a car and booked this hotel to have the benefit of the shuttles to the parks. The shuttle did run several times a day to disney but only once to universal/seaworld, at 9.25am to return to the hotel at 20.00. As we have older kids who prefer universal this was a big drawback. So although this hotel is very good if like me you dont plan to drive, you may be better off choosing a hotel on i-drive - we will next time! One other thing - the lifts are REALLY slow & a hotel of this size should have the alternative of an internal staircase to save a 10 min wait for the lift in the morning!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: KYtravelcat
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. Beautiful hotel and very clean. The bed was very comfortable The buffet breakfast was absolutely wonderful. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value/Good Location/Free Hot Breakfast/Free Shuttle Service”
Reviews.Author: NickyT
Reviews.Content: We are from Toronto, ONTARIO Canada. We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It had a nice room size (we're a family of 5), great house-keeping, convenient laundry facility on each floor (which worked very well), nice pool, nice hot tub, outdoor tiki bar & super bartender lady, elevators worked great (I was happy because I read reviews where they were slow and we ended up on the top floor), delicious hot variety buffet breakfast. Old Towne Kissimmee is right next door - and it was fun and entertaining with lots of shops. Red Lobster and other restaurants and discount stores/souvenir shops are within walking distance. You can catch a bus to Busch Gardens in Old Towne if you order on-line it's offered. The shuttle service at the hotel to the parks is free. One thing we didn't know was that you have to take the shuttle to Disney World to get to all other parks, plus to get to Universal you have to take another shuttle from the hotel around the corner from the drop off. (No one mentioned that!) Which brings me to the only disappoinment of staying in the hotel is that of the front desk staff - NOT HELPFUL AT ALL! They don't help you out or offer any advise or even know the area. Overall though, the price is good, the location is GREAT, the rooms are clean and the breakfast and transportation is FREE!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: amsdf
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience here. My husband & I spent 8 days beginning May 2, 2007, at the Comfort Suites Maingate East. Our room was very clean and nicely furnished. The staff were all very helpful and we found the overall quality to be above standard. The included breakfasts provided a nice variety each morning including fresh fruit, juices, muffins, bagels, waffles (Mickey shaped ones for kids!), cereals, both hot & cold, meat, eggs and biscuits & gravy. If you can't get an adequate breakfast here I'm not sure what else they could add. The coin-op guest laundry located on each floor was clean and in good working order and the rate for use was very reasonable. The location was convenient (once you find it the first time!) and quiet. It is adjacent to "Old Town", a small, privately owned amusement park where there were several choices for food and entertainment. The pool and whirlpool area were spick and span clean and pool towels were provided. I would not hesitate a moment to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a Disney/Sea World vacation!”
Reviews.Author: KaryaDawn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the Comfort Suites from June 21-26, visiting Orlando from the Kansas City area. We requested the top floor upon contacting the hotel and our request was honored - upon checking in, the friendly associate handed me a key to "the penthouse." The hotel was great and our maid service was exceptional! There were 5 of us, 3 children, and each day we returned to the kids stuffed animals arranged on the beds in various ways - they absolutely loved seeing what had changed every evening! They also enjoyed the fun ways the towels were folded - birds, flowers ,etc. Very nice touches!! Yes, the elevators are slow, but you have to take into account the quality of the other occupants. Children would "hold" the elevators to wait for their friends and such. We also encountered teenagers who hopped in and out of the elevators, stopping on every floor, just to be ridiculous. It isn't the fault of the hotel that their guests have never been taught any manners. The beds here are plush and comfortable, and each queen bed had four very squeezable down pillows. The five of us had plenty of room in the 2-queen suite. The refrigerator was perfect for a lot of water bottles, and the extra sink did come in handy. The breakfast is quite good, and with great quantities, but again, you have to contend with the rude patrons that can't seem to be avoided. A line forms for the Mickey Mouse waffles, and yet still some guests feel they can cut into the front of the line and help themselves to the waffles as they are placed into the tray, further delaying the line. The girls working there put out waffles as fast as the irons would allow. The hot foods varied a bit, but were mainly scrambled eggs with ham or bacon stir-ins (sausage once) and biscuits and gravy. There was plenty to eat and drink, including that fabulous real Florida orange juice, and nobody in my family had a single complaint about the food. If you're smart, get there at 7, though, as the later crowd gets a bit nuts. We never dealt with the "Concierge" due to the warnings I read on this site, so I can't say much about them, but the regular staff was friendly and helpful. The room was cool and comfortable, and we had no problems. It's a straight shot down 192 to Disney, or hop I-4 to go to Sea World or Universal. The theme parks are close, but the cost is affordable. Old Town traffic is a bit annoying, but it isn't too bad. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you're visiting Orlando. I'd also advise asking for a top floor room - the wait for the elevator is worth the peace of not having anyone on the floor above you! Enjoy your vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: deni68
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 6 days. What a loverly hotel! The rooms were big, and the beds were very comfortable. The maid service was excellent. The kids enjoyed going to old town, which was just a little walk away. Would definetaly stay here again! North Carolina

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pattychiang
Reviews.Content: My husband and I with our 4 year old son recently stayed here for a week. It was very nice with a lovely pool area. The rooms were large with small refrigerators and a small sink and counter areas. The breakfast was decent though many of the same things show up every day. We did take fruit for our Disney World tour and that cut down on costs of snacks. I also have to mention the maid service which was out of this world! The room was spotlessly clean each day. The only down side was that it is very very noisy on a Saturday night...music, fireworks, etc. from the local "Old Town" area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & comfortable, but staff need to learn to smile and be helpful”
Reviews.Author: Shevy1
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed at the Comfort Suites in May for 10 nights. The hotel itself was clean and comfortable, and the room very spacious, breakfast great. Apart from one of the receptionists all the others were not real friendly, they need to learn that it doesn't cost them anything to smile and be polite. The location was OK, but not fantastic, even though there were several eat-in restaurants/take away restaurants, and flea markets within walking distance, the main tourist attraction area located on International Drive was not within walking distance and this made it difficult to get there each day. The taxis were expensive, and on some days we took the free shuttle which the hotel offered to Seaworld and then caught a trolley/bus from there to International Drive, this was a lengthy process and some days we would have to change 3 buses to get where we wanted to because taking a taxi was too expensive. There were a couple of other things we did not like about the hotel staff, one was that when we asked them to call us a taxi they would call one of their friends/associates who worked for a supposed private taxi company and would turn up in an unmarked car (no taxi signs/writing on the car) this did not make us feel very safe. The second thing was that the staff offered us discounted theme park tickets which when we had looked into a little more had a catch to them, we had to go to a "free breakfast" run by a different hotel company and then to a one- on -one talk and tour about time- share properties that this hotel were trying to sell you - they said it would only take 90 minutes but ended up taking half a day. During our stay in Orlando my sister had to go to hospital and on our last day I was frantically trying to ring the medical records department to ask them to send her a discharge letter for her insurance company, the payphones in the lobby at Comfort Suites kept asking for more and more money and would not connect me through to the phone number, when I mentioned this to the reception staff they were VERY UNHELPFUL and told me they had nothing to do with those phones, they didn't even have the courtesy to offer their phone for me to use or a refund for the several dollars I'd lost on their payphones.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews - this is GOOD”
Reviews.Author: Blooster
Reviews.Content: Even though the reviews of this hotel were so good, I was still wary coming here. I needn't have worried. This hotel can really give a lesson to so many others - everything they do, they do it well. The Ritz it ain't, but if you're looking for a spacious, clean and welcoming oasis at the end of a hot Orlando day, you can't do much better than this. The rooms are large enough - we had two Queen-size beds, a smallish living area and a spacious bathroom. The "kitchen area" was very small and had no cutlery, but it has a fridge and you're not going to want to eat in anyway. The rooms are cleaned fastidiously - every day without fail. Can't fault that - very clean thoughout. Concierge not a problem. I'd also say the breakfast is great considering it's gratis - again if you're expecting haute cuisine, stroll on, but it's decent enough. The only grumble I would agree with is the lifts - they are painfully slow (and no staircase nearby), but I think most would settle for that as the only gripe. Location is great too. I heartily recommend.

Reviews.Title: “noisy but nice!”
Reviews.Author: PeteNorthWestUK
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 week stay at this hotel. We thought the rooms were clean and modern enough, the location was excellent and the old town (just over the road) was a pleasant surprise as it had a lot for our 8 year old to do - Go karts, mini rollercoaster, quasar/laser tag/dodgems and more. The breakfast was average, some days ok some days just boiled eggs for the English (recomend ponderosa 5 mins walk away). The noise levels were ok as long as ear plugs were used at night. We found the poolside bar average as it was understaffed e.g. 40 mins wait for food, slow service. The pool was clean and warm enough, the jacuzzi was a touch too hot and the kids 'fountain' was just unusably cold. We didn't get pestered at all in the 'lobby' and thought the games room in this area was good. Eating out at night was good, recommend Logans roadhouse and Joes crab shack - both about 10 mins walk away. We liked them for more genuine good service/food/cleanliness although both could be classed as a touch on the brash side. Stay Away From Pacinos!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Budget!”
Reviews.Author: jackiefu
Reviews.Content: We had a nice, big room. Clean. Great maid service. These rooms would be great for families on a budget. There were only two of us, so we had lots of space. Big bathroom. Decor is ... dated - but you're spending 12 or more hours a day at the theme parks, so who cares. We had a tiny fridge and sink - perfect for storing small snacks. NO cutlery/dish soap provided in our room. Didn't use the pool, but did get a visit from a real live raccoon while eating beside the pool. Good service at front desk. Great shuttle service to the parks - I would NOT recommend driving in Orlando, especially when you're exhausted at the end of the day, driving "home" must be especially painful with tired children. If you wait to catch the last shuttle home you will be on a packed shuttle - and perhaps waiting in line - so catch the second or third last one. The only complaint about the hotel is the food. The free breakfast buffet is pretty gross - i.e. a hundred boiled eggs floating in water, etc. But tea and toast was good enough! And the bar out by the pool has food late at night, but it was equally gross. I got potato skins, which were greasy, doused in globs of sour cream and fake cheese (that liquid processed stuff). So avoid the food, but enjoy the prices! Also, "old town" is kinda ... grungy. We went to the car show but were turned off by the tattoos/grunginess. You could save money buying crappy trinkets at the big stores across the street though. I would avoid "old town" at night. Great value hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: TJNewton
Reviews.Content: Just had a very pleasant two week stay at the end of April at the Comfort Suites booked via Virgin Holidays and would definitely agree with previous reviews, the hotel is of a very good standard in an excellent location close to all the major theme parks. We had a suite at the rear of the hotel on the 7th floor overlooking the pool. Beyond the pool and the hotel grounds there was nothing but trees. A much better, and probably quieter, option as the front looks out over the car park and Old Town. Maid service was excellent and the towel art, see piccy, was a nice touch. Wasn’t hassled by the concierge at all, in fact found them quite useful on the two occasions we approached them for advice. Several good restaurants within walking distance, some the wrong side of the 192 which took a little nerve to cross, handy if you like a drink with your evening meal so you don’t have to worry about drinking and driving. This proved to be a very good time to visit Orlando, just after spring break and before the main season kicks in. No problem with tables at breakfast time or the lifts. Also very quiet in the theme parks, queues were minimal hardly had to use the Fastpass service at all. My wife and I, 50 somethings, thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel as a base in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Another visit and once again it was great!”
Reviews.Author: Rosani
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property recently and as we had the chance to visit Kissimmee again, we didn’t hesitate to book at the Comfort Suites again. Good job we did as those days were fully booked! We even tried to add another night to our stay but unfortunately that wasn’t possible as there were no vacancies. When we arrived the check-in was quick and efficient and we were able to go to our room quickly. When we got to our room we were surprised by the fact that, in spite of booking a standard room, it appeared like we’d been upgraded to a two-room suite with two bathrooms and oodles of space! The main bedroom with a king bed was so comfortable and the main bathroom even had a Jacuzzi function. Our little boy slept in the main living room area (sofa bed provided) with his own enormous TV and acres to run around it. It was great! There was a lovely touch where an amenity basket was left for us (full of yummy goodies) as well as a personally addressed note welcoming us back to the hotel. It was a lovely touch and we were certainly impressed. The hotel itself provides an excellent breakfast (included) and has a great heated pool that is open 24 hours. There are also concierges for things like booking dinner or buying park tickets, as well as a fitness room and a small games room. It is located next to Kissimmee’s Old Town and this made an interesting place to visit on Sunday night when there is a classic car “cruise” going on. But the hotel itself is far enough from Old Town to remain quiet and relaxing. We certainly enjoyed our stay at the Comfort Suites and look forward to going back again – even without the amazing upgrade!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: Celtic4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here while attending a wedding in Orlando. We were very pleased! We found the room and property immaculately clean. The king bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I ever slept in - better that the Hyatt! The many pillows were divine. It made it hard to get out of bed in the morning! We also enjoyed the pool and the poolside bar. The two different bartenders were amateurs but personable and made generous drinks. We also loved Old Town. What an unusual place! We had a great evening shopping in the unusual shops. We sat on the patio of the pizza place and enjoyed delicious pizza, beer, and live reggae music. A bit bohemian but that's its appeal. The only negatives to our stay were slow elevators on the morning and the breakfast. The dining room was extremely busy and the food quality was not good - cold biscuits and gravy, warm milk, no waffles. We'll definately be back and next time we will bring the kids!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place/Great Value”
Reviews.Author: blazer33
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here during Spring Break. Rooms were large and very clean, Beds were soft and very comfy, also had extra pillows equally as comfy. Fridge and room safe a plus. Pool was nice and very warm, poolside bar made wonderful pina coladas!!! Expanded continental breakfast was a BIG hit, lots of items to choose from,nobody left for the day hungary. Welcome gift at check-in was a nice touch, lots of good stuff, coupons for drinks at the poolbar, oil of olay samples, sample packs of childrens pepto and tylenol products, razors, and coupons for local restaurants. Staff very friendly and helpful. Our room was not ready at check-in time and we were immediatly put into a room that was ready. Only complaint was that their is only 2 elevators and they were very slow. Would stay here again in a heartbeat. We like the Rt. 192 area a lot better than the mess of trying to get around on I-Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Who need sleep anyway?”
Reviews.Author: GetawayGangAlberta
Reviews.Content: This is a very average hotel. The rooms are clean, the waffles were good but the rest of the breakfast was mediocre and the staff was indifferent. There were tip jars every where. The pool area was very pleasant during the daytime but a zoo at night. We take fairly long holidays so we like to go to bed realatively early (around 10). We booked this hotel through their website almost 6 months in advance and requested a room on a higher floor knowing that these should be the quieter rooms. When we arrived we were given a first floor room. We didn't make a big deal about it because we were only staying 2 nights. It was very quiet right up until we put our child to bed at 9:30, about that time a bus of students on a trip and the shuttle from disney arrived. Then it was like trying to go to sleep in a train station. You could hear every word said in the hallway, which was the only way to get to the stairs, and when unloading busloads of overexcited kids there was a lot of noise. After that there was a constant roar as they made their way to the pool and breakfast area. Our window was about 10 feet from the pool so we got to share their excitement. The next morning we asked to be moved to a different room and were told that the noise was not normal because the kids had just got off the bus after a long road trip, it would be better tommorrow and that there were no quieter rooms because there was another bus trip coming and they were spread throughout the hotel. Instead of creating a scene, we agreed to stay in our assigned room. It was just as bad the next night. If the hotel used any common sense when allocating rooms, they would keep groups together and close to the entrances understanding that they will be overexcited and undersupervised. This hotel is for the stay up late, get up ealry crowd only!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: FULWOOD02
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel as a direct result of reading the reviews and hotel info on Trip Advisor and we were not dissapointed. The room was clean and had everything we needed, the maid service was excellent. The breakfast was good but as the hotel was full you need to get down early to get a table. As the previous poster mentioned the hotel was a little noisy at night due to the number of teenagers but you could get this problem at any hotel. Our real negative was that we were approached whilst at the breakfast table one morning by one of the timeshare people who seemed a little annoyed that we hadn't been to see her but we made it clear that we weren't interested and weren't bothered again. The hotel's location is ideal for visiting the Disney Parks and we would recommend this hotel aany visiting the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here for a great time in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: TraceUk
Reviews.Content: This is the 6th time i've stayed at Florida and this hotel was one of the best i've stayed in. It's situated near to old town in kissimmee which is a lovely old fashioned place to walk around at night with nice little shops, eateries, bars, fairground attractions and has a car and bike show on certain nights. I say the hotel is close but it's not that close you experience any noise. Anyway, as for the hotel - check in was o.k., front desk staff not over friendly or helpful at any point but that is such a small niggle. The hotel was extremely clean (cleaning was taking place every day at some point). The pool area was fantastic with good size pool at perfect temperature, kiddie fenced in pool with water fountain, hot tub set amongst shrubbery. Poolside bar served drinks and snacks so could sit around pool and enjoy some good nights while kids played in 24 hour pool. Our cases were taken to our room by concierge staff who would not accept a tip, went out of their way to be pleasant each time we passed by and made the whole stay a really friendly pleasant exerpience, not annoyance at all from them. There are two lifts which you can some time wait for but so what, it's never really that long and by the time you've finished talking about your day in the park they have arrived. Breakfast, was possibly the only thing I wasn't over impressed with, it comprised of boiled eggs, fresh cooked waffles, yoghurts, toast, some fresh fruit but not a great deal of choice. It was nothing to complain about but not great either - it was always the same each day we were there too - oh and the seating could get difficult depending on time. The rooms were great size and kitchen area had microwave, fridge, sink. Not a great deal of storage space for family of 5 but we managed. Would definately go back to this hotel in the future - great location and great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deanotess
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on reviews from this website and were slightly nervous about the odd bad review but we needn't of worried at all, It was great! This is the 3rd time we've stayed in the Orlando area and this was the best place we've stayed. The room was good it was bigger the your average double and the fridge and microwave was a great help. The bathroom was a good size with complimentry toiletries, that were regularly replaced. Room was cleaned daily. Shower was lovely and there was always hot water. The complimentry breakfast gave us a good start to the day and there was plenty of choice, the children loved the Mickey Waffles! All the hotel staff were really helpful. The pool was great, very warm and the Hot tub was fantastic. It could get a bit noisy at night when there were a lot of teenagers in there, we were on the 6th floor so not too much of problem for us. The lifts were slow but this was not really much of an inconvenience. If you want discounted park tickets from hotel concierge you will have to go to a timeshare talk, we didn't go but heard from others that it was a nightmare to get away once you got there. That said, we were not put under any pressure to go to timeshare talks. Overall a great hotel, we would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Arielitoll
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a last minute place to stay in Orlando to visit our family and thankfully we came across the Comfort Suites Maingate East. It surpassed my expectations! This hotel is wonderful! Everything is new and in great shape. The staff was very nice and helpful! Check-IN was quick and efficient. We were in our room within 5 minutes of checking in. The room was in excellent shape! Very clean too! We had a view of "Old Town Amusement Park" which was very nice. The bathrooms were spacious and very clean as well. The free breakfast was excellent! The eggs, cereal, and bread all tasted excellent! They also served free ice-cream sundaes in the afternoon on the second day of our stay. It was delicious!! Parking was also no problem. Overall, we were very happy and blessed to have found this place! We highly reccomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the price”
Reviews.Author: GojkoK
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff never smiled. The female bartender at the pool bar was unpleasant and aloof. The room was nothing like the pictures on the website, but it was more than adequate for our needs. The pool was very nice, as was the jacuzzi. The Old Town "amusement" park is kind of sleazy looking, and some of the area around there is a bit on the rundown side. But everything you could possibly need is within a couple of miles east or west on 192, and it was just a few minutes away from MGM, Epcot, and Animal Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not platinum”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly007
Reviews.Content: Good stuff: This hotel is a great location if you're headed to Disney World - easy to get to and in/out to the freeways - walking distance to many restaurants (Red Lobster, Denny's Logan's Roadhouse, McDonald's, Pizza Hut...). Great breakfast buffet to get your day started - Mickey Mouse waffles with or without chocolate chips. Pool, fitness room, hot tub were good. Our stay was pleasant enough. Lots of parking for rental cars. Nice decor. Not so good stuff: Elevators are extremely slow - lots of times it was faster to use the stairs, which isn't convenient with small children. The hide-a-bed mattress was shot - almost falling off the frame and the springs dug into your back (for kids only and then maybe only). The dryer on our floor was out of operation the entire stay - a platinum winner should be fixing things and replacing worn items quickly. Be careful when making phone calls--we phoned to put our names on a waitlist for Joe's Crab Shack (1/4 mile from the Comfort Suites) and were charged over $9 for long-distance! Wouldn't recommend the food from Barricuda Bart's although we saw a few people eating their pizza and it looked okay. Staff were marginally friendly - tired of tourists?

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: skibunnie630
