Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel conveniently located near all of the Disney theme parks. It is behind Old Town in Kissimmee, but it is not seedy like the others surrounding that part of town. Everything in Old Town is within walking distance with the exception of a grocery store which is across the street and down two blocks (you have to cross 192 to access it and it's a death trap!) The room itself was nice. The ceilings were high which made the room look more spacious and the bathrooms were very large. The carpets could use a good steam cleaning, but besides that it was nice. We only found one cockroach on the wall in the morning which is great for Orlando, and a good hotel. The breakfast bar in the morning was great for the cost...free! They always had plenty of fruit, yogurt and oatmeal if you are a health nut, and waffles, pastries and cereal if you're not. Their coffee was excellent as well. I did not have the opportunity to visit the pool area, but it looked nice from our room. The only complaint I had was with the elevators. They were the SLOWEST elevators I have ever been on. We waited forever for them at all times of the day and night. Other than that the stay was great and I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Disney area.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice if you are on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: cridge
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 6 night stay (March 8-14). This was our first trip to Disneyworld and we were travelling with a 3.5 year old. The hotel is just off the main street and looked fine from the outside nothing unexpected or outstanding. The lobby is large and BRIGHT BLUE, YELLOW AND ORANGE...kind of made the place look more outdated but not a big deal. The staff wears tropical hawaiian shirts. The lobby contains a gift shop/ snack shop which is handy if you want snacks, camera stuff, pool toys, band aides ect. There is also a small arcade with an air hockey table, pin ball games, and driving games. There is Concierge desk (TIMESHARE DESK!!!) where you can buy Disney tickets...IF YOU GO LOOK AT A TIME SHARE. I just politely/ firmly told them no and that was that. There is also the eatting room which is a large room...I NEVER had/ saw a problem with people trying to find a spot for breakfast. The breakfast is fine! What do you normally eat for breakfast??? There is bread for toast, cereal, juice, yogurt cups, mickie waffles, sausages, eggs, so on! **THERE is ALWAYS HOT FREE COFFEE IN THIS ROOM** Also off the lobby is an exercise room with a treadmill, eliptical bike and other machines. The pool is off the lobby and is as WARM AS A BATHTUB!!! Even at night we went swimming!!! The hot pool is tucked behind some bushes and could be slightly warmer. There is a splash pool for toddlers but it is COLD. The pool was busy but not crazy. There is a bar but it is only open in the evenings...they make an excellent margarita. Our room was a suite with a King size bed and a sofa/bed. You walk into the suite and see the kitchen which is Large...no cutlery or plates. There is a microwave, minifridge, coffee maker. You then walk into the TV sofa area which on our side overlooked the parking lot and old town amusement park. (The palm trees came up to the windows which was nice to look at.) The main bed room was large and comfy. The bathroom had a Jaquzzi tub. Overall I was surprised how LARGE the bedroom was?! It was clean and comfy the linens where good and we had no problems!!! Area around the hotel : I was a bit scared of old town being that I am from Canada and didn't know what to expect. My husband went over to find some beer and came back and told me it was fine and fun. We went over near the end of our trip and I am glad we did...THERE ARE LOTS OF TOURISTS!!! There are some funky clothing stores (retro/vintage) and some karoke bars (Spelling.) We found one bar with a large dance floor where my 3.5 year old girl danced with a 4 year old boy while we had a margarita. (Harmless fun.) There is a red lobster, A&W, Ponderosa (Really yummy) about 5/7 minute walk past the parking lot. There is a small grocery store on the left hand side just before the main street beside a pizza hut (5 minute). Shuttle bus: The shuttle bus leaves 7:40, 9ish, 10ish and 11ish and goes to the MAGIC KINGDOM. The shuttle returns 5:45 for a 5.00 per person fee, or 7ish, 9:00 and 10:30. IF YOU WANT TO GO TO ANOTHER PARK YOU MUST GET ON A FREE DISNEY BUS TO GO TO THE OTHER PARKS. THE SHUTTLE BUS GOES TO THE OTHER COMFORT INN WEST THEN TO THE MAGIC KINGDOM (this takes 30/40 minutes). IF YOU ARE GOING TO ANIMAL KINGDOM IT TOOK US 1.5 Hours TO GET THERE. If you have small children some of them where getting tired/ bored. The hotel shuttle bus has movie screens and plays cartoons. TO GET TO DOWNTOWN DISNEY...you have to check a shuttle to the magic kingdom...then catch a bus to a disney hotel...then catch a bus from the hotel to downtown disney. Saratoga springs is the closest hotel to downtown disney and you can walk there in about 10 minutes. **Since the fireworks are at 8:30 or 9:00 we missed our 9:00 shuttle...right around the corner where the busses park is the I56 city bus which will take you right in front of old town for 2:00. The I55 bus will take you to the Magic Kingdom...not the nicest bus but its good to know its there if you are in a pinch. SO there you have it!!! There were lots of Canadians and locals staying at this hotel which makes sense because it is a bargain. IF I had the budget I would have stayed at a Disney resort, especially one on the monorail track. FORGET ABOUT PARK HOPPING IF YOU ARE BUSSING IT WITH LITTLE ONES!!! hahahahaha I don't know who/ how that would be possible?! Would I recommend this hotel? Sure just know that you are going to be spending alot of time on buses if you aren't renting a car.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with stay, but couple of complaints”
Reviews.Author: andrewseliz
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my 3 1/2 year old and a 2 year old kids, and my mother. Overall it was a great stay. The free breakfast was great, even if the biscuits were cold. My kids could eat all they wanted and we saved bananas, yogurt; bread, peanut butter (ask the lady making waffles for it) and jelly from the breakfast bar and made PB&J's later for lunch. (Complaint #1: There is NO place on site to get lunch...the pool side snack/drink bar doesn't open until 3. Why???) Also, the pool was nice and warm like a bathtub, which was great. But, the kids pool with the fountain (which is one of the main reasons I booked this hotel) was FREEZING cold and full of large dead bugs. The whole time we were there, I never saw ONE single kid in that pool. We never used it because the water was soooo cold. We spent a lot of time at Old Town Village that is nearby, because the rides are perfect for toddlers. The first two nights I bought the unlimited rides bracelet for $25 (under 36" can ride free with a paying adult), but on the third night I went into the Old Town Visitor Center and the guy there sold me a bracelet for $10! He was a timeshare guy, but we were leaving early the next day so he didn't even ask me about it and he was very friendly. One of the two treadmills in the fitness room wasn't working, and the elevators ARE very slow, with inconveniently located stairs. BUT, for the money, I think you would be hardpressed to find a better value. Rooms are big, employees are very friendly, great location, and great pool. Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, convenient....”
Reviews.Author: hikinggal
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weeklong stay at this hotel. I originally was booked at a local theme park hotel but read the reviews on this site and changed my reservations. I have no regrets about my decision. The previous reviews were quite accurate. Our room was clean and comfortable. Each day we returned to find our pillows plumped and arranged in a different way as well as our towels and washcloths. The lady who serviced our room was very nice. We were pleasantly surprised with the "continental" breakfast which was so much more than the typical continental breakfast offerings. More like a full breakfast. The conceirge desk had tons of info about activities,restaurants etc in the Orlando area The only complaint we had was that our room overlooked the pool area to the left of our room and a field with what looked like junk to the right. We would definately say here again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, Good Value Close To Orlando Attractions”
Reviews.Author: tedward2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Comfort Suites Maingate East for a night with my two children aged 4 and 6. We needed a reasonable priced hotel near Disney. The room was clean, comfortable and larger than average for this type of accomodation. I was happy with the room as although there were quite a few teenage guests (softball teams?) walking the halls there was no noise at night so I assume the rooms are pretty well insulated. The location is just off a main strip near "Old Town". Old Town seemed as an amusement a little run down in comparison to most of Orlando but at least was something to look at as we walked up to the main road that had some chain restaurants (we ate at a Pizza Hut). It wouldn't be a reason to stay here but it's not a detraction. Disney is a short drive from the hotel and I believe there may have even been a shuttle if required. The breakfast buffet was alright really. For the kids it had plenty of choice with Mickey-shaped waffles and cereal and they loved helping themselves. It's all not of a totally high end quality but really what do you want with a free buffet. There was a large selection when compared to a continental breakfast which is often offered with hotels. I think between the fruit, yogurt, cereals, coffee and hot stuff it's possible for anyone but the most picky eater to have a decent breakfast. Didn't get to the pool but it looked a reasonable size and not too busy when we were there. This is a reasonable place to stay if visiting Disney or Orlando attractions. I think the breakfast is good if you have kids and want to get some food in them before a busy day of amusements. In then end it's not a high end boutique hotel but that's not what it wants to be. For families or travellers looking for good value I would recommend the Comfort Suites Maingate East.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lindajeanDumfries
Reviews.Content: 21 February 2006 TripAdvisor Member Scotland Stayed at this hotel for three nights visiting Disney. The accommodation is of a very high standard, comfortable and clean. The room we stayed in had a separate living area, kitchen and bedroom and overlooked the old town.The hotel is in a central location and yet being off the main road is quiet and peaceful. I swam in the pool every day and found the area relaxing and welcoming to children. On our second day we ordered room service from the pool bar and enjoyed the meals that were delivered quickly to our room. The breakfast buffet was very nice with a good choice to see you through to lunch time and beyond. I would definitely stay here again and have no hesitation in recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: LynnetteKirsop
Reviews.Content: My husband, two daughters (ages 6 1/2 & 5 years old) and myself stayed at this property from Feb. 23-March 1. It's a super location if you're doing the Disney parks. The people at the front desk were very friendly upon arrival and the concierge never bothered us for the timeshare presentation. The breakfast did get a little boring by the 4th morning, but we really couldn't complain considering it probably saved us at least $25/day by eating there versus going out for breakfast. We had a room facing Old Town and it was fun looking out at it. The room was very quiet and extremely clean. Our girls couldn't wait to get into the room at the end of every day to see what shape the maid had folded the towels into (bunnies, flowers, etc.). I would definitely stay at this property again and wouldn't hesitate recommending it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well kept, no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: suburbantoo
Reviews.Content: I'll agree with most of the previous reviewers. Breakfast food was just okay, nothing special. Olde Town isn't a problem but a new go cart track under construction directly in front of the hotel might be in the future. I think the additional traffic and noise will be a detriment to the property. Pool and hot tub were fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful for a travelling family!!!”
Reviews.Author: asualumni87
Reviews.Content: After researching and reading reviews for hotels near Disney World, I think we made a great choice. As a family of four (including two small children) this hotel suited our needs. The suites are roomy enough for the kids to run/move around and are extremely clean. We spent six nights here and everyday after returning from the Disney Parks, our room looked like it did when we first checked in. The housekeeping staff is excellent!!! The outdoor, heated swimming was our kids' favorite. The temperature felt like bath water and no one wanted to get out. There is also a separate kiddy pool and hot tub. The breakfast buffet, in my opinion was outstanding! A large variety of hot and cold food, breads, cereal, oatmeal, coffee and tea. There is something for most dietary needs. Overall, we were pleased and would recommend this hotel to anyone that is looking for a moderately priced, extremely clean place to lay their heads!!!

Reviews.Title: “average beds, but GREAT Disney location”
Reviews.Author: zmn4500
Reviews.Content: Average hotel, nothing special. Rooms small but clean. Noise was not bad, off the highway enough. Breakfast OK (but hot biscuits and gravy every day got boring), but definitely not enough room for everyone to sit. Most all get up early and want to be at Disney by 8-9AM and can not sit to eat. Pool was fair size and hottub nice and warm. Lots of restaurants close and shopping easy also. But the only real reason anyone should stay here is VERY quick to Disneyworld ... maybe 10 minutes on our worst day.

Reviews.Title: “The Pros And Cons Of Comfort Suites Maingate East”
Reviews.Author: CrissyAnn
Reviews.Content: My Husband, our two year old and myself stayed at the Comfort Suites Maingate East for four nights. We chose this hotel based on 1.) Trip Advisor traveler reviews 2.) Cost 3.) Location and 4.) Amenities. Cleanliness And Staff: The one thing that stands out in this hotel is the cleanliness and the staff. The hotel is very clean (we only found one stray hair in the tub when we first arrived). Maid service came every day. They folded our towels in the shape of roses and rabbits. We returned to an immaculate room every evening. We were very surprised that the maid staff had even folded our pajamas and the blankets in our Toddler's crib! The towels are thicker than the towels you usually receive at this level of hotel. The sheets and blankets on the beds are very thin. However, after being worn out from the theme parks during the day, we were too exhausted to care about this in the evening. The front desk staff is very friendly and helpful. They will accommodate you with whatever you need. Out son spilled a cup of ice water on one of the beds at 10:00pm. We called the front desk and within minutes they brought fresh, clean sheets to our room. We received our wake up calls at the proper time every morning. Our check in at the front desk was friendly and quick. Location And Views: The location is a very short drive to the 4 major Disney theme parks. This hotel does not sit directly on the main highway, but it is a stone's throw away from it. The area surrounding the hotel is an area with Pizza Huts, KFC's, Burger Kings, low budget souvenir shops, liquor/beer stores, tourist ticket/timeshare stores, etc. This hotel sits right on top of Old Town. We never made it there, but I know another reviewer called Old Town "tacky". Old Town is basically a "street side carnival" or “small town festival” type of attraction with your typical carnival rides. Old Town was not an issue with us. The main issue was that our room was in the back of the hotel and did not overlook the lights of Old Town. A small comer of our room overlooked the hotel’s pool. The main part of our room overlooked a torn up construction/dumpster area..not too pretty. We called down after arriving in our room and asked to have a room facing Old Town. The front desk said that there were not any vacant rooms facing Old Town and to try back in the morning. My Husband did not care about the view and did not want to pack again and change rooms, so we stayed in our original room. Amenities: Ok, the "free" breakfast is just not good. We have had other "free deluxe breakfasts” and they have been much better. The selection was plentiful, but to be completely honest, it was the quality that was not great. There were a lot of generic, pre-packaged foods. Mini muffins and mini donuts that we spit out after one bite, low quality white bread and flat English muffins for toasting, a couple of generic cold cereals in big plastic bins, boiled eggs floating in water, yogurt sitting in icy water (where it soaked the containers and made the yogurt runny). The breakfast room was also hot and extremely crowded. People let their children run crazy through there, bumping into you and cutting you off to get what they want from the bar. There is a sign asking parents to supervise children, but I did not see this happening. It was also so crowded, everytime I turned around someone was ramming or bumping into me. I felt like I had to fight crowds of people just to grab a piece of fruit. We did manage to grab fresh fruit (bananas, oranges, apples) from the breakfast bar and head down the street to Dunkin Donuts. At Dunkin Donuts we would order coffee, muffins, donuts, bagels, croissants and have our fresh fruit from the hotel with it each morning. Dunkin Donut's reduced fat blueberry muffins and coffee are phenomenal! Also, we did not have to fight through maddening crowds at Dunkin Donuts to get our food or sit at a table. The other bonus is that we did not have to worry about children or adults ramming into us with a full cup of coffee in our hands. We used the pool one night. It was heated and is open 24 hours a day. We never used the kiddy pool, because we never saw the fountain on during our stay and the water looked kind of stagnant on the bottom. The cleanliness of the pools was average. I did see a greasy film on the top of Jacuzzi. These pools do get a tremendous amount of use. Day or night, anytime we looked out, there were tons of people swimming in the pools. People also like to sit around the pool and drink alcohol, because there is a bar right beside the pool. People also smoked around the pool, because the inside of the hotel is completely non - smoking. The Internet service in the business center you have to pay for. It is $1.00 for every four minutes -ouch! Also, there is no printer. I chose not to go online at all to check my email (even for business) at those prices. The front desk clerk also warned me that the internet service was extremely slow. We never used the restaurant on site, but did order several times from "Flipper's Pizza", a place recommended by the hotel. Flipper's Pizza delivers right to your room and the pizza is always hot, fresh and delicious. You will receive flyers from other pizza places slipped underneath your door. There is a note in your room warning you to not order from these establishments. Apparently, they are “fly by night” places and the quality is terrible. We even received a flyer from a pizza place saying that if their phone # was blocked, use your cell phone or a pay phone to order from them. It seems the hotel has blocked the rooms from even calling these establishments, due to the poor quality and complaints. The front desk said these people are also trespassing on the property, when they put these flyers under your door. This does make you wish there was some kind of secured entrance to this hotel. There was a laundry room on our floor (7). It was very clean, but it only had one washer and one dryer, which someone was always was occupying. We just saved our washing for when we returned home. Price And Overall Value: We booked this hotel using the Orlando Magic Card, which anyone can get for free by downloading it from the website. The rate per night, before taxes and fees was $79.00. It was an OK value, I guess. I feel that it would have been a better value if the breakfast was of higher quality, the internet access was complimentary, the kiddy pool was usable, the view from the room a little easier on the eyes and their were larger clothes washing/drying facilities available. Next time we come to Orlando, we may try a different property just to compare. I really wanted to “love” this hotel and return again and again, but we probably will not return unless we can get a room for around $50.00 - $60.00 per night. $80.00 a night, plus resort fee and taxes in February is a little steep for us, (budget travelers) in my opinion. I found some other hotels without business centers, free breakfast, kiddy pools, etc, that we could have booked for around $50.00 - $60.00 per night. We may try these places next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, comfortable, convenient, affordable”
Reviews.Author: SunSurfSki
Reviews.Content: If you, like us, prefer to spend your money on the attractions yet still wanted pleasant, comfortable accomodations, you will be really happy. We stayed here from February 20-22 on a family vacation, and we will defnitely stay here again should we revisit Universal and Disney. The location is central to all attractions. The rooms are spacious (we had a king suite that was 500+ square feet with two bathrooms). There's not a lot of outside noise. It is very clean. The large pool area, open 24 hours, has a regular pool and a water sprayer for the younger crowd. Breakfast is extensive with warm and cold options. There is a gift shop with sundries.. Steer clear of the time share folks in the lobby beningnly masquerading as concierge help, unless you want discounted tickets in exchange for a pitch. They did not give us an offensively hard sell, but we ended up going elsewhere for tickets because they were not upfront about what their real purpose was. Also, ask for a room on the third floor or lower because the elevators are slow and stay very busy. Better to go up and down the stairs once you get settled.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KumarSanjose
Reviews.Content: Initially I didn’t care about writing a review, but after experiencing some horrible hotels in my trip, I decided to write reviews about the Hotels which are really worth mentioning. Myself, my wife and our young son stayed here Feb 3rd for four nights. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. Room staff is excellent. They kept the room so clean that I used to slip into sleep as soon as I reach room. Breakfast is excellent. They have so many choices in breakfast buffet that even though we had breakfast for 4 days, we did not get bored at all. This hotel is located in a pretty nice location as it has numerous hotels near by which serve food round the clock. This hotel is like 2 to 3 miles from Disney parks. I saw lot of reviews about the lift being slow, however I didn’t experience the delay. May be I am lucky . My only complaint is when I initially entered the room I felt that it was a smoking room (mine is actually a non-smoking room).I think after a while I got accustomed to the smell. I gave only 4 stars to this hotel as I expected something extraordinary by looking at the #1 rating. I will definitely recommend this hotel to any one. If you are planning to visit only Disney parks in your trip, then probably staying in one of the Disney hotels will be a better option, as you don’t need to hire a car, depend on hotels shuttles etc.. Disney has excellent monorail and shuttle services between the parks and their Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Clean & Comfortable 2/11-2/15”
Reviews.Author: Brent_2004
Reviews.Content: Have to say this was one of the nicest & cleaness hotels we have stayed in around the Disney area, spacioius clean & quiet rooms with small fridge that kept the beer ice cold & microwave what a great touch & convenence to have. The pool not sure what temp it was at but was very warm & made for a nice swim with secluded hottub to relax in after a great day of golfing. The breakfast for free cannot find any fault with. With a great location minutes to everything & friendly staff made this short golf holiday a very enjoyable one would recommend this hotel to anyone & we will definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mellowc
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! This was a clean quiet very nice hotel. Some hotels that are non-disney can tend to be worn and dirty but this one was very nice. Never had problem with elevators or timeshare. Very convient shuttle to the parks. Going back next Decenmber!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'd never stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: masjeb
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation at this hotel because it was rated 1 on the trip advisor list for Kissimmee. I would hate to see 50 or 100 on the list. The staff at the checkout desk was extraordinarily rude. The concierge staff was pleasant enough, but could answer none of my questions. The shower was awful: enough water pressure as a light drizzle, and the hot water shut off after about 2 minutes, leaving me with a head of soapy hair. The mattresses were like concrete blocks. The tap water tasted like it was poisoned. The food at breakfast, while plentiful, was barely edible. AND the location was HORRIBLE -- across from what looked like a dump, and next to the tackiest "amusement" park I have ever seen. I wouldn't stay there again if the rooms were free. I was in town for a family funeral, and my stay at this "hotel" made the experience ever so much more unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Super - Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Familyfundays
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. Very clean and comfortable. The room was large and the staff extremely helpful and accommodating. Breakfast is provided and catering staff were very good with the children and their requests for chocolate waffles. I would definetly recommend this hotel for a family holiday - the swimming pool is heated and towels provided which is such a bonus with four children! A laundry room on each floor and it is only $1 to do a wash load! We done Disney World with shuttle transport provided through the Hotel which was great. Hotel is next to Old Town which is very lively and a great place to visit but you are not disturbed by the noise at all. If you require shopping their is a Public supermarket about 10 minute walk which is very cheap, do not use local mini mart type shops as these are costly. Can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place!”
Reviews.Author: CindyMH
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Comfort Suites during a conference Jan. 15-18, 2007. The room was spacious and very clean, with a comfortable, firm bed. The staff was friendly. The lobby and pool areas were clean and inviting. The continental breakfast featured hot, fresh waffles, fruit, yogurt, juices, cereals and a variety of breads. It was better than most. I was in town with colleagues and we had 3 rooms total - we all had the same good experience. This property is located next to "Old Town" - an area of shopping, dining and amusement rides themed to the 1950s-60s, so there are lots of restaurant choices within easy walking distance. The only negative is that there was never really hot water in the showers - only lukewarm at best. The elevator was a little slow, but that is common in a hotel of this size. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Tom_the_Team_Guy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a week in January. I really felt happy with it. The price was good, (Just under $90/night with all the taxes and miscellaneous charges) The room was clean and quiet (6th floor). They had a big breakfast room with lots of choices each morning. It was just a couple miles from Disney. The Old Town amusement park next door isn't anything special, but a convenient place to get an ice cream cone after a hard day of exploring. We never had any problem getting strong-armed by the concierge desk to check out a great deal on a local time share. I'd definitely go back to this property if I ever find myself in Orlando again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our Magical Vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Luv
Reviews.Content: I usually stay right on Disney Property, so I was a little nervous about staying off-site. This trip was 4 generations for 3 nights (we stayed January 4-7, 2007). My 13 year old, myself, my mother, and my grandmother. We booked the Junior Suite at the AAA rate. What a find! We actually ended up paying less than the Florida Resident Rate at the Disney Value Resorts, but we did pay $10 to park one day of the trip, as we found it would be easier for us with Grandma. We had 2 CLEAN queen beds, CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN microwave, refrigerator, 'kitchen sink', all shampoo and lotion and shower gel, FRIENDLY front desk staff...we took the shuttle to Magic Kingdom. No charge and on-time, though it was crowded, but Grandma loved it! Our room overlooked the bungee jumpers and the 'sky coaster' at "Old Town". Grandma loved sitting at the window and watching this when we were in the room. We ate the full breakfast each morning and prepared our other meals except dinner on two of the nights in the room....what savings for us! We did not use the pool, so we cannot comment on that. The shops at the "Old Town" are in walking distance but were 'forgettable' and run down for what we wanted to do. I would definitely recommend this place. Thanks to all of you on Trip Advisor, or we would have ended up at a dive!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for the New Years”
Reviews.Author: Hope&FaithChicago
Reviews.Content: The room we were stayed in was spacious, alot of towels and clean enough. The hotel was only a few yards away from Old Town and alot of food establishments. It was close enough to the Disney World parks, there's a shuttle available but I didn't use this since we had rented a car. The receptionist was helpful enough considering we checked in late at night on December 30 and stayed for 5nights. The pool was heated and we really enjoyed it even if was nippy on some nights. There was a laundry room on every floor--which helped alot with the way my kids went through their clothes! Their buffet breakfast was excellent--freshly made waffles with an option of having chocolate chips in it or if you want a Mickey Mouse shaped waffle (which was a hit with the kids), boiled eggs, yougarts, fresh fruits, a choice of cereals and their coffee was excellent. My complaint--only two VERY SLOW elevators and the mattress on the sleeper sofa was really uncomfortable, not thick enough. About the time share presentation? I didn't go to the coincerage because I was warned about it reading the reviews on this site, so if you don't have the patience for something like that, don't even get tempted by the "free gift available at the coincerage"... All in all, I would recommend this to friends and I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A really nice stay”
Reviews.Author: makowish
Reviews.Content: My husband planned a last minute trip for our anniversary to Kissimme for a balloon ride. After speaking with the owner of Balloons and Beyond he suggested the Comfort Suites. Everyone was very helpful at the hotel. Upon arival we were greeted with a hotel gift of cookies with a friendly smile. The staff was constantly cleaning and available for any type of questions. The rooms were suprizingly very clean. We had a beautiful view of Old Town on the 5th floor. The room was tastfully decorated and came equipt with a small efficientcy kitchen (this was a nice extra). Also, the bathroom was squeeky clean and another suprize was the massage shower with the wonderful Martex fluffy towels. The pool area was also quite nice with munchies and pool bar. Our stay also included a free full breakfast, we had freshly made Micky Mouse shaped waffels with all the trimmings (don't get too excited if you want scrambled eggs though, they only offer hard boiled). Regardless, it was a very pleasant stay and we will be sure to return soon. Another plus was that all of the balloon companies use the lot next door to take off, it's really great to see them all take off into the sky!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it used to be”
Reviews.Author: HV1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 8 nights over the Christmas period 2006, encouraged by the excellent ratings on this website. This was the second time we had stayed here, the first being a few (3?) years ago when it first opened and in general the quality has gone down while the price has doubled. The things that are still good about this hotel are the rooms, which are very big for this class of hotel, and the housekeeping, who always did an excellent job cleaning the rooms. The pool was well heated, beautifully warm and is large enough to never feel crowded. Now for the things that were not so good. Thje elevators are extremely slow, there are only 2 of them, and it is not possible to use stairs as they do not connect from the inside of the hotel (i.e. they are emergency exit stairs only). With the hotel booked to capacity, we often had to wait long periods for the elevator to arrive and there to be sufficiant room for us to get in. The free breakfast works well when the hotel is not full, but when at full capacity it cannot cope. There was often no table available, the noise level was high, and the lines to get food were annoying. The setup was also less than ideal, with 4 waffle makers positioned in the middle of the breakfast bar, causing long lines to build up waiting for waffles to be cooked. People lined up behind not realizing that others were only waiting for waffles. In general it was a very confusing, unrelaxing start to the day. Other annoyances were the constant "carribean style" music being played around the pool, too loud to be ignored, and the hotel in general is now in need of some touch-ups and updating. In summary this is still a reasonable hotel, but (at the time we booked) was more expensive than other equivalent hotels in its class, and it struggles to cope when it is full. My advice would be to only use this hotel in an off season when it is less likely to be full, and go to breakfast early before the rush.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time”
Reviews.Author: BAXTER10
Reviews.Content: Second time we have visited the hotel at Christmas.We had a party of 15.The hotel is very close to Disney and a shopping is one block ,if not less,outside the front door.Chain stores line hwy 192 which is the main street to the hotel.We are planning to stay again for Christmas 2007.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: cherriest
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in April 2006. Upon walking into our room, we were met with a clean, fresh smell and everything we noticed about the room was very clean. AC, fridge, and microwave all worked very well. We had a very pleasant sleep and there was no noise. We enjoyed time at the pool area and the bartender was very nice and friendly, and she made excellent drinks. The front desk personnel were all nice, however, I did have difficulty understanding a couple of them because of their broken English and they had difficulty understanding me as well. My only other complaint is that there are only 2 elevators and the word 'slow' does not even start to describe the turtle pace at which they move. Use the stairs if at all possible. Old Towne is directly across from the hotel, and I highly advise that you wander over there at some point during your visit. If a neat little place and fun to just walk around and see all the little shoppes, etc. The free breakfast was quite good. Fruit, bagels, cereals, yogurt, toast and waffles. Also coffee, milk, tea, and an array of juices. It was crowed during breakfast time, but the eating area is large and there were plenty of tables to accomodate everyone in the dining area. I would like to WARN everyone NOT to order from the flyers that are placed under the doors to the guest rooms. There are multiple flyers that are placed there daily and the deals for pizza, spaghetti, etc seem too good to pass up... but trust me.... pass it up. Although the hotel advised me not to order from any of these people (they said they can't control the people walking into the hotel and going from room to room putting them under the doors), I did so anyway and it was a huge mistake. We got pizza and spaghetti and garlic bread from this one place that delivered. The pizza was horrible... as tough as leather... nasty is the only word that comes to mind for the so-called sauce. I absolutely hate spaghettios from the can, but frankly, spaghettios are 100 times better than the spaghetti that was delivered to us. And as for the "garlic bread" that came with out mean... it was toasted hamburger buns (plain... not even a bit of butter or garlic on them). The whole meal was a joke. My husband and I each ate about 2 bites of the pizza and one bite of the spaghetti and threw the rest out. We then promptly went down to the pool area and ordered hotdogs! Very good hotdogs!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Orlando area hotel”
Reviews.Author: lblambert
Reviews.Content: This was the fourth time we've stayed at the Comfort Suites since 2003. Rooms are clean, spacious and comfortable, the staff are outstanding and the free breakfast each morning is a plus. Location is excellent - only a few minutes from Disney. Upon check-in there was a welcome basket of goodies and a note welcoming us back to the hotel - a nice touch/ One afternoon after returning to the hotel to rest, we were greeted by a lovely towel animal that housekeeping had left for us. As other guests have also indicated, our only complaint would be the slow elevators. We have also stayed on-site at Walt Disney World and we much prefer the Comfort Suites to Disney with much bigger rooms and a price that is quite a bit less than what Disney charges. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a reasonably priced, clean hotel when visiting the Orlando area. We are looking forward to returning in 2007.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: katunes
Reviews.Content: This hotel was all that previous review said it was. Had a wonderful stay, the room was clean and spacious, the employees were friendly and courteous (especially the front desk), and the the complimentary breakfast wasn't bad either. Only one thing keeps them from an excellent rating - there are only 2 elevators for 7 floors....and we were on the 7th floor so we had to wait during peak times to get up and down.

Reviews.Title: “great location and cleanliness!”
Reviews.Author: reed13ja
Reviews.Content: All the great reviews are true, this hotel has a great location and is clean clean clean! It is set back off of 192, so traffic noise is not a problem at all. From the rooms on the front side of the hotel you can see Old Town, which has carnival type attractions and gets busy at night. It appears there is some expansion going on at Old Town, and there is construction between it and the hotel, but right now it is just dirt moving and ripping up trees. I imagine that it could get a little loud if any building starts, but it is seperated from the hotel by the hotel's parking lot. The front desk was really friendly, and we didn't have any trouble with them pushing timeshares at the concierge desk - just tell them you arent interested! The room was very spacious and clean, and the housekeeper left us our towels folded up like roses. The breakfast was great, it was easy to stop in on the way to the parks and grab a meal. It was always clean, no bugs, and plenty of tables available. There was such a good variety that I had a different breakfast every day and we stayed for 8 days. It took 5 minutes to reach the main gate of disneyworld (another 5-10 from there to actually get to the parks) and about 20 minutes to get to Universal Studios. The hotel does offer a free shuttle service, but we rented a car instead because the shuttle service was limited to mostly Disney stops. For example, the shuttle only made one morning and one evening stop at Universal parks, and the evening stop was before the parks closed. We booked our trip through Expedia (flight and hotel together) and when we arrived we had to pay a daily resort fee of about $2.50. It was well worth it, considering the great deal we got on the room. We stayed Oct 28 through Nov 4 and payed a total of about $450 for our King bed suite with kitchenette. The rate was through expedia, and I found it to be a little higher on the hotel's own website.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Phil&Sarah
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed here. We went back because on our first visit we found it was a very clean, modern hotel with good facilities and (importantly) a good breakfast, which won't cost extra. I'm glad to say that things were just as good second time around. The rooms are spacious and spotlessly clean, there are some great restaurants nearby (I particularly enjoyed Red Lobster and Pacinos) and the drive to the theme parks takes no more than 10-15 minutes. I would recommend this time of year as the weather is still nice and warm and the theme parks are not as crowded (or hot) as they are during the peak of summer. All in all, this hotel gets a great review - and it doesn't cost a fortune either. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Close to old Town”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte500
Reviews.Content: What a lovey hotel to stay in. We spent 10 days here and arrived after spending 4 days at the Hilton in Clearwater. The rooms at the comfortsuites were bigger and far superier to those at the hilton. We had two queen beds, lounge area, fridge and microwave. They were lovely and clean. Yes there is a breakfast which they say is free, but it depends on how you look at it, there is no cost involved but surely this is paid for when you pay for your room and your resort fee, as they say nothing in life is free. The breakfast is only ok, get easily tired of cold waffles, boiled eggs, same cake and pastry every day and toast which you have to que up for for ages to get it toasted. Pool and hot tub was great which is open 24 hours. Old town was really nice to go and look at at the evening but threre are not great restaurants at old town, only burger joints. There is a nice restaurant on the 192 called Logans which had gorgeous food. As I said we stayed for 10 days and never and any problems what so ever with the concierge which everyone says are time share people. They give good directions to places if you need them and don't hasstle you at all. Overall a great place to stay close to the theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: aos1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, it could be comparable to a marriott. This hotel is much much better than any other comfort hotel in the orlando area, and bigger ane better than disney value resorts.Its right off of hwy 192, by old towne,this area is better than the ran down international drive area and its closer to disney.Pool and hottub was nice,room clean, microwave and refrig in room! All sorts of resturants, and stores( target,publix,walmart )right on 192: as wellas great shopping deals at lakebuena vista outlet center.

Reviews.Title: “late night swim after halloween horror nights!”
Reviews.Author: sviscardi
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews about this hotel, I decided to change my plans from staying "on property" to the comfort suites maingate east mainly because of the luxury of swimming after a very late night at halloween horror nights. I was very pleased with everything. The reviews were correct. I did not have a problem with slow elevators though. I stayed 4 nights on the 4th floor room 402. I was first put in room 429 which stunk like smoke and I immediately went back to front desk and they changed me to 402 with no problem. Front desk is so friendly and nice. They even gave my 16 year old niece razors and shaving cream which she had forgotten. I booked for a week in april and look forward to returning. My only complaint would be they need to fix the hot tub. The jets were weak and I think that it needed more water although security said it has had problems for a while. Well, thats a clue that it needs asap attention. Hopefully it will be done by my return in april. Overall ,we had a great time. Clean rooms, good breakfast. and very comfortable beds. Magi our housekeeper was great to allow the teenagers to sleep in and come clean last before she left at 5pm.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Steveky4
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading good reviews on this website and we weren't disappointed. Hotel was very clean, rooms were good and staff friendly. Breakfast is a real bonus and they provide cakes/pastries, fruit, cereal, waffles, pancakes, juice and hot 'gravy' and biscuits. A real saving and much better than having to walk to a restaurant for breakfast. Free coffee on tap all day. There's a swimming pool and gym too. Lifts can be a bit slow at peak times, but not too bad. You can walk over to Kissimmee Old Town in a few minutes and the Classic Car and Bike Nights are worth seeing. Lots of restaurants nearby. We had particularly good meals in the Red Lobster and Logan's Steakhouse. Like most Orlando hotels the concierge desk in the hotel will try and get you to sign up to view timeshare/holiday homes but they weren't over pushy and didn't hassle us at all. Hotel is very well placed for visiting Disney Parks. We had a thoroughly good holiday! Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Looking Forward to Going Back Here”
Reviews.Author: TracyBrookes
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic we loved everything about it and have already decided we are going back next year. We have been to Florida for 6 years and have stayed in numerous hotels but this was by far our favourite. The hotel is situated right next to Old Town which has plenty of shops, bars, small fairground, car shows and bike shows and a great atmosphere. Check in - I had been pre-warned about the concierge staff trying to take your cases and mither you but they were a big part of this hotel's welcoming feeling. We were greeted at reception (would have to agree that the staff here aren't that friendly or helpful but hey you don't have that much to do with them anyway) and then handed over to Buck our concierge who took our party of 12's luggage to our room and would not accept a tip, all of the concierge staff greeted us by name each time we passed through the lobby and were always friendly without trying to sell us a thing! We also went for our welcome pack and free gift from the concierge desk which had money off vouchers for local attractions and a beautiful cake wrapped in gold ribbons and at NO point were we pressued into doing anything! The hotel itself FAB FAB FAB... The whole hotel was very clean. The rooms were great, good size, excellent air con, microwave, fridge, large bathroom with great shower. The rooms was cleaned daily with fresh towels and complimentary toiletries. We were on the 5th floor and had a fabulous view over old town (my only niggle was that there wasn't a lot of storage space for a family of 5). The breakfast buffet was nice, with fresh waffles, muffins and bread for toasting, boiled eggs, biscuits and gravy (I think the americans call them)? Yoghurts, cereal, fruit juices. It does get a bit samey but you can nip to Ponderosa for breakfast or McDonalds or even do as we did and buy in from the local supermarket Publix. It can get very busy too but there is always a table, it's not a problem. Again, the only niggle I would have with the breakfast is that the toasters are really slow and didn't always work which caused long ques and put you off even trying. Pool was always clean and just the right temperature, good sized. The hot tub was set back from the pool surrounded by shrubbery - very nice. Plenty of sunbeds, tables and umbrella's. Poolside bar offered a good range of drinks and snacks (although I agree that it was a bit of a pain it not opening until 3pm, as kids often wanted soft drinks before then). The lifts! - what is the problem? - the lift was more often that not called for us by one of the concierge people and we never waited for any longer than a minute which is no time at all when you chatting to each other about all the fabulous things you've done that day. The only time we found them slow was when an ADULT! had pressed the button to every floor before getting out! There is no noise from Old Town but I belive from people travelling with us that the rooms overlooking the pool can get noisy from kids playing in the pool, as it is open 24 hours, but again your on holiday, who cares? The complimentary shuttle bus to the parks was great - always on time. I could keep going but all in all i've never been so sad at having to come home before then when I stayed here, it was just a great stay from beginning to end and we are definately going back again next year - why change a good thing? One tip - if you like fish food - eat at The Red Lobster - food and service was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “what a wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: fcan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Thanksgiving week and had a wonderful time. The staff were lovely and accomodating. The timeshare people never approached us.The housekeeping is incredible- they left our room spotless and even took the time to arrange the kids toys in cute positions.Breakfast was great- even homemade waffles. Yes, it is a little noisy, but for the price, location and comfort it is a small price to pay. Loved the easy access to the laundry. Will DEFINITELY stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: CMS_60
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Comfort Suites in August. Had a nice visit but yes, we were approached immediately upon walking into the hotel by the timeshare folks. Having read previous reviews, I was able to polietly decline the offer to stop at the Concierge desk for my 'free' welcome pack. Trust me, NOTHING in Orlando is free. They did escort us up to the room, however, and told us again to stop down. We said we would later - we never did. If you have the time and want to spend about 5 hours listening to the sales pitch to save a few $$'s on park tickets then do so, otherwise keep on going. As for the hotel itself, it was nice and clean and the room a good size - no complaints there. The breakfast was average - nothing to write home about, but convenient and plentiful. The hotel backs up to a foreverwild so if you plan on swimming or sitting outside in the evening -- be prepared for mosquitos, especially after a big rain! All said, a pleasant hotel in a convenient area and a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel should be!”
Reviews.Author: allpackedup
Reviews.Content: Friendly, courteous, very helpful staff. Clean, comfortable rooms with very large bathrooms and generous counter space. Many offerings on the Breakfast Bar including juice that actually tastes like juice, not 50 percent water! First rate all the way! Would stay here again...highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, served our needs well”
Reviews.Author: Cliff_Taylor
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Comfort Suites 9350, Turkey Lake Road on 3 previous occasions, read the reviews and decided to book the Maingate East option as it sounded as though it was an improvement. The location was better from the point of view that restaurants and other minor attractions were within walking distance. Travel distances to parks were no different, we decided not to use the free shuttles as time was important to us and it appeared that it would take ages to get to parks with the bus stops involved. The pool and hot tub was better at Turkey Lake Road. Turkey Lake Road is a lot cheaper and nearer to Lake Buena Vista (by far the best area to stay in the Orlando attraction area). Regarding other comments made by previous reviewers, OK the lifts are slow, but if you are on the second or thid floors then WALK OFF THE BURGERS!!!!! Service was good (maids, reception, breakfast...etc), we were not at all bothered by the concierge (Timeshare) staff. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Suites Maingate East and Timeshare Reps”
Reviews.Author: Rutilla
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 weeks during end of July/August 2006. I was concerned after reading the reports of timeshare sales people, and we were directed over to them following check-in. However, we were given a local attractions promotion booklet , some complementary banana bread and invited to return if we needed to buy any tickets (we'd already prebooked our park tickets). One of the timeshare boys did take our luggage to our room and accepted the tip given for this service but for the rest of our stay they didn't approach us, even though they were constantly in the foyer. The hotel itself was clean and served it's purpose. The reception staff could have been more friendly but the maids who cleaned our rooms were lovely. It is very much a hotel for families and young children did make the occasional noise in the corridors but not to excess. The free breakfast was ok (but gets busy at peak times), for an occasional treat we drove to a nearby Dennies. Parking at the hotel is free and washing/drying facilities ($1 each), on every floor, were a plus, (although you need to previously buy washing powder). The children enjoyed the swimming pool but somedays were too exhausted to use it. I did struggle to initially find the hotel, as the road wasn't listed on our maps (but for anyone else visiting) it is near marker 9 on H192 East, in the Old Town, right near to the ferris wheel and the huge towers that swing people up through the air. The Old Town entertainments didn't prove noisy and the position is very convenient for travelling to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Buff_G
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for myself and 5 friends through Virgin Holiday. We visited for 3 weeks in October 2005 and loved every minute of it. Four of our group had been to Florida on other trips previous to this and two had never been to Florida at all. The 6 of us were split into 3 couples and had a room to sahre between each couple. My boyfriend and I shared a room which overlooked a field at the back of the hotel and it was lovely and quite (exactly what you need after a busy day visiting the parks!) I would reccomend this hotel for all people regardless of age or group size as it has everything you could need. There is a free bus shuttle service to and from all of the parks and you can even catch a bus to Bush Gardens just a little walk up the road from the hotel. You get a great breakfast which includes waffles, muffins, yoghurts, coffe, tea, juice, toast and cereal. Also it's right next to Old Town so you have plent of shops and attractions on your doorstep (but they aren't so close that they disturbe you either). I would have only one moan about this hotel and that would be towards the attitudes of the staff! They are all rude and do not want to help you thsi included the reception staff and in the restaurant. The only friendliness came from the maids who claen your room.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 9 days in November of 04 and are planning a return trip in Nov of 07. We were traveling with our 2 toddlers and found the hotel staff to be very friendly and accomodating to our needs. When we arrived, the staff had already set up the crib in our room so we did not have to wait for one to be delivered. The kids enjoyed the fancy folded towels when we came back to the room each night. We loved the free breakfast buffet and the one room suite, so we didn't have to go out to eat for every meal. We liked the fact that the hotel wasn't huge; you didn't have to walk too far to get back to your room. Most notable, during our last night there, our 3 year old son came down with the flu at about 2am. The staff kindly provided us with clean sheets, towels, ice and 7-up/Sprite, and some over the counter medicines to help him feel better. They brought them up to us so we didn't even have to leave the room. The hotel also let us stay an extra half day so our son could rest up before the flight home. All in all, we were very pleased with our stay, and quite thankful for the extra attention we recieved for our son.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and family stayed here in May 2006 and loved it. Good location lots to do in area. Braekfast good, very clean and friendly. Good facilities in hotel. Disney parks only a couple of miles away. Would stay again !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: kapjet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Suites for 9 days and not once had a problem. The rooms were clean and maintained. Elevators are a bit slow but not as bad as we expected. Check in and out was great and on time. The pool was clean and warm, our kids loved it! We stayed in room 231 and we could use the stairs if elevators were slow. Laundry on each floor was great, except once the washer was not working and I had to go to another floor. However the next day it was fixed. $1 for wash and $1 for drying and all my loads were done in 30 min. including drying. Very friendly staff. Breakfast was excellent , especially when free. It saved us alot of $. Never used the shuttle to Disney as we rented a car, plenty of free parking available. Close to many stores and restaurants, could walk although quite a busy road to cross the street. 24Hr Walmart close by (CAR) and grocery store. We would definately stay here again as the convience to Disney and stores make it a great location. Our cleaning lady was Ravza and she did an amazing job each day, plenty of towels and shampoo etc. One thing they could change is the pillows, I found them a bit too soft. Beds were comfortable although, I could have slept great on concrete after long days at Disney! Would rate this Hotel a 5+. for the $. I used the Orlando Magic card to get a better discount. Its free on the Orlando Tourist web site. Thanks Comfort Suites for the great holiday!!

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel when travelling around america, this was our last stop. This hotel was a great place to stay in to end our holiday. Everything was brilliant about this hotel, i cannot really think of a bad word to say about it. Our room was very spacious and very well cleaned every day. The outside pool was amazing and just what you need to get out of the heat. The staff were all freindly and helpful. The one down side that i found about the hotel was that on a couple of nights a school group stayed at the hotel and they were quite noisy running up and down the stairs, and had music quite loud. But it was bearable and it was only on a couple of occasions. I would definatly stay at this hotel again, it suited all age groups, there were families, old couples. And myself and my partner who are only 21 found it great for the younger generation too. As all the amusment parks are close by, and there is a lot of things to do around the hotel. Every friday and saturday night there was a classic and modified car show, which was very interesting. Also i have to say if you go to orlando visit the skull kingdom, it was one of the most amazing haunted houses ever. But it is very scary just to warn you!!!! It is found at international drive.

Reviews.Title: “Your basic hotel with a few extras”
Reviews.Author: winonatraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here June 28-July 2 after reading great reviews on TripAdvisor and taking note of all the awards this hotel has won. To be honest, it didn't really live up to my expectations. The photos on the internet were deceiving - the lobby is nowhere as beautiful as in the photos, and the pool is smaller. However, the rooms were extremely clean and comfortable. The maids did a great job and fold the towels into fan/seashell shapes. My three kids aged 11, 10 and 7 even liked the sofa bed and told me is was very comfy. I liked having a suite, but I wished the sink/micrwave area had plastic forks, knives and spoons. That would have been handy for in-room meals. I do have to say that I was impressed with the service we received from the bellboy upon checkin. He insisted on taking our luggage up to our room on a cart even after my husband refused. He was extremely polite and helpful in unloading our bags for us, and he refused the tip my husband offered him. We really appreciated that - a very kind gesture you don't see too often. I also admit that this hotel is very ideally located to the Disney parks, Univesal and Sea World. We didn't go to Disney but it's just a couple miles away. And it was only about a 15 minute drive to Universal. Even though the pool was smaller than I thought it would be, our kids absolutely loved it and spent a lot of time in there each night. The hot tub is small but served the purpose. We didn't eat at the pool bar/snack shop because we had our fill of junk and snack food at the amusement parks during the day. But from what I've heard the food is good. The breakfasts in the morning were great, although two of the mornings we could barely find a table. 8am seemed to be the really busy time for the line. We went at 9:30 another morning and the crowd was much more tolerable. The food was OK, nothing too fabulous but did the trick- the best item was definitely the homemade waffles with whipped cream. But they also offered hot and cold cereals, fruit, yogurt, donuts etc. There were plenty of choices to satisfy most. By the way, we found the elevators to be fine. They weren't slow. There was only one time during our whole stay when we took the stairs instead because we were tired of waiting. And that was after the hotel got very crowded on the weekend. Also I have to say that noise was not a problem for us. We heard a few voices running past our room at night - but not any worse than any other hotel. I should note that I had read about the timeshare sales pitches on TripAdvisor before we got to the hotel, so we avoided the ticket sales area like the plague, and we had no problems whatsoever. Being near Old Town is a plus for this hotel. We strolled over there one evening to check it out and it was fun to walk over there and look in the shops and get a bite to eat. My husband really loved the car show. He is a car buff so that was right up his alley. Also if you want to find a restaurant or store elsewhere, there is so much right near the hotel it's very convenient. Overall, it was a good price for this hotel and what it had to offer. It suited all our basic needs, but I guess I was expecting something a little extra from an award winner and I just wasn't feeling it. I wouldn't discourage anyone from staying here because it was fine. It was slightly above average than most hotels, just doesn't have any "wow" factor that would make me want to vote it #1.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 7 nights at this hotel and agreed that, for the money we paid (booked as a package at expedia.com), it was an excellent value. Every staff member that we encountered was very friendly and efficient. Check-in and check-out were handled very smoothly. We requested a late check-out (check-out is 11 am) and were cheerfully given an extension until 1 pm, at no additional charge. There were 6 of us in our room and we had plenty of room. If you are orgranized, sharing the bathroom will not be an issue. We had to be certain to ask for extra towels and this request was fulfilled. We had two queen beds and a pull-out couch. My two kids slept very weill on the pull-out and had no complaints. There are PLENTY of restaurants, major chains and all price ranges, up and down the main drag. They all tend to be open later, so you can grab a quick snack or meal after a late day at the parks. There is also a Walgreens (open 24 hours) and a Publix food store within walking distance. The rooms come with a small refrigerator and a microwave, so you can stock up on goodies at the two stores. Old Town is nearby and is a neat place to visit. The parties go late into the night, but you will not hear it at all. They have rides, shops and small restaurants and the atmosphere is like a big carnival. As is mentioned in many reviews - BEWARE THE SALES PITCH. The concierge is very helpful with brochures, maps and questions about the park. However, they will want to talk to you and your spouse for "just a few minutes" and offer more goodies. *** DON'T DO IT ***. My wife and I never approached their desk, or walked through the lobby, together in an effort to avoid this pitfall. The only complaint that I have, and it was shared by many others, is that the elevators are excruciatingly slow. They have only two cars and this hotel is generally packed. If given an option, take a room on the second, third or fourth floors. This way, you can take a short walk down the stairs (located at the end of the hall to your right if facing the elevator doors), rather than wait an inordinate amount of time for the elevators. My family and I enthusiastically endorse this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hello teachers”
Reviews.Author: Bomber254
Reviews.Content: My daughter and i are staying here as i write this and I've got to tell you that it is just excellent. The rooms are clean and spacious and if you are government (and that includes teachers), the price is unbeatable. We paid 80 bucks a night. You are super close to all of the Disney parks (10-15 minutes) and as someone above said, having a rental car is the way to go. Universal/Islands of Adventures is about 15 minutes away on the I-4 which you can access about 1km from the hotel (yup Canadians). I managed to get lost several times but everyone is fairly forgiving of U-turns. The breakfast (free) is great although boiled eggs leave me a bit cold. Around 8 it gets busy but it opens at 7. There are free newspapers and being next to Old Town is a bonus. The time-share people are certainly here. But they can take no for an answer and they are helpful and basically nice people trying to make a living. Ashley helped me with directions (construction on the I-4) and even gave me her cell number in case I had any other questions. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toesmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel after reading the reviews here. Arrived June 22, 2006 for 3 nights. Great hotel for families. The elevators were slow but so what. The sofa bed wasn't too comfortable but the kids slept on it. Tipped the maid everyday & she left plenty of towels & the room was made up great each day. My daughter had the kiddie pool all to herself. The bartender at the pool bar was great. Walked to miniature golf & old town. I recommend this hotel to everyone. If we go back to this area we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “the good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 days at this hotel. Was impressed with the staff and the hotel. But guests were so very LOUD!! Lots of kids running around (literally) in the lobby and down the halls at all hours of the night. We had to change rooms once when our next-door-neighbors were screaming at their kids at 7:00 a.m. The staff was very understanding and accomodating. I realize we were in the heart of Disney World land, but, I personally observed the hotel staff ignoring children running around in circles in the lobby, pretending they couldn't see and hear the misbehavior. And while the breakfast was great (waffles, biscuits and gravy, French toast, eggs), it was so noisy and crowded in the breakfast room it was hard to enjoy it. I think this hotel, as nice as it is, should have some higher standards where noise is concerned. Maybe some designated, enforced "quiet hours" would be helpful. After long days in the crowds of the theme parks, it would have been nice to have some quiet enough to sleep at night. If you can catch this hotel with some more considerate guests staying there, you will have a great deal. Speaking of the theme parks, others have mentioned getting "caught" into the trap of the time-share salesmen. Don't be fooled by your "welcome pakage". You'll get some tasty banana bread, and a sales pitch for you to go to another hotel's breakfast to pick up your discount park tickets. If you have time for this, maybe it's worth it. The "personal concierge" assigned to you is really a salesman.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked through Expedia and was pleasantly surprised by the hotel. The hotel and the room were clean and well kept. The staff were courteous and helpful and the continental breakfast was first rate. We expected muffins and coffee. We got that, but also a variety of fresh fruits, boiled eggs, fresh waffels, hot oatmeal, gravy and buiscuits, cereals, yogurts and other choices. This is a great choice for families as it offers numerous selections to satisfy adults and childern of all ages. The hotel is minutes away from all theme parks and easily accessable. The pool is smaller than appears in the photos, but is well maintained and enjoyable. Disney is 10 minutes or less away. Worth the parking fee to get there and back faster than the shuttle can do it. Skipped the discount tickets from the concierge since we were uninterested in sitting through vacation package presentations to get them. Yes...we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Base for Orlando”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from an absolutely fantastic holiday, and what made it such an easy time was the base we stayed in. The Comfort Suites Maingate East behind Old Town, is very centrally based for all the theme parks and attractions, the staff were friendly, helpful and extremely polite. Each time we came back from a day out, the staff behind the reception always welcomed us with a hello. If any help was needed to get to anywhere, the reception staff were very easy to talk to. The rooms were very clean as was the rest of the hotel. This is definitely a hotel I go back to when I go back to Orlando for a holiday, and it is a hotel that I would highly recommend anyone staying in Orlando, if no other reason than to go into Old Town. Every Thursday night is the night for anyone who likes motrobikes as this night is Bike night. This is where bike owners from around Orland come and parade their machines up and down the main street. Every Friday and Saturday night is "Cruiser Night", this is very much in the same veign as Bike Night, but with cars of all sorts. All in all this area has plenty to do in the night as well as being an excellent base for the parks and other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. The staff there was overwhelmingly nice. We visited Disney world, May 26th through May 31st. If I had to choose a hotel all over again I would definitely choose Comfort Suites Maingate East. The breakfast bar was great, always stocked with fresh food and plenty of it. We had an AAA rate so the rate was not the normal rate. I searched every web site and no one person had a problem with this hotel. I'm, extremely picky about where I stay on vacation. Sure I know I won't spend as much time in the hotel room, but when I lay my head down I'd like to be able to have a clean place to lay. I can honestly say the place was clean with one of the best staff I've come in contact with. Dianne P.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - See Concierge timeshare warning”
Reviews.Author: acfoster
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a simple but a good option for staying at when visiting Disney. The rooms are clean, has friendly staff, breakfast is provided and has a nice pool / hot tub with towels supplied. Check in and check out also went smoothly for us. Disney is about 10 to 15 mins by rental car depending on the park you are visiting. The main problems with the hotel are: * Concierge - see below * Lifts are very slow and packed in the morning leaving you waiting for the next lift so get a room as close to ground floor as possible so you can use stairs if need be. * Can be noisy at times due to the closeness of old Kissimmee and its few ride attractions. That said there is a Pirates Cove mini golf right next to the hotel. So just get a room on the back of the hotel and you will be fine. * You get a lot of flyers pushed under your door. Don't use any of them especially the Pizza ones. They have well known names but are normally fraudsters after your credit card details or the pizza was made in a garage somewhere. I would note that the breakfast is not full English but more than Continental and the same every day so if you do not like muffins, cinnamon rolls and waffles you may get fed up of toast and egg but it does save you a lot of money. However you do have to pay a resort charge of $2 a day that really covers the breakfast. Concierge -------------- Concierge or should I say TIMESHARE salesman. Yep they help you take your baggage to the room give you a gift of cookies and then add on can we have a 15 min chat to check how good our service is. What they forget to mention is really that is 5% of the conversation the rest is trying to sell you into TIMESHARE. Our saleman MOE was fine but he never actually checked back with us during the holiday till it was sales pitch time. This was extra annoying because my mother in law had to bare the brunt of it rather than myself as she booked the hotel but we arrived a day early and agreed for her to meet MOE. Had they been upfront I would have been happy to just do the review section and avoid the sales pitch. We had already got our park tickets so we did not use any of these Concierge services but I think I would advise you to avoid them especially now you know they have an ulterior motive behind providing the service. Note other reviews state they gave vouchers and were not actually cheaper than buying at the park itself. General area points worth noting: * When you come to the hotel from the airport on 417 Toll Road the exit ramp booths need 2 quarters (exact change) so make sure you have change there are no dollar bill holes or ways to contact people for help. * Access to highway 192 and route 4 is currently restricted at Junction 64a/b. This means: ------------>Coming and going to Disney is unaffected on 192 ------------>You can head I4 east from 192 when going to Universal but when coming back I4West has no access to so use Gaylord hotel exit 65 ------------>Similiarly heading I4East from 192 when going to Tampa is closed but not when returning home. So overall other than concierge this hotel is a good pick. Hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: JW&DLM
Reviews.Content: What a Wonderful place to stay. We have just returned from a trip to Kissimmee and stayed at the Comfort Suites Maingate East. The staff except for the young man who checked us out (seemed bothered he had to work) was Wonderful. Laura at the front desk in the evenings was a GEM. She always had a smile and went far out of her way to help you any way she could. When you check in you are given a great deal of information about the area. Our room was extremely clean with abundant towels. There were no stains on the carpet and at night even though there were many children in the building, we only heard silence. We had a view of the wonderful pool and were on the 7th floor. There was never any wait for the elevators. It was a real plus to have a refrigerator and microwave in the room. There is even a small sink in the "kitchen" area. The room was very spacious and had a sofa sleeper and dining table. The internet worked every time we tried it. There were many lighting fixtures in the room so you can adjust the light to whatever level you choose. The breakfast buffet was really very elaborate. Donuts, cinnamon rolls, hot and cold cereal, biscuts and gravy, waffles, yogurt, muffins, juices, coffee, milk, mixed bananas and strawberries for your cereal or waffles, an assortment of teas, and more! Even though it is a large place with many guests there was always a place to sit. The dining area is nicely decorated. The pool was wonderful. It is so nicely landscaped and the pool is just the right temperature. I do not usually use the hotel pools but I could not resist this one. There was always enough seating around the pool. Since this hotel is off the main street (Route 192) it is very quiet at night. Overall, it's a TERRIFIC place to stay and quite a good value!!!!! Don't miss this one.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay and would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: all4won
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews over before we stayed here and have to say that some I can agree with 100%, while some were not true for us. The elevator was not slow for our entire six day stay. The continental breakfast of muffins, donuts, juice, cold cereal, coffee, tea, hot chocolate and sausage gravy with biscuits was only useful on the days when we stayed at the hotel to swim for the morning. It is not a suitable breakfast option for a full morning at the parks. The rooms were very clean as was the entire facility. The front desk was kind and helpful each time we spoke to them. Housekeeping was outstanding. A plugged toilet was fixed immediately. Extra items needed were delivered right away as well, for example, an extra blanket, kleenex and more shampoo. We are not high maintainence though what I have written makes us sound as though we are! My only disappointment was in the lack of a concierge. The front desk tried to send us to the "concierge" for information. In fact, the "concierge" was an employee of another resort. They may have had information to share, but they wanted us to do the 90 minute tour of their resort first. The big pool was OUTSTANDING. Perfect temp, clean as could be. Same for the large hot tub. Prices at the cabana were very reasonable , two dollars for a bottle of Coke. The pool is open 24 hours which is perfect for the late nights after a full day at the park. The halls are brightly lit. We stayed on the Old Town side and had no problem with lights or noise. Even on a Sat night. Lots of other families with children made for some fun new friends for our children, too. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: poppyland3
Reviews.Content: We spent the last 5 nights of our holiday here and we were very impressed with everything. Check in was quick and efficient with polite and friendly staff. The room was much much better than a lot of the other hotels on the 192, and not much more expensive.
