Breakfast is served between 7am and 10am, so we never had a problem getting a seat or running out of goodies. If I can remember the goodies, there were muffins, cinnamon rolls, toast, chocolate and plain waffles (with or without maple syrup) eggs, porridge, oatmeal and cereal, fruit juices, milk, tea, coffee and chocolate. Maybe more, but I can't think!! I agree with other comments here about the lifts being extremely slow, but since we were only on the 3rd floor we could happily use the stairs at busy times! Rooms were cleaned and tidied extremely well, and the bathroom bits (shampoos, conditioners etc) were plentiful and replaced every day. The rooms had a little kitchen area with fridge, microwave and kettle, but no plates or cutlery, so if you're tempted to make yourself a snack, just remember that you will have to take spare plates/cutlery from the breakfast room. (they are all throw away anyway) We didn't use the gym or pool but they looked good. My only niggle was the girl working in the pool bar, we only went the once because she made it clear that she would rather be talking to her mates at the bar than serving us. She made us the worst margaritas we'd ever had! So we didn't go back. I suppose if it had really bothered us we would have complained, but there were plenty of other places to go to so it was the hotel that lost out, not us! All in all it was a very good hotel and we would happily recommend it and we will be booking again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarrieWisconsin
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay in this hotel again. I stayed here for 7 days in may with my husband and 2 children 7 & 9. I did a lot of research using this site and it was very useful. The ONLY negative anyone had to say about this hotel is the elevators were slow. Which was true. But other than that, this hotel was absolutely perfect. The Continental breakfast saved us a lot of money on breakfast. It was a good start to the day. Some mornings it was crowded but there was always a place to sit down. The Pool was a nice size and heated. My kids loved it. There were always plenty of lounge chairs to sit on in the shade or sun. The hotel was very clean. There was always someone cleaning or touching up. One day, they had cleaners washing the windows. Another day, someone was touching up the paint on the walls. The area was very nice. Just off Hwy 192 next to Old Town, which was the nicest little strip. I loved walking thru Old Town at night. I felt very safe in this neighborhood. There were lots of families walking around there. It was easy to get to all the parks we wanted to. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Impressed”
Reviews.Author: davisaim855
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from 10 nights at Comfort Suites Maingate East. After reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, I chose to go with this hotel among many others on my short list. My family and I had been planning this vacation for months and I was very particular about chosing the best hotel for the money. My family and I could not have been happier! This truly did become our home away from home during our vacation. It is nestled back in a little alcove between Old Town and Pirates Cove mini golf. Even with the night life at Old Town, our hotel room was very quiet. We walked to Old Town on several evenings and played mini golf four or five times. The hot tub was excellent after the many long days at the Disney parks and our boys stayed in the pool for hours on the days we had nothing planned. We ate the breakfast buffet every morning which was excellent and saved us a ton of money. We ate at the pool bar once and the food was above average for a pool bar, I think. The housekeeping staff did a wonderful job, as others have already mentioned, with the cute shapes with the bath towels and arranging my sons' many stuffed animals (won at Old Town!) in different ways on the beds each day. Contrary to some other reviews, the front desk staff were very helpful, cheerful and always willing to offer help or a smile each morning. Yes the elevators were slow, but who cares? For the price I paid and the service I received, I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Orlando. Did I mention it took us 5 minutes to get to any of the Disney parks each morning? Considering the price of gas, that was a huge savings, too!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Loved it! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent in every possible way! It's very clean and spacious. The room (which could sleep up to 6 people without any extra person charge!) has all the amenities a traveller needs: toiletries, hair dryer, iron and ironing board, internet connection, a cable TV with pay per view movies, free local phone calls, a safe; a small kitchen with cabinets, coffee maker, a refridgerator, a microwave, and a small sink. The free breakfast in the morning is just great. They have lots of variety including fruits, boiled eggs, and a coffee bar. You can make your own capuccino or latte if you want to! I didn't use the pool but the food my brother brought back sure tasted great! I lived on the fifth floor and it usually took about 2~3 minutes for the elevator to come up. I met lots of nice people here. The housekeeping staffs were exceptional! Not only was everything cleaned throughly, they even organized and folded towels and tissue paper into those pretty flower shapes. The front dest people were very friendly and helpful. When I mentioned I had to check out early due to an early morning flight, they slid in an express checkout form with the receipt and documents so all I had to do was to make a phone call to check out. The morning calls were all made promptly every morning. As for the shuttle service, well, there were two drivers so it kind of varied. One was always on time and he always came into the breakfast area to announce his leaving time before he went and reminded everyone the different pick up times and places. The other driver was quieter and was late on two occasions, but both were no later than 20 minutes. There were about 5 drop off times and 5 pick up times. 2 to Magic Kingdom and 1 to every other Disney parks. In case you miss one, you can always get on the hotel shuttle first then use the Diney shuttle to get to the park you want to go. It only takes about an extra half an hour. Comfort Suites share the shuttle service with two other hotels so it takes about 30 minutes to get to Disney, but since we were always the first to get on the bus everyone here always had a seat! Overall the shuttle service is nice and appreciated. I stayed here for 9 days and I'd give it 6 out of 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal!!!”
Reviews.Author: pmcder9902
Reviews.Content: Was very satisfied with our stay. Here are the Pro's & Cons: Pros 1. Clean & cheap 2. Good continental breakfast of waffles, cereal, toast, donuts, bagels etc. 3. Tom the Bartender!! 4. Nice pool 5. Within walking distance to grocery store - 4-5 blocks 6. Room slept 6 (2 queens and one fold out queen couch) 7. Took IMMEDIATE care of shower problem Cons 1. No shuttle to/from airport - taxi about $50 2. Shuttle to Disney parks not frequent - we used taxi's twice to/from part $20 average 3. Computer/business center is kiosk based and TERRIBLE!!! Bring your own laptop as they have wireless 4. Elevators are SLOW!!! Ask for 1st floor room

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, but the staff is not so wonderful”
Reviews.Author: leepoffaith
Reviews.Content: After going through many reviews from both Kissimmee and Orlando I decided to stay in this Comfort Suites hotels. The reviews from this site were very good and I trusted that everyone was telling the truth. After staying there seven nights I would have to say that I made a great decision. The hotel is located right next to Old Town, but it is far enough away so you don't really hear the noise from there. It is also located right off Highway 192, but again it is far enough away from it that you don't hear any noise from the highway. It is very close to all the Disney properties and still fairly close to Universal and Sea World (About a 10 - 15 minute drive). If you are going to Internation Drive at all I would advise taking the back roads. They are not very crowded at all until you go past Sea World and it is much less stressful then having to use I-4 with every other tourist that doesn't know where they are going. I stayed in a room with 1 king sized bed and a sitting area. The room itself was just great. It was very roomy and came with everything one wants when staying in a hotel: A Small kitchen area (Microwave, Refridgerator, 2 cabinets and a small sink), High Speed Internet, Ironing Board and Iron, Hair Dryer, couch and coffee table. The bathroom is a very good size and ours even came with a removeable shower head (I'm not sure that all rooms have that). Over all the room was excellent and I would rate it a 5 out of 5. The housekeeping staff was also great. Our housekeeper, Ravza, was the best housekeeper I have ever had in a hotel. The first day we were there we put all of our tolietries on the counter. When we came back from the pool the next morning they were all organized on top of a towel and there was a cup lined with a washcloth with our toothbrushes in it. It was a wonderful surprise. Just a tip for other travelers, we tipped her about $2 dollars a day. I'm not sure this was why she did what she did, but It couldn't hurt. I would rate the housekeeping 6 out of 5 if I could :). The breakfast area is pretty good. They have doughnuts, bagels, bread, waffels and cereal every day. I can tell you though, i was sick of waffels by day 5. We always got down there between 7 and 8 and we never had a problem with finding a table. It seems to pick up later on though, so I would advise getting there early. The pool area is wonderful. We always arrived at the pool around 8:30 and left around 12 or 1. There were almost always chairs available the whole time we were there and the pool was not that crowded. The hot tub is huge and is very nice to relax in. It is set away from the pool and surrounded by bushes and trees. The pool was cleaned every morning and the tempurature was always very comfortable. The pool bar was also very nice, but I just wish it opened earlier. From what we could tell the pool always got very crowded later on in the day because of everyone coming back from the parks. We never used the shuttle, so I can't say much about that. We also didn't use the ticket booth in the lobby either. I would highly advise buying your tickets online before you come. There are not only cheaper then that booth, but you also get days free. For instance, I bought 2 tickets for Universal online from the Universal site and paid 120 or so. With each ticket I was able to go in and out of the park as much as I wanted for 5 days. You can't beat that. The ticket counter was not offering anything like that. Now we will go on to the front desk. We arrived at 11:30 am which was a bit early because check in is at 3:00 pm. I checked in and they said to come back in a few hours and they should have my room ready. I came back at 1:30 pm and it still was not ready. The lady at the counter was extremely rude and kept saying "Welll, check in is at 3:00 pm, and it is not our responsibiliy to have to room ready early." I had just driven 20 hours from Miwaukee and was so tired I almost jumped over the counter at the woman, but I didn't. I came back at 3:00 pm and our room was ready. Thourghout the week I had to complain about a few noisey kids in the hallway and they seemed to respond in a reasonable amount of time, but that first experience left a real sour taste in my mouth. The only other thing in the hotel is the small game room where my partner Kendall and I played a few games of air hockey. It seemed to have some up to date games, but I never saw a whole lot of people in there. Overall the hotel was just great and I plan on staying there again next year. The front desk staff should try and live up to their "Platnium Award Winning" customer service that they claim though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice-Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: MItchReece
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this Hotel. It was just as I expected from reading other reviews on this web site. It was close to all the Disney Parks. We made use of the Hot Tub every day and the Tiki Bar. It was a nice break to recharge your batteries for an evening out. Room was cleaned well everyday. Quiet at night. We did not utilize the continental breakfast. We went across the street to eat at Denny's almost every morning. Our son loved the pool. The Pool water was clean and the landscape was well tended. Elevators slow but we were on the third floor so we used the stairs--no problem. Every floor had a washer/dryer--$1 to wash and $1 to dry. The gift shop sold tide and bounce for $1 each. Very handy as we stayed six days. Front desk was nice and friendly. Would stay there again. Refrigerator in room --we stored our bottled waters in there. Very handy. Well, that is all. Our family was very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Derek & Gisela Huddleston. Karen & Jessica Taylor”
Reviews.Author: DerekandGisela
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a friendly well run hotel which is definately above its official star rating then look no further. My wife, daughter, granddaughter and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The Comfort Suites and would definately return. We upgraded to a Deluxe suite mainly to have the two bathrooms facility. The suite was spacious and immacuatley cleaned every day which was in keeping with the rest of the hotel. The queen size bed was very comfortable but the mattress of the sofa bed was rather thin. This and the sometimes slow elevators were our only minor complaints. The buffet breakfasts were very good although we did go to Perkins on acouple of occasions when we were not making an early start to go to the parks. The hotel is conveniantly situated for just about everything and would be surprised to find a place of better value. Many places list themselves as a hotel when infact they are no more than a motel. The Comfort Suites at Maingate East is certainly a HOTEL and we have no hesitation of recommending this as a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: vixx77
Reviews.Content: wow what can I say - this hotel is classed as a 3 star - i've stayed in worse 5 star hotels, yes it's that good. The staff are so friendly and helpful. The free breakfast was nice - plenty of variety. The hot tub was wonderful! The snacks from the pool bar were very tasty as were the cocktails! The hotel is very close to amenities, plenty of restaurants to choose from and Disney World is only 5 minutes down the road. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay at Comfort Suites!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned home (unfortunately!!) from our second visit to Comfort Suites. This hotel is fantastic! The rooms are spacious and very clean, breakfast is great, the pool and hot-tub a god-send after a busy day at the parks and all the staff are friendly and eager to help. Great location....just a few minutes walk to Old Town and shopping outlets and restaurants. If we could fault anything at all it would be the timetable for the buses to the parks...they didn't run as regularly as on our first visit and the Omni Tours buses have seen better days!! The MCO Express shuttles were good, though. Overall, this is a great family hotel in a great location. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Lynforde
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great! We stayed in the executive suite only because they gave away our standard suite. This is the one we would choose when we return again, Great master suite with separate living room area. Great internet connection! Very clean in all areas, breakfast was nice and the pool/hot tub were wonderful. We stayed here with our two young children who absolutely loved it. It's within walking distance to Old Town, mini golf and restaurants. Pool bar was a nice touch with reasonable drinks and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Great Location Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay. It is located just off the main Irlo Bronson Expressway so you don't get as much traffic noise as closer motels do. Old Town is right next to motel with many shops and eateries. Several shopping sites with-in walking distance accross from Old Town. Publix grocery store is 3 blocks down but kind of hidden, so ask for directions. Staff was very nice and kitchen help were super helping get free food to you. Pool and hot tub were clean and well cared for. It rains about every afternoon and the pool guy would go out and pick up stuff after the rains. Had a problem with leaking air conditioner. Maintanence guy came up with in 1/2 hour sucked up the water cleared a blockage and had it all fixed up in less than a half hour. Elevators are slow so it gives you a chance to chat with people from all over the world on the ride up. A great time to go is the second week of August. Florida k-12 schools startup that week so you will have a heck of a lot less people to contend with at the parks. Mostly European and Asian folk there on holiday from 1st of August through end of August. Fun to compare notes with them on they're lives and points of view by the pool. Shuttle service is limited. We would catch the early bus then use the trolly's from hotel to parks to get around. Make sure you study the Disney trolly system. When we would get tired we would call a taxi or go back to the Comfort Suites on the bus. Make sure you ask the bus guy where he is going so you don't get left. City transportation is pretty good from the Comfort Suites Maingate East. It's right in front of Old Town. You can go east a ways to go to Wal-Mart and other stores and a shopping center is a ways down. Best deal is the Orlando Magic Pass. Reduced rates on this hotel plus reduced rates on food and such. Lots of free couponbook to be picked,too. Use them to cut some of your meals and snacks from $1 off to 1/2 off the listed price. This is a super place with a great fun location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value!!! Would definitely stay there again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: becca01
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry, but you simply can not beat the value here! Yeah, the elevators are a little slow... but big deal! (We used the stairs most of the time, since we were on the 2nd floor.) We had no problem grabbing a luggage cart, and an elevator, when we first arrived (on a Monday night). We stayed four nights total, and everything was great. My husband was happy because he was able to get a good internet connection (wireless and ethernet), and was able to check in with work on his laptop. The $2.25 (I think that's what the charge is per day) covers internet and safe, so you might as well use them! The shuttle to Disney has a set schedule, and if you miss it (this includes delivery back to the hotel), you're SOL. So, we opted to drive and pay the $9/day that Disney charges for parking; this gave us more flexibility anyways. The pool was warm enough for us (hey, we're from Michigan... we label 60 degrees as a heat wave!). The days were hot (80 to 85 degrees.. we miss it already), but nights get pretty chilly. The hotel has a gift shop (we were able to purchase some batteries for my son's toy phone), and the front desk offered up a phillips head screw driver so that we could fix his toy. The front desk was VERY nice and extremely helpful. If you smile at them, they'll smile back. The lady who cleaned our room was terrific! Leave a couple dollars (tip) each day... they have a crappy job, and get very little appreciation for what they do. We try to behave the same way at a hotel that we would at home (not being pigs and picking up after ourselves). The breakfast was sufficient... hey, it's free! The waffles were great! I think you'd be hard-pressed to find the same amenities (free shuttle, free breakfast w/ waffles, gift shop, game room, coin-operated laundry, ice machines, heated pool, etc. etc.) for the same price! Anyplace else, approx. $90 a night would get you a dive! (Having the fridge and microwave in the room was very handy too.) We've stayed at a lot of hotels over the years, and this one actually lived up to our expectations!

Reviews.Title: “great locattion, make sure you use right credit card”
Reviews.Author: ferrettfish
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Comfort suites maingate east and enjoyed my stay. Place is clean. Staff on the whole friendly and for the money the resort is above average. If you want to book I strongly recommend you use the credit card that you originally book with. I planned on using my husband's card on check in as I had just cancelled my card because I lost it at the airport. As most resorts require you to pay once you arrive I did not think it would be a problem whatever way I paid. Unfortunately, as they had tried to authorise my card in the morning before my arrival, as the card was cancelled and therefore could authorise it they decided I had cancelled my stay. They could not contact my because I was on an airplane, so, rather than wait until I arrived they instead gave my room away. The front desk dealt with it in a professional manner, and luckily there was a room avaliable, however, this was only because someone else had cancelled as the hotel was pretty full. So my advice is that if you do need to cancel your card at short notice, ring the comfort suites with a different card straight away to avoid them cancelling you and arriving to find you have no room. They must be the only hotel chain to do this.. I know if you are a no show they will authorise payment at most hotels but to authorise it before you get there is a first for me I have learned my lesson..

Reviews.Title: “"Customer Serivce" is not their forte”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending a few days in Orlando and then on to a cruise so we were there for only a short time. They have a banner in their lobby boasting "Platinum Serivce Award" winner. It must have been the housekeeping or bartender service that the award was based on because it certainly wasn't for their front desk personnel. They relunctantly assisted us when we were checking in, (they got our reservations wrong and they blamed it on Expedia and made us feel guilty about using them), made us feel like we were interrupting something significant when we wanted a wake up call, and it obviously was a great imposition to them when we watned to check out. The biggest problem was regarding the shuttles. The website states free shuttles to the parks. What they don't tell you is that it only runs twice a day to select parks. The first day the shuttle was early. There was no announcement that it was there and when we went out to wait for it 10 minutes before it was scheduled to arrive we learned that it had already been there and left. This resulted in a $20 cab fare to the Magic Kingdom. On the Second day, we were waiting for it much earlier. Unfortunately, it was running late. This happens and we were being understanding however, when it was over 35 minutes late, we went to the front desk to find out when it would be arriving. The lady at the front desk informed us "It will be here and I'm tired of dealing with you!" This was pretty much the tone we received for our entire stay. Their front desk/gift shop personnel (which are one and the same) do not really have an understanding that their job is first and foremost customer service. As an HR Manager, this would not have been tolerated where I work. This was not platinum, gold, silver or even tin service. It was just plain rude. Beyond that, however, the hotel was nice, the rooms were kept very clean, the variety of food for the continental breakfast was good, the bartender was exceptional, and the variety of food offered from the pool bar was a surprise - and very very good. There are no bellman so be prepared if you have a big family and need to haul in lots of stuff. If management did a little 're-orientation' with their front desk personnel, the overall rating for this hotel would be at "Above Average" when considering the price. However, because of their extremly poor service, I wouldn't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “toilet brush found on tooth brushes”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed. Overall our the hotel appeared to be well taken care of. This opinion changed quickly when we found the toilet bowl brush left on our tooth brushes...yes you read correctly, disgusting. We realize this can happen at any hotel, but the hotel itself did not go out of its way to correct the situation. They did not respond to our compaint via Choice Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Just got back!”
Reviews.Author: cgreno
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week, and we were very happy with our stay! You won't be disappointed, unless you are expecting luxury without paying for it. We checked in very smoothly. We booked through an online agency, and paid in advance. We entered our room to find it very clean, and cool. It remained that way for the week. We would leave our room between 7 & 8 am, have breakfast, leave the hotel and return around 2 or 3 to find our room clean and cool. Our kids stuffed animals were arranged in a different way each day, which they loved! My only issue is that the bedding is like any other hotel chain I've stayed in. It's thin sheets, a valour blanket, and a bedspread. 6 pillows in the room, and the towels were as expected.. thin and bleeched white. However no complaints about cleanliness. I was impressed! Breakfast was the same thing all week. Having said that, it's included in the price of the hotel, so it was a great way to start our morning and get going. They have some tiny muffins, powdered donuts and cinnimon buns. There is bread and english muffins you can put in the toaster. They make waffles hot off the griddle, regular or chocolate! You can cover them in syrup, whipped cream & powdered sugar. They also have hard boiled eggs $ buiskets. Then, they have fresh fruit. I saw a big bowl of strawberries one day and peaches the next. Then they have 3 kinds of cereal, fruit loops, raison bran, and frosted flakes. Next, you can choose apple juice, orange juice, milk or ice water. They have blueberry or strawberry yoghurt, and regular & decaf coffee. You have to be able to find something you like there! There is more food than I'm describing and for a delux continental breakfast, you won't be disappointed. However you'll miss bacon or sausage by the end of your week. We ate there mostly around 7am, and it was easy to get breakfast and seat yourself. However a couple of times we went there around 8:30, and it was PACKED, the elevator was SLOW, and we could barely find a place to sit. Lesson learned. The only time I heard anybody complain about a slow elevator was at breakfast time around 8:30. I mean, come on, the place is jammed up with people trying to get some food in their belly, and they are grumpy having to wait for anything. The elevators are just fine. If you are expecting to press a button and have a door open right away, then forget it. You'll wait about 30 seconds. Big deal. I think the longest we waited in a week was about 3 minutes. The pool was great! The little mushroom pool was only up about a foot deep, and it was cool! My kids only got in that the first day. Then they got in the heated pool (which some days was warmer than the air at 75+) and they wouldn't get out! My 5 year old could stand up in the shallow end, but my 3 year old could only stand on the steps. However, the deep end is only 5'5" or so, so parents will find it easy towing around toddlers who like the water. The hot tub was really nice and refreshing, some days were hotter than others, the temp. fluxuated. It sure was nice getting into the hot tub after a long day at Disney! The games room was a great distraction at the end of the day. A couple of games my 3 year old could play, but I saw teenagers in there as well. There are probably 5 or 6 archade games in there, and it's right off the lobby. I never used the Disney counter, although they did pitch us a time share. No. Thanks. We used the laundry, and it was a great feature to have on the same floor. 4 quarters for a wash, and 4 quarters for a dry... although it usually took 8! Ice machines and drink machines on each floor too. We just drove down to Walmart/Target and picked up a 24 pack of bottled water, then froze it in the in-room fridge freezer. Great feature! Just a driving tip for anyone going within the next 6 months or so.... off the #4 hwy, the exit for the 192 is closed down, so map it out how to get back to your hotel from the #4. A little confusing, but if you have advanced notice, you can plan around it. Red Lobster, McDonald's, Burger King, Pizza Hut, and Old Town are a really short walk away, less than 5 mintues. I didn't feel any safety concerns about walking. We really enjoyed the miniput! Our little guy got a hole in one, and they almost threw him party! We were there 3 times. The easy course was great for my 3 & 5 year olds, they loved it! There are tons of restaurants and shopping stores very close by, if you have a car. Just take a drive down the 192, and you'll find something you like. We would stay here again. Bottom line for us is, we got up, got breakfast and got out. We came back around 2 or 3 pm for a swim and re-charge, and left again until 7 or 8 pm. We didn't spend TONS of time in the room, but that's not what we came to Florida to do anyways. I really hope this helps some people out!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased--Family of 5”
Reviews.Author: Cami40
Reviews.Content: We just got back from FL and stayed at this hotel from 3/5-3/13. Our room was a 1 room suite, which meant 2 queens and a sofa bed. One TV, refrigerator, microwave (which cooked our popcorn perfectly), hairdryer and in room safe which appeared to be broken so we did not use it. We had 2 adults and 3 kids, 4, 9 and 13. The two younger kids shared one bed, my husband and I the other and our 13 year old slept on the sofa, but she did not unfold it to make it into a sofa bed. Other reports have said the elevators are slow, I wouldn't say "slow" but there are 7 floors and only 2 elevators so it was quite busy at times. The pool was heated, not terribly warm, but definitely heated. I never used the hot tub. I used the washers and dryers (one of each is located on each floor by the elevator). They cost $1.00 each per cycle. My best advice is don't try to dry heavy clothes, they take forever!! Apparently detergent is available in the gift shop but I bought my own at a nearby Target. The breakfast buffet was okay. We stuck to mini muffins and cinnamon rolls. They also had cereal, hard boiled eggs, waffles, yogurt, applesauce and more. To drink they had coffee, 2 percent milk, orange juice, apple juice, water and I'm not sure what else. Housekeeping was very good, our 4 year old got the stomach flu so they had a lot to deal with. It was odd though that the last Sunday we were there they hadn't come by 2pm and then on Monday they knocked on the door at 8:35 a.m. ?? Guess they were eager to get rid of all traces of us. I was only disappointed in one thing. They tout that they are within walking distance of Old Town, and indeed they are, but it is not a short walk and not one that I would take alone or just with my kids. We never went there. There is a Ponderosa, McDonald's, Burger King, Pizza Hut and KFC all very close. We ordered room service from the bar twice, they closed at 10 or it would have been 3 times. I liked the grilled cheese, the kids liked the chicken nuggest, my husband liked the fish, my 4 year old did not like the pizza and neither my husband nor myself liked the hamburger at all. I'd avoid it in the future. We would not hesitate to stay here again. It was pretty conveniently located and had just enough room for us.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Clean”
Reviews.Author: golden40
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the beginning of February. Basically everything was great! The first week we stayed in Disney and I have to say, if you are doing Disney . . . staying in Disney would be better. I don't think that staying off-site, that you really can get the full "Magical" effect/experience of Disney. Personally, I would never stay off-site if I was doing Disney. The flexibility that you have, to come and go from the parks is unbeatable! But, for the second week, when doing Universal, Seaworld, it was okay. Even though the rooms were extremely clean, spacious, the pool was always warm (even on cool evenings, my son was in the pool), and the staff were great, I think next time I'd stay closer to International Drive, as I didn't really care for the drive every day. The elevators were a bit slow, but you're on vacation - can't believe that anyone would find that to be an issue?

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed the Comfort Suites”
Reviews.Author: garycvh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Maingate East with my wife and two girls from 2/25/06 - 3/1/06. We had a very nice stay. We spent each day at Walt Disney World. Our room was clean, comfortable and roomy. The location for going to WDW and exploring the 192 strip was very convient. The pool was warm and there was always towels by the pool. The breakfast was good. It had the usually complementry breakfast stuff. I do have to agree with other reviews that the elevators are slow. Our room was on the third floor so we used the stairs alot, which was just fine. The desk staff was helpful enough. The pool bar did have a small selection of food that was so so. When booking a room, use the Orlando Card that is free you can obtain from the Orlando Convention and Vistor Bureau. We were able to obtain a rate of $79.00 a night for a regular suite. This hotel is a darn good value. We would stay here again and recommend it to friends and families.

Reviews.Title: “attitude”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: have been staying for lasy five years lovedit but this year had attitude problems with girl anna at front desk and another employe who yelled at my two daughters who were in the gift shop buying something he threw them out because i was not in their with them but i was standing in doorway said some thing to him he gave me attitude and walked away themn I checked in at 3:30 and room was not ready was supossed to be ready at 3:00.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 nights (Feb 19th - 27th) and had no problems. The pool was warm even on a very cool night. The hottub was nice. The landscaping around the pool was pretty. The hotel was clean - especially the lobby bathroom - spotless! The room carpeting is not spotless, but OK. The cleaning person made roses out of the washcloths and gave us extra towels. While this is not a luxury resort, it gives a "resort" impression for people on a budget. What was a big surprise was how easy it was to get to Seaworld and Magic Kingdom - no big traffic tie-ups. Plan route on map - you need to go on several roads though. Even a hospital was nearby - our daughter had a high fever. Breakfast was as described previously. OldTown seemed noisy, but couldn't hear it in room. We would stay again although I'd love to stay at Animal Kingdom!

Reviews.Title: “n feb”
Reviews.Author: leonard-TRIP
Reviews.Content: we arrived feb 19 for 1 week stay. I had phoned earler in feb requesting upgrade to a king suite which was not available at that time, but upon arrival they had earlier noted this on my reservation was able to upgrade. I found the front desk friendly (not like previous post) Yes, I found elevator slow , but same as any busy hotel. Pool was heated, breakfast good, Rooms Large , clean, Quiet, No problems would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “people were rude”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry to say that we did not get past the front desk. We made our reservations through Venere who gathers information to help you make your decision. I had a confirmation number and everything but had not guaranteed with a credit card because their site said it was not necessary if arriving before 6pm. When I got to the desk they could not find my confirmation then the owner came over and was very rude saying that they got the reservation but did not hold it. There was no reasoning with him. The hotel looked ok but it was not what I expected when arriving. We ended up riding for three hours trying to find a room because there was so much going on in the area. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Easily confused with Comfort Suites Maingate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I wonder if Itchy is confusing Comfort Suites Maingate East with the Comfort Suites Maingate. These are very different hotels. The reason why I ask, is that Comfort Suites Maingate East is not that old of a hotel. Also, when Itchy said the room was tight, that does not fit with the Maingate East location. I believe that their most basic room is quite large. Just curious. It would be easy to confuse the two. It has been a while since I stayed in this hotel, over a year ago. When my family of 4 was there, we loved it! We have stayed here a total of 3 times. Comfort Suites Maingate East had a lot of bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Find”
Reviews.Author: aiki4me2
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice property, particularly for the price. I go to the Orlando area once or twice a year for more than 10 years and I have stayed in many hotels. The Comfort Suites is perfect for the business traveler and families as well. At minimum I look for a free internet connect and a decent breakfast buffet. This hotel delivers that and much more. It is clean, has a nice pool, small fitness center and free parking. The continental breakfast is quite good, although I agree with other reviewers that it could use a meat item. Everything else was quite good. I did not run into any of the noise problems -- my room was quiet and well maintained. I highly recommend it and I will be back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Comfort Suites Maingate East and it was absolutely great! It was a very clean, quite and inexpensive place to be. "Old Town" is right next to it with it's many shops and the weekend car shows and carnival. The breakfast is probably one of the best we have ever had in a hotel. Would we stay again....sign us up!

Reviews.Title: “itchy.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had your basic room , on the first floor. We called for more linens at 4 pm never rcvd them. The toilet wobbled alot, it was not attached securely to the floor. The room was very tight as well as the bathroom.There was a dehumidifier we were not told about in our room.It was full and after we emptied it the heat it gave off was too much for the a/c. We were hot all night. The furniture literally fell apart or could not be opened. We had bug bites on us that did not leave for days and we were very itchy. There was previous guest hair in tub. Smell of mold and mildew was very bad. We stayed one night ,New Years Eve 2005. If we had booked it longer we would not have stayed. We travel to the disney area atleast twice per yr. I would warn people against it. We were not asked how was our stay at check out and I believe it was because they knew.We were also charged $2.50 extra at check in per night that we were not made aware of at time of booking. They called it a hotel fee and could not explain what the charge covered. I am sorry , this was a bad stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: jak000
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 4 nights. Overall, we had a good stay at this hotel. When we checked in, the non-smoking room we got (4th floor) smelled like smoke, so I went to the front desk where they gave me another room, also on the 4th floor, and informed me that half the rooms on the 4th floor used to be smoking and the hotel is in the process of doing away with all their smoking rooms. How they do this is by spraying the smoking rooms until they no longer smell like they used to be smoking. Our second room smelled less like smoke, but still smelled. So I went again to the front desk and asked to be given a room on a different floor. That room did not smell like smoke at all. The room was very nice and roomy with two queen beds, a sleeper sofa, fridge, microwave, coffee maker and sink. The complimentary breakfast has many options to choose from: waffles, mini doughnuts, hard-boiled eggs, grits, oatmeal, yogurt, cereal and toast to name a few. Good choice for the price.

Reviews.Title: “very impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed here for 2 weeks at the starting of december with our 2 children. the rooms were very clean but i do have to agree with some people about the staff at the front desk, they were not the friendliest. we were also not very happy that 6 nghts out of the 14 that we stayed the hot tub was not working and when you would go to ask about it noone seemed to know anything (when it was going to be fixed or even that it was not working). the breakfast was very handy and did save us alot of $. we rented a car which i think is a must and it was very easy to get to the parks. the elevaters are very slow but i think that is because you need to repush the button once it is on the floor again not sure why but if you pay attention to when the light goes off and repress the button the door opens faster. during our stay the fire alarm was pulled in the middle of the night, i understand that it has nothing to do with the running of the hotel but after the fire trucks came noone even came out to tell us that it was a false alarm and we could go back in i think that managment should take a look at this. all and all we loved it and will definatley stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the money”
Reviews.Author: agirlinfin2004
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon. We lucked out and were at the end of a hallway. I think this place attracts families with their kids. One night I woke up because the baby next door was crying. Kids are kids...Like others have said the elevator is slow. The free breakfast is good, and helps you save money for other meals in the day. The staff wasn't super friendly but they let us check in early. The location of the hotel is great...food places and small shopping area. Good deal for the money

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great rooms, great location - keep it a secret !”
Reviews.Author: gmanning50
Reviews.Content: Even for a couple like ourselves, who like quiet, this was a well built hotel - the only noise we heard was from the halls. Yes, alot of families and kids there, but not like a holiday inn or howard johnson's. great breakfast ! our room was very clean and mgmt was great whenever we needed them. keep it quiet or everyone will go there ! :)

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: bluebells26
Reviews.Content: We are a party of two adults and three children having just returned from two weeks at this hotel. This hotel did live up to all our expectations mainly based on reviews we read. Our room was clean and spacious even for five with excellent daily housekeeping. Staff at the front desk were always helpful. The breakfast offered a fairly wide choice including cereal, yougart, fruit and toast. Our children loved the heated pool and hot tub (which certainly was hot) and at this time of year both facilities were very quiet. We ate only twice from the poolside bar and although the menu is basic the food was fine. The hotel is right beside Old Town which is interesting and quirky. We spent an enjoyable evening there on the fairground rides. The hotel is ten minutes away by car to all the main Disney parks. Florida was our dream holiday, so we researched thoroughly our accomodation and I have to say we were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have 4 adults & 2 children stayed for 3 nights and cost me more around US$110 per night during the Christmas on 25th, 26th, & 27th. I believe it is a little too much for the price I paid because of the following reasons: - When I just check in, it already found the problems from sink and and toilet. First the toilet couldn't flash and the kitchen sink' water couldn't go away. We need to call the front desk to have these problems fix it. We just didn't expect these kinds problems when they said they are 2003 winner. - Bathroom towels are in a bad quality, it has been use for many times or many months didn't change it. You better bring your own towel if you select this hotel. - The breakfast just in the average, not what they said the deluex breakfast and the staff ask me did I come from outside, this is a little surprise to me becasue she said some people from outside (not the hotel guest) actually came in the resturtant to use their breakfast. And I ask her "Should I show my room key to identify meself? She said what their manager want they to do and make sure nobody eat in the resturtant from outsider. Well, I believe this is totally not acceptable with the price I paid and the service what I get.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CBTOURIST
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in nov. Great location and nice rooms. Well maintained and courtous staff. Pool was nice and great breakfast. I couldn't go wrong for the price. Paid $70.00 Cdn. per night. Well worth it. Close to old town. After staying at other Hotels in the Orlando/Kissimmee area, this is 1 of the best. Stay here you will enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: BillRBirmingham_AL
Reviews.Content: My wife and two girls (8 and 5) stayed in mid December for 4 nights. We found out about this hotel from TripAdvisor and noticed the high scores and low price. We weren't sure about the hotel as we normally spend more but we thought we'd give it a try. The hotel was very quiet and clean. Our room was very large. A pleasant surprise was the fitted sheets on the bed!!! We didn't have to battle the sheets coming off during the middle of the night and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel is near several eating establishments on 192. It only took us 10-15 minutes from door to door to each of the Disney parks -- and most of that time was driving in the large Disney parking lots! Only complaint was that the elevators were a little slow. They have two but should have put in 3 when they built the hotel. Last year we spent 4-5 nights at the Swan and had a great time. However, we couldn't justify the price given that most of our time was spent in the parks. Overall, this was an excellent value -- not the Swan but not at cost of the Swan.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for a younger crowd...”
Reviews.Author: MShanNYC
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews from this site, my boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 8 nights in the beginning of September. I got a rate of only $60 per night, through Choice Hotels lowest rate guarantee on their website. Expedia had a lower rate, so Choice gave me that rate plus 10% off, I believe. As for my boyfriend and I, we are both 24 years old, and from NY. This hotel was geared more towards families with children, as far as decorations, amenities, etc... The pool/hot tub were open 24 hours, which was great! It was very quiet the whole time we were there, and yes, the elevators were HORRIBLE!! We were on the top floor, so we wasted a lot of time waiting for elevators! It was within 15 minutes driving distance to all the parks, and we even visited Medieval Times, which was right down the road! There is a Chili's, and various other restaurants within a few minutes drive. McDonald's is across the street, if you prefer that sort of thing. Old Towne was certainly not what I expected it to be, and therefore, we did not visit. (More like a carnival type thing)It was interesting though, if you have a room facing Old Towne, to watch the crazy people on the Bungee Swings. Overall, the hotel is not bad. Very good for the price! I only made it to breakfast twice, and everything was gone and/or cold! I would recommend this hotel for those going to both Universal and Disney, because it is right in the middle of both! The room was very clean, and housekeeping was great!! Plenty of extra towels, which were greatly needed becuse the tubs collect a lot of water around the edge!! The fridge and microwave were very clean as well. They had free internet access in the rooms, and we had no problem connecting our laptop. I have stayed at the Disney's All Star Music Resort, and overall, I have to say that this one was a lot better (if you have your own car that is)!

Reviews.Title: “how supurb was this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 2sisters
Reviews.Content: like many other people chose this hotel based on customer reviews, star rating, free breakfast, shuttle transportation to theme parks as we were without a car) It was supurb, large rooms, comfortable beds, great house keeping, most of the staff friendly - thanks John (from reception) and Tanya (dysney desk). Will definately stay here again if ever we visit. Orlando beautiful handy having old town so close.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We're from Belgium and we've chosen this hotel upon the reviews. The hotel was very clean, staff was helpfull, good choice of breakfast especially when you travel with children. Large rooms and very clean every day. Close to all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First off, let me thank everyone here for their largely accurate and very helpful reviews of this property ... we just finished a week's stay and found it highly enjoyable with only a couple of small gripes. The high points: 1. Our room was as advertised, large and with all suite amenities (fridge, microwave, etc.) Cleaning staff were very friendly and thorough enough, with one small exception (see below). 2. Price ... averaged $72 a day, well worth it for the quality and location (it's right off Irlo Bronson Highway - Route 192) and a short 5 minute trip to Disney. 3. Pool was great, ice and laundry were convenient, deluxe continental breakfast was great for park days, even had the classic "biscuits & gravy" on the buffet a couple of times. Really saved some $ by only eating breakfast out three times in 7 days. 4. Overall an excellent stay at this terrific hotel. Two minor negatives ... and they are very minor, but nonetheless irritating. 1. We were charged almost $9 for three uncompleted in-state long distance calls ... our party didn't answer and there was no answering machine pickup. 2. As I was setting up the room for our stay, I happened to plug in an electrical device behind one bedside table and found two small articles of clothing from a previous guest behind it. Not sure how long they'd been there, but it made me question how long it had been since the room had been given a deep cleaning. Daily service was fine, but I still wondered. All in all however, as long as you don't mind a LOT of kids around you, this is a tremendous place to stay and a terrific value in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just completed our stay at this hotel for the second time. We stayed here four years ago and remembered the great place that it was. I knew if I came back, this is where we would stay. No need to even look at other hotels. We stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of our 10 day vacation. We left the area for 3 nights and then came back to the area but was unable to reserve a room at this hotel. We stayed just down the road at another Choice hotel (Quality Suites Maingate East) and it was horrible. For my next trip I'll be sure to book early. The rooms are very clean, the staff is friendly and housekeeping is very accommadating. This is by far the best hotel for the location and pricing. I'll definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: thewiganer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Comfort suites for two weeks during mid october 05. Good Points 1. Rooms good size and well equipped with coffee maker, safe,iron/board, hairdryer,toiletries, clean towels, fridge etc 2. Breakfast included although continental,plenty choice. With complimentary tea/coffee all day in lobby and at breakfast.Good pizza/resturaunt Flippers nearby-massive pizzas!!! 3. Internal corridors. Handy during Hurricane Wilma!!! Able to use all facilities whilst storm going on outside. 4. Nice pool and hot tub which kids used a lot. 5. Excellent transport to everywhere!! In car movies in mini bus and great drivers on disney coaches.You don't need to drive if you stay at this hotel. This is our second visit to Florida and we have never driven. Bad points 1. Old town is a little sleazy, especially when there at night with kids. 2. Eateries nearby tend to be fast food places i.e K.F.C, Mc Donalds, Pizza Hut, Ponderosa. Missed our favourite Golden Corral althought found one up near Universal Studios (was within walking distance as we didn't drive). 3. Virgin welcome meeting was at another hotel and we were expected to find it ourselves. When we did find a meeting in Downtown the horrible American rep refused to give us our free meal because we were late but was quick to take our money when we wanted to buy something from him.VIRGIN YOU WONT BE GETTING ANY COMMISSION OFF US NEXT YEAR. We will book trips on our own!! Also Virgin never contacted us regarding the Hurricane which hit. But then again the Hotel didn't give us much advice either. Perhaps they didn't think it was a big deal but it was the first one we encountered-it wasn't too bad. All in all a great holiday, have booked in a Disney Hotel for next year for that touch of luxury but this is a bargin and well worth it as you can see none of the bad points are directed at the hotel.Ignore people who tell you that you need a car, we have never driven and dont intend to. Its lovely having someone chauffer you around-you are on holiday for Gods sake!!!.If you want to go shopping get a hotel shuttle to Seaworld which drops you off at the I-Ride trolley bus stop on the parking lot at Seaworld. You then have a choice of Premium outlet Shopping Mall (our favourite) take trolley bus heading south or Prime outlets -a little more spread out (take trolley bus north)? stop 11(ask driver) all stops have a map so it's easy to find what you want and it's only a dollar each for adults and kids ride free. We love Florida, the shopping, the dining, the parks and the people.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm a business traveler and stay in 4-5 star hotels around the world. While this is no 5 star hotel, I'm not paying a 5 star price either. My rate was $63/night for a very pleasant 'suite' room that was large enough for my companion and I. I decided to take a chance on this hotel and was pleasantly suprised as the facility is a classic Florida tourist hotel that is very clean and friendly. While we were just two people, there were many families in the hotel (we saw them at breakfast - which is included) so I'm guessing these large rooms would accomodate families with no problem. The hotel is very close to all the parks and within walking distance to downtown Kissimmee. I'll be back - especially if I could get the $63/night rate again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: VictoryInJesus
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and loved it! With the Orlando Discount card, the room is only $64 a night. You can order the card online or print a copy of it if you need it right away. We stayed here FREE for 2 nights, because I applied for a credit card which gave me enough points for 2 FREE nights! The room was very clean, which was important to me. The beds were very comfortable, the room was quiet, and we had a view of the rides, lit up at night at Old Town. I would recommend going to Old Town in the day instead of at night. We walked through at night and didn't like it at all! If you have young children or are Christians like we are, you won't like all the drinking going on at night. People are walking around with mixed drinks and beer in their hands, even in the shops. The breakfast was very good and they had a good variety. They had cereals, donuts, muffins, hard-boiled eggs, juices, milk, and waffles which I loved, especially with their strawberry and banana topping. The pool was also very nice, which my 14 year old son enjoyed a lot. The hot tub was nice after the long day at the park! We took advantage of the FREE shuttle service. The bus doesn't leave until 9:20am for EPCOT, but after talking to the very nice lady (Gilda) at the Disney counter in our hotel, I found out we could take the Magic Kingdom bus at 7:55am and then take the monorail to EPCOT. This worked out great, because we arrived at EPCOT 9AM, just when they were opening. The shuttle was nice, because we didn't have to pay $9 in parking. We ate at the Biergarten Restaurant in Germany (World Showcase in Epcot), this was an all-u-can-eat buffet. Delicious! Only $15.99 for adults, $7.99 for children during the lunch ( 11am until 3:45pm), after which goes up $5 more per person for the same meal. Gilda, at the Disney desk, at the hotel made Priority Seating reservations for us. I was very happy that we made reservations, because there was a 30-40 minute wait, but we only had to wait 5 minutes! We used the Disney service at the hotel, but already had our tickets. The hotel is right off 192 (sits back from the road), so it's close to I-4, lots of shopping spots, and plenty of places to eat. My husband, son, and I loved staying here and when we come back to Kissimmee we don't have to look any further than staying here at the Comfort Suites Maingate East!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Being a regular traveller to Florida my wife and I always spend at least a week of our holiday in the Kissimmee area. We have probably stayed at over a dozen hotels in 192 area and I can honestly say this is by far the best we have visited. It is well run and well maintained with friendly staff throughout. Even when one of the lifts broke down the cleaning staff were more than willing to take you to the service lift. I won't require to spend time reviewing hotels for my next holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Will Return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week stay. Great location. Clean. Affordable. Close to all attractions. The FREE continental breakfast was a huge plus and money saver. Nice variety of food, beverages. We will definitely stay here again when we return to Kissimmee, and recommend this hotel to family, friends, and to you!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place”
Reviews.Author: lakecity21
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel. The rooms were very clean, spacious and inviting. The beds were nice and comfortable. Housekeeping did a great job keeping the rooms clean. The continental breakfast was excellent with waffles made from scratch along with everything being fresh. The only complaints I would have is that the elevators weren't working properly, it can get noisy in the hallways, and they weren't really suites. They had a mini refrigerator, sink, cabinets, and a microwave, but no stove and no counter space. Other then that I would say this place is a good value especially since it is conviently located near restaurants, shopping and the theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “great price, great area, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we just came back from our Disney trip and we stayed at the comfort suites maingate east. The hotel was clean, the staff was very nice and overall we would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: HollyLovesMrTumble
Reviews.Content: Having decided to come to Florida for 2 weeks I made a point of exploring this site as well as some of the standards and came up with the Comfort Suites. I was encouraged by the ratings it received on this site (and also Expedia) and I managed to get a great rate through HotelsmartUSA. I was very pleasantly suprised with the quality of the hotel particularly when you consider the price for a 2 week stay. I was very pleased we had a car because although the Old Town is close by and there are some nice eating places on the 192 it does get very humid in the evenings and it was nice to have an air conditioned car to go to eat in! I don;t know what previous complainers were moaning about the lifts for. Other than the few days that one was out of order I found them fine. The housekeeper was excellent and the counter service was on the front desk was the same - with a couple of exceptions - and I have to especially mention Flora who was brilliant. A bit disappointed with the bar by the pool which was pretty dead at night and it was a shame there was nowhere inside you could get a drink. Overall I think the hotel represented excellent value for money and it is only 10-20 minutes away from all of the parks.

Reviews.Title: “very impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 3 granddaughters to Disney,they are ages 2,8 and 8 1/2. The rooms are very clean and spacious. We swam in the pool and it also was very clean and large and was available to guests 24hrs. Plenty of parking and close to Disney. We drove so we did not use the shutlle. The staff was pleasant. Continental Breakfast was somewhat limited but great for kids and OK for a short stay and it was free. We have 3 more grandkids to take to Disney and will definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great deal!!!”
Reviews.Author: bryson2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7 days and had a lovely stay. The price was great and the rooms were tidy and clean. The breakfast was okay but one can't complain as you are not paying for it anyway. Great way to save some money if you are traveling with kids. Close by to all the attractions and millions of places to choose for dining. The pool was very nice sized and it was great that it was open 24 hours. The kids loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PearceFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 weeks from the 29th July 2 adults and 3 children. Very good location for Disney Parks and only 20 minutes by car to Seaworld/Universal. Also ideal for eating out with numerious restaurants within walking distance. Free breakfast was good quality and we always managed to find a table even at busy times. Rooms were large and clean and room service very good. Poolside restaurant was ideal for snacks after visiting parks. We had a car so did not experience the free shuttles, but did use the shuttle to Busch Gardens which departs from old town a short walk away. Pool always clean and open 24hrs. Only downside were the front desk and breakfast staff who we found a bit unfriendly and didn't seen to smile much. We would certainly recommend this hotel for anybody who wishes to stay offsite from the parks and found it ideal for familes with young children.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights. The room had more than enough room for my family (1 adult & 3 kids). The 24 hour pool is awesome. Our housekeeper, Noolita, was terrific. After long days of running around, the kids would actually run back to the room “to see how she set it up this time!” The continental breakfast is ok. It has more choices than the average hotel. The waffles aren’t actually “made to order”. There’s a pile of waffle quarters, and you can add butter, strawberries & bananas, whipped cream, or maple syrup. On the weekends they also have biscuits and gravy. There was no wait for the laundry room on my floor. On the downside, the elevators (two for the entire hotel – yikes) are incredibly slow. The game room and gift shop are very small. Most of the front desk staff could try a little harder. It’s well worth the price. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “rooms are a great size”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel while visiting Disney. Started as 2 adults and 3 children (5,6, & 19). Brother and sister-in law decided to join us and were unable to get an additional room, so they stayed in our room. Actually there was enough room for all with the addition of a portable cot (we provided). Didn't think the original 5 of us would be comfortable in a standard hotel room. Upon reading the reviews about this hotel I figured we would give it a go and I wasn't disappointed. Also have to note large size for the bathrooms. Though I do agree with the comments regarding the slow elevator and not so friendly desk staff (they screwed up our reservations). Plenty to offer at breakfast, lots of restaurants near by. Recently have stayed at a few other hotels (PA, CT, & MA) for business and none can compare.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 week vacation in Orlando. Our group of 5 (2 adults, 3 children) stayed at this hotel for the entire time and have nothing to complain about. Sure the elevators are extremely slow, but amazingly they have these things called stairs that you can take instead. For anyone complaining about the breakfast that they put out, go somewhere else! The staff work hard to put put out an excellent breakfast with a little bit of something for everyone. No there is no meat, but hey, there's a multitude of of restaraunts within walking distance. The housekeeping on 2nd floor was excellent. Our lady really enjoys her job and would rearrange our stuffed animals every day. It was a joy to come back after a day at the theme parks to discover where the animals would be. Our room was always spotless and we certainly had nothing to complain about. The hotel is a very short drive from Universal, SeaWorld and Disney and a couple of blocks from Old Town. The pool was always at a decent temperature and you could go in it any time. If you are looking for a nice clean hotel (remember that this is not a 5 star so don't expect it to be) for a decent price, friendly staff and fair sized rooms, then look no further than the Comfort Suites Maingate East.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel, close to Old Town and Disney. Rooms were very clean!

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked through Magicard and were a little hesitant at what we would receive. We were plesantly surprised! Our initial booking was for 3 nights and we liked it so much, we extended our stay for 3 more nights. We booked a King room and got a King suite with 2 completely separate rooms and 2 bathrooms. It was really great. It took some doing since they were really full, but, the night manager was able to go ahead and give us the same room, at the same great price, for the additional 3 nights. We had family that we wer initally going to stay with for the other 3 nights and instead, invited them to come and spend some time with us at the Hotel. Anyone wanting a great value, especially for families, this is a great place to stay. The breakfast that was included was wonderful, waffles with strawberries and bananas for topping, and whipped cream, chocolate waffles were a surprise after a couple of days, fresh fruit, sausage and biscuits on the weekends, several kinds of cereal, various pastries, applesauce, oatmeal, bagels, juice, etc. Really a good value for our money. Also, there were many places to eat within walking distance along with Old Town as a nice change of pace.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Patty07
Reviews.Content: Choose this hotel based on previous reviews on TripAdvisor. The good selection of breakfast, spacious and clean rooms, slow elevators are all true. Only personal negative comment is regarding the front desk service. During check-in, the lady at front desk was rude and unwelcoming. When passing us our rooms keys, she very rudely said " Well, TAKE IT!". When I asked for the receipt, she accused me that I had already taken it and didn't apologize when she found it next to her computer. During our stay, I would be apprehensive to ask for help if this particular lady was at front desk, in fear that she would refuse us service or quickly dismiss our concerns. However, the rooms were always clean, the pool was nice and the shuttles were money savers. Old Town was a great way to spend Friday nights. Damon's restaurant in Old Town served great food. Tip to travellers is to flip through the coupon books found in the hotel lobby. There are many discount coupons and free appetizers which can save travellers some money if dining in the neighborhood. In addition, I found a cheaper hotel rate online for $79 and the Comfort Suites website was able to not only match but beat this fare by 10%. If you can find a cheaper rate on the web, they will beat it by 10%. Do your research...it can payoff!

Reviews.Title: “well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: backtothefuture
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Suites are in a great location beside Old Town and shops and restaurants. The rooms are large and comfortable and very clean. Breakfast was included and was tasty and more than adequate. I would recommend this hotel for people on a budget who are looking for good value. I would certainly stay here again with my family.

Reviews.Title: “I'm picky but this hotel was great!”
Reviews.Author: Now_Picture_This
Reviews.Content: Comfort Suites Maingate East Address: 2775 Florida Plaza Blvd, Kissimmee, FL 34746 We stayed here 7/13-7/14 after reading the great reviews here. Super friendly staff, CLEAN rooms that didn't stink (and I have the nose of a bloodhound), great warm pool, nice breakfast, free shuttle service to Disney and Universal and only 2 miles from Disney. Also, the hotel is within walking distance to the "Old town" where the streets are closed off with great shops, food, and rides, etc. We booked our reservations through hotelmartusa at $79 a night for two queen beds and a sleeper sofa. But to our suprise when we arrived, our rate was only $64! Loved it! Loved it! Loved it from a very picky person!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: just arrived back to england after staying in the comfort Suites Maingate East for two weeks with my wife and three kids this is the best yet have been coming to orlando now for the last 6 years trying different hotels and locations (i-drive) etc but at last we need to look no more this is a fab place to stay five mins walk to old town loads of places to eat which u can walk to ie kfc, b/king, macdonalds, red lobster etc etc rooms were spotless even the bathrooms were spottless no funny smells of mold etc room service first class i could go on all day about the hotel so stop worrying if u have all ready booked u will have a great time and if u are still thinking about booking just do it this place is great steve!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, nice price”
Reviews.Author: Ivanova
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 3 night stay at this hotel and I can tell it was OK, rooms are big and clean( we were 2 adults and 2 kids), the pool and kiddie pool was very nice and so were the drinks at the bar. ( The staff gave us 2 for 1 coupons for the drinks which was very convenient) The breakfast was awesome considering it was free, I just couldn't get away from the waffles with strawberry-banana topping and whipped cream!!! ( yes for breakfast lol ) they had fresh fruit, bagels, muffins, outmeal, cereals, yogurt and much more options, what more can you ask for? The hotel is walking distance from old-town which was very nice and has restaurants and shops nearby. As for the service, well I believe that since they won the award... they are taking it easy as I didn't see a special service here, but overall I liked it very much and will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the price, we were pleased with this motel. We spent 10 days here on our first trip with the kids to Florida. It is a great value if you don't want to worry about breakfast and driving to Disneyworld. The breakfast was more than adequate, but we did get somewhat bored of the selection. It would be nice if they rotated the menu! But as far as a family motel with a continental breakfast, we have only been to one that was better in this price range. The bus transportation was on time, but the schedule does not allow you to do an early afternoon return so plan for an entire day at the park. Our room was better than we expected after reading some earlier reviews. There were four of us and we had plenty of room with two queen beds and a hide-a-way. The microwave and refrigerator were great for kid snacks. The pool area was clean. The convenience to Old Town and numerous restaurants was great. For the price, breakfast convenience, and Disney transportation, we would select this property for the average family. It is not a five star resort, but if your mission is to explore the various theme parks then this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Once_a_Yr_Vacationer
Reviews.Content: Very good value for the money ($60 night). Nice and clean room. Great housekeeping service. Good breakfast for the value-same every day. Elevators were very slow - we had to actually ride the elevator all the way up then back down just to get to the lobby with our luggage from the second floor when we left. Loud washing machine noise began between 8:00 - 8:30 a.m. - though we were usually ready to go by then, but I would request the other end if you are a late sleeper. Guest laundry was always very busy in the evening-I was not able to get a machine before 10:00 p.m. Some of the front desk staff was not very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Great Price!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we Just returned from our florida vacation. We stayed at Comfort Suites Maingate East and I could not have been more pleased with this hotel. The rooms were very nice size and the hotel was kept very clean. The free daily continental breakfast was nice and saved us a little money on eating out. I liked the pool area, and the fact that the pool was open 24 hrs instead of closing like most hotels do, so you could go for a relaxing swim after spending the day at one of the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: lindhof
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our Memorial Day weekend stay at the Comfort suites and we had a wonderful time. Everything was perfect, the room was large, clean and the included breakfast was good. Great location, several shops and restaurants closeby and Disney is a short drive. We will definitely stay here again. Thanks to everyones recommendation on this site- we took your advise and stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & clean. Great value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 night stay @ Comfort Suites. This was our 4th trip to Disney and we opted to stay off Disney to save a little $$. We were pleased with our stay here. Our room was priced very reasonably in comparison with Disney's All-Star Resort. Plus we had extra room and a fridge and microwave which was handy for snacks after a long day @ the parks. Our room was always clean and our maid even made neat little things with the washcloths like a duck and flowers.(Our boys loved it!) We found the location was close enough to the parks that we left each day around 3or 4 to go eat and take a break from the parks and HEAT.We even came back to the hotel to swim a couple times. Our boys loved the pool. It was always really clean and the landscaping was neat with a tropical feel. The only complaint we had was the SLOW elevators. Not only were they slow but one of them was not working on two seperate days. The breakfast was a nice bonus although it got a little old by the end of our stay, but it served its purpose. All in all We enjoyed our stay here and could even see the fireworks each night from our window. If we stay off Disney on our next trip we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights May 18- May 21 2005. The romms were very spacious and clean. Front desk empolyees were friendly and helpful. Free breakfast was more than we expected with waffles (chocolate and plain) with fruit toppings, powedred suger, toat, muffins, pastries, cereals, eggs, it was great. Pool area was large with lots of tables and lounge chairs. Pool it self was ok a bit on the cool side but the kids didnt seem to care. Hot tub felt great. Pool side bar which also served some food was fantastic! Free shuttle service to area attractions was very handy ( just wished the ran more often). Overall this hotel well exceded our expectations we wished we would have stayed here our whole trip (we spent 3 nights at the Comfort Suites near Universal, no comparison). We will definately stay here again on our next trip to central FL.

Reviews.Title: “Worst senario comes true”
Reviews.Author: DisneyFan_natic
Reviews.Content: We have a friend that works for choice hotels so we would be paying 40 bucks a night at most facilites ( friends and family rate). We had spent days reading reviews - After reading the reviews though - we felt the only possibliity for us was maingate east - which didn't qualify for the $40 discount - instead it would be gov't rate ( I'm a Federal employee) at $75.00 per night - still a great rate compared to Disney where we were headed. We've stayed on-site Disney 12 times over 15 years, at all three catergories and the campground. We were always very impressed and never had a bad experience, though we were looking to go inexpensive this time for a short getaway. Showed up at Comfort suites with a guaranteed reserveration for a non-smoking king suite - (reconfirmed the day before) They gave us our room - go up to find two queens and a funky smell ( cigarettes, perfume, and mold). Back down to request the king - The clerk says I'll give you an upgrade to a king - but won't charge us the difference ( big of them since it's what I had reserved and paid for already.) Back up stairs ( hauling the luggage the whole time of course) to find our King room is strewn with garbage and dirty towels - the maids tip is still on the counter, obviously not made up and it's 9:30 at night. Back down again - told them we were leaving and headed to Disney - Port Orleans French Quarter - immaculate room and great customer service - We'll never stray again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time......”
Reviews.Author: Busterkg
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 7 days at the Comfort Suites. Overall very comfortable, safe, clean accommodations.
