One night upon returning from the parks at about 10:30, a gal was on her hands and knees with a toothbrush scrubbing the baseboard by the elevator! Rooms were adequate with a microwave and refrigerator. Free breakfast was nice – definitely not for a low-carb diet! Waffles were delicious. Everything was kept well stocked and clean. We had the best luck when we arrived at around 8:00 AM, any later we had to wait for a table but no big deal. Variety was impressive for continental with several drink choices, fruit, donuts, English muffins, toast, hard boiled eggs, cereal, yogurt, applesauce, instant oatmeal and on the weekends they offered biscuits/gravy. Note: When both toasters were running, we had trouble most mornings with shorting something out and found the reset button on the power cord down behind the toasters. Laundry facility was nice (1 washer/drier on each floor), which was convenient. The elevators can be a little hectic and seem a little slow during busy times – mid-morning and after the parks close, but with just being on the 2nd floor we could use the stairs when it seemed to take a long time. The pool was nice but seemed cold to me. The children’s pool/fountain was nice especially with it being fenced in but unbearably cold at the time we were there. The hot tub was very nice. There is a small bar, which serves drinks and pizza, appetizers and such. The 2-for-1 drink coupons in the room were a nice touch. I printed directions off to get from the airport to Comfort Suites. We had a little trouble finding it. My directions indicated to turn before Old Town but you have to pass through Old Town to get there, which can be crowded if you arrive Saturday evening like we did – they have an antique car show every Saturday night. It’s much easier if you go past Old Town and turn between Red Lobster and Pizza Hut and go straight back. There is a sign right there too but it’s easy to miss. As far as restaurants in the area – good luck! We tried to be adventurous at first and tried new places but weren’t successful so we stuck with the common chains in the Midwest. Hwy. 192 has about everything – if you can’t find what you’re looking for, just keep driving, you’ll find it!!

Reviews.Title: “About what we expected”
Reviews.Author: davdell_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the first week in April for one night. The hotel was about what we expected. It was clean, had a fairly nice pool, and had an adaquate breakfast. We got a rate of $79.00 for four family members which was a fair price. We did have trouble getting the managment to send up extra pillows but to be fair, the hotel was sold out and the front desk staff was extremely busy. All in all we'd stay there again, but I would not give this hotel 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Wilson60
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in April and found the hotel to be very nice. Our room was extra clean, spacious and very quiet. We had no problems with the elevators. The breakfast was good, but it was pretty much the same thing put out every day. We rented a car so getting to and from the Disney parks was easy and quick; having the car made it more relaxing as the hotel shuttles only run at certain times. The location next to Old Town is also great as you can walk there. We would stay here again and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 12 days and loved it. The rooms were spacious and very clean. Bed linen was regularly changed, and the spacious bathroom had a good stock of clean towels. The swimming pool and whirlpool was great after a day at the Parks. The location of the hotel is also perfect, near the Parks, but also in the Old Town which offers extreme sports, great! We found this hotel to be great value for money. The breakfast was fantastic - fresh waffles were served every morning, along with eggs etc. There was something for everyone in the breakfast buffet - well done Comfort Suites. We would definitely consider returning to this hotel again, it has won many awards and I can see why. There are shuttle buses which run to the Disney Parks, and only one shuttle bus to Universal and Seaworld at 9am returning at 9pm. There is no shuttle to wet'n'wild. We had to hire a car because of the limited shuttle service. Otherwise, it is a great place to stay and the staff were very friendly!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: nbtraveller
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at this hotel. On the whole we really liked it. The rooms were large and clean, (heated) pool was nicely landscaped. A nice buffet breakfast with delicious waffles. Also the location was great. Set off from the highway but very close. You could also walk to Old Town which is an amusement area. There are a number of restaurants and shopping areas handy and Disney Parks a 15 minute drive. The elevators and toasters are slow but this is a minor complaint. This is a nice new hotel. Make sure you do not get a room near the elevators though as you can hear people talking while waiting for them. I only noticed it the first night as we went to bed very early. There is generally not much activity in the halls after 11p.m. -in any event I had my trusty earplugs. I would definitey stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice hotel all around”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January with another family. The front desk was very helpful, and changed our rooms so that we could be next to each other. The hotel was very close to Disney, only took about 5-10 min. to drive there. The breakfast had a very nice selection. mini doughnuts, waffels, buscuits with gravy, cereals, toast, several kinds of juice, coffee, tea, fruits, yogurts, ect. I was crowded in the morning, but we always found a table, there were plenty of tables. The pool was very nice and clean. It was heated and he kids were able to swim at night even though the temperature was in the 40's and 50's. The hut tub was nice also. Not too crowded when we were down there. The only complaint we would have had was that the elevaters were too slow. But we just got used to taking the stairs everywhere, which is better for us anyways. Also. the dryers didn't dry my clothes very well. I gave up, and hung the clothes in my room over night. The housekeeping staff was wonderfull. Our room was cleaned very well, and the kids like it when their stuffed animals and blankets were layed out nice on the beds. Plenty of towels. We ordered pizza one night from the bar, and it was very reasonably priced, and pretty good. Also the 2 buy one get one free drink coupons were a nice extra as well. We booked our rooms on Expedia and only paid $56.00 a night. What a deal that was. I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: Realestategirl61
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a couple of nights toward the end of March 2005 and were very pleased. The only problem we had is the 1st night the air conditioner did not work well but as soon as we reported it the next morning it was fixed within 1 hour. The staff was friendly and the room was very clean and nice. Beds were comfortable. Would definitely stay here again. If you have any problems don't wait to tell the front staff, get your problem taken care of right a way because they will quickly be on it.

Reviews.Title: “Family Excellence”
Reviews.Author: KruserL
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here during March Break with 10 and 15 year old boys. The pool was warm and clean. The rooms were clean. Jessie (assistant mgr) was fantastic. The beds were comfortable and the sofa bed was great for the 10 yr old. Rooms offer lots of space for family of four even on rainy days. Buffet breakfast was included and probably saves a family of four $20~$30 a day not to mention the convenience of it all. The hotel is tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the main drag in Kissimmee with mini-put and Old Town (kind of an amusement park) so close you will walk there. Other hotels could take some lessons from this place - 5 stars for cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Just back to Canada!”
Reviews.Author: lollypopj
Reviews.Content: Spent 10 days in this hotel.Good breakfasts-chocolate waffles ,toast ,yogourt,boiled eggs, oranges,small muffins,Fruitsations applesauce every morning !! The country churned stuff isn't butter, but margerine! Bought 2 tee shirts for $12 there,good gift shop! No hair conditioner-bought some at Gift shop!Heated hot tub,bar open 3PM til 11 PM,serves pizza or they will deliver it.Closest restaurant is RED Lobster and Pizza Hut~!Also a KFC close!!Good basic hotel,nothing fancy!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two weeks in February. Great place, great location, enjoyed the one block walk to Old Town almost every night we were there. Deluxe continental breakfast was very good, ample seating area. We went to Disney's four parks, Seaworld, and Busch Gardens in Tampa. Easy to get to from this hotel. Many restaurant choices nearby. The only reason I didn't give it full marks was the elevators are somewhat slow, and not working 100%. We had read about this in earlier reviews and it hasn't been fixed. However we would definitely choose this location again. Rooms were clean and the cleaning staff did an excellent job each and every day. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Florida and we stayed at the Comfort Suites it was amazing the rooms where clean, the breakfast was good, and the staff was wonderful. I chose this hotel based on the reviews I seen on trip advisor. I consider myself to be a very picky person and I cannot say one bad thing about this hotel. I will highly reccomend this place to friends who go to the disney area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Winky
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel last May while visiting Disney World. Very close to the parks, all kinds of restaurants in walking distance. It is set back from the main road. Rooms were comfortable. The snack bar food was great for the $$$. Only paid $60 a night. Would stay there again. Oh yea, another plus is it is right next door to Old Towne which is a lot of fun at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here in early Feb.2005. The room was very clean and large. The breakfast bar was very good. The location can't be beat, within walking distance to Old Town and a few minutes to the parks .Good pool bar and nice swimming area. Also we got a great deal $58.00 a night on -----!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Value, Clean”
Reviews.Author: salsagirl_7
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, I must say the best I have ever stayed at. My husband said he rated this hotel a 9 out of 10 which is pretty good for his high standards. Our first morning for breakfast my kids looked at me and said "WOW MOM, this is great" They were right, what an excellent variety. Yes, the elevators were a little slow, mostly in the morning when everyone is heading downstairs for breakfast or the parks. We never used any of the complimentary shuttle services. none of them really worked with our time schedule. They should really offer more times. The room was very clean and the maid did a great job daily. Would I come back to this hotel? Absolultely!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Nepean
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Suites Maingate East Jan5-18th. We were fortunate to get a price match guarantee on the Choice Web site for $49.50 per night. I was a bit worried that we would be given the worst room in the hotel due to the low rate but my concerns were unfounded. Our suite was immaculate and the maid service was better than I have received in 5 star hotels. The large continental breakfast had something for everyone. The pool and hot tub including the surrounding area were clean and the pool warm. The wireless internet service at the pool allowed my daughter to check into her school classes while we sat in the warm sunshine. We arrived shortly before noon and were allowed to check in early. There are uniformed security guards patrolling the hotel at night. The laundry room on our floor was clean priced reasonably. $1.00 per load and to dry. The last weekend we were there the hotel was very full with soccer teams and dance teams. The noise could have been terrrible but it wasn't. The staff truly care about this hotel and show it with there excellent work and ready smiles. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We are planning next year's trip and are looking forward to staying at the Comfort Suites Maingate East.

Reviews.Title: “Give this place a try!”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie40
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at CIME on two occasions, and have enjoyed the convenient location to Disney and everything that is on I92. Rooms are clean and we love the pool - warm and clean. They offer breakfast included in the rate and it's quite good. Lots of selection and a very nice, large breakfast room. Only negative both times was how slow the elevators are. We love the fact that we can walk to Old Town, and any number of restaurants located on I92. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Don't check in late”
Reviews.Author: Billa86
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Jan. 9-13.Hotel was nice . But they gave away my room and had to stay in another the frist night. The person at the front desk could of cared less. I called that night at 6p,m and told them I was going to be late they told me that was o.k. And still gave my room away. I also was told they could not give rooms away!!!! ha,ha. I arrived at 11.30 at night with 3 kids to find we had no room.they offered us a smokeing room that could only sleep 4 people.

Reviews.Title: “Super Price and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: chris036
Reviews.Content: A treat of a hotel in a perfect location for exploring Disney by car, just a short hop from the parks. The rooms are large, bright and clean, whilst the daily maid service defies belief for the price you pay to stay here. Included in the standard room rate is a reasonably stocked continental breakfast in a spacious dining room - you can even eat by the pool if you choose. Dining couldn't be easier, with the major US chains all situated along highway 192 a few steps from the hotel, along with 'Old Town', a throwback 60's style shopping village. Of course, nowhere is perfect as I've found, and the gripe with this hotel is the security - although the location is quite secure itself, there appears to be little or nothing to stop you from walking into the hotel, grabbing a free breakfast and using the pool all day without actually paying to stay (not that I tried that of course!).

Reviews.Title: “excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I (5 of us) stayed at the comfort suites from Jan 4th-10th 2005. I had booked another hotel prior to this one but after reading the reviews (I should have done this before booking) I decided to cancel at the other hotel. I read reviews for days and finally decided that this was the one I wanted to stay at! I was not dissapointed by anything at the hotel. The room was very clean upon arrival and the maid did a wonderful job cleaning it daily. We enjoyed the time spent at the pool area (pool and hot-tub very clean) The bartenders at the Tiki Bar were very friendly as were the hotel staff (always greeted with a smile) The continental breakfast was very impressive---cereal,fresh fruit,yoghurt,apple sauce, waffles, boiled eggs,different breads for toasting, muffins, doughnuts ,juices,coffee & tea. A lot more choices than your usual standard continental breakfast offered at other hotels. We also enjoyed being so close to Old Town..a few minutes walk! Our children are adults 18-25 so they could enjoy the evenings taking in the sights/sounds of Old Town as my husband and I enjoyed some quiet time by the pool :o) I had read complaints about the slowness of the elevators---in the morning as everyone was heading to the parks it was slow but we found it fine the rest of the time. There are many good restaurants within walking distance! Ponderosa offers a good breakfast deal if you feel like bacon, eggs ect. $3.99 all you can eat buffet. We really enjoyed our meal at Red Lobster (3 min walk from hotel) and the staff were excellent!! We enjoyed our stay immensely and look forward to our next trip to Florida where we will say at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Go enjoy and relax”
Reviews.Author: Lepke24
Reviews.Content: Returned to this hotel several times. Can not find anything to complain about. Pool is the greatest, heated year around. Even in the winter cold remains nice, fun to swim in it, open 24/7. Exercise room well equipped. Staff is professional. Little more selection at breakfast would be good. Never had noise, smell, roach or cleanliness problem. There is a small arcade room, a mini store (good prices) in the lobby. McDonalds, Kentucky Fried Chicken, Old Town in walking distance. Short drive to major attractions, with a map you can navigate well. For $50-$80 great deal.

Reviews.Title: “one and half rating: roach, hair, and beer”
Reviews.Author: freequentflyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here October, 2004. We were greeted in the hall by a large dizzy roach meandering right by the housekeeping staff's cart. Beer bottles and pizza boxes overflowed from the hall garbage also right within sight of the housekeepers. The beer and pizza garabge stench was present in the halls throughout our 6 night stay. I found hair made into the bedsheets on the first night of my stay and every other night there. Hotel was hard to find when returning from Disney. Front desk had attitiude. Internet access misleading on website. Given my experience at this place I think some of the glowing reviews here have potentially biased information.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights Dec 18th to 22nd. Room was very clean, good beds and furnishings. Only problem is that a lot of the rooms have adjoining doors which can be noisy, we had a family arrive around 1:30am who spent the next 2 hours on the phone talking very loudly and letting their children run riot around the room and corridors etc. which kept us awake. A quick trip to reception at 3:30am and we were moved rooms the next day while we were out. Overall a good hotel and at $52 a night a bargain :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked through Expedia. The hotel has excellent access to all parks, IDrive shops etc. Close to Old Town for its amenities. Should be noted that Old Town can be a little noisy until around 2230hrs, although not realy intrusive. The sevices in the hotel are excellent with ATM, guest services, laundry etc. The lifts can be a little busy at peak times however we still would go for an upper floor room. The rooms were clean and of excellent standard for the standard of holel. The houskeeping could not be faulted. Complimentary breakfast is available, although we did not use this facility. Complmentary coffee all day in reception is a nice touch. Top marks to the reception staff and houskeeping who, on our wedding anniversary, help me order flowers and had them placed in a vase in the room all unknown to my wife while we were out for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stated at the Comfort Suite Maingate East between Dec 2 and Dec 9. What a fantastic hotel - no wonder it's rated the best Comfort Suites in the USA. The hotel was an excellent part of our vacation. We booked a one bedroom suite which had 2 queen beds and a pull-out sofa bed, a large bathroom, a fridge and a microwave. The room was well appointed, clean and very spacious for two adults and two children. The common areas were well kept and quiet. We partook in the complimentary Continental Breakfast everyday and it was great - the fresh-baked Belgian-Waffles were a hit with the kids. There was lots of fresh fruit, breads, cereals, hard-boiled eggs, grits and gravy, etc. We all ate like vultures! The outdoor heated pool and hot tub were also popular with the kids and is open 24-hours. The poolside bar provides 2 for 1 drink coupons when you check-in, so that was a nice added bonus. The location of the hotel to attractions is excellent. The Magic Kingdom, Downtown Disney and MGM are just up the street from the hotel and even Universal Studios (the farthest away) was just 7 or 8 minutes away. There are loads of restaurants, shops and attractions like Medieval Times and Arabian Nights right nearby. We could not have asked for more from this hotel. We will certainly bring our business back to them the next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “This place is great for families!”
Reviews.Author: Tracey88
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4-night stay at Comfort Suites Maingate East. I'd researched the heck out of this hotel, and after reading so many great reviews, decided to book it. We got a great off-season internet rate directly through the Comfort website of just 55/night, plus the taxes, which brought the nightly rate up to about 65/night. This hotel is immaculately clean and spacious. We were in a non-smoking suite with two queen beds, a sofa bed, and full bath with jacuzzi tub (I believe this room was a handicapped designation). The room was HUGE! Lots of space to spread out with our two kids (ages 5 & 7). The room has a little kitchennette area, complete with a medium size fridge, microwave, cupboards, and small sink. We neglected to bring a few dishes with us, which we regretted, since we were too tired to eat out one night and stopped off at a market to buy some microwavable food, but we made do. I liked the small sitting area with a sofa, lamp and coffee table. Since there is a small divider between this area and the beds, my husband and I could sit and read there after the kids went to bed, without the light disturbing them. Our room was just across from the elevators, so I'd anticipated a lot of noise, but I was only bothered one time by some late-night revelers whooping it up in the hallway. Speaking of the elevators, this is perhaps the only minor complaint I had about the property. There are just two of them, and they are VERY slow. However, it wasn't really a problem for us as we weren't on any tight time schedule. I can't say enough about how spotless our room was. Our housekeeper, Marisa, made us think we were in the wrong room every day when we returned, it was so tidy! She even arranged the kid's stuffed animals in a cute pose after she'd made the beds. Now the breakfast: it comes free in the room rate, and while it is called "continental", it is so much more than a few muffins, juice and coffee. The offerings included freshly cooked waffles, boiled eggs, biscuits and gravy, all kinds of muffins and pastries, cold cereal, fruit, a variety of juices and milk, of course coffee and tea, packets of oatmeal and grits, bread and english muffins for toasting and more. A couple of times, my husband and I went down and brought some stuff up to the room, but the other times, all of us enjoyed the spacious breakfast room. It was fairly crowded, but not overly so at this time of year. The pool is nice and warm, and the hot tub not too hot. We were so busy, we only enjoyed the pool on the morning of our departure, so we didn't miss the fancier slides some of the more expensive properties offered. There is a fun "raindrops" kiddy pool (a fountain of water sprays out over the kiddy pool), but this area is not heated, and the day we swam was just barely warm, so my kids tried splashing around in it a bit, but then opted for the warm main pool. I liked the fact that the kiddy area is completely surrounded by a fence with a high latched gate so that parents with little kids can relax around the kiddy pool and not worry about their little one wandering out to the main pool -- a very thoughtful detail to help out parents. The hotel has no restaurant, other than the breakfast offered in the morning. But there are scads of restaurants just off the main drag outside the hotel's long drive. Free, scheduled shuttle service to the Disney parks is offered, but we opted to rent a car (I recommend L&M Car Rentals at the airport!) so we'd have more flexibility. It took us about 10 minutes from the hotel to Magic Kingdom, and the route is basic enough to just get on and follow the signs. We were right in Old Town Kissimmee, but didn't have time to look around on our short trip. We had Disney tickets in hand when we arrived, but if you don't, there is a ticket seller on property selling both Disney and Universal Studios tickets. This place is a tremendous value for the money and I'd recommend it to anyone. We plan to stay there again, and perhaps get a one-bedroom room next time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have recently spent a month travelling round Florida staying in numerous hotels and this is definately one of the best. We haven't cut corners either, we have paid good prices and updated to rooms with sea views etc. I find it hard to understand how anyone can "pick holes" out of this hotel. Rooms are large , clean and fully equipped. It would be hard to find anything lacking. The "free" breakfast was more than adequate for even the greediest of people. After a busy day the poolside was very enjoyable with numerous towels, chairs and sunbeds at you disposal. The location couldn't be beaten. It is at the side of The Old Town, just off the 192 and very close to all the Disney Parks. If I ever return to Orlando I would have no hesitation in using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the Price!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a vacation in Orlando 10/24-10/27/04. While in FL my family and I stayed at the comfort suites maingate east. We were given an early check in, about 1230pm, which worked out very well since we were in a hurry to get to universal! The hotel is very adequate considering your rarely in the hotel until the evening hours upon returning from the parks. The rooms are updated,very clean, the beds comfortable and the bathrooms always loaded with fresh towels. The housekeeping does an excellent job! To avoid problems no matter where you stay at I would always recommend calling ahead to verify your reservation. This one phone call can prevent plenty of frustration later on. Overall our stay at comfort suites maingate east was quite enjoyable. I would also recommend renting a car considering a midsize car for 4 days at thrifty was only $113.00.Don't let them sell you the extra insurance!!! The breakfast at the hotel was not elaborate or fancy but was enough. For $60.00 per night the hotel was well worth the price. It was also only minutes from all the parks. When your leaving the parks at night the last thing you want to do is wait for the hotel shuttle bus with your sleeping children!!! For example the bus to and from universal is ran on an extremely limited basis.There will be nights when you stay late for extra shows which are worth the stay. Bus times are limited so I highly suggest a rent a car.... P.S The Disney parks are managed perfectly! They are clean safe and so enjoyable. The workers couldn't be any nicer and will always go the extra yard for the visitors!! Good luck and enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Another bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Missouritraveler01
Reviews.Content: We had reservations for a non-smoking room. The only room they had left was a smoking room. So, the staff put us in the smoking room. I showed the staff that our confirmation said that we reserved a non-smoking room, but the staff said that the non-smoking room wasn't guaranteed. I was never told, and it was never printed on the confirmation that the non-smoking room wasn't guaranteed. When we got to the room, the smoke smell was terrible. I called the front desk and was told that we could stay at one of their other hotels, but we refused. The next morning, I called the front desk to see if we could move to a non-smoking room. They said that no rooms were available. I realized that several people were checking out, but the staff still refused to put us in another room. So, I went to the front desk and complained about them giving us the "run around," and had to raise my voice before anyone would listen to me. And...they had another room ready for us in 15 minutes. Then our new key didn't work in the lock. Also, for an entire day, the outdoor pool was being cleaned and was closed. And, on the next morning, before checkout, we wanted to use the pool, but couldn't because they were cleaning the pool again. I have no idea why we got the "run around" this time because we stayed there last year and had no complaints. After all of the problems/attitude the hotel staff gave us, we asked for a discount, and the staff refused, but, later, gave us a discount after raising my voice again. I have never had such an unpleasant experience at any hotel. Since we had all of the problems/attitude from the staff, we had to leave at a later time to go to the theme park. The hotel staff may have ruined our stay, but they didn't ruin our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We made reservations for Comfort Suites Maingate East, King Suite. After driving ten hours to this destination, we were told we only reserved a standard room. We produced the written confirmation and then were told that the people in the room we reserved wanted to stay over. They offered no apologies and were of no help at all!

Reviews.Title: “clean”
Reviews.Author: mikeb1026
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. I would reccommend it to anyone who is wanting to stay somewhere that is resonably priced ,and is clean. The front desk staff weren't terribly friendly, but they were polite. The cleaning staff were very polite also, but if you don't want to be waken early, make sure you put your do not disturb sign out. I would stay here again just because of the cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: MFB68
Reviews.Content: I can recommend this hotel - very good value! Clean rooms, good breakfast, nice pool area with poolside bar. Nice location, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Comfort Suites, Maingate East”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would recommend Comfort Suites, Maingate East to anybody. I am currently booked for my third stay at this hotel. It is very clean and comfortable. The breakfast that they offer is excellent! There is something there for everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: pennyjacks53
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights and loved it. Our room was very clean, the king bed very comfortable and we loved having a microwave and refrigerator in our room. Great value for the price. The pool is clean and well maintained and the poolside bar makes reasonably priced drinks that actually have alcohol in them. You get 2 for 1 tickets for the drinks in your room. Take advantage of some of their speciality drinks. Yummy!! The elevator is alittle slow however.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a superb hotel. Yes the breakfast was great, the room was great and the location fantastic but the real high point for my family and I were the staff who were so helpful. We arrived at the hotel at 9.15 and were allowed to check into our room straight away. Upon departing we requested a late check out, we left our room at 3.15pm, all at no extra charge. Such a relief when you've got a little one who needs to sleep! I would definitely recommend this hotel as we were treated superbly!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Suites East, Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: embutterfly75
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was really nice. I was hesitate because of some of the reviews, but i couldn't of asked for anything more. Only paid $59 a night, rooms and hotel were very clean. Breakfast was good and they had a variety of food, more then what i expected. We only got to stay for two days because of hurrican frances and when we weren't sure whether we wanted to leave they gave us until 3:00 to check out. It's only minutes from the park and some area shopping. i will defintley come back to this hotel on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just recently stayed at the Comfort suites and I thought it was the most impressive Hotel in the area. I don't think I'll go back in mosquito season though, those little buggers made us have to spend our evenings indoors by 8:00pm every night. And I suggest the Hotel invest in some working tosters, there were 4 tosters to use but only one worked (a tad bit of a pain having to wait). Staff was very polite, the lady who cleaned our room did a Wonderful job! My daughter loved the way she positioned her dolls up on the beds after making them. The place was very clean and the pool was perfect for August's HOT HOT weather. I would suggest to anyone souvenir shopping to check out Walmart down the 192 before going to all the flee markets around. They have alot of the same things (shirts/towels etc...) for a cheaper price. You can also stock up your fridge in the room with beverages snacks etc... I definetely recommend this Hotel ****

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed at a dozen Hotels in Kissimmie but this was the best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We did not know this hotel existed, we booked our travel arrangement with AAA. We were booked to stayed at the Comfort Suite Maingate West of which we had a horrible experienced. We found this hotel at the last minute and was just over joyed by the room size and the breakfast facilities. the game room and the small gift shop. This was more suitable to our needs. The staff was very pleasant. What would have been a ruined vacation turn out to be a more pleasant one. Thanks Comfort Suite Maingate East.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I`ll try and make it as short as possible. If you want a clean and large suite and not expensive this is a very good choice. The hotel is very well located and the staff is friendly. I do recommend taking your own car to the parks, the wait at times can be long. The cold breakfast buffet is quite good, their`s a variety choices. For a moderate category hotel it`s a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value and superb location”
Reviews.Author: singh11
Reviews.Content: Chose Comfort suites as it catered for 6 per room (we had 11 in our party). Rooms are spacious with 2 double beds and a double pull out sofa bed (which was very comfortable). Having a fridge and microwave as well as the usual iron helped as we could stock up with snacks/drinks etc. to keep the little one's happy (suggest going down to Wal Mart on 192 about 20 mins from hotel as local stores have 'tourist' prices). Breakfast is good but limited & repetative - waffles (excellent), cereals, toast/pastries & boiled eggs. The location of the hotel is superb as its slighty of the 192 so not much noise issues but close enough for all the resturants, of which there are many -- chinese, red lobster, pizza hut, burger king, 24hr Mcdonalds and a 24hr Denny's diner all within walking distance (5 mins). There's also a funfair type amusement area and a mini golf place all within the same area. Getting to the Disney/Universal parks is straight forward from the hotel (20mins - Disney and 40mins - Universal up Interstate 4) though the hotel has shuttles to these parks I don't recommend them if you have young kids as the return journeys are packed (we found we had to stand on our way back from Universal) and they only have a couple of pick up and return times (normally after the park closes so your looking at around 11pm from the park) - not convenient as the kids are normally tired and restless by then and having to wait for a bus can be a painful experience.. get a hire car if you've got small kids! The hotel staff are very helpful and polite - reception changed our room at short notice. The rooms are kept clean, with fresh towels etc everyday. The pool bar is pleasant and the food is well made (fish & chips was lovely) but choice is limited, few times we found they ran out of certain things and it closes at 10:30 but this is not a major problem thanks to all the other places nearby. Pool area is nice and clean but can get busy at times and watch out for mosquito's and other biting insects in the evening, (for UK holiday makers - keep the air con on at night as we found we got bitten, especially around the legs, during the night when we had the aircon off ). OVERALL this was an excellent hotel and amazing value for money - if you want fancy frills look elsewhere but if your looking for a comfortable, friendly, straight forward base to explore Orlando then you can't go wrong. Definite 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This all-suite hotel is the nicest, most beautiful hotel I've ever stayed in, and by making the reservations far in advance, I got an outstanding deal. The hotel decor is very attractive, the pool is very large and has a nice outdoor bar where you can order food and eat outside. The breakfast buffet was outstanding. There are laundry machines on each floor, plus an exercise and game room, and gift shop. It was a wonderful stay all around.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 8/23/04 We just returned from a family vacation, the hotel was very nice, clean and the staff was friendly. Would recommend this hotel to everyone. The only drawback was the elevators were a little slow.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: vegkidds
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, the staff was friendly, the buffet breakfast consisted of muffins, cereal and waffles. Dont expect to cook any meals the kitchen was useless, with rusted stove tops. Shower had little water pressure. Kids ran around the hotel all hours of the night wich was a nuisance. The room was large, the carpet had a lot of stains on it. We paid 75 a night which was a pretty good deal. IF you dont mind the little things you will enjoy your stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Disney”
Reviews.Author: lmonk
Reviews.Content: GREAT HOTEL IN KISSIMMEE. Spent a lot of time on the internet looking for a hotel that would accommodate my wife and me plus 16 year old son who is really a full adult size, for 12 days in early July. So, we needed a good size room, with swimming pool, close to shops etc. and of course Disney. We chose the Comfort Suites - Maingate East and were not disappointed. The ‘standard rooms’ are very large with 2 Queen size beds and a kitchen area and bathroom. The rooms are serviced very well each day. We actually ended up in a huge suite with 2 separate rooms - 2 en-suite bathrooms - 2 televisions, a Jacuzzi - kitchen area with micro and fridge and overlooking the swimming pool! Breakfast was included in the price, a real bonus and served from 7.00 a.m. to 10.00 a.m. This is described, as ‘Continental’ but is a bit more than that. You can eat all you like and the fresh waffles are really good. If we got lazy, one of us would go down to breakfast with a tray and fill it up to take back to the room - great. You can order some good Pizzas/snacks etc. from the pool bar and they are very good value and delivered to your room - very convenient. Free coffee/tea is available in the restaurant area all day, so you can just help yourself – nice touch. The gym is more than adequate for a workout and overlooks the pool. The pool area is very pleasant and we never had a problem getting seats to sunbathe although it can get busy in the evenings. The laundry room on each floor is a real bonus. We actually left the hotel with all our clothes clean! The staff were all excellent and very helpful so thanks to everyone at reception and the back offices and to the lady (Veronica? - 5th floor) who cleaned our room so well every day. Comfort Suites is a casual/relaxed place so you can dress comfortably and the guests all seemed really nice people. Plenty of excellent restaurants within walking distance on 192 and of course Kissimmee and Old Town with lots of activity/places to visit. The Comfort Suites have a ‘shuttle’ service to the theme parks but we hired a car for the whole 12 days and found visiting the Disney theme parks a quick and simple drive from the hotel. Universal is a bit further to go but only a few minutes drive up Interstate 4. We also took day trips to Clearwater and Daytona beaches. This is a good hotel (suites) to use as a ‘base’ and we felt ‘unbelievable’ value for money. The rooms are very comfortable and spacious. Kissimmee is a pleasant area to stay in and 192 has so many restaurants etc. If you are going to Orlando the Comfort suites has to be high on your list for choices to stay. High standard/great value. We enjoyed our holiday in Orlando and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvtogolfBarrie
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of researching of hotels and discovered this one. It got great reviews so we thought that we would try it. What a great choice. The rooms were big enough for our family of 4. The pool was clean and we used it alot. My only negative comment about this hotel is that the continental breakfast can get tiring. It is the samething everyday. Mostly muffins, cereal, toast and waffles. It would be nice to have more of a variety. Other than that i would highly recommend this hotel for any family.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Suites Maingate East is clean, comfortable, and affordable.”
Reviews.Author: TracyCT
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed in a spacious one bedroom suite that was immaculate. We have stayed both inside and outside Disney in the past, each has differnet benefits. It was nice to have a refrigerator, microwave, cabinets, and kitchen sink in our suite. We saved a lot of money this year, our suite cost $89 a night and included free breakfast. Each floor had washer and dryer. It only cost me $5 to wash and dry 2 loads of laundry. We were given coupons for 2 complimentry drinks at the poolsde bar. Our room had a view of the pool area which was very nice. There is a lot to do within walking distance of this hotel (shopping, dining, rides, minature golf), my teenage children were never board. My family was very happy with the price, cleanliness, and location of this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay here but Drive to the Parks Yourself”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 night stay at the Comfort Suites Maingate East. It is a nice hotel. Our room was very clean. The breakfast and pool are nice. I also recommend taking bug spray along. The poolside bar is great and they have great Pizza. As others have mentioned the elevators are slow, the shuttle is crowded and doesn't offer much flexibility, but it does save on the stress of driving. One thing to mention, they do have high speed internet, but it is NOT wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Comfort Suites for 5 days and were very pleased with most of the services offered. We were especially pleased with an early check in and the housekeeping services. The complimentary breakfast was also a nice treat but was often crowded. Our children loved that the pool was open 24 hrs a day and was heated. (Note: If you go to the pool at night, take a can of bug spray or the mosquitos will carry you off.) The only thing that we were discouraged by was the shuttle service; there were no afternoon shuttles going to or from the Disney parks and the shuttle rides were almost one hour long. Three of the days that we were there, we took a taxi; it cost $17-$20 per one way trip. For your convenience, we recommend renting a car. Overall, we had a really great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had one terrible night stay, First we were told we will have 2-queen size beds and a outside porch. When we got in the room, there was 1-queen bed and a pull-out bed (VERY uncomfortable), no door to the outside, and they put us on the top floor. When I called down to the front desk they were really rude, dismissive, and put the blame on us saying they have no other rooms. The staff is truly hypocrital, uncaring and incompetent. So we left the next morning and stayed at CourtYard by Marriott. Even when we called Comfort Suites Maingate for our refund they were really rude. You deserve better than this on your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT DEAL”
Reviews.Author: nenagolf
Reviews.Content: I based my lodging selection on favorable reviews from this and other websites. However, two days before departure, I read two "terrible" reviews about the establishment and was a bit apprehensive. As for our visit, we had a great time. I traveled with 2 young children and without my husband. The location next to Old Towne was a good break from Mickey and friends. Service was excellent. The rooms were clean. Any type of restaurant one could desire was conveniently located in the vicinity. Driving to the theme parks was extremely easy. We also tried the complimentary shuttle. No real complaints in that department. Driving offers more flexibility. The girls loved the pool. The complimentary continental breakfast was a good start of the day. As mentioned in reviews by others, the waffles were a big hit with the kids. The guest laundry was a lifesaver. I cannot verify their late arrival procedures because we arrived early and were allowed to check-in early(11:00). I wanted to jump for joy. Comfort Suties Maingate East was a nice place to stay and we would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: gmoust
Reviews.Content: Thinking we had reservations at this hotel we showed up expecting to have a nice room and a nice stay. However we find out that the hotel gave our room away. Yes gave our room away even with us having a confirmation number. We planned the trip several months in advance and confirmed with the hotel prior to the trip that we had the reservations for a week stay. But two hours to us actually showing up the hotel gave our room away. They admitted they gave the room away two hours to us arriving. So I would not recommend staying here since you are not guarnteed a room even if you have a confirmation number. (We had seven nights booked here.) So be aware that even though you think you have a room here they may give it away.

Reviews.Title: “Only positive!”
Reviews.Author: hegfam
Reviews.Content: I based my decision to stay here on the overwhelming majority of positive reviews on this website, and I need to pass along that I was not disappointed. This place was great. With a family of 6, choices are limited, but our room slept 6 with the pull-out sofa, and we were completely comfortable the entire stay (10 nights in June, 2004). The free breakfast was an overwhelming plus, with just about anything you could want from a continental layout (no bagels though). The room was large and comfortable, overlooking the pool. Daily maid service was perfect. Free internet hookup. Any assistance from the from desk was prompt. Yes, the elevators are a bit slow, but a good thing about being on the 6th or 7th floor is that you're sure to get a ride down every time! The pool was great, we got fast food and pizza from the pool bar; the food being really good, and the service friendly. There was minor difficulty on Sat. nights with the Old-Towne car show going on, but once we figured out to use the 2nd (main) entrance off 192, and not the first one, we were fine. We did not use the bus service. This was a safe, clean, top-notch place to stay and we would stay there again without a doubt. We booked our room on hotelmartusa.com, and got a great more than we paid for in my opinion!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May 2004 and would highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for a reasonably-priced, clean, modern hotel with good facilities. Location is great, just off the 192 (so no traffic noise) and right next door to Kissimmee Old Town (less than a 5 minute walk). There are lots of shops, restaurants and a mini-golf within just a few minutes walk. Room was very nice, with plenty of space (including a separate sitting area) and was spotlessly clean. Facilities in the room were good: small kitchen area had coffee maker, fridge, microwave and sink. Takes about 10-15 minutes to drive to WDW. The complimentary continental breakfast (cereals, waffles, fruit, yoghurt) was also handy for those early starts to Disney. Would definitely stay here again. Try HotelmartUSA for a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Comfort Suites Maingate East for our 8 day stay. An excellent hotel for the price. Very clean rooms and super maids kept the rooms clean. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. I was not sure of the hotel, just looked at reviews from others. I was suprised how nice it was. The morning breakfast they had was a plus in my book. Overall I rate this hotel high. easy access to all attractions and close to Old Town which was a good place to walk around.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: sallywallygal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful! We booked our room based on the good reviews on this website. Our sixth floor room was large, clean, comfortable, attractive, and had a great view of Old Town next door and even the fireworks at Disney! The room had a nice closet and a makeup table with lighted mirror outside of the large bathroom. It also had a microwave, small fridge, desk, recliner, and comfortable sofa. The trip to the Disney parks was less than 15 minutes from door to entrance, so we were able to return to our room every day for a swim in the gorgeous pool. The free breakfast was not excellent, but for a free breakfast it was fine. I was able to let my daughter sleep till the last minute because I could take her breakfast up to the room. Our only complaint was that we were across from the elevators and we could hear people talking as they waited for the slow elevators. We got the room for only $55 a night through Expedia, so it was a great deal!! For a spacious room, free breakfast, nice pool, and close proximity to Disney, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with this hotel - it is comfortable, quiet and clean, and the continental breakfast was great (although a little crowded at times). It’s conveniently located close to all attractions and is right next to Old Town. Our suite was always immaculate upon our return and the complimentary paper each morning was a nice touch. Our only criticisms would be the free shuttle to and from the various parks – it is restricted to only 2 or 3 departure times - there are only two elevators (which can cause long wait lines) and the front desk staff seemed somewhat unfriendly. Overall a good hotel for a reasonable price. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: DK223
Reviews.Content: This place was clean, modern and friendly. The rooms were more than large enough for the 2 of us. However, as non-smokers we were not very pleased to find a distinct smell of smoke on the bedclothes the first night we got there. It was 1:00 am and we were so tired after travelling trans-Atlantic and taking about an hour to find the hotel that we couldn't be bothered complaining. After that night, I didn't smell smoke again. As for the breakfasts, I don't eat waffles and donuts so I was quite disappointed that they didn't have much cereal, warm croissants or freshly baked rolls. I found the breakfast products overall quite stale tasting. The yogurts and fresh juice were nice however! I would overall recommend this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Suites Maingate East
HotelInfo.Address: 2775 Florida Plaza Blvd, Kissimmee, FL 34746
